title: Snakes üêç on A Train
text: This one blasts off from scene one, never letting up, while packing plenty of bite along the way. Humor, action, cleverness, and style. The best I have seen of Brad Pitt, he's the shining star here as Ladybug, but there are other notable stands out (let's hear it for 'the twins' Tangerine & Lemon) as prime examples played by none other than Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry. Loved Sandra Bullock, too and hey even the snake was a stand out. It is a literal edge of your seat thrill ride that you won't ever wanna get off, so be sure to strap in for the ride of your life. I hope there is more to come.

title: Worth it!
text: This is a genuinely good movie. Full of laughs, full of action and fight sequences and not afraid to even mock itself (the water bottle scene). I consider it to be the best aciton movie of 2022 so far.

title: Fantastic story
text: I don't know why but the movie just looked insanely fun ever since I saw the trailer. I've already watched the movie twice now, that's just how much I enjoyed it!!!

title: A surprisingly odd action comedy that runs out of steam before the final stop
text: Starting out a rollicking pace and keeping you glued to your seat for a large portion of its opening half, action specialist David Leitch and his bankable leading man Brad Pitt find their oddball Hollywood blockbuster running out of track as their two hour genre hybrid wears on, making Bullet Train an "almost' film that is still highly watchable, if not at all memorable.Adapted from K√¥tar√¥ Isaka book, David Leitch's version of Bullet Train is a pick and mix mash-up of seriousness, OTT action, straight up comedic hi-jinks and colourful characters, as Leitch aims to emulate the likes of Guy Ritchie and Quentin Tarantino in bringing this wild ride of a train full of assassins and guns for hire to the big screen, with Pitt's trying to be a better person Ladybug caught up in the shenanigans that involve anime mascots, on the loose snakes, a significant body count and more Thomas the Tank references than you'd have ever thought plausible.In amongst everything going on in this jam-packed journey, the most surprising elements to Leitch's big-budgeted affair is just how willing he is to make things weird and it's likely that many that have witnessed the extensive marketing for this oft-delayed feature will be taken aback by just how strange things do get along the way, coinciding with the fact that while the film has been promoted as a genuine Pitt star-vehicle, Bullet Train isn't at all afraid to shun Ladybug on multiple occasions to allow its supporting cast of actors and characters time to hog the spotlight.From Joey King's ruthless Prince, Andrew Koji's Kimura and most notably Aaron Taylor-Johnson's Tangerine and Brian Tyree Henry's Lemon, those expecting Pitt to dominate screen-time here are going to be left disappointed but thankfully the film can work when Pitt isn't hamming it up as his peace aiming change seeker with Leitch giving each of his side characters some nice moments, even if in many instances you don't feel like their sub-plots and background segments make the film significantly more impactful, with some trimming of these detours potentially having allowed Bullet Train to not run out of steam as it heads towards its elongated endgame that features less look at me moments and more focus on just getting on with the job at hand.There's no doubt that despite its missteps and inability to be as cool and inventive as it thinks it is, Bullet Train still offers a fun ride but while it may be an easy and enjoyable watch, there's a missed opportunity here to create a genuine cult film that would've added to the ever growing reputation of Pitt's career that has managed to provide its fair share of timeless efforts that remain in constant conversations.Final Say -Far stranger than you're likely expecting and not the Pitt dominated event many might have hoped for, Bullet Train is a well-filmed action oddity that is unable to to grasp the greatness its story offers as it sluggishly reaches the end of the line after a bright and feverishly entertaining start.3 bucket hats out of 5For more reviews check out Jordan and Eddie (The Movie Guys)

title: Tries way too hard . Another Hollywood Fail
text: Lots of blood and luke warm forced comedy. Tries so hard to be a legendary film and fails on multiple levels. Tangerine and lemon do not convince me that they're capable of killing anything other than believability. So many unrealistic cutesy scenes and dialogue. The plot is overly complicated and tries desperately to rival a Tarantino film. Dumb character names and poor plot. Can we please start making real , innovative films again? Lastly,that female tween villain is totally a miss as far as casting.

title: Funny
text: It's an action comedy. It was a good movie. Brad Pitt was hilarious. He was my favorite character. It was kind of a crazy movie! A lot going on. But not that hard to follow.

title: Good
text: I had high hopes after seeing the trailer, and this film did not disappoint. Pitt knocks it out of the park, and the story was very captivating amazing performances by rest of the cast as well . It was an amazing story to have told.

title: Great action and tone, draws you in completely. But by the time you get to the end you have lost interest and don't believe in the weak plot line
text: I think 7.5 is too generous. It is highly watchable and it is quirky and original in tone so you get drawn in and don't stop to think about too much for the first half hour. But when you do work out what's going on and then have space to take a step back you start wondering where it is going and what is actually happening in the story then you realise it is all a bit bonkers. Which is fine, bonkers can be done well. But by the time the last 20 minutes come i was left feeling that the story was full of holes, boring, and I didn't really care how it ended, it wasn't all very believable. It was clearly a homage to Tarantino, and other quirky filmmakers, but sadly felt mostly derivative by the end rather than original.

title: Don't stop me now
text: Actually I am almost surprised the song is not in the movie - there are some other iconic songs in this. Well versions of them (sometimes with other lyrics too) - like the "hero" song to name but one. Very well placed to say the least.But apart from the songs it is the genius casting and the wonderful directing that elevates this. Also while you may have issues with CGI (blood), it really helps the movie too (especially considering everything apparently was shot on sets).Cinematography is off the rails (no pun intended) and really beautiful. I don't think it was necessary to watch it on an Imax screen, but it did pack a pun(ch) or two ... so not dissapointed either. Brad Pitt may be the most zen, but also the most action packed on screen you have seen ... well at least for the length he is doing it (no pun again).As I already said, the movie has a fantastic cast. Some of the names are not revealed in the (end) credits. And I only really knew of one of the cameos - it is the lady you hear in Pitts ear (you may even recognize her, even if you don't know who she and the fact that she is returning a favor - or is it the other way around?).There is a fair amount of violence and a lot of cool dialog along the way. In the beginning the it seemed like it wasn't mixed right though and the accents may have thrown me off a bit too. Needed some time to adjust - also the fire rapid dialog does not give you much room to breathe.Cool actors playing cool characters. I even felt rooting for the bad guys. Although technically all of them were bad guys if we are being truthful. But this is an action movie with a lot of fun stuff in it. Be it visually or in the spoken text. It even has quirks such as having two masked goons argue over a trivial thing they have to do ... but the circumstances of the briefcase they have to check and the resolution that we do expect ... well all of that elevates that scene and that odd bit quite a lot ... even if you actually could have cut it out of the movie without "hurting" the story of the movie. But it enriches the movie and it makes it better for it.I really loved the movie as you can tell and the director already had proven he can make good movies. But he has taken it to a whole new level here. You can nitpick of course and find flaws and mistakes ... but the way it is shot and the gusto with which it is made ... the passion behind it ... there is so much that works that it overshadows anything that would shine a negative light on it - no pun intended. Now strap on your seatbelt and enjoy the ride (you know I had to do it, right?)

title: Don't be a Diesel
text: This is a good film. It has good action and fight scenes. The cast is great with Brad Pitt, Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry giving the stronger performances.There's alot going on in this film and there's an overarching story that ties up everyone's reasons for being on the train. It's entertaining throughout and there's never really a dull moments, it's just the film is abit too long.I think "The Wolf's" character could have been cut out to trim the plot down and Bad Bunny's performance was the weakest of the cast. Other than that this is an enjoyable action-comedy with some great cameos that you may enjoy as long as you don't take it to seriously.

title: Loved it.
text: Straight off I have to say the casting in this was almost flawless even down to the cameos and background characters.There's no way to watch this movie and do something else at the same time as you will definitely miss something.Even though the story is straight forward the amount of flashbacks to different characters and reasons as to why they are doing certain things needs to be focused on.There's a fair amount of violence and gore but I feel it's done really well and not over the top particularly and is certainly offset by humour in a lot of places. The choreography was pretty amazing and hats off to the stars and stunt players.To be honest the only thing that I felt let down by was the CGI in some scenes and the slightly unbelievable nature of certain scenes too but I'm not throwing out spoilers.I highly recommend this movie. There are a few subtitles here and there but certainly not enough to put anyone off that doesn't like them as it takes up very little of the movie.

title: Great - but put off by poor accent
text: Great film, but removed from the immersion by Lemon's terrible London accent. It misses the mark on a number of occasions, especially when he tries to say bad arse, which he pronounces "barred arse"..... what???? As a Londoner myself, it's sound off the whole way through, it's not Dick Van Dyke, but he hasn't quite nailed it.

title: FAST LAUGHS AND ACTION
text: A sensational little fast moving cigar tube of laughs. Great characters, fun script and terrific action. Oh and twisty twisted plot.Pitt gets to play out his fantastic cameo from the pathetic Lost City. This movie gets the Bullock/Tatum/Pitt balance right and hence is a roaring success.

title: Funny, violent and useless
text: A high-speed train on which multiple killers are searching for a suitcase. This pretext is used to frame scenes, in a confined environment (a Japanese high-speed train) of indirect then direct confrontations between these different killers. We like the tone, which oscillates between cold violence and ironic humor.David Leitch, who has yet to make a remarkable film since John Wick (2014) - let's not forget that he co-directed it with Chad Stahelski -; if anything, his Atomic Blonde (2017) has a slight hysteresis.This Bullet Train is his most interesting film since John Wick. Brad Pitt's character manipulates irony. The violence is dry and brutal, and above all very bloody. The whole thing is very abstract. The film is completely unrealistic: the train carriages are empty, or the passengers are unaware of the killers' presence. And it borders on the abstract, with its large, empty tube sets. This lends a particular atmosphere to the film, which is completely implausible in almost all its sequences.

title: If this was from Tarantino .....
text: I am going to write a certainly unpopular opinion: I was bored watching this. You certainly wonder now how this is possible with all these great ratings? Well, let me try to explain:I felt it was a pinch of Pulp Fiction with each character having an "origin story" which lead to the finale. We had a grain of Reservoir Dogs with the made-up names. There was a drop of Kill Bill with the asian background, the revenge theme (for certains), the Yakuza and the fights. But there were quite a few other influences, too. For example Smoking Aces and Shoot'em Up for their crazy non-sense action.Still I thought it was boring. Hollywood these days is so out of ideas and uninspired and many writers think of themselves at the same level as for example Chrichton, Clancy .... or Tolkien (wink wink, nudge nuge, say no more) yet it becomes obvious they lack the same talent. Here the dialogues were supposed to be funny, but Hollywood is churning out one remake/reboot/update/modernized version/clone/plagiarism etc at a ludicrous pace that the customer - that's us - is getting fat, uninterested, bored, underwhelmed and it takes much more to get the praise these movie companies think they automatically deserve."Consume and root for our product ... until our next product."Sorry, this movie lacked (for me) everything the aforementioned movies have, so no, this wasn't for me "the blockbuster" so many people make it out to be. And no problem at all if you enjoyed it ;)

title: If you like action movies that border on the ridiculous
text: It's essentially a slap-stick comedy that takes place on a high-speed train between Tokyo and Kyoto. It follows the interaction between, I think, nine assassins on the train at various times for related reasons that are totally at cross-purposes.The primary characters are Ladybug (Brad Pitt), a retired assassin who has rejected violence but fills in for another agent to grab and escape a suitcase of money. His handler, Maria (Sandra Bullock), is present primarily by voice. The other primary killers are Tangerine (Aaron Taylor-Johnson) and Lemon (Brian Tyree Henry), British brothers hired to protect The Son (Logan Lerman), the son of mob leader White Death (Michael Shannon). Another key player is a British schoolgirl (Joey King) with her own agenda. Yuichi Kimura (Andrew Koji) is a criminal father seeking revenge for the attempted murder of his son. Yuichi's father (Hiroyuki Sanada) is also involved. Even a boomslang snake gets engaged.The film follows a convoluted story on the train from Tokyo to Kyoto. Much of the humor is broad, and although the violence is explicit, it is never really gruesome. As it proceeds, it seems more and more like a Marvel superhero movie with many special effects. Ladybug is still standing at the end, which is all you need to know.If you like action movies that border on the ridiculous, you'll probably enjoy "Bullet Train." The plot is a little too convoluted, but Brad Pitt is great in the lead role. Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Brian Tyree Henry, and Joey King are also memorable.

title: Very good scene
text: Brad Pitt is really just a boss man and his acting pallet is so extensive now. It's certainly going to make him a legend. Loved every bit of the movie!

title: Finally a movie that's good
text: Not perfect, but good. Yes, the "a bunch of quirky assassins after one thing" has been done before, so have action movies that take place on a train. However they were clever enough to make it work. Is this going to win any Oscars? Probably not. Did they take a couple of concepts that have been done before and make it their own? Yes. Was it an enjoyable watch? Yes. With so many disappointing movies lately, I've felt cynical, but it wasn't just that, a lot of movies that have the potential to be good nowadays have fallen flat. It's a relief to see an action/comedy, that was as good as it looked.

title: Such a Fun Film!
text: This film won't win any oscars, but it was a very fun and entertaining flick. I came in with no expectations, and thoroughly enjoyed it. Many moments that have you laughing, others have you wincing from the gore, still other moments reveal a twist from some small element earlier in the film that seems like a much bigger AHA moment than expected. Then there are the many surprise appearances that make you smile and enjoy it that much more.Don't go into the movie expecting anything amazing, but go just to enjoy a great movie with lots of action, laughter, surprises, and a pretty good soundtrack to go with it. Let your fate guide you!

title: Rock This Bad Boy Right Now
text: The movie started and within thirty minutes, three percent of the audience had left. I guess they are going to post rather negative reviews. If you thought that "Bullet Train" was about fast trains in Japan you'd be wrong. It's a little bit of "Murder on the Orient Express," "Snakes on a Plane," and "Superman" where you will see guys do impossible things. It is a serious movie and it's a comedy. It is difficult to follow, but it makes some sense. It can be ridiculous at times, but, why shouldn't it be? There might be more people killed in this movie than in "Saving Private Ryan" in its opening scene. There is a purpose for all these deaths, or is there? There are some cameos of great actors who have nothing to do with the purpose of the story but fit into the plot. Don't leave as the credits start to roll - stay at least, until mid-way through them. The movie will not be an Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences award winner, and it isn't even trying to be. Some graphics are amazing, some gory, and the language is at many times harsh (prepare for that). Remember when Hollywood said they'd stop promoting smoking? Well, at least in this one, they kept their promise. And, you will learn about the most important and enjoyable item on a bullet train ("If I had one in the chamber, I'd rock this bad boy right now"). Oh, yeah, and don't drink the water.

title: Not Sure What People are Crying About
text: Not sure what all of the over-the-top downer reviews are about here. Is it possibly because you didn't follow the actual dialog of the movie? For me- over the past few years- there's something 'up' with the sound in movies where the dialog is buried under sound effects or music. Drives me nuts. Ok, add subtitles on your TV and boom, you get what's going on. I wish filmmakers would get a handle on that so that subtitles aren't necessary. Besides the point.I don't think I have ever seen Brad Pitt not do something well. His comedic timing is really great here and if you pay attention (that means: put down your phone, stay awake, and pay attention for more than 5 minutes) the movie is pretty decent. His bathroom scenes were pretty darned funny.I WILL say that the trailer didn't make me want to watch this film. Not sure what was up with that, but it just didn't pique my interest, so I nearly passed. However, checked reviews and also said "If it sucks within 1/2 an hour, we'll find something else". Luckily, it was enjoyable.The 2 British guys were also funny. I thought the whole Thomas the Tank Engine was a weird touch at first, but if you go with it and see the brothers when they were younger, it made sense. But they were good together.The Tarantino comments review comments are probably warranted. All the gore was kind of overdone, but the movie was still a good watch.

title: Fantastic movie
text: I you want to enjoy a great movie with lots of action, laughter, surprises, and a pretty good soundtrack go and watch the movie. Every minute there is a hilarious twist, awesome action, or a funny gag. Brad Pitt really shines at the role within the movie of humor, conflict and fighting proficiency and other character are also too good to watch on the screen.

title: Fast paced crazy action with bright colors and cool choreography
text: Bullet Train (2022)If Brad Pitt wasn't in this film, I would have never even bothered with it despite being familiar with the entire cast because I've had my share of disappointing action. The first 25 minutes didn't do the movie any favors as it looked like a cheap parody of Pulp Fiction with pretentious dialogue and excessive self indulgence. I began to contemplate if I was going to end up watching Machete 3 based on the initial action, but then the plot began to get interesting, combat dialed up and the train took off.Bullet Train revolves around a bunch of assassins running after a highly prized briefcase that belongs to a crime boss named White Death. Additionally, every single killer on board has their own unique objective which ends up being derailed as new characters come into the picture. After the initial drag, the film turns into a highly dynamic ride of violence with bright colors, eccentric characters and cool choreography.While most of the cast fit their parts, I can't possibly understand what did Joey King do to get the leading role. The eccentric nature of the film can feel excessive at times as half the edginess ends up being pure cringe; I mean the whole Thomas the Train went from being a fun gimmick to an overbearing annoyance. The humor is split about 50/50 depending on your sense of humor and the dialogue can be laughably stupid at times.Nevertheless, all these negatives didn't ruin the overall fun experience that progressively dialed up the action while having a nice little element of "who-dun-it" with plenty of cameos. I also loved the "subtle" Fiji advertising. Naturally, Brad Pitt is the driving force behind this locomotive and he is highly enjoyable in the role of a chilled out assassin. Not much to see in the cinema nowadays but this film was definitely worth the trip.Movies.shmovies on Instagram for honest movie and TV Show reviews.

title: THIS MOVIE WAS MADE JUST A HUGE SELFIE FOR BRAND PIT
text: Bad humour with beyond bad acting, just a film with cringe lines it looks like this was made just for Brad Pitt's ego an attempt for himself to stay reelevate trying to hard to make himself look cool as if he wanted every take to make him look cool, the acting is soo bad the script is soo boring and stupid it actually makes all the effects and cinematography effort go down the drain really boring to watch you get nothing out of this film, I didn't even laugh once... This is far by the worse film yet Starring Brad Pitt, make me made I wasted my time watching this since it has fake high ratings.

title: Frantic ensemble action comedy held together by a bewildered Brad Pitt
text: Brad Pitt leads an insane cast of assassins trying to kill each other on a high speed Japanese train.The script does sometimes try way too hard to be clever and not all the jokes land. But by the third act, it actually comes together for a really enjoyable finale.Pitt plays his part as a perpetually confused but still capable action lead. Think if Jeff Bridges' the Dude from Big Lebowski suddenly became the lead in one of those Tarantino ripoff action flicks. He reminds us audience members that he still has the chops as an action lead but remains charming and funny.The supporting cast is a giant one and most of them fare well in their given roles. Granted they are all playing cartoon characters but they are colorful and memorable ones at least.Hiroyuki Sanada is excellent as a wise swordsman while Joey King is a great love-to-hate villain as a cold killer masquerading as an innocent schoolgirl. Brian Tyree Henry and Aaron Taylor-Johnson have this back-and-forth as hitmen who happen to be twins. Yes seriously. That is not a funny joke imo but there is a running gag about Thomas the Tank Engine that pays off surprisingly well in the climax.The movie does run a tad too long and there is a lot of CGI in the closing action scene. But it still has good jokes and visual gags like the rest of the movie leading up to it.

title: This is how comedy-action movies should be!
text: Very entertaining. Spot on comedic relief and fast paced action by some of the best actors. No scene is wasted, everything ties in the story very well.

title: Fun and Hyperactive
text: I got out of Bullet Train a couple minutes ago, and overall: it's a fun, hyperactive and action-packed movie! It's not crazy or unforgettable, but it is definitely not bad. The action is solid, but the one that that really surprised me was that Brad Pitt isn't in the film as much as you'd think he'd be. The action is great and awesome to watch when it does happen.Overall, it's not a film I could go more in depth with, as it's just a fun, enjoyable, funny and hyperactive film. It flashes in your eyes, and it moves at a very fast pace.It's a really great Popcorn Flick to watch when you're with your friends and want to go to theatres to see something funny, fast-paced and action-packed!7/10.

title: Staying Alive
text: "Bullet Train" is a thrilling ride that left me thoroughly entertained from start to finish. While some may argue that it's overrated, I personally believe it's an underrated gem that deserved more recognition, including an Oscar nomination.One of the movie's strengths lies in its diverse and engaging cast of characters, with standouts like Tangerine and Lemon stealing the show. Their dynamic personalities and quirky names add an extra layer of enjoyment to the viewing experience.The film's fast-paced action, clever dialogue, and stylish direction evoke the spirit of Quentin Tarantino's best work. From the gripping plot to the well-executed action sequences, "Bullet Train" delivers on all fronts, keeping me on the edge of my seat throughout.Even though 10/10 may be overrating I still believe that this movie got to much hate from some people.

title: Bullet Train employs David Leitch's maximalist style in a purposefully silly narrative driven by frenetic action and distinct humor.
text: If you enjoy reading my Spoiler-Free thoughts, please follow my blog to read my full review :)"Bullet Train employs David Leitch's maximalist style in a purposefully silly narrative driven by frenetic action and distinct humor.Although it doesn't stray from the familiar formulas and doesn't leave viewers blown away by never-before-seen action sequences, the execution of all the intended cinematic moments is more than satisfying, resulting in a couple of hours full of entertainment.The exceptional cast is worth the ticket, and every second with Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry is genuinely hilarious. Brad Pitt shines as well.Despite visual effects, script, and character development all traveling in economy class, it would be a "crime" not to recommend this trip."Rating: B.

title: Strong 7 for sure.
text: I quite enjoyed this movie. You can tell it wasn't made to win oscars but that's okay, as it was shot comedically with a tonne of action to enjoy. Loads of characters that are memorable and enjoyable to watch perform their act. I'd def recommend a watch if you like something like Deadpool. But no supes tho :)

title: You're a Diesel man!
text: With colourful characters, an engaging mystery plot, funny dialogue and banter, stylistic visuals and crazy action sequences. David Leitch continues to show that he is capable of making stellar action films.There are some flaws with the plot taking a while to take off due to spending a lot of flashbacks to explain all the characters and motives in the beginning. The plot is slightly convoluted and over-padded causing the film to feel much longer than necessary.However, Bullet Train is wildly entertaining once it takes off, resulting in the most hectic action movies of the year so far. Special praise to both Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry who are the most enjoyable duo in this film!

title: Unwatchable
text: I went to see this "film" because I had ever seen a bad movie with Brad Pitt. Until now. Imagine a Quentin Tarantino film but directed by a child on acid. I felt trapped on the Bullet Train with psychopaths except they weren't even interesting enough for the ride. Save your money.

title: It's an entertainer,be entertained
text: To build a comic action thriller in a confined space (in this case bullet train)is a Herculean task. For this character development is extremely necessary and when the characters are overcrowded this becomes more challenging.The family revenge involves a lot of assassins and things get tangled inside the bullet train.an interesting premise which has been handled craftily in this movie. Brad pitt has got the most screen time and shines perfectly.action scenes are smooth,slick and somehow the premise set in Tokyo perfectly fits in because of its shaoliny action sequences.The bolivian twins will give you a pulp fiction vibe inside the movie.this movie is an entertainer be entertained.

title: Perfect
text: Everything about this film is perfect. It nailed the action comedy genre and the casting was amazing. Brad Pitt was phenomenal and the bromance between tangerine and lemon, also to mention how good Aaron Taylor Johnson looked!

title: Two words, (Brad Pitt) is back
text: I've been a fan of Brad Pitt for a long time. Even in bad movies he is delightful. He's an assassin on the job on a Japanese bullet train. And then you're wondering now how's this gonna play out. I love how he plays the slightly dissholved hit man dude. I loved how he was bumbling his way through this movie, and I thought he may never accomplish his target. Then he also has to compete with 2 or 3 more assassins, who seem to be just as inadequate. What a fun way to travel on the worlds fastest train ride. There was a lot going on, as you can possibly imagine! And quite frankly I had to watch Bullet train several times to get the whole gist of what was happening, it's a fun train ride is my answer as to not spoil the films premise.

title: Loving
text: I remember how my film school made us John Wick because of its splendid directorial theme. I am sure now The Bullet Train is going to get featured similarly..

title: This is a very fun and enjoyable action/comedy - though certainly not without its flaws.
text: First and foremost, I would like to recognize and actively appreciate the very thesis of this film, that of which being a high-budget star-driven original blockbuster not attached to any previous cinematic-related IP. Even if films of this nature are a swing and a miss, I think it's important to, at the very least, celebrate the effort.As far as positives go, I really enjoyed just about everyone's performance in this film - the highlights of which being Brian Tyree Henry and Aaron Taylor-Johnson, whom I think had undeniably strong chemistry and easily the most interestingly-developed characters of the whole movie. I also think the action sequences themselves are beautifully-creative in design. The imaginative thesis of their design perhaps overshadows the execution a tad, but not in a way that dragged from the overall presentation.However, I do think the style and editing of the film can be a bit obnoxiously-overbearing at times. While it certainly is trying to achieve a style-over-substance product in its intention, I think the very notion of such a film within itself can quickly become tiresome and slightly annoying. In my view, if every single scene is dialed to a 10, then its overall impact on the audience becomes increasingly dwarfed as time goes on. A balance should be achieved, and I don't think this film knew exactly where to draw the line.In the end, I think this is a highly entertaining spectacle that absolutely deserves to be seen in theaters. It's not perfect - I'm not sure I'd even call it great - but it's unbelievably a fun experience at the theaters, and I had a great time watching.

title: Enjoyed it!!!
text: I liked the experience in the cinema the movie was amazing, funny, action, The cinematography is just beautiful. Mostly what I like is that the movie is in Japan so the different culture, the cities where need nice to look at.

title: Full of adrenaline
text: This is a much needed action movie audience have been craving. Just grab some popcorns and relax on a weekend night and have a blast. It is made to thrill the audience and full of suspence from the start.It is stylishly made with good colour gradient. The acting is great and story proceeds with good pacing, sometime too fast perhaps for some viewers.But it is enjoyable . Brad pitt is star of the movie and captures the screen every time he is in the scene.One thing is for sure that it becomes rather predictable at times and viewers starts to have an idea wha is going to happen next.Over all a good watch.

title: Watched it 4 times in theatres.
text: This is a really great movie with a really great cast and some wicked humor. I enjoyed it immensely. Lastly, we need a Lemon & Tangerine prequel please!

title: Really Entertaining and Humourous. Just go and watch.
text: The movie is fully filled with humourous content. From start to the final few seconds of the movie, humour is everywhere. Brad Pitt really did a nice job, on the humour.It's a really good entertainer, and keeps you engaged fully.Has some good plot twists here and there.The movie has a backstory in it, but as the movie focussed fully on humour, the story part, kinda fades in the back, you will be constantly engaged in what's happening on the screen.It won't be boring, but if you are a person, who is dry as a rock, or maybe prefers action movies and dark-themed movies rather than a funny movie. You MAY not like it, but it still has action scenes, and gore. It's worth a watch. Try it.

title: Over rated tosh
text: Whilst I can understand the concept, it didn't work. It promised so much but this is NOT a QT movie! I have to admit that after 30 - 40 mins I gave up trying to enjoy it (I really wanted to enjoy it after reading so many positive reviews).The frequent Thomas the Tank references were tedious and irrelevant, and added little to the humour - come to think of it; where was the humour?The violence was excessive but acceptable because it was made to be so 'unreal'. A comic strip movie with comic strip violence that just doesn't deliver.Its a shame that its a waste of Brad Pitt's talents - though he did seem to enjoy his role.

title: Is what it claims to be
text: Before watching this film, check your intentions.If you do so and find that you're looking for a fun couple of hours, you'll be in for a treat, however if you're after anything else prepare to be disappointed.The plot is rooted in the concept of 'fate' and does a good enough job at keeping you engaged, however, most of it is impossible to believe and obviously not nested in reality.There's little bits of character development here and there and Brad Pitt is phenomenal.The best: This movie is seriously fun! Great action sequences, soundtracks and visually very exciting.The worst: Tries way too hard to funny and a lot of the jokes simply don't land. This is where Brad Pitt really shines for me, everything his character does seems authentic, natural and comedic, whereas just about everyone else is the opposite.This is definitely a movie I'd watch again, but again, now what you're getting and expect nothing extra.

title: Nice movie so beautiful
text: For anyone who likes action and thriller movies, this movie serves everything you could imagine. It's a combination of a great story panned out perfect cast driven by the perfect director!

title: Likeable characters & an enjoyable plot
text: I imagine this is what a Guy Ritchie x Quentin Tarantino collaboration would look like ;-) And if that's hard to imagine then think back to Inglorious Basterds x The Gentlemen x Kill Bill with a sprinkle of Pulp Fiction :-) Characters are likeable, dialogues are witty, plot is entertaining & well structured, & cinematography is great. You have to love Brad Pitt in these types of movies ... the older he gets the more fun he becomes. Lemon & Tangerine were fabulous ... partnered beautifully with Pitt!Watched this not expecting much & suspecting it will be a cashed up action flick ... turned out to be a very enjoyable, lighthearted movie that is even suitable for a family movie night (if kids are old enough to appreciate a fast-paced clever adult-oriented dialogue).

title: Osm
text: Awesome movie Brad Pitt did a fantastic job and held my interest the entire time. I wasn't let down because the story felt new and fresh. I'll most likely watch it one again.

title: not bad for what it is
text: Okay, it's a derivative mashup of Tarantino & Ritchie gimmicks, w/ Brad Pitt playing Brad Pitt, but unless you're expecting something different, what's wrong with that? Plus some derivative "Snakes on a Plane" business as a bonus feature.One way it really stumbles though is with a soundtrack of randomly inappropriate and irrelevant songs slapped on every once in a while, none of them much good. A bit distracting, but doesn't ruin the show.As Pauline Kael said: "The movie doesn't have to be great; it can be stupid and empty and you can still have the joy of a good performance, or the joy in just a good line. You talk less about good movies than about what you love in bad movies."

title: Great example of a good action comedy
text: I just really enjoyed the comedy and the action that was implemented to this movie. The story is really well detailed too, and the cinematography of this movie is awesome. I loved how they catched the perspective of every character. Pretty good movie.

title: Brad Pitt carries
text: While I did think the movie was very fun with a unique premise, the movie folds in fully fleshing out its characters and makes some intentionally ridiculous and ironic twists that that just miss. By the end, I knew where it was going as the plot is straight forward but the superficial story telling did not have me bought in. The twists don't work well since we don't get enough background on the big ensemble to care much about them. HOWEVER. Brad Pitt is a phenomenal presence from start to finish. He takes a jokey script and plays it amazingly. I felt like the character was somewhat of a play off his awesome Once Upon a Time in Hollywood one since he was incredibly laid back and funny yet somehow super engaging. If not for Pitt, I would have rated this a 5. He makes up for a chaotic movie that does not have enough runtime or sharp writing to stick the landing. I would compare watching the movie to watching a random sports game on TV that has some ridiculous plays and a star talent. You're entertained but you couldn't care less about who wins.

title: Incredibly Hilarious
text: Never laughed so hard at a film as much as I did watching Bullet Train, burst out laughing in the cinema with my best friend immediately when the film was finished. The storyline is clever and full of humour, heartwarming at times too. Plenty of interesting characters that have great backstories and are played perfectly by the actors. Honestly my favourite film I've watched this year so far, definitely recommend!

title: A Tarantino Try Hard
text: When Bullet Train is not trying to be a Tarantino rip-off or trying to cram eight separate movies into one, it can be an enjoyable ride. However, this is not the case most of the movie, getting derailed by the third act due to a mess of a story.

title: Gripping and hair-rising film with plenty of unstopped action , crossfire and overwhelming fights
text: Brad Pitt stars this action movie with large doses of tongue-in-cheek and twisted humor (a very violent and black humor) compellingly directed by David Leitch (Atomica). A former professional assassin code-named Ladybug (Brad Pitt) goes back to work with a newly positive attitude, where he is assigned by his handler, Maria Beetle (Sandra Bullock) , to collect a briefcase aboard a bullet train travelling from Tokyo to Kyoto after her normal contact, Carver (Ryan Reynolds) , is forced to call out due to illness. Unbeknownst to the mission tasked to Ladybug, three other killers are on board: hit-men brothers Tangerine (Aaron Taylor-Johnson) and Lemon (Brian Tyree Henry) and deceptively innocent schoolgirl The Prince (Joey King) . Tangerine and Lemon have been contracted by White Death (Michael Shannon) , ringleader and head of the world's largest crime syndicate, who seized control of the Japanese underworld years before.. The end of the line is just the beginning!Thrilling and nail-biting movie with plot twists , violent struggles , kinetic energy , very high body-count and paced in a comic-book style. In the purest style of filmmakers like Quentin Tarantino, Bullet Train is all action, with charismatic, satirical characters, extensive dialogues full of ironic phrases, explicit violence and a narrative structure with continuous time jumps. The picture based on the novel Bullet Train by Kotaro Isaka, follows a group of gangsters who meet in a high-speed train traveling from Tokyo to Marioka. Most of them do not know each other and supposedly have different targets , but nothing could be further from reality, since their missions intersect in ways that not even they suspect . It's an action-packed film with an engaging mingle of suspense , martial arts , gun-play , killing rituals with weird codes and bloody shootouts . The plot is simple and plain , as hired killer Ladybug being forced into action and steadily butchering his merciless enemies , while inching ever closer to the long-awaited bloody reunion with the boss killer who attempts to exact a relentless vendetta . This is a bone-chilling thriller with non-stop action , including impressive fighting with a lot of blood and gore . It's a mindless but enjoyable for thrillers and martial arts aficionados of the old style , but adding some new technical being made by means of digital computer generator as well as expert stunts . Abundant fist-fights and lethal fights in which arms and body parts are slice off here and there and limbs are slit open everywhere or blasted apart . Of course , highlights of the film are the impressive and groundbreaking fights with lots of blood dropping here and there. .Together with Brad Pitt, other good actors are part of the ensemble cast in the film with a lot of nice and familiar players , such as : Joey King (Wish Upon) , Aaron Taylor Johnson (Avengers), Brian Tyree Henry (Eternals), Hiroyuki Sanada (47 Ronin) , Andrew Koji, although it has numerous cameos, such as : the singer Bad Bunny, Sandra Bullock, Ryan Reynolds, Masi Oka, Logan Lerman , Michael Shannon and Channing Tatum.It displays a charming and rousing musical score by Dominic Lewis , including some popular and catching songs . As well as colorful and brilliant cinematography by cameraman Jonathan Sela. The motion picture was competently directed by David Leitch , who began his career as Pitt's stunt double in The Fight Club. In fact , on the martial arts circuit, he met Chad Stahelski with whom has co-directed some films .Leitch who was living in LA, starting his career as a stuntman. Leitch is a martial artist, skilled in several arts such as: Muay Thai, Shootwrestling, boxing, wrestling, movie fights, and was a national competitor in Kickboxing. Leitch is well known producer/director of box office films , such as : John Wick (2014) , Deadpool: No Good Deed (2017), Deadpool 2 (2018), Fast & Furious: Hobbs & Shaw (2019) and Atomica (2017). Rating : 7.5/10 . Above average. The pic with appeal to Brad Pitt fans.

title: Nice
text: Fun filled fiction based on the book of the same name , most of the story is made up for the creative freedom. This is one of those energetic films, that are good to watch. Brad Pitt fans can watch it for sure.

title: Great action and comedy... but it's that enough?
text: Bullet Train was one of my most anticipated movies of 2022 and it wasn't everything I wished for it to be.While the film is filled with colourful characters, the setting, design and premise was quite interesting at the beginning, Bullet Train unfortunately ended up feeling as an increasingly ridiculous action display without much story there for the most part. I am not trying to sound pretentious, I understand some movies are just meant to be fast paced and action-packed, but I needed something else so that it wouldn't feel just like noise by the end of it.The performances are a standout, this isn't the best Brad Pitt has been, but he is functional to the story and believable as the capable yet desperate protagonist Ladybug.Brian Tyree Henry and Aaron Taylor-Johnson are surprisingly great as the unlikely twins Lemon and Tangerine, the relationship between the two characters felt to me like the direct connection with the audience throughout the film, this is the only emotional arc I actually care about (did I find Aaron hotter than Brad Pitt too? Wow, never thought the say would come).

title: Derivative, but funny and talented
text: Yes, it is clearly derivative of Tarantino with large chunks of the plot and characters being direct quotes from his masterpieces - the 'black and white' Lemon/Tangerine unfortunate gangster tandem undeniably copy-pasted from the classic Pulp Fiction. And yes, a lot of others attempted to follow those same master footsteps before and the majority failed miserably.This attempt, however, is also undeniably different and presents a perfect example of how it can actually work: derivation becomes an ironic yet respectful bow to the master, and same old recognisable tricks mixed in a fresh talented arrangement become a masterpiece in its own right.That's how the magic of creation happens anyway, in my opinion: everyone has the same elements to use and mix, but some mixtures fall flat and others fly off. This one is obviously the latter. This 'just right' combination of the cast, style, setting, music, plot dynamics, ratio of the silly vs funny jokes somehow works and results in a fresh, truly hilarious and engaging spectacle. Could be a sign of a true talent or a pure luck, but does it really matter?

title: A fun ride; nothing more and nothing less
text: I'd been hearing some mixed things about this, and the critic reviews were surprisingly pretty low. But the movie looked like it could be enjoyable, and despite the less than amazing critical response, it still seemed like it had enough things going for it. Maybe it all helped to lower my expectations, because I had a good time with this overall; definitely ended up better than I was expecting.It's also difficult to write about in any great depth. It's just straightforward, fairly stupid entertainment, with a plot that's got many moving parts, but ultimately, all that matters is there's a bunch of shady criminals/assassins on a single bullet train, and they clash and fight and banter amongst themselves for two hours before the end credits roll.It's a good time while you're watching it, but it definitely dawned on me as soon as it finished that a fair amount of it didn't add up, or otherwise felt a little too silly. Still, I barely worried about that while the movie was actually going on, so I'm not even sure it's too much of a problem to realise the ride was kind of contrived when the ride itself was fun.What was more noticeable - when it comes to flaws - was the hit and miss humour. Some of the comedy worked, but some of it didn't really, and there were a few jokes I think they could have cut completely from the movie, which also would have helped with the pacing.But there's enjoyable action, simple but fun characters, and a cast doing mostly solid work. Brad Pitt is surprisingly good, and gives a central performance that is to this movie what Lebowski's rug was to his room: he really tied it all together.

title: Very amazing
text: Excellent work from Brad Pitt and Joey King as actors! Despite the odd pairing, they both did a great job in their respective jobs. When it comes to growing his action film resume, David Leitch can never fail. The Bullet Train is just one more title in his long list of legendary action pictures!

title: Very Entertaining!
text: This film caught my attention, not from its trailer, but it's movie poster. I loved it's almost retro looking poster and became interested.Directed by David Leitch, this is based on the Japanese novel of the same name. The plot remains the same, where an assassin who wants to retire is brought into another mission that is secretly interconnected with missions that various other assassins are on. To avoid spoilers, I'll keep it at that.For the record, Brad Pitt in action comedies is usually gold and this is no different. On that note, don't expect too much from this and you will have a blast. There's no real drama. It's sort of reminiscent of Mr. And Mrs. Smith in terms of tone, another film starring Pitt.The action fits the tone. It's action packed but keeps you laughing and into what's going on.The cast is tremendous. Pitt and Sandra Bullock are naturally awesome but I was completely surprised by Joey King, who I thought was miscast at first, but she does a great job.The only real flaw is that the film is not for everyone. This is very much a movie that will appease action fans, but not really anyone else.So overall, it's fun, funny and action packed. Go in with those expectations and it won't let you down.

title: Nice
text:
The Bullet Train is going to break all the shackles and records. Star studded cast with most basic yet outstanding story line. Loved how It progressed and was a delight for the viewers
Brad Pitt and Joey King together in a movie, always knew this is going to be so amazing and that's how it was!!! Loved it, The Bullet Train is surely one of the best I've watched in recent times..

title: Wow such garbage
text: Did the people who rated this movie 10 and 9 watch the same.movie that I watched? What are they smoking? This movie is a worthless piece of garbage. Utterly boring, senseless and stupid. It fails to hold your attention for more than a few minutes. I had to watch this movie over several hours and even that was painful. I think most of the top rated reviews are manipulated just to hype this movie. There is absolutely nothing in this movie including Brad Pitt that is worth watching. If you have time to waste then you are welcome to waste it watching this movie and even then I bet it would be difficult to sit through the entire movie without taking a break. Hollywood needs a reboot. They are producing absolute garbage these days.

title: Kill Brad
text: Utterly ludicrous Kill Bill x Pulp Fiction x Guy Ritchie hybrid that is also an extremely fun and entertaining thrill ride. Brad is in a joyful mood scurrying about the bullet train trying to avoid a multitude of assassins and Japanese henchman taken straight from O'Ren Ishii's crew of psychos in Kill Bill. Part 1. Some wonderful cameos are littered throughout, so it's best to go in blind to the theatre, as this film is a nice little surprise in itself. The supporting cast of mostly no-name actors are sensational, particularly Lemon and Tangerine, who deliver multiple laugh out loud moments. I was expecting a low budget indie-flick, but this is a big budget spectacle that spares no expense, and delivers in spades. 7/10.

title: Superb
text: Bullet train is a very enjoyable movie. The story-line is easy to follow which makes the movie more engaging. In addition to this the film is adapted from the novel which makes it more relatable for some people.

title: A Fun Modernized Whodunnit
text: This movie reminded of the recent adaptation of Agatha Christie's Orient Express. It is not a conventional whodunnit, but it shares many elements of that narrative type. In a constricted setting (in this case a bullet train), we are given clues about a murder as events progress. In that context we get to know a brief background story of several passengers and their connection to the central plot.The difference here is that the main character comes through the whole thing in a whimsical lucky fashion, rather than through his detective skills. It still shares in the spirit of Agatha Christie though, in the sense that the detective is not hired necessarily for the job, but comes across the mystery by accident. Here, however, the idea of accidents is at the core of the movie's philosophy or message, which is not really that hidden. As in the audience does not have to work to get the message the movie is trying to communicate. For it is blatantly given through the characters' dialogues: there is no bad luck or good luck, there is only fate. Don't fight or curse that fate but accept it. That kind of flow philosophy is reminiscent of many eastern philosophies, stoicism and other spiritual traditions.This is another important feature of this movie, which is diversity and globalization. The movie is set in Japan and there are many Asian actors with crucial roles. There are also Mexicans, Russians, British, etc. Several languages are spoken, references to anime and British cartoon, diverse music, etc. This all makes the movie feel international, and although this sometimes feels like it is forced, it is balanced out by the witty and whimsical nature of the movie.The dialogue itself is not bad, and extremely funny. This is an entertaining movie from start to finish. The actors are charismatic and perform their roles well. Brad Pitt plays a role that we are not used to see him in, a sort of hipster. He does it in a subtle way though that goes well with the plot.The gore in the movie is over the top and really unnecessary in my opinion. I understand that it is part of the general feel of the movie. Where it seeks to be silly by being over the top in everything, but still I didn't enjoy the level of blood. The action sequences are well done though, and in general carry the idea of luck/fate throughout the movie, almost like a looney tunes cartoon. In general, I was entertained by this movie and would recommend it for an easy watch, action comedy. This genre has been lacking for sometime, so the fact that it's done in a new way is itself impressive. Also, I like that the overall message, even if a bit forced and ignores the audience's intelligence, is a good one.

title: Very wild and fun Action train !
text:
Finally, an action film appears in the cinema, in which there is a lot of action and the most important thing is high-quality, so the film does not disappoint at all and does not let you get bored.The film at the beginning looks like the fruit of Guy Richie, but unfortunately.. the story is confusing and complicated at the beginning because I work a lot, but as the film develops, everything falls into place and the film becomes an energetic device, with a good and bright company of actors, laughter and effective images.There are a few cameos in the film, I really didn't believe it, but it's a pity in very short scenes. Brad Pitt and Aaron Taylor-Johnson
duo chemistry is most insane ,like the actors are known for their charisma, so it is difficult to predict who is waiting for a minute or a few.so I'll have a snack and go to the bullet express!!

title: Fantastic story
text: I am not going to give out any spoilers but the movie has 2 cameos that will take your breath away. Love it when there are special appearances you don't expect!

title: Not a favourite, but no complaints
text: A surprisingly fun action movie that hits all the notes you expect to find in an action movie in a refreshing way.This film somewhat feels like what would happen if you took the Murder on the Orient Express concept and turned it into an action movie instead of a mystery. You lose a lot of good story-telling, but you end up with a lot of fun - which is honestly all I really wanted out of this movie.Bullet Train hits all the action beats you hope and expect to find. It does not really do anything too new, but it is a good break from all the heavy dramas out in the world today.I think most audiences would have a fun time with this movie. No one will call it their favourite, but very few would complain about watching it.

title: Great movie
text: The actors of the movie are chosen perfectly, everything about this movie is great. I am in love with Joey King, she is so beautiful and cute. A must watch movie.

title: A Stylish, Chaotic and Kawaii Ride through Japan
text: Action movies are often filled with formulaic tropes, and although Bullet Train's plot is rather convoluted, its cinematography was the one element that caught my eye. The cinematography combines cyberpunk elements with both traditional and kawaii Japanese culture. The shots involving the White Death felt like they were ripped straight from Ghost of Tsushima with its setting in traditional Japanese temples and households. Meanwhile, the shots of Tokyo in the opening sequence showed off Japan's modern technological cityscape and had a very cyberpunk feel to them. During the train ride, we see more of the modern-day kawaii culture of Japan mostly with the mascots for their most popular anime.To complement the cinematography, the acting was extremely entertaining. I especially liked Brad Pitt's comedic timing and banter with both Sandra Bullock and Aaron Taylor-Johnson. Pitt's on screen chemistry with Bullock is so good that I kept referring to this film as The Lost City in Tokyo way too many times. But besides Pitt and Bullock, I really enjoyed Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry's chemistry. The two really feel like brothers and I wished I saw more of their insane adventures as assassins. Additionally, I also liked Joey King as The Prince. This is the second film that I saw Joey King in since Ramona and Beezus. And I have to say, she surprised me with how well she can hold her own among the likes of Pitt and Taylor-Johnson.Besides the cinematography and acting, the action sequences are absolutely insane! The action is tight in both hand to hand combat in addition to some really over-the-top Fast and Furious style set pieces. This should come off as no surprise as David Leitch has loads of experience in the action genre, creating exhilarating and jaw-dropping scenes whether it's in hand to hand combat, car chases or fights on moving vehicles. One aspect of Leitch's filmmaking that I really like is his use of slow motion. Leitch uses slow motion to not only emphasize certain scenes but also allows for audiences to catch their breath and truly absorb the madness unfolding in front of them before the scene snaps back into real time.Despite the insane action, the plot does feel overly cluttered. Coming in at a bit over two hours, the film does feel a bit too long for my taste especially with the multitude of backstories and characters. Speaking of which, I do feel there were too many characters crammed in. I understand that the film was based off a book, but books have the luxury of telling multiple backstories through hundreds of pages, unlike a film. Some characters were just introduced and given a backstory despite only being in the film for a few minutes.Although the film does suffer from a messy plot and too long of a runtime, I still think it's worth checking out for the action, cinematography and humor alone. Bullet Train is more like a Fast and Furious movie than anything else. Treat it as such and you won't be disappointed as you brace yourself for a fun, chaotic ride through The Land of the Rising Sun.

title: Overrated fake Quentin Tarantino movie
text: Tries so hard to be a Quentin Tarantino movie but here the acting is mediocre to woody. The action is copied from HK movies, the plot is silly slapstick but problem was it's so predictable.The gory scenes are funny. There are one or two spots that are laugh out loud for a few seconds but the accents are so bad and the acting is so bad.The CGI is ok . But the music is overdramatic. Some scenes are illogical and just forced.It is entertaining if you are stones at home with nothing else to watch then it's OK in that case.The music is also over the top. Some scenes would be crying boring if it wasn't for the over the top sound effects and music.

title: How much excitement can happen on a train?
text: This wasn't a bad movie however they definitely ran out of wow factors. Just goes to show you there's only so much action that can take place on a train and they ran out of ideas. The scripts were just okay. I say just okay because the banter between the duo assassins was full of mumblings and was difficult to understand. They certainly didn't have the best writers for this movie. I don't understand why directors like to throw in a British actor with such a horrible accent that makes it difficult to know what they're saying. That's a clear indicator they're low on creativity and just need some element to fill up the space. I feel they want viewers to take the focus off the boring movie and try to decipher what the character is saying. This is another movie whose writers decided to throw in an extremely fake scenario. It brought this movie to the level of stupidity for a while. How does a train continue to speed up even after ripping out the computer that controls it? And the part where the two trains collided was just as dumb. How does one train go airborne while the other one stays on the track?? Thankfully there were scenes that didn't involve the train so that picked up the pace and energy. Despite not having the best writers it's still better than 90% of the other crap on the red N.

title: Great movie
text: A movie you cannot miss for sure. I was recommended to watch this movie by a friend but now I am thankful to him. A perfect movie for with great ending.

title: Fast Paced Action Thriller
text: There's more than a touch of Tarantino about this fast paced action thriller, which contains a great deal of excessive, cartoonish violence, relieved by lashings of dark humour, and a cast of larger than life villains. It's an entertaining way to spend just over two hours, as long as you have a strong stomach for the frequent graphic violence, but don't expect the story to make much sense, or it to have any depth beyond the level of visceral thrill. Brad Pitt holds the plot together, and Aaron Taylor Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry make a good double act. The attempt to give it a little more depth, by introducing a theme of the effect of fate on a person's life seemed unconvincing, though.

title: Fun ride from start to finish, hop on
text: One of the most fun movies to come out in recent times. An absolutely fun ride from the moment the movie starts, hardly a dull moment. Brad Pitt has got his weird cool guy persona full on and almost every character will make an impression. Don't miss it.

title: Brutal, Viscous, and Delicious on a Train
text: Bullet Train earns 7 bags of popcorn. It's an instant classic!I love Mr. Pitt so I am biased, but this movie is two hours of nonstop fun. Trains are exciting already so add the element of a train that's called a bullet and you got yourself a story.The plot was very convincing. I thought they portrayed a scenario where many assassins find themselves on the same train very realistically. I don't think this is based on a true story but they could've easily added that in the opening credits and I would have believed it.The title is also very clever because bullet trains are fast and also deadly just like the story in the film. You have punching, kicking, wrestling, poison, guns, swords, trains. If you take all the fighting scenes in this movie and put them together.To quote the Tom Cruise movie, "you had me at bullet train". I highly recommend this movie if you're looking to enjoy a Friday night. Maybe you're by yourself, you're a little tired and you don't feel like trying to hang out with friends. Put on this movie and you'll feel like you're with friends.

title: Non-stop action
text: Kind of confusing at first, you have to figure out what's going on. It might've been only my theater, but we could not understand what people were saying most of the time. I highly recommended watching this movie with captions. I definitely will next time. We missed a lot just by not being able to understand the characters. Other than that visually this movie is so stunning. Easily some of the best cinematography of the year. Brad Pitt was also good in this movie. Great characters and an interesting story. The kind of movie that doesn't need a sequel.

title: Great movie
text: The wolf (Character led by Bad Bunny) is more interesting and fun to watch. He has done a great job by giving good competition to Brad Pitt. The overall movie has a spice and fun plot.

title: Rock 'n' Roll
text: A stylish, well made bum bum, and then some more. Bullet Train is a fun ride if you like comedy packed with action, lots of. A fun having cast, some crazy ideas and characters, make this one an enjoyable easy watch. Just leave all logic behind and get some coke and popcorn. Last but not least, the movie got some filler scenes mostly with wanna-be tarantinoesque dialogues, sadly they are rather tiresome than interesting and entertaining. Therefore a rate of 6 and not more.

title: I had been warned that this Brad Pitt movie was a disappointment and they were right!
text: Another Quentin Tarantino wannabe that failed spectacularly. The ingredients are all to recognizable: a bunch of weird characters, lots of violence, funny soundtrack and lots of flashbacks. But despite all these Tarantino ingredients "Bullet Train" simply hasnt got any movie magic or soul.The bad: it's not funny. They have TRIED to make it funny, with lots of silly English accents and supposedly silly situations, but I didnt laugh once. Not once.More bad: it's static. Nothing much happens. Everything takes part in the same setting of the train. That shouldnt have been a problem PROVIDED the characters and the story were strong and interesting. But unfortunately both were NOT interesting at all.Not any good then? Perhaps best suited for those who are just into a brainless "action" movie with lots of blood shed. Perhaps fans of that will be interested in watching it.I got bored. Really bored. Why? Because I NEED BELIEVABLE characters and an interesting suspenseful story with true to life dialogues. NONE of that was present. Big DISAPPOINTMENT. I had been warned by many others that "Bullet Train" was a failure and they were absolutely right!

title: Snappy, fun, but ultimately underwhelming and convoluted
text: Bullet Train's strength is its cast. A-listers abound, from lead to supporting on down to the one-off cameos. The performances reflect it. Brad Pitt is... well, Brad Pitt, and. Brian Tyree Henry steals the show at every turn.The production value? Absolutely phenomenal. This is what a nine-figure budget will land you. Movies like this are the future of the box office. If you're not going to feature caped comic book heroes or the seventh installment of a longstanding franchise you're going to have to dazzle audiences, and that's exactly what Bullet Train does.The story? Well... that's where we begin to falter. It's actually a great story, and I can only imagine the structure boards in the writing room. There's a LOT to pull off here narratively. And structurally they do. Bullet Train gives us all the twists, turns, script flips, flashbacks, surprise arcs, and any other storytelling methods conjureable to tell an entertaining story.But the exposition... that's what kills us and is Bullet Train's grand flaw, and why it earns seven stars from me. By the adrenaline-packed third act it's apparent the writers have painted themselves into a proverbial corner and there's not much they can do to back out of it. And then, in a single scene, writer Zak Olkewicz commits the ultimate crime: assassinating the audience with a wearisome, drawn-out expository sequence explaining, in one cumbersome session, half-disguised in entertaining graphics, what the entire plot REALLY was. It's the film's cardinal sin, and ultimately reeks of laziness.Does the film overcome that flaw? Sure, it's wildly entertaining. But from a technical standpoint it's dragged down at its most important moment by a lack of creativity behind the pen. Bullet Train never fully comes off the tracks, but it loses too much steam at its crescendo.

title: Great movie! If you subscribe to Netflix this is not for you
text: Being 2 hours long, anyone who subscribes to Netflix and binge watches TV shows without question will find this to be not their thing. You will need an attention span not suited to streaming services and social media addicts.This movie is a fun experience. There is nothing particularly needed to enjoy it other than to bring yourself along. There's no complexity to the script and its simplicity offers something for everyone.Brad Pitt shows his range in comedy and is able to pinpoint the atmosphere of the story within his performance. This is not a movie to be taken seriously. It's intended as a movie to be enjoyed by all and that is exactly what you get.

title: Great movie

Brad Pitt gives a terrific lead performance, make fun of himself whilst still being an action star. Hiroyuki Sanada and Andrew Koji have also demonstrated their finest acting skills. The movie actually worth the price of admiration.

title: Surprisingly good!
text: First part of the movie was very hard to follow, at one point I even thought of just walking away, however, I am glad I gave it a chance! title: Amazing
text: I didn't realize how stacked the cast of this movie was. The style of each character is elevated through the vivid storytelling and editing. The movie is an action comedy film based on the Japanese novel "Maria Beetle" by Kotaro Isaka. Like with his previous films of David Leitch, Leitch injects plenty of stylized action into practically every scene, even ones focused mainly on exposition. The fight scenes are really well done, movie just had me smiling the whole time. My favourites of the year easily and highly recommend going to see this one asap.

title: Well that was fun!
text: Pulp Fiction on a train? Snakes on a Train?High on style, less so on substance, but a fun ride nonetheless. Takes a while to get going but once it does, it's a mostly a fun ride. Could have used some fat trimming for sure.The movie's ability to keep its two secret cameos under wraps was impressive, with one being an absolutely hilarious addition. The ensemble cast was really entertaining.All in all a great action comedy, as long as you suspend A LOT of disbelief in how it got all its seemingly unrelated pieces to fit in the end.

title: I didn't go to the theater... I took a ride on a train. Fun film!
text: When I first saw trailers for this movie, I knew I wanted to see it. I figured with the cast it'd be cool. Even with that, I went in with super low expectations not really knowing what to expect.I'll agree with what I've read other places; That it takes a good 30-40 minutes before you see what the setup is going to be for this movie but man, did I love it? I had so much fun with this little flick.I do feel like some of the subtle humor flew over the audience I was with but overall, I loved it! This movie is going to fly under the radar but hopefully, it'll find a cult following. There are too many characters and parts to not have some kind of cult following.The sound in my theater was awesome too. After getting on the train, I totally suspended where I was and it felt like I was on a train for the entire movie. The train whooshing/general noise sounds and being able to look out the train windows in the background totally worked for me. The sound in my theater was that good.The last thing I'll say is that's the best theater exit I've had in a while for an action movie. Everyone seemed happy and chatty about what they had just seen. I didn't hear one negative thing about the movie walking out.

title: Absurd action movie again? After Thor: Love and Thunder?
text: This movie is very absurd and somehow harder than Thor: Love and Thunder (2022) to understand the jokes. The director looks like wants to create a similar movie ambiance and absurd action. He may be successfully created Deadpool 2 (2018) but this movie quality is just so so than that. Jokes could be considered as pros but also cons.The movie pros are a lot of huge casts even for cameo roles. Sandra Bullock and Channing Tatum look like paying their debt to Brad Pitt for his cameo role in their movie, The Lost City (2022). The movie set, costumes, and music are great.Besides that, the movie's biggest pro is an abstract plot that is well-narrated.Firstly, the abstract scenario is when a bunch of chars is contracted to do their own job via bullet train, a very fast train which is "bullet" as a metaphor for the train speed. Then, slowly but surely every char. Are collided in the same scenario and is forced to stay on the bullet train. The great narration is the audience is easily distracted to guess how can be all chars are related to the same scenario. A bunch of jokes are provided.But the funny things just happen for some time. Sometimes, too many jokes and it is inappropriate which distracts emotional or intense moments. This becomes movie cons. Absurd jokes maybe could be the perfect thing for our world because there are so many bizarre and chaotic moments, but plz not too much. Even though, there were very absurd jokes which is a vivid ad for a brand that is also an unimportant story.In my POV, movie jokes maybe a lil bit similar to Deadpool 2 (2018), Thor: Love and Thunder (2022), and The Gentlemen (2019). Gentlemen's comedy and action quality are a lil bit similar to The Gentlemen (2019) which is tend to become an elegant and sophisticated fashion.Nevertheless, this movie is fun to watch but don't expect too much. The great cast, absurd jokes, and action are refreshing. Maybe we need that to entertain and escape our minds for a lil bit from reality. As always, I didn't expect anything before watching in the cinema. Enjoy this movie or just pass it.

title: A bad copy of a copy of a copy.
text: From Smoking Aces to Snatch to Pulp Fiction to Snakes on a Plane, Bullet Train plagerises them all. The writers must've thought that ripping off far superior movies would make the viewer associate this laughable dumpster fire with them and therefore produce a small subliminal dopamine hit. They were wrong, Bullet Train just looks plain bad by comparison. We have the usual tropes, the hit man working through his "issues", a pair of cockney geezers talking bollocks about Thomas the Tank Engine, the deadly female assassin dressed as a school girl and psychotic Russian gangsters. These characters are meant to be quirky and entertaining, they are boring and anoying. The fight choreography is terrible, the dialogue excruciating, the CGI diabolical and the acting atrocious. WTF is Brad Pitt doing in this garbage? Surprisingly the third act is better than the proceeding two as elements of the messy plot are resolved but it's still absolute BS.

title: A Slow Start Gives Way to a Strong Ending
text: The movie gets off to a very slow start, with heavy British dialogue-driven scenes, but is saved by a second half that picks up drastically. As the plot progresses and connections are made, the time between the aptly devised combat sequences shrinks. The director, David Leitch, showcased some nifty filming in confined locations, and the use of CGI was more restrained than the typical modern blockbuster. There are a few clever plot points, such as the difference between Ladybug and Prince's perceptions of luck, but there was more exposition than I tend to prefer, and it was far from subtle. It was also longer than needed, and I suspect the filmmakers had hopes of a far funnier final product. Nevertheless, it was a pleasant surprise to see Michael Shannon make a brief appearance at the end of the film, as he's one of the more consistent actors currently working. I could think of worse ways to spend a Friday night than grabbing a few drinks with your friends and putting on Bullet Train.

title: Playful and fun
text: The first 20 minutes doesn't instil much confidence this is going to be any good. The Guy Ritchie style 'mockney' grates and there are clear borrowings of Ritchie gangster comedies, Tarantinoeque dialogue and non-linear plotting, and Kingsman style violence. But as it gets going, it somehow finds its form, never taking itself too seriously. There is a charm and playfulness, with well played characters. It even gives the feeling like it could be a play set on the train and you never know who is going to end up dead or alive. It at times veers close to being a disaster of a film to somehow pulling it back and being fun and funny and by the end a thumbs up for entertaining comic book action and story telling.

title: Fast and Fun
text: Movie reminded me of something of Quentin Tarantino. Very fast paced, aggressively quirky in a way that works and pays off most of the time. Character development doesn't stand out because it only occurs in the main protagonist, which is very disappointing because the film does a good job of getting us intrigued in a lot of the side characters, but end up doing nothing once we are made to become invested in these characters. An argument could be made that this is because it adds to the unpredictably that this movie seemingly goes out of its way to incorporate. The plot at times can be confusing and while watching this movie it often becomes an afterthought. Each character has an agenda. But, this agenda changes the longer they stay on the train. Which was hinted at in the trailer and in the movie by seemingly the theme song for this movie "stayin alive".Overall this movie got a 7/10 because I believe it accomplished what it was set out to do. This is a very entertaining movie, a lot is happening and it commands your attention and rewards you for giving it. Numerous times I found myself laughing and reacting to the gorey and flashy action sequences that are everywhere in this film. There is an underlying message to be received if you pay attention to ladybugs character arch and it is super relatable and will always be relevant in a more spiritualish way. This movie could have scored a higher rating if more characters were given a better arch. If the plot was more of a priority. If you're looking for something to do on the weekend and are looking for a good time and to be entertained I don't believe you'd be disappointed if you devoluted your time to this film. Is this film going to change your life. Absolutely not, is it a terrible film. Absolutely not. I recommend watching this film if you are interested but you definitely don't need to go out of your way.

title: One of the Worst of This Year

title: A Middle Of The Track Action Flick With Moments Of Thrill.
text: Bullet Train cruises along, delivering an enjoyable action-packed ride. The film offers adrenaline-fueled sequences and a charismatic ensemble cast, led by Brad Pitt. While the plot may hit familiar beats, the engaging performances and dynamic action scenes keep the momentum rolling. The pacing occasionally wavers, preventing it from reaching top speed, but the film manages to deliver a satisfying blend of entertainment and intrigue. Bullet Train may not break new ground, but it certainly keeps audiences on track. It's a fun, albeit predictable, journey that delivers on its promise of adrenaline fueled excitement.
