title: A Crazy Expository Train Ride
text: As Hollywood tends to enjoy adapting fictional works from Japan, it would make sense that they'd tackle a semi-unknown black comedy thriller novel called Maria Beetle and make it into a theatrical action comedy called Bullet Train. Released in the summer of 2022 to mixed critical responses, it was nevertheless a modest financial success and did bring some awareness of the novel to a mainstream universal audience. Coming from the director of Atomic Blonde and Deadpool 2, this kind of film seems like it would be a perfect addition to the type of action flicks we're into nowadays, and rightfully so.The film follows an unlucky assassin named Ladybug whose current mission sets him on a collision course with global lethal adversaries aboard the fastest train in Tokyo, Japan. As this film has a lot going on story wise, it could have so easily gone all over the place and had no real sense of cohesion. Thankfully, the main end goal of all the characters ties everything together as each and every one of them have a different reason for being on said train, or at least in conjunction to said train's schedule. In addition to Ladybug being on the train to steal a briefcase being sent to a terrifying crime boss known as the White Death, there's "The Prince," who puts on the facade of an innocent schoolgirl in lieu of her being a devilishly clever murderer, and British brothers Tangerine and Lemon having to protect the briefcase. There are so many targets and criminals coming into play with the crime spree, many of whom play a significant role in the insanity on display. While Bullet Train's themes of fate, luck and karma are nothing new, the bonkers plot still makes them funny enough to take home.Speaking of bonkers, as much as the film offers carnage and dark drama, its overall tone is much more sardonically comical and somewhat of a lampoon on this type of genre. With a good amount of absurd flashback montages, witty banter during heavy weaponed fight scenes, and mocking the generic tropes common in action packed nonsense, there is a clear influence from modern filmmakers like Quentin Tarantino and Guy Ritchie. Much of this is lifted from the genuine charisma found in the cast such as Brad Pitt, Joey King, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Brian Tyree Henry, and Sandra Bullock. There is still some stone cold fierce acting from the likes of Andrew Koji and Hiroyuki Sanada, especially since their characters lend the film's much needed pathos in terms of where the train's heading. Perhaps the film doesn't entirely pay off in smoothly transitioning tonally, especially when some characters are more believable than others (Tangerine and Lemon have the best chemistry between each other). That being said, the abstract execution favors the comically absurd in the end.In terms of the visual direction, part of me wonders if this film should have been animated or not given how much insane effort went into crafting the aesthetic built around the train. Since the film is entirely set in Japan, the filmmakers put so much attention to detail in the country's modernesque era and utilized strong action choreography and digitally manipulated effects, partially thanks to director David Leitch's stunt coordinator background. Some of the finest effects work in the film borders on near cartoon-like psychedelia, and there is so much nonstop editing and planned out motion work that one has to wonder if this took any influence from the best animated action films from Japan as well. In addition to some hardcore Japanese covers of popular songs, composer Dominic Lewis implements a strong score that accompanies the hardcore action as much as it puts the drama in its place with heavy lifted orchestrations. It's crazy to think this film had nowhere near the budget that today's blockbusters have, especially when it pulls its effects off better than most of them.So while Bullet Train has so much going on in it, there is still enough to get into thanks to its ludicrous plot, humorous characters and nonstop action packed mayhem. If you're getting tired of all the annoyingly pretentious action flicks coming from Hollywood nowadays, this film is right up your alley as a breath of fresh air. Sure it might not differ too much from the competition due to its similarities to other soulless blockbusters, but there's too much to appreciate about it as a comically absurd take on an already beaten to death subgenre. Besides, it sure beats being on the fast train itself.

title: Very osm
text: Pitt and his co-stars performed flawlessly in the excellent script adapted from the book and its plot. Very well produced, with excellent action scenes and editing, and terrific comic timing. The way it addresses the events and Brad Pitt's appealing lead performance make movie worthwhile to watch. It moves quickly, has an entertaining and intriguing story, and is self-conscious throughout.

title: Serviceable action flick with the 90's in it's DNA
text: A straightforward action romp that keeps the pace quite steady throughout it's two hours running time. It's an enjoyable movie for people who like fast-paced action comedies. It isn't nearly as witty as it thinks it is, and some of the banter and running jokes felt a bit forced (I particularly found the Thomas the tank engine refernces a bit weary). What saves it are mostly the performances by Pitt and Aaron Taylor-Johnson. They are clearly having fun, and they have great chemistry whenever they share the screen.Although I found the reveal of the actor who played the White Death a little bit underwhelming, since said actor has been playing this role for so many times.The movie is slick with slightly too much use of green screens, especially the 'outdoor' shots look a bit too fake, due to the poor lighting. Nonetheless the action is mostly entertaining, nothing groundbreaking if you are familiar with 80's or 90's Hongkong movies. The beginning is a bit rough though, since a lot of characters get introduced, accompanied by little flashback vignettes. It's not as elegant as movies like, say, Pulp Fiction but it gets the job done. And the premise reminded me a little bit of Smokin Aces.It's entertaining enough though if you're looking for a light-hearted action-packed evening. And you might want to stay until the end credits if you liked the ride.

title: Funny but no need for so much violence

title: Untrealistic CGI In An Otherwise Excellent Action Flick
text: So this film is a hard one. I loved the Kill Bill-style narrative and screen-play. The Yakuza v Ladybug and the other attendees of this unfortunate Bullet Train to Kyoto.I am however extremely frusted by the unrealistic and stupid cgi from people running up a Bullet Train (not possible) to fighting on the roof.The choreography is top-level. The stunts inside the train are brilliant. It just is runined by stupidity. I love the idea and the concept but please try and make films realistic.We can do action films without the need of countless CGI usage. It is very dull seeing the same impossible action sequences from films recently.However I loved the storyline. Brad's acting and terrible Japanese was great to view. The casting was superb and I loved the interaction-of-comedy between the actors. Chemistry of casting was absolutely nailed.I however just can't get over the end which is like something a child created with a toy trainset and a storyboard. That is so disappointing as the general film was thoroughly enjoyable and a riot.Just bare in mind that adults with realistic action expecations are watching these movies. Please look back to the great (RIP) Sonny Chiba and what he did for movies as a key reference point example.I'm so sad that this is happening so much to otherwise what would be great movies. A 6/10.

title: Amazing
text: Great script from the novel and story line and acted to perfection by Pitt and his co stars. Very well shot with great action sequences and editing, Comedy timing was also good.

title: Snatch on the Orient Express
text: I'll say straight off the bat that I enjoyed 'Bullet Train.' I must have because I continued to watch it past the halfway mark, even though I had little clue as to what was going on. A lot of people have compared it to 'Snatch' (probably because of Brad Pitt's involvement), but I though its style of story was more in keeping with 'Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels,' due to the way it had multiple characters all with their own weaving storylines which eventually put them all on a collision course with each other.However, where as 'Lock Stock' was set all over London, 'Bullet Train' is kept primarily to a single location of a train as it hurtles through Japan one night. Aboard are a multitude of hitmen and general henchmen from the criminal underworld, all with their own motives. Like I said, the narrative is quite convoluted and I have to confess getting kind of lost most of the way through. Luckily, the film pulls itself together and nicely ties up the various tales to a satisfying ending.Brad Pitt is always good value for money, but it's the two assassins 'Lemon' and 'Tangerine' who steal every scene they're in and could almost be the central characters to a spin-off of their own (and I will never think of 'Thomas the Tank Engine' the same way ever again!).About my main gripe was that the film does feel like it drags a bit near the end. It seems that it's wrapping up and coming to a conclusion, only to keep on going for a further half an hour. I'm pretty sure they could have edited it down by about fifteen minutes here or there to keep it a little tighter.I never saw the trailer before I watched this, but I understand it's cut like some sort of 'Matrix' action film with loads of fight scenes. I would warn anyone that there isn't that much of this and if you're thinking you're in for a wall to wall action epic then you're going to be a bit disappointed.Overall, if you like films with multiple (crime?) story threads that weave and twist, before finally coming together, then you should enjoy this one.

title: Where's the fat controller?
text: Why does David Leitch exclusively direct sub-par scripts (I haven't seen 'The Fall Guy (2024)' yet, which will hopefully be the exception)? It's clear that he's capable of crafting a specific style conveyed mostly through entertaining, if often tonally undercut, action. He's not the most visionary director, but he injects each of his movies with enough flair and reverence for practical stunt work that they all have elements which are genuinely successful. This only makes their narrative shortcomings all the more frustrating, though. One of the main problems with 'Bullet Train (2022)' is that it just doesn't have enough action in it. It also doesn't have enough Brad Pitt. Instead, both of these elements are often cruelly sidelined in favour of an annoying ensemble of quirky characters who spend more time talking about 'Thomas & Friends (1984-2021)' (because they're on a train, I guess) than kicking butt like the premise promises. With a messy, flashback-oriented structure and often grating dialogue, the picture is honestly a bit of a chore to get through at times. The cast all do what they can with the material (and accents) they're given, but even the most charming amongst them can't stop the film from being a bit boring whenever it isn't focused specifically on its set-pieces. It's not as funny - or clever - as it clearly thinks it is and, despite looking quite nice, a lot of it feels rather hollow. Having said all that, it does improve fairly significantly as it goes on. Whether it's because the thing has already worn you down by then or if it's because it's genuinely improving in pace and tone and energy with each new scene, the final act is surprisingly enjoyable despite its use of intangible digital effects for some of its biggest moments. There are a few enjoyable sequences prior to the finale (in fact, you sort of accept the affair's flaws after its opening movement and lower your expectations accordingly), but it's near the end where everything really clicks. It's unfortunate that it takes so long to get over its growing pains, but the film is ultimately fun enough for what it is. Although it's over two hours long (and doesn't need to be), it's light and fluffy and fairly fast paced. It's kinetic when it needs to be and features a few well-choreographed fight scenes that don't make the protagonist out to be an unstoppable machine, but rather a self-proclaimed bad luck magnet who's clearly out of his depth. This dynamic makes things more interesting than they otherwise would have been, all without robbing the experience of the exciting to-the-death bouts you expect. The occasional moment of pretty extreme gore is undercut by the generally playful atmosphere, but a couple of gags still provoke a wince and act as nice punctuations to the altercations they typically end. Ultimately, this is a fun but flawed experience that alternates between being annoying and being exciting in almost equal measure. You can see what the filmmakers are going for, but they never quite hit the sweet spot and, as a result, the piece is fairly inconsequential. Still, it's entertaining enough.

title: Bullet Train - Passable Action Film
text: I love bullet trains, and rode on them for the last decade while in China. The vast majority of Americans, however, have no clue of what it is to ride on one of these beauties. You speed along at 300 mph almost silently and without any sense of movement. You can easily fall asleep on the large, comfortable seats while you are online. But you won't fall asleep during this film; it is packed with action from beginning to end. As I generally do not like hitman films, I thought I would be panning this film, but the combination of good performances and clever story line, made me change my mind preset. It really delivers the goods; especially Brad Pitt.

title: A sexy, fast-paced action/comedy tainted by cultural appropriation
text: David Leitch's Bullet Train feels like a Quentin Tarantino movie with some cultural appropriation thrown in the mix. I will do my best not to get too "woke'' here, but the movie unashamedly exploits Japanese culture despite starring a Caucasian, A-list actor (Brad Pitt). That aside, Bullet Train is quite an adrenaline rush. There is plenty of violence, as to be expected from a big-budget Hollywood action movie. However, Brad Pitt's character, a hippy-dippy, long-haired assassin on some kind of a weird self-help journey, is too comedy-driven for my personal taste. The movie would have been more memorable and in better taste had Andrew Koji's character (who is Japanese), been the main character.The setting, a Japanese highspeed bullet train headed from Tokyo to Kyoto carrying five assassins in pursuit of a briefcase containing millions of dollars, feels very realistic. The acting is believable, even if certain scenes and details are quite far-fetched for either comedy's sake or for the advancement of the plot. Also, it seems a little too convenient that one of the main characters has an obsession with Thomas the Tank Engine when the movie takes place on a train.This movie reminds me a little bit of another movie starring Brad Pitt, which is Babel, a much better movie than this one. The two are similar in that different events from around the world are portrayed that end up all being tied to each other. However, whereas Babel paints a realistic and authentic picture of different cultures, Bullet Train uses stereotypes as a crutch. From the main bad guy, the White Death (played by Michael Shannon), a Russian, playing "roulette" with his revolver, to the big-headed anime mascot in the train, there is no shortage of stereotypes on display. Also, as opposed to Babel, it is clear that Bullet Train was made with an English-speaking audience in mind, as the English language is the dominant (although not only) language spoken in this film.I would be very curious to hear how Japanese people have received this movie. I don't think it goes as far as being disrespectful of their culture (other than casting Brad Pitt as the lead role), but I imagine they are tired of being portrayed in such a one-dimensional way to western audiences. Director Bong Joon-ho's movie Snowpiercer, which also takes place on a train, stars an American actor (Chris Evans), and co-stars Asian actors is a better demonstration of fraternity between the American and Korean people than is Bullet Train a demonstration of fraternity between the American and Japanese people. This movie wasn't even filmed in Japan.Also, I won't get into spoilers, but it would have been nice to have seen the Mexican assassin's character, Wolf (played by Bad Bunny), further explored. They at least could have given him a non-anglicized name, "Lobo," which sounds a lot cooler anyway. But that would go against the archetypal names given to the characters throughout the film, I suppose.Overall, I didn't necessarily dislike Bullet Train. There were several occasions where I indeed laughed out loud. The comedy is comparable to that of the James Franco and Seth Rogen movies. Joey King's character, Prince, is particularly interesting and gives the movie a unique vibe. She, along with Brian Tyree Henry's portrayal of character Lemon, may be the movie's saving grace. However, Brad Pitt's character is annoying and the movie shouldn't have starred him just because he's Brad Pitt. While I wouldn't be opposed to giving this movie a second watch, there are a number of things I would have done differently had I been in charge.

title: Smart, high velocity adventure for a summer that asks not much more.
text: At least five assassins are riding the same high-speed Japanese train, with a common purpose and a disposition to dispose of enemies by bullets and swords as is culturally appropriate. Chief murderer is "Ladybug" (Brad Pitt), whose therapeutic advice as he delivers a MacGuffin briefcase or his fists is Pulp-Fiction funny (Ladybug: "Because if you put peace out in the world, you get peace back"). He's in therapy.Ladybug's a "snatch and grab" operative delivering that briefcase, hardly a peaceful activity that other assassins also participate in. No Peace Train this. The best rep for all of them is The Prince (Joey King), a sweety pie with a wicked MO. She's lured a father (Andrew Koji) aboard while her past activity involves shoving his son off a bridge. Not to worry, fate will allow the grandfather (Hiroyuki Sanada) to be aboard as well, and rest assured he has that old thriller staple, revenge, riding with him as well.Bullet Train is pervaded by Asian-type philosophy and biting dialogue to mix the sublime and the ridiculous into lessons amidst pleasant chaos. "Let this be a lesson on the toxicity of anger!" (Therapist Barry). One car on the train has Kitty-themed seats, a nod to Japan 's Hello-Kitty obsession. Think Eastern Pulp Fiction seasoned with characters called White Death, The Hornet, and The Wolf. It's crazy fun.The most pervasive motif is fate, which ironically doesn't make Ladybug lucky but provides facile answers to questions about the randomness of violence aboard the train. An assassin refers to Thomas the Tank Engine in an attempt to understand character, to the exclusion of Diesel from any survival technique.It's overdone action and philosophy but set in high-end visuals like Dolby and IMAX theaters. Impressive sight and sound together with a $3 all-beef hot dog and temperature-controlled comfort while you watch an out-of-control adventure. It's our own little mayhem thumbing noses at COVID and inflation-for just over 2 hours only.

title: Amazing great
text: If you loved Deadpool then I would really say you really can't afford to miss this movie Bullet Train. I went to watch this movie with a group of friends.

title: Such a Great Energy in the Film, Moves like a Bullet
text: "Bullet Train" has a very unique story structure. It has a bit of influence from anime, a bit from Tarantinto and a splash of Deadpool. It is from David Leitch, director of "Deadpool 2", and "Bullet Train" has a violent, dark and fast paced humor similar to that of Deadpool. How funny the movie is will vary from person to person, humor is a subjective thing. But objectively, the movie has a lot of jokes and if one doesn't work, they don't linger on it too long.The way in which the film tells the story is very clever. The movie will shift to different vantage points, points of view, flashbacks and train carts. Doing this helps create suspense, dramatic irony and feed the audience needful exposition in clear and quick ways. It is a very tightly written story, there is no wasted space.On top of the humor and clever storytelling, the movie has some great action set pieces. Despite taking place on a train, the action scenes are all shot with clarity and style. No two fights feel the same. Our hero is not invincible, he is frequently on the back foot, and this leads to some compelling action sequences.As far as the negatives, towards the story really goes off the rails towards the end and loses the grounded gritty action that it once had. There are some plot convivences that are hard to ignore, and some character gimmicks that don't work.Despite the story losing some steam towards the end, the movie is a clever, tightly written, funny action film. Don't let this train pass you by, this is one bullet you want to catch.

title: Amazing
text: The film's trailers changed into one of the first-class I've visible until date truely so I changed into skeptical approximately the film doing justice however the film is simply as great.

title: Fun Watch mid story

The cast can be a bit misleading on this front, but they got some great cameos that make it more fun. It's just a lighthearted comedic action movie with an ok enough story to get by. I will say however the comedy didn't land for large portions of the movie but there was a lot of action, and it was good.Overall, just a fun movie to watch and put on at any time. title: Incredible
text: Just amazing! Loved every bit and Brad Pitt is just wow so talented, full of action on top of action and also it was funny had me laughing nearly all the way through, 2hr film but it was good every second never got bored as I tend to do at long films. A lot of familiar faces in which are also great actors.

title: Pulp Fiction on a Bullet Train!!
text: This is one of the most gruesome action-packed movies I have seen in a while!! The film will take you back to Quentin Tarantino movies of old including the Kill Bill films & the classic Pulp Fiction as Brad Pitt's character, along with a handful of other assassins, are tasked with different assignments one night & early morning on a Japanese bullet train. The graphic action is outstanding, this Netflix film is obviously not for children with it's R rating. The acting is good with Pitt leading the way & the dialogue/writing is acceptable. Mixed throughout the film are a couple vintage American pop songs sung in Japanese that add humor to the film. The flow of the movie is good & more than a sprinkle of life philosophy is discussed in the film as Pitt's character ponders it throughout & the film ends as Pitt's character & Academy Award winner Sandra Bullock discuss it at the end. A fun film - 7 out of 10 stars!!

title: Really great
text: Guys if you are looking for funny, cameo, action movie Bullet Train is something you cannot afford to miss absolutely. The cast of the movie are just as awesome as the movie.

title: Action, mystery and a lot of blood ;-)
text: The ultimate lunatic cat & mouse story in the best way possible.Action packed with many "well, didn't see that coming" moments.Japanese story in style of Tarantino, Coen brothers or even Luc Besson.This was a lot more fun than expected. The cast was great. The story was full of so many little things that seemed unnecessary but just added to the fun. Each character had great quirks and those quirks always ended up coming into play in fun ways.There's vindictive cartel hitman Wolf (Bad Bunny), poison user Hornet (Zazie Beetz in a glorified cameo), and a deceptive schoolgirl nicknamed The Prince who, despite the efforts of Netflix star Joey King, is underdeveloped as the "Lolita femme fatale" the film wants her to be. There's also two British gangsters, brothers Lemon (Aaron Taylor-Johnson) and Tangerine (Brian Tyree Henry).

title: All the cast did their parts and had a good time, but
text: Screenplay is a messy farce, about several light years away "Kill Bill", it just turned all the characters so dramatically exaggerated into some crazy overacting cartoon figures. Everybody in this movie was like a crazy psychopath or zombie, high on drugs or intoxicated with Bacardi 151 mixed with Vodka. The bullet train became a nuthouse. All logic and sanity were thrown out the train. What I've seen on the screen was just a bunch of mixed half-human, half-animal mutant human races trying their best to kill each other and one another. They all seemed to do improvised acting without script or directing, they just did whatever they wanted to mess up the bullet train. There are so many talented and reputed actors in this movie, but they were totally ridiculed and wasted. It is so far the most disgusting, most boring, stupidest, messiest, most pointless, most purposeless, most out-of-control farce ever made.

title: Very good...
text: "Bullet Train" is an Action - Comedy movie in which we follow five assassins in a bullet train that all has mostly the same mission. All of them want to finish their mission as fast as possible but the others have different opinion about it.I have to admit that I enjoyed this movie very mush because it combined very well action with comedy in a very clever way that we do not see often. The direction which was made by David Leitch was very good and his work in this movie reminded me "Deadpool 2". The interpretation of Brad Pitt who played as Ladybug was simply hilarious and he made the difference on this movie. Some other interpretations that have to be mentioned were Brian Tyree Henry's who played as Lemon and Aaron Taylor-Johnson's who played as Tangerine. Finally, I have to say that "Bullet Train" is a nice comedy movie with clever humor and plenty of action so, I highly recommend everyone to watch it because I am sure that you will both laugh and have a great time.

title: One of the greatest, action comedy movies ever made. Period.
text: This is, without a doubt, one of the funniest, wittiest, action packed, dark comedy action movies I have ever seen.The characters each have their own unique quirks, the dialogue is fantastic, the story has twists and turns that you sometimes don't expect and of course, the fight scenes are not only well choreographed, but very funny as well.Please, ignore the "professional" critics who have been slating this movie. I have no idea what they were expecting to see when watching this movie, but clearly they woke up on the wrong side of the bed that morning. This is a modern classic.

title: Best and good
text: I think this is one of those odd cases where the movie exceeds the level of the book. Not that the book wasn't good but the movie just goes above and beyond it!

title: Just Plain Fun
text: Plenty of humor, iconic twists, fun action. Don't over compliate this. It's simply a fun and funny action flick. The cast is fantastic, the dialogue is well written and most importantly of all the action sequences are clever and engaging. BP is a perfect foil for an assassin. Both effective and overly phylosophical. His attempts to recosile his line of work, to continue to handle things differently is the comedic edge of the film and it works nicely, along with what might just be an enjoyable action flick. There is a little something extra in this which provides the final ingredients for success. Just enjoy yourself!

title: had low expectations and was proven wrong
text: I remember seeing the trailer for this film when i was watching other movies in the cinemas. It hooked me into watching it like an ant and their sugar problem.This movie was extremely funny, it was bold and was such a right move to choose the humour they presented throughout the film. I love the minor twists despite them not being WOW-ing, the jokes were certainly the carry of this movie. It was extremely entertaining and im afraid a tad bit forgettable. It would definetely be those movies id recommend to people but think twice incase its not their humour. Definetely more to the fun side rather than serious side, exactly what i was expecting.The casting was extremely nice as well, the performances given by each actor and actress felt fulfilling and just overall wonderful. title: Entertaining, could have been better
text: Amusing, good music, funny characters. Fun setting too. Train scenes always work well in action movies - Mission Impossible 1, Knight and Day, Casino Royale, From Russia with Love... More of this.Don't get Hollywood's obsession with portraying women as over-the-top badass with a spiteful attitude while always being a step ahead of everyone else and making it all seem effortless though. It's just a bit too unrealistic, even in an unrealistic movie like this. They never look like fools, as opposed to the portrayal of men, and seem invincible. Nobody buys that, it seems almost like the biggest dream of certain screenwriters. The actresses act well though, they're only doing their job of course.

Finish it off ChatGpt:"Bullet Train" is a fast-paced and action-packed thriller movie directed by David Leitch and starring Brad Pitt, Joey King, Zazie Beetz, and a talented ensemble cast. Based on the Japanese novel "Maria Beetle" by Kotaro Isaka, the movie follows the story of five assassins who board a high-speed bullet train bound for Tokyo, each with their own target, only to find themselves in a deadly race against time and each other.From the opening scenes, "Bullet Train" sets a thrilling tone that never lets up. The action sequences are spectacular, filled with intricate choreography, stunning special effects, and explosive set-pieces that will leave you on the edge of your seat. David Leitch, who has a background in stunt work and co-directed the original "John Wick," brings his signature style of kinetic and relentless action to this film, making it a visceral and adrenaline-fueled ride.The cast is phenomenal, with Brad Pitt delivering an intense and charismatic performance as the seasoned assassin "Ladybug." Joey King shines as "Prince," a young and ambitious killer who seeks to prove herself. Zazie Beetz is impressive as "Marmalade," a sharp-witted and skilled assassin with a mysterious agenda. The supporting cast, including Andrew Koji, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, and Hiroyuki Sanada, also deliver excellent performances, bringing depth and complexity to their respective characters.The movie's screenplay, written by Zak Olkewicz, is engaging and clever, filled with sharp dialogue and unexpected twists and turns. However, the plot can be confusing at times, and some of the characters' motivations are not always clear. The movie also suffers from some pacing issues in the second act, with some scenes feeling dragged out and repetitive.Overall, "Bullet Train" is a thrilling and entertaining movie that delivers on its promise of high-octane action and suspense. It's a must-watch for fans of David Leitch's work, as well as anyone who loves a good action movie. However, if you're looking for a deep and thought-provoking story, you might be disappointed. Nonetheless, with its stylish visuals, stellar cast, and heart-pumping action, "Bullet Train" is a ride that's definitely worth taking."Zzzzzz - AI.

It felt like they had been done before and the visuals seemed so forced that I became uninterested.The characters were great with Brian Tyree standing out with some brilliant acting. title: Great
text: Enjoyable, feather-light, hyper-kinetic action-comedy. This film is a fun night out and entertaining surprise for the late summer movie season. Presence of Sandra Bullock, Michael Shannon, and a couple of surprise cameos.

title: An Enjoyable Experience
text: I enjoy this film, but it does have a lot of that cheapness that modern action films have. However, the second act is actually really good and exciting. I wasn't a big fan of the first act, though, and I was mixed on the climax.The effects in this movie were amazing, probably better than most modern action films lately, and the story was mostly pretty good. I think Brian Tyree Henry was my least favorite part of the film. I found him and his dynamic with Aaron Taylor annoying for a good amount of the film, but it got better in the middle.This film was very fun to watch, and definitely not boring, but things like Brad Pitt's only lines being one off jokes and jokes that go on for too long bring it down a bit.

title: Fast and funny!
text: I will admit that the jokes in the beginning were a bit too many and a bit too cheesy. Fortunately, later on this aspect was improved a lot so no need to worry about it.This movie does not pretend to be something it is not. This your typical silly action film, with a nicely thought out script and some very likeable characters! The jokes are there too, they are plenty, they work well and don't overtake the action, thankfully. I was very happy to see that non-critical characters did not stay long, they just did the necessary part and they were killed off. So the movie was not overloaded with unnecessary side plots, which seems to be something many productions suffer from lately.I enjoyed all the performances, I can't say anyone didn't fit their role.So if you take this movie for what it is and you want to watch a fast paced, well thought out, light and funny summer action film then go watch this!Again, I would want to rate this a 7.5 but I can't. I wish IMDB would allow half stars.

title: Great movie
text: Must watch enjoyable piece of content, Brad Pitt and Joey King acting! It was an interesting duo to star together. The best parts are Brad Pitt and fight scenes, I didn't realize how 2 hours went. I'm so glad I found out this was playing from 5 of August, comedy hit right on the scene at the right time and it was perfect to watch character compiling with the scenes. Must watch from my side.

title: Good old fun.
text: Haven't had this much fun in the theater since 'Everything Everywhere All At Once'. Bullet Train is filled with exciting gags, grotesquely unique action sequences, and a charismatic lead performance from the sensationally charming Brad Pitt. While I didn't think the jokes were all that hysterical, I could still appreciate the character writing and how well acted everything was. Aaron Taylor Johnson and Bryan Tyree Henry were two of the biggest highlights in this star studded ensemble, their chemistry and brotherly bond gave the film a little heart and made the trip worthwhile. I had a bit of trouble adjusting to Joey King's character near the beginning, her presence was very insufferable to the point where I patiently waited for the character get die a horrible death. But once her motive became clear, I began to understand her purpose in the story and how it makes her character even more engaging. There's a ton of philosophical themes that I never expected such as the idea of fate being unescapable and how bad luck is essentially a common threat that every character experiences. The film does a great job reinforcing these themes in the finale and doesn't become too pretentious to the point where it completely tarnishes the action blockbuster tone the film sets up. This was the perfect movie to end the summer on; it was a witty stylish action comedy while at the same time it was a thoughtful character study.

title: Most Fun I've had watching a movie in a long time
text: Saw this Movie at the Theatre on Saturday and it was the Most Fun I've had watching a movie in a long time, I thought it was a perfect 10, Imagine if Quentin Tarantino and Guy Richie had equal influence in directing a Movie, then Mix a little John Wick and Smokin Aces and the Ultra efficient way Anime portrays detailed Backstories on Characters in under 2 minutes, Bullet Train Is a Masterpiece of efficient story Telling, Editing and Perfect Comedic timing.

title: Funny & Entertaining!
text: Bullet Train is a fun movie. If you're just looking for a nice comedic action flick, this one's for you. I had a lot of fun with it. There were lots of twists and turns that kept me engaged along 2 surprise cameos that caught me off guard. One in particular was very funny. The cast does a great job in my opinion. I liked the character work a lot. Brad Pitt is great but I particularly loved Bryan Tyree Henry's performance along with his "brother" Aaron Taylor Johnson's. Joey King was great and stood out in her role. And Bad Bunny was good as well in his first movie role at that I know of. Overall loved the action and look of the film. Very fun, engaging and over the top at times but nothing really special.

title: Good job
text: The feel of the entire movie was so exciting and colorful. It couldn't have been done any better, not by the directors, not by the actors. Truly wonderful!

title: Great fun even with an existential touch
text: All reviewers comparing it to Tarantino do not know anything about movies. All visual elements Tarantino uses have been done before. Tarantinos works are all post modern work. So if a movie uses visuals mainstreamers just know from Tarantino it is their fault to not know anything about art and movies. Nevertheless this movie is more than a simple action flick with guy ritchy storytelling and Tarantino visuals. Because where Guy Ritchy uses his style to fill holes of substance, this movie is about taking control over destiny. Or the question if it is even possible and we as humans are caged in a train of predestination or determination? I for myself see it as ladybug. Things that happen happen. We just have to smile at it and grab a tangerine after our ride home got crashed. Yes, the visual style seem to have no purpose and I facepalmed at the japanese version of Hero but its not like that it makes the movie terrible. The movie is very well thought out, so we as the audience can follow Ladybug as he understands the principle of stoicism.

title: Fun action with dozens of telegraphed moments.
text: There's something inherently exciting about being trapped on a train with a murderer. It's why Agatha Christie's Murder on the Orient Express has done so well for almost 100 years. In this more modern take, Bullet Train (2022) fills this titular high-speed form of transportation with a half-dozen unique killers with ties to a mob boss known as "The White Death." Ridiculous at times, Bullet Train is fun and full of action while also being the repeated poster child for the literary concept of Chekhov's Gun.With Brad Pitt in the leading role as the "unlucky" assassin with the codename "Ladybug," a lot of the comedy comes from the coincidental alignment of particular circumstances that pull Ladybug further into the conflict. There are almost Mr. Bean levels of close calls for Pitt's character as he finds himself tangled up in the parallel plans of his fellow assassins. Of course, the number of mistaken identity tropes in this film almost qualifies it to be Hitchcockian in nature. Because what good story on a train doesn't have at least a little mystery involved?Where Bullet Train excels is in the way it shows the audience things that become important later in the story. Sure, there are a lot of little things that might not seem important, but it wasted none of these moments. This may also be with the way this movie was filmed, with the hand-to-hand combat being John Wick (2014)-like and the big action set pieces focusing on those Chekhov's Guns just before it used them for their ultimate purpose. Granted, with so many unique characters, it was a little difficult to keep everything straight at times. But when things lined up, the result was often satisfying.Fun action with dozens of telegraphed moments, I give Bullet Train 3.5 stars out of 5.

title: Intresting
text: Brad Pitt really really stood out in this movie. It's been so long since I've seen him in such a role but he has definitely made his mark in comedic movies with this role.

title: Amazing Movie!
text: 10/10 right here. Everything about the movie was so well done. Such a great theater movie and will watch it multiple times. Brad Pitt is perfect for the role. Great cameos as well. Don't pay attention to any bad reviews.

title: The most violent comedy I've ever seen
text: Some may not consider this to be a comedy, but that's really what it is wrapped up in an extremely exploitive violent film. The two don't mesh all that well for me a lot of the time though there is humor here. The constant banter between Aaron Taylor-Johnson & Brian Tyree Green is fairly enjoyable once one gets the hang of it. It's kind of like a bad joke that gets funnier the more often it's told. Joey King pulls of her odd role quite well, but the film belongs to Brad Pitt. Almost all the times I laughed were due to him. The plot? I don't know. It all takes place on a bullet train in China (oh, how far behind the US is in transit!) and it's mostly about the quest for a briefcase full of money along with something else, but it's also about other coincidental crimes going on at the same time and it's much too convoluted a plot to be all that enjoyable, but it will certainly hold your attention with so much going on. A lot of effort was put into this, but not all of it pays off.

title: Weird but WONDERFUL
text: We didn't expect to have as much fun watching this film as we did. The style snappy subdued humour and the cameos were very refreshing, whilst the action scenes were well done with even the gore being almost comedic despite how much gore there was!If you like comedy films, action films, or spy films and want a great fairly lighthearted laugh then this film is 100% worth a watch. The trailer did not do this film justice!

title: Witty dialogue meets action packed comedy!
text: Ladybug takes over a job for Carver, but it winds up being anything but simple like his handler leads him to believe. The interlacing of this action packed movie along with the creative and witty dialogue makes for one heck of an experience for the audience, and it is worth every minute of it.

title: Dumb fun with emphasis on the first part
text: If Bullet Train wasn't as fun as it is at its best, there would be close to no redeeming qualities. SOOOOO much missed potential because of overbearing editing that rewinds to remind the viewer every single time anything happens that was caused by something previous and writing that, when it's not being careless and fun, is either ultra proud of itself for anything and everything, annoying, or so incoherently stupid that turning your brain off can't prevent you from noticing. The music choices can get overbearing, the cameos were mostly obnoxious, and the entire first third was loaded to brim with momentum killing flashbacks that plagued the rest of the film, but many of the action scenes, especially in the first two thirds, were fun. The director clearly knows how to direct some fun action. The first half of the film went decently far with the style it was going for and it worked, even if it was bit too stereotypical and laced with tropes at points. The writing also wasn't all bad. Many of the characters were fun. Brad Pitt and the twins were incredibly fun and backed by very charismatic performances, with the twins probably being the closest to fully realized. At its best, it's an incredibly stylish film with uniquely entertaining characters that clash in genuinely funny, entertaining, and even tense ways. The stuff with the guy and girl wasn't necessarily bad either, but that plot through line along with the others would be lost in the shuffle of bad or absent development as the writers tried to shove in even more characters to make the plot work. The main storylines were never amazing, but they start off way better than they finish and how they interacted would become more hit or miss as the film went on, eventually becoming too much without the punch to back it up. One character genuinely felt like a throw in because the writers noticed a plot hole and needed to fix it. The ending was just bad and represented everything wrong with the film, from the editing that assumes the least of the viewer, a plot that desperately wants to be meaningful, and action that finally got too gratuitous even for me. I came in with "I just want to have fun" expectations and still left sort of disappointed. I really do want to say it's a fun/10, which it is at its best and why I can't necessarily say don't watch it, but there is so much undercooked, obnoxious, and flat bad parts that aren't made up for. It passes with a 6 and it isn't a movie that will be better on the second watch because they REMIND YOU OF EVERY SINGLE POTENTIALLY SUBTLE PLOT DETAIL WHENEVER THEY BECOME A TINY BIT RELEVANT LATER ON! Watch Nice Guys instead. If you've already watched that idk this could be fine for you.

title: First time I've walked out in 30 years.
text: Can't believe this got such a high rating. Says something about how low our culture has lowered itself. I was hopeful given Brad Pitt and high rating but absolutely no redeeming value in this. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEYThe only good thing is having walked out after 30 minutes is we didn't regret the 2 hours we would have invested that we'd never get back.I can tolerate a high amount of violence as long as it se bed a purpose in an otherwise good movie...which this isn't.

title: Stylish Action joy ride!!!
text: This film was all about its Japanese aesthetics. And hilarious fast-paced well crafted action sequences. The jokes were perfectly placed and it never seemed full even for a second. Anyone who wants 2 hours worth of pure enjoyment should board the bullet train asap.

title: Beautiful story
text: Any movie by David Leitch has to mandatorily always surpass viewer expectations. This movie is no less! The action sequence in the movie hits every point.

title: Fun
text: Fun. Not more, but not much less either. My only real criticism is that the main character only seems to communicate using "funny" oneliners which almost never worked for me. And a few side characters share this problem, some more, some less, but over all, most of the dialogues consist of jokes. Which you might or might not enjoy, but for my taste, they could have toned it down a little. Apart from that: Solid action, interesting stylistic choices, a few, maybe a little bit foreseeable, twists, a bunch of mostly fun cameos by famous Hollywood stars and a loveable character with an extraordinary interest in a kids show.

title: Amazing wonderful
text: Good comedy! Great direction! The movie has everything for being a blockbuster. It's rare that we get such a star studded film these days and this feels like a new role for Brad. Op jokes that land great, one of the best structures and detailed plots I've seen in a comedy, Lemon and Tangerine steal the show.

title: Entertaining
text: Contract thief "Ladybug" has an assignment: steal a briefcase on a bullet train in Japan. This task turns out remarkably easy to complete but in doing so he falls foul of a duo of ruthless criminals meant to guard the case. Things get even more complicated as it appears several contract criminals, and a few other people with similar agendas, are on the train, all with murderous intentions.Entertaining movie. Great action scenes, a complex plot that is heavy on killing, a light tone and some good punchlines make for an interesting and blood-filled yet amusing journey.On the negative side, the plot is overly complex, complex for the sake of complexity. Just when you think you have all the pieces and agendas sorted out, another character is added or a twist occurs. In doing so the plot becomes less and less plausible, to the point of being laughable at times.In addition, the whole light-hearted schtick, especially Ladybug / Brad Pitt's pop philosophy musings, wears thin after a while.Still, there's hardly a dull moment and overall it's pretty good fun.

title: So Entertaining
text: This has a Kingsman vibe to it in the best way possible. This movie was so fun. I have a hard time watching any action movies lately. This kept my attention and enjoyment the whole way.This movie is also beautifully shot. The lighting, character design, the cinematic. Wow. What a blend of different styles. It never got boring.As always I am a catcher centered viewer. This is a master class of blending serval stories. This ensemble cast is amazing. Even the smaller parts are so enjoyable you could see them being full fledged feature length films.I've seen this movie around for a long time. I'm disappointed there wasn't more hype and lasting noise about it. What a great movie!

title: Fun Ass Movie!
text: I saw the trailer for this when it was first unveiled and though the bright colors and flashy action sequences cut to a Japanese rendition of "Staying Alive" caught my eye. I didn't expect much from it. However, I kept this film on the back burner for a night out with some friends. It absolutely did not disappoint! Featuring quick witted humor and bloody fun action to match, it was a genuinely entertaining experience. The story is honestly all it needed to be and then some. Short backstories are well utilized to tie in each character to there respected position within the overall narrative. I honestly have no clue how people can say the story is lackluster, as it's a simple as it needs to be without giving away the various twists and turns. And no, not every movie that features nonlinear storytelling is a Tarantino ripoff and that's coming from an actual fan. Either way I absolutely loved Bullet Train! Just fun as hell.

title: Powers Through
text: This is an engaging movie, almost all exposition but the way the cast bounce off of each other is pure chemistry in action. All the characters are fun and a bit over the top with personalities it's no wonder they all collide the way they do, the humour doesn't feel forced to say it's got a lot of it in it too. It's a story of coincidence thats actually watchable. Whether it's hijinx type of situation or even a more somber and serious tone, my eyes were glued to the screen. There's a lot to pay attention to and I think virtually everything it set up it pays off in a very satisfying way, all while been flashy and stylish.

title: Bullet train is a very awesome movie
text: I have to say that it has to be one of the greatest action movies I've watched in a long time. But it's no surprise since it stars Brad Pitt, what a brilliant actor!

title: Light hearted gore!
text: Bullet Train" is the ultimate adrenaline-fueled joyride with high-octane action, jaw-dropping stunts, and a star-studded cast that brings infectious chemistry and witty banter. The film's sleek cinematography enhances the fast-paced chaos of a speeding train, making it a delight to watch. While not the most complex plot, the well-choreographed action sequences and charismatic performances make it a perfect escape for action fans. Embracing its identity as a fun, light-hearted popcorn flick, "Bullet Train" delivers an exciting and thrilling ride worth taking. Grab your popcorn, buckle up, and enjoy the action-packed journey!

title: 7.2/10. Recommended
text: Have you missed late 90's/early 00's comedy-crime movies? You know what i am saying, these "Tarantino-Esque" movies like Guy Ritchie's movies, SMOKING ACES, LAYER CAKE, KISS KISS BANG BANG etc? Not many good movies of this genre recently. RIDERS OF JUSTICE (2020) is the only good comedy-crime movie i can remember right now.BULLET TRAIN reminds us how fun this genre is.This is not just a fun ride, but an insane ride, pure entertainment until the end. These good actors seem to enjoy this, i only wish Andrew Koji (Tv series WARRIOR) had a bigger part/role. Action is over the top. Yes, comedic element was not always spot on, some times they forced it. Yes, this is a movie that you will forget it the next day, it is not as good as the aforementioned Tarantino-esque movies. However, it is very enjoyable and the ending was satisfying. 127 minutes and never a boring moment, this could easily be a tv mini-series. If you want to have fun, watch it. Just remember, it's more unplausible than a movie with, i don't know, space zombies.

title: "Nothing Says Goodbye Like a Bullet Train."
text: David Leitch has made a rousing return to theaters with his newest film, Bullet Train. Leitch, who is steadily mastering the art of sleek, kinetic action, leads a talented and capable ensemble through a John-Wick-meets-derivative-Tarantino rollercoaster. Although the script is uneven, Leitch's eye for action and dynamic editing reaches a new peak in Bullet Train. He's learned from his time directing other actioners such as Atomic Blonde, Deadpool 2, and Hobbs and Shaw, reinvigorating his style and trimming most of the story's fat.The film follows Ladybug, an assassin sent to pick up a briefcase on a Japanese bullet train. This simple task soon becomes more complicated, however, as a myriad of other assassins become intwined with Ladybug, fighting him and each other amid a serious of confusions and misunderstandings. The conflict is compounded by Ladybug's sincere attempts to quit the business and turn to a life of peace and tranquility among the Japanese landscape.For all its flaws and faults, Bullet Train is a lot of fun. It's never as clever as it thinks it is, but it is kinetic, dynamic, and snappily paced, on both a micro and macro scale. It's also a precarious blend of half-meaningful stakes and over the top comedic sensibilities, each vying to be the film's defining tone without throwing the entire affair off balance. It's firmly watchable and should be refreshing for action fans who crave a more cinematic, distinct outing than the typical MCU slog. Unlike most of Leitch's work, where characters run the gamut from rigid to stoic, Bullet Train's appeal lies on its ensemble cast's charisma.Performances are often near the back of my mind during a screening, but Bullet train is thoroughly focused on, and sometimes carried by, its cast, which is top tier across the board. The film often revolves around three main principles: Ladybug, Tangerine, and Lemon, played by Brad Pitt, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, and Brian Tyree Henry, respectively.Pitt is the standout of this talented cast, expertly balancing the sporadic inner conflict and new-age, hippy-dippy mindset of his character with the frenetic action of the film. He's a stabilizing force in the madness and knows exactly what the role is and how to play it.Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry, who play "twin" hitmen, work off each other immaculately, maintaining an impatient, unpredictable presence. Henry's conception is clever; he's an imposing figure with an innocent, childlike naivete. He's single-minded, dissecting others on the bullet train with comic accuracy and precision. Taylor-Johnson, yin to Henry's yang, is an acidic hooligan ripped from a Guy Ritchie film (most of Bullet Train is ripped from Guy Ritchie films, but Taylor-Johnson drives the point home) and played with a suave, boiling verve.The rest of the cast, which includes Joey King, Andrew Koji, Hiroyuki Sanada, and Logan Lerman, is also superb. Everyone is fashioned to physically resemble their persona, and every actor knows who they are, what film they're in, and how they should be perceived. While there are moments of posturing and a few miscalculations from time to time, the desired effect is usually achieved - nailing down a tone which is at once whacky and brutal.Bullet Train could've easily been disparate and hopelessly unfocused, but Leitch's steady hand congeals the film. While he should've given the script another once-over, his vision and direction of the chaotic world flavors the action and emphasizes the fun. Alongside the cast's understanding, Leitch's camerawork and trademark, neon-soaked cinematography - shot by Jonathan Sela - make the film work until it simply doesn't.Every motion feels purposeful and gratifying; most every cut, both within and between scenes, is chosen to tell a more concise, streamlined story, which could've been overblown and overwrought in the wrong hands. There will come a day when Leitch's films lose their novelty and passion, especially as his spectacle balloons and his plots become increasingly convoluted, but Bullet Train represents an impressive addition to his grittily sleek, blood-soaked, morally apathetic oeuvre.In contrast to the film's spectacular craftsmanship, the script is rushed, contrived, and sometimes nonsensical. Despite the stellar editing, the first act is bogged down by a mountain of exposition, which is both vomited out and agonizingly long-winded. Characters are either unprofessionally dense (despite their repeated proclamations as professionals) or essentially omnipotent, knocking down their objectives or enemies with boring ease.Also distracting from the fun are three nagging questions, floating in the back of the mind throughout. Why are there so few passengers or employees aboard this train? Why does every ensemble film need Suicide Squad-style graphics spelling out character introductions? Why does Leitch opt for digital, poorly rendered blood squibs in a film that revolves around constant, visceral action?Though the above problems cheapen the film, they can be overlooked in favor of the greater visual and structural unity of the film. But all of Bullet Train goes sour in the last act. The prior commitment to skill, patience, and restrained action is wholly aborted, leaving both the characters and audience adrift in a nightmare world of impossible stunts and tensionless revelations. Even a clever, final moment of wild casting can't save Bullet Train's final act from feeling like anything other than a sudden, sharp betrayal; it's an absolute nosedive.Bullet Train is not perfect; it's surprisingly talky, though infrequently funny or incisive, routinely contrived when it should be simple, and breaks its neck on the final dismount. However, there are several elements to admire, including strong chemistry among a cast of unique characters, an exotic location for what's sorta'-kinda' a chamber piece, and some handsomely assembled cinematic action. It's a worthy addition to Leitch's filmography, finely tuned to the upper tier of this era of cinematic action and stands in stark contrast to the assembly line sludge theaters are currently overrun with. It's a nice harkening back to dense, rubbery assassin-driven action which deserves to be seen on the silver screen.6/10.

title: Ugly people behaving badly
text: Bad, bad, bad. Sleep-inducing, gratuitous violence with no real plot. Artsy for the sake of being artsy. This film will appeal to a younger crowd who loves being immersed in gratuitous foul language and violence. It's non-stop action actual made be sleepy from the boredom. Evidently, a bunch of people needed a paycheck.

title: High Speed Carnage....
text: 7.2/10"Bullet Train" is definitely an entertaining film. While some of the sequences are bemoaning in how over-the-top and unrealistic they were. They still worked in the world of the film. I also laughed, or chuckled, through a good portion of the film, even in parts I probably shouldn't have found funny. However, I found some lightheartedness through the carnage.The acting wasn't half bad. I enjoyed Brad Pitt in this one, and I found his character to be relatable, so that was a bonus. The twins were hilarious and brought good chemistry. I found the mini bosses and the big boss to give about a good performance, nothing crazy. However, I was not a fan of Joey King's. While her acting was ok. Her attempt at a British accent was awful. Sometimes she spoke with it and other times she seemed to lose it. I still don't know if her character was British or not.Lastly, the cinematography and score were very enjoyable. As we know films use certain colours, tones, and sequences to capture places on film, and I felt like they captured the Japanese essence very well with the vibrant colours, and poppy music. I enjoyed how lunches were matched with a beat, amongst other similar actions.Overall, I was very pleased with this film. It entertained with a good story, decent acting, and cool cinematography & score. I will say there was a lot more carnage than I anticipated, but that didn't keep me from enjoying it. It's definitely worth seeing in theatres, especially IMAX.Thank you for reading my review. Until next time.... Enjoy the show!

title: Familiar Hyper-Stylized...Ultra-Budgeted Pop-Culture Pastiche...Somnambulists Movie-Makers At Work
text:
Seemingly, Director David Leitch, Doesn't Care to Rise Above Past-Glories.Doing a Movie that has Become, with an Affordable Budget, Actors, and Crew at This Level, could be Made by these Film-Makers in Their Sleep.Walking Over the Same Ol' Ground Year After Year...Never Wishing that "New" Directions of Style would Open Up Opportunities that Lead to Inspirations and Insights with Their Chosen
Art-Form, the Most Popular in the 20th Century.Lazy Enough, and Satisfied Enough to Create and Deliver to Consumers of Their "Craft" a Thing that Could be Called "Product".Certainly a Product from an Assembly Line of Like-Minded Talented Folks who have Sold-Out to the "Gravy Train" that Laps this Stuff Up Like "Hot-Cakes". It's Already Doubled its Budget. AnThe Movie, Another Copy of a Copy, that, Unlike Digital, Quickly Loses its "Soul" to the Corrupting, Coma-Inducing Limbo Where "Artists" Go to Devolve.They have Failed to Get Back in the "Groove" that Made Them Become Creators in the First-Place. The Thrill is Gone and This is Film the Movie-Going-Public is Offered.What a Repetitive,"Been There, Seen-This Movie Before".Time to Get Off that Train of Imitation,because, Creatively, This One Reeks of a Rip-Off of Better Movies and Lacks the Power to Entertain at a High Level that is Required Considering the Money and the Talent Involved,Could be Leaning Toward Fraud at Worst, or Could it Be that a 125 Year Life-Span is Not Only a Human Condition, but the Collective Film-Making Condition as Well.

title: Fun and fast - like that train
text: Having watched it 3 times, I can sincerely admit that this is one of the most entertaining movies I've seen so far. The cast is incredible, the plot is catching, the soundtrack is on level as well.The tandem of Lemon and Tangerine is absolutely hilarious. Despite the fact that they are criminals, you feel for them. Brad Pitt's character made me clap my hands every time he "got lucky".I have no clue why people are looking for deeper meaning in this movie. I believe it's just another exciting, high-quality attraction which will not leave you disappointed.Simply speaking, buy your pop corn and enjoy the show!

title: A Guy Richie knockoff.
text: A Guy Ritchie knockoff. But it was still enjoyable enough. Brad Pitt is very charming. Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry steal the show, however. They are the best things about the movie. The action is surprisingly pedestrian for a David Leitch movie. I was expecting more with it. Also, Joey King's character is absolutely terrible. She almost ruins the movie with one of the worst characters I've ever seen in a movie. Luckily, by the end they fix it. Again, just an ok movie.

title: A work of art
text: It's one of the best movies that I've already seen, comedy, action, drama e etc... There are no holes in the script. Everything perfect, the critics are dead wrong.Everything in the film will always make some sense, all the characters, even the supporting and secondary characters, were well presented and used correctly, everything fits together as if it were a puzzle, even a bottle of water was important to the plot and script. Of the movie.That's it, go ahead and watch the movie by yourself and don't trust the critics.Akansnizjznanaiaizjzxbsjkskzznsjsokanabsuxuxbznakskxjxhsbskskzkkxjxnx.

title: Bloody Good Fun
text: Visually arresting, but with a script that feels tailor made for such a style & actors that look amazing within that world. Script has enough going on to keep you invested, humor you get used to so that the non-realistic feel goes down better. Most of all the last 1/3rd really kicks it up with the drama between the brothers and what winning means to each of the characters remaining.

title: A comic book - colourful, fast and empty
text: Fast action, meaningless, "deep" dialogues, medicore story, forced humour, unnecessary cameos and the comedy/action combination fails in this case.As the title says - it feels like a comic book; overdrawn characters and situations, lots of bright colours, no sustance, just style. Flashy show off that busks in Japanese neon lights.It is straight to DVD/VOD kind of a movie; don't think it is a step-up in Brad Pitt's carrier.In a month time I am not going to remember what this movie was about.Don't get me wrong - it is a good Sunday after dinner entertainment, solid 5/10; it just is not a blockbuster worth a score of 7.5/10.

title: This Movies was a Japanese Version of French New Wave Films
text: Bullet Train was a movie based on the Japanese Novel of the Same Name, and I know that this movie was inspired by an Iconic Jean Luc Goddard film Pierrot le Fou, Brad Pitt's Performance was so Weird. Nevertheless, Joey King's Performance in this movie was excellent, and She was Femme Fatale. This movie is the best, with Good Action and Good Soundtrack. Andrew Koji and Hiroyuki Sanada Performance were the best. It was funny that this movie was very Violent; yeah, I Love Violent Scenes in this, unlike a Short Film About Killing; Bullet Train was the best and had references to many Pop Cultures, and I recommended watching this film.

title: Really A Fun Time, But Very Dialogue Heavy
text: This movie is such a wildly fun ride with its pulse-pounding action along with its many fun and interesting characters. But there lies an issue with how the story progresses, through the action and the dialogue. And while both are not problems, the dialogue makes itself a problem for the audience by taking us out of the experience of the action to read us an essay on past events or character backstories. And since there are so many characters, a lot of them get dialogue dumps while others get visual storytelling, which is a nice change of pace and fits the vibe of this movie but is rare. If there wasn't as much dialogue, the film would've been a far more entertaining experience.

title: Did you count the spots?
text: I think there's two kinds of people who watched this film: those who counted the spots on the ladybugs and those who didn't. What I mean is, those who have a keen sense for detail will appreciate this film more than those who need a broad picture to take shape with minimum effort. This film has a great story set-up that reveals itself in sections while the interim is peppered with witty action scenes and clever dialog that helps frame the story. Much of the humor lies in the detailed facial expressions, captured with skilled precision.Some of the low-star reviews missed blaring details, such as why the train was virtually empty. They complain that the action scenes were unrealistic having entirely missed the humor of the good v bad luck theme. The film mocks the popular mental health portfolio we see so much in today's younger crowd with great success. In fact, there are so many clever personality odes that the characters are built on them rather than taking us on verbose intros.Bullet Train may remind some of the older crowd of a combination of clever assassin films over many decades yet it doesnt feel cliche. I don't know that I would watch it more than once but out was definitely worth the first go.

title: I wish Tarantino made this film instead
text: Bullet Train had very good bones to it. A very interesting place for the film, the Bullet Train. A good cast try to carry this film and they managed to draw you in from the start. However the story was disorganised and it was hard to piece together what was going on. The characters rushed through their explanations of what their plans were. I only got the picture at the end when White Death showed up which wasn't a big wow moment either. I feel if Quentin Tarantino was at the helm he would nicely put this film together in a way that made sense, was humorous and took us on a journey. He always tends to have a good method to the madness. Unlike Leitch who has let this film be like a train with no driver. Despite Brad Pitt's strong performance the film did not quite meet expectations for me.

title: One of the Most Fun Movies to Watch. Ever.
text: I'm a sucker for Bee Gee's Stayin' Alive. And opening the movie with it in Japanese? Couldn't take my eyes off for the rest of the movie. Bullet Train is the first Brad Pitt movie I've seen, and it's by far my favorite. Genuine laugh out loud moments throughout the movie, and when the camera wasn't on Ladybug, Lemon and Tangerine made sure there was never a dull moment. Ladybug dodged metaphorical bullets from start to end but got hit by metaphorical cannonballs. Great camera angles. Epic soundtrack. Entertaining backstories and flashbacks. I love Bullet Train so much, I watched it on loop for an entire weekend from the time I woke up to the time I went to bed. I prefer making my reviews without spoilers for people who haven't seen it, but I could make paragraph after paragraph of positive feedback if I broke Bullet Train down scene by scene. If you like high-octane, funny, and popcorn-entertainment, this is surely to become one of your favorites.

title: Snatch meets Smokin' Aces on a train
text: The setup is the same as Smokin' Aces: a bunch of dangerous people with contrary objectives converge on a single location and mayhem ensues. In this case the location is a high-speed train from Tokyo to Kyoto. The execution here is better than Smokin' Aces in every way: the plot makes sense, the dangerous people are interesting, and the humor mostly lands. This is a violent movie but the action and dialogue are sufficiently cartoonish and fast-paced that it comes off as affable and fun rather than grim and nihilistic. The style is reminiscent of Snatch, especially cutaway flashbacks to fill in backstories, and there are a few times this movie seems to be trying too hard to mimic Guy Ritchie's style. The only other major drawback is that it overstays its welcome by about 20 minutes and the novelty has worn off a bit by the finale. Overall very enjoyable but not especially original.

title: Fantastic movie
text: Nevertheless, Brad Pitt has done a sterling job.Brad Pitt and Joey King acting! It was an interesting duo to star together, but they did a phenomenal job with their respective characters.

title: Just great
text: Finally I watched one which i can say I enjoyed , mystery was good , drama was good , comedy was good , action was good , everything is in balance .. mixtures of culture was good also . Usually movies with many stars is not that great but this one was really good .. ofcourse there was a some weakness but in total everythings was fine and ofcourse with this budget we expect something like this . Actors played very well . Mix of story , acting , directing , virtual effects and movie script was in high level . I hope we can see more movies with this quality every year .. complete package well done.

title: Very bad attempt to copy Tarantino
text: Saw the poor critics reviews if this but decided to go and see it because of the viewers reviews. Unusually for me that turned out to be a bad decision. The film is beyond awful. Trying to be objective but I can't think of a single thing positive to say about it - I asked my husband if he could think of anything people might like it for and he suggested it might be the violence. Perhaps it's just me ...

title: "Let this be a lesson in the toxicity of anger."
text: "Bullet Train" is an action movie, fast, fun, and totally insane. It has an above-average story for its genre, effective plot twists, and somewhat less effective attempts at humor. It is a fact that it is full of clich√©s, borrowings, and hit & miss attempts at humor, but those clich√©s are perfectly integrated, I experienced the borrowings more as homages than as a lack of originality, and the humor, although you will not roll over with laughter, is still at a quite decent level. The screenplay is certainly not an Oscar material, but hey, this is an action movie, not a literary classic.On the other hand, the qualities it brings almost completely compensate for the shortcomings. The pace does not let you catch your breath, it is visually beautiful and, although practically all of it takes place on the train, there are flashbacks that prevent monotony at the right moments. In several aspects, the homage to the cult "Pulp Fiction" is obvious, to some extent in stylistic moments, but mostly in the black-and-white duo of hired killers, who both physically and in character strongly resemble the Travolta-Jackson tandem. In addition to this most obvious one, movie lovers will be delighted by a handful of less conspicuous homages and cameo appearances.But the main asset of the film is the excellent cast, by which I mean literally all the actors, because everyone, from Brad Pitt to the smallest supporting role, treated us with impressive performances, far beyond the level I expected. Many single out the young Joey King, but in my opinion, Aaron Taylor-Johnson (Kick-Ass) and Brian Tyree Henry are the backbone of this entire spectacle.7,5/10.

title: Bullet is good movie
text: I am not a fan of action movies but my husband made me watch this one. Not admitting it to him, but really enjoyed watching it. Might watch it again too!

title: Why can't the US have a Japan-style bullet train?
text: David Leitch's "Bullet Train" is one of the most pulse-pounding action flicks that I've ever seen. The plot involves a number of assassins aboard Japan's bullet train who turn out to have a link. This is the jumping-off point for some of the most intense scenes that I've ever witnessed.Obviously, there will be comparisons to similar movies - I've read some reviewers compare Tangerine and Lemon to Vinny and Jules in "Pulp Fiction" - but this is definitely its own movie. Brad Pitt may be the official star, but each character turns out to be important. It's not any sort of masterpiece, but I recommend seeing it. On top of everything, it makes me wish that the US had the sort of mass transit that Japan has; if nothing else, we wouldn't have to spend hours stuck in traffic.

title: Good fun movie
text: Reminded me of Kill Bill in the way it was shot - some good humour, great chemistry from the actors and a fun movie.I'd even say this is Brad Pitt's best movie - we actually got to see him with a lot of dialogue.

title: Super bullet train movie
text: Brad Pittt never disappoints, I knew this !!!! How amazing he was in this movie along with Joey King. Both acted so well and made me fall in love with the movie is very super bullet train movie and it's a very interesting this bullet train movie is a very awesome movie.

title: Bullet movie is very awesome
text: David Leitch take a bow!!! What a masterpiece you have created. A light comedy and action movie is all I needed right now. I admire the story line and the loved watching this.

title: Bullet Train combines all the action, expertise, and stunt work of John Wick with the pacing, goofiness, and fun of Hot Fuzz.
text: High energy, vibrant colors, funny characters, and excellent action fuel Bullet Train to take its audience on a wild and entertaining ride. Each character is larger than life and outrageous, but all fit perfectly in this vivid and comical world. Bullet Train feels like Edgar Wright's version of John Wick - all the action is there, but so are all the comedy and quirky characters. Brad Pitt's prowess as an actor shines as his ridiculous peace-loving assassin blunders through the film but never crosses the line into cliche or too much. Brian Tyree Henry's Lemon is the most entertaining out of a cast of enthusiastic over-the-top characters that will have you laughing from the first second til the credits roll. Funny cameos and great action punctuate this already fun and colorful film. Bullet Train is a fun watch, but some poor visual effects distract from the ending and keep the rating from being higher. Even with its few faults, Bullet Train is a goofy, dynamic, and bright action flick that invents a fun world I wouldn't mind exploring in future films.

title: Child support payments must be getting expensive...
text: ...that's the only reason I can think of for Brad Pitt doing this train wreck of a movie. I gave it 1 star because my popcorn was hot. Oh, and the cinema had recliner seats which were very comfortable.

title: An Entertaining movie that keeps a viewer entertained till the very end
text: I had been eagerly waiting for the film's release ever since the trailer of the film got released.Seeing the mixed reviews and review vlogs made me a bit hesitant, but as it was action film I decided to shrug those reviews as reviews on these films are never to be taken seriously.The film is about a reformed assassin given the task of robbing a brief case from a bullet train set for Kyoto. The rest of the film showcases numerous miscommunication that is albeit shown in a rib-tickling manner.In terms of technical aspects, the writing is definitely not to be taken seriously but the action sequences showcased in the would keep a viewer entertained till the very end.In terms of performance, apart from Brad Pitt, the duo of Aaron Taylor Johnson & Brian Tyree Henry were highlights of the. The former excelled in the action sequences while latter was witty with his one liners and his reference to Thomas Tank Engine. The audience would be surprised to see two cameo's featured in the film. One may have been as a gift for appearing in Lost City while the other one must have been kept for the sequel.Would be exciting if a sequel for this movie is made.

title: Nice
text: This movie is entertaining and plenty of humour, but it's also jam-packed with action and moves swiftly. Pitt, humour, and action? Check everything three times! If that describes you, grab some popcorn and settle in. Be prepared for an exciting cinema experience that will leave you reeling from thrills, enjoyable action sequences, humour, and the joy of real sentiment.

title: nothing special, but fun
text: The first 25 minutes are quite plain and look like if somebody is trying to copy a Tarantino, but just lacks the wits.When you get over these, its getting better, especially because of the funny performance of Brad Pitt who carries the movie and the mere fact that the film is more a parody than actually an actioncomedy.If you like Deadpool or if you are a Brad Pitt-Fan surely you will enjoy and get your laughs, otherwise you can skip it without missing much.

title: I appreciate this movie
text: I read the novel sometime back and was a little jittery but this is a different case all together. Definitely comes at par with the story of the novel and the actors did a great job..

title: Outstanding movie
