text: I've read the novel by Kotaro Isaka by which the movie Bullet train is adapted. Movie is as much gripping as the novel. Its appreciating to maintain such level of quality when you are adapting a movie from such a great novel.

title: Bullet Train was a very good watch
text: Bullet Train is one of those type of movies that you just sit down and enjoy, the plot can get a little confusing at times because they try and connect everything together, it's filled with a lot of cameos, it doesn't necessarily take itself too serious.You follow the story of different assassins boarding the bullet train, with Brad Pitt taking the lead and he does a great job of course, I won't go into too much detail on what happens, but the movie is very graphic, kind of reminds me of Deadpool with the humor and gore. I will say the movie does have a bit of a slow beginning because it try's to set up a bunch of backstory to some of the characters. But once you get past those stories the plot is very quick paste with a lot of characters that you follow along. Overall it is a very fun watch, definitely recommend it.

title: Bullet train is very nice movie
text: The Bullet Train, oh my god !!!! Amazing, amazing movie . Will sure watch it again with my friends witness this amazing journey again is very interesting this bullet train movie is super and very nice is very awesome movie.

title: Fun but lacks personality
text: I watched this movie with out knowing anything and so expectations did not factor into my experience. I the production was very slick. Photo, score, VFX the lot, was what you would expect from a high end action flick. As for the cast, I thought there were good performances, but a combination of the script and actor execution or chemistry fails to bring down the really big laughs. You will smile, but not roll over. What it lacks is the type of "personality" that movies that manage to nail it has. I don't think there will be any memorable memes or pop culture references coming from this film. It is a watch-it-one-time movie, but that's OK. Every movie can't be a classic and you go to be entertained, it will entertain for the duration of the running time. You just won't remember much in a year.

title: It's like being on a very long roller coaster
text: Watching Bullet Train is a lot like going on a very long roller coaster. At first, the twists and turns are a lot of fun, but then there gets to be so many that it becomes a little tiresome. In fact, it gets to the point where you expect the surprises to happen, so they don't really feel like surprises anymore. I thought the cast all did a good job with what they were given. Brad Pitt's detachment to what was going on around him kept me amused, and I really enjoyed Brian Tyree Henry's character, as well. It gets pretty ridiculous at times, but Bullet Train is quite the ride if you're in the right mood.

title: Bullet train good movie
text: As a martial arts enthusiast, it's absolutely perfect! Most movies tend to consider it more of a theatrical element but here, the art has been introduced and panned out exactly how it is.

title: It certainly, shall we say, goes off the rails.
text: Fun movie, if you see the trailer, you know exactly what to expect and it delivers in spades.Great cast, great action, fun dialogue, not meant to be a super serious movie, but still grounded enough to not be campy.However, the third act of the movie is a letdown in my opinion; it's a fine line to straddle comedy and action, and the film mostly (mostly.) gets it right, which makes it all the more frustrating when in the final 30 minutes or so, the script, exposition flashbacks, and action sequences, just become a bit too over the top and clich√©d, to the point where they become trite.Still, that wasn't enough to detract too much from my enjoyment of the film overall.It's still a fun popcorn flick, obviously not at all for kids, and there's Brad Pitt.If you like Tarantino or Guy Ritchie, with a smattering of Knives Out, you will enjoy this film. If you don't, you should probably give this one a pass.

title: Bullet train nice movie
text: Itne time baad kaafi interesting action movie dekhi. Thoroughly enjoyed it! The movie was a little too stretched but still worth watching! Joey King was great.

title: Funny but some poor execution
text: I read Bullet Train during lockdown so was seriously looking forward to this film. The film adaptation of the book makes me feel like where it departs makes the film more convoluted. I don't entirely mind, like the cutaway scenes of the boys watching West Ham United beat Chelsea. It made it quirky especially if you hate Chelsea.One of the stranger bits is departing from the book by removing some of the hilarious elderly characters.But some of it really didn't make any sense. This isn't like brain candy, where you can switch off and not think too hard. You have to figure out whats going on and it's not entirely clear even you did read the book.

title: Adventure
text: It's a David Leitch movie so it had to be this great... But the contribution of the actors was no less. A wonderful combination developed by Leitch!!!

title: Smokin Aces with Brad and friends
text: This movie reminds me of Smokin Aces: The plot was a bit of a mess, the dialogue was subpar, but the cast was stacked with decent action sequences. The same goes for this, though I think this ensemble is more stacked.Overall, the plot is a bit of a mess and convoluted, but at least it all ties together in the end. The dialogue was pretty subpar, but the action (for the most part) made you forget about about it. I would say the standouts were Aaron Taylor Johnson, Brad Pitt and Zazie Beetz (with some other solid cameos). However, all the star power doesn't make up for a lackluster, incoherent script with cringe-inducing dialogue.If you NEED to see it in theaters, make it a discount matinee.6.2/10.

title: Wonderful movie
text: The movie is somewhat compared to Tarantino, but a funnier and better delivery of dialogues and action in every is fresh, the best part of the movie is cameo of so many stars, Guys stay after the credit it worth waiting and we will definitely see a great movie from the banner in future.

title: This was like a watered down Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels (1998)...but I still enjoyed it!
text: This really was like a slightly watered down version of Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels (1998, Guy Ritchie), but I found myself enjoying it even though I went in not expecting to.Big all-star cast in Bullet Train, Bad Bunny, Sandra Bullock, Michael Shannon, Ryan Reynolds, Masi Oka, Brad Pitt, etc. And they deliver some great lines amidst this action-packed story that places 5 assassins on-board a bullet train in Japan...each has their own agenda or target. The story develops into a mystery, that like any good mystery comes together at the end.Really interesting characters...Ladybug, who won't use guns, thinks he's unlucky and is seeing a therapist to help him work through some issues. The Prince-a girl who lacks empathy and uses her innocent look to sucker victims. The Twins, lemon and tangerine, who clearly aren't twins, spend a lot of time bickering and are obsessed with Tommy the train and numbers. The Hornet, who uses a deadly snake venom to kill her victims. The Elder, who used to be a high ranking member of the Japanese syndicate but was ousted by The White Death, a Russian who came in and took over. The Wolf, whose entire family is killed and is seeking revenge.There were a couple scenes that I absolutely loved. I really enjoyed the telling of The Wolf's story and the use of the rotating bed to signify the passage of time. (I also love Bad Bunny...so that was fun.) I really enjoyed the perspective of the water bottle...it was a clever storytelling technique.Great campy use of color, lots of close up action...a snake in a train, and quick clever dialogue. This was snappy, fun to watch and for me unexpectedly funny. I would highly recommend this to action movie fans and fans of comedy. If, like me, your family loves Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels...than this should be a must see.On one side note there are some completely unbelievably events in this film...a ridiculous train crash, people walking on top of a bullet train, etc. So, don't forget to just go with it in order to enjoy this film.

title: Pale imitation of films it's derived from
text: If you enjoy Tarantino and Guy Richie films then I suggest you rewatch those rather than wasting your time with this very poor imitation. I haven't walked out of any film for 36 years but this one was my second ever.

title: As close to a guy Ritchie film as you will get
text: If you like guy Ritchie find you well love this. It's a good fun caper with good characters and great dialogue.It is a shame it gets a bit ridiculous at the end but it's still good fun.

title: A Diesel
text: I must say, someone really liked Domino (from Deadpool 2) quite a bit (enough to even get Zazie Beetz in on a miniscule role), because the movie's core is basically that. Still, it is an enjoyable action-film filled with many elements I normally like! Such as a group of assassins butting heads, and being set in one closed location (like a hotel or a train). The best I can compare it to.. is Kill Bill (a lot actually), mixed in with the tone of the recent "Lost City" film. It is by no means a serious movie. And while it did not think it was great, most of it wasn't bad either.As you may know, the cast is quite famous, but their presence on screen is rather lacking (Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry, mostly) and the characters feel underwritten. Bringing the movie down. Ah, but whenever Brad Pit is on screen, it feels like a completely different movie! I also quite enjoyed Joey King's role. Oh, and ironically, for a movie set in one of the world's fastest pieces of transport.. it feels slow a lot of the time. With some unimportant dialogue that could be trimmed or compressed for a better viewing. It all feels rather unpolished.But good choreographies, beautiful locations, some great moments.. it's worth a watch.Maybe just not on theaters.

title: Amazing wonderful
text: At first I don't like seeing a 136 minute runtime but far out I didn't notice it at all, hooked from start to finish and will be going to watch again. An over-abundance of appearances and surprise appearances contribute to the portrayed of the film and add to that joy. If you like Deadpool and Deadpool 2, then this is the movie for you! Great cast, solid performance by Brad Pitt, and some surprising cameos.

title: Bullet Train
text: Brad Pitt is "Ladybug" - a now zen-like, semi-retired, hitman brought out of retirement to appropriate a suitcase from a train. Easy enough task, you might think - especially as he obtains it relatively easily. It then transpires, though, that there is much more afoot. Also on the train are the two guys who own the suitcase - "Lemon" (Brian Tyree Henry) and his twin "Tangerine" (Aaron Taylor-Johnson) who have been tasked with rescuing the recently kidnapped son of the legendary "White Death" crime lord and his ransom (in the suitcase). When the pair discover that their loot has gone missing and that their charge has developed a rather nasty habit of bleeding from the eyes, they have to keep their suspicious employer at bay and find their luggage whilst this high-speed train hurtles from Tokyo to Kyoto. Add to the mix the slightly enigmatic "Prince" (Joey King) - outwardly a charming, butter-wouldn't-melt, schoolgirl type, but really a gal who is also up to something with the rather hapless "Kimura" (Andrew Kohi) whose son she had recently pushed from a roof and, well... Yes, the plot is pretty convoluted at the start but with a monologue style narrative well delivered by an on-form Pitt, and an engaging repartee between the 'Thomas the Tank Engine" obsessed "Lemon" and his spiritual brother, this actually makes for quite a decent action adventure. It is way too long - it could comfortably shave twenty minutes from the character establishment phase, but the script is quickly paced and sometimes quite clever and there are plenty of action scenes that are fun to watch and don't take too long. It has shades of "Pulp Fiction" (1994) I thought - multiple characters with entertaining storylines that gradually involve and synergise all the characters. The ending isn't the best, and perhaps one might wonder about the complete lack of security not just on the train but at just about every station between the two cities. Carnage ensues pretty readily but no sign of a blue light. It's fun, throwaway, entertainment that follows on from "The Lost City" in which Sandra Bullock and Channing Tatum allow Pitt the supporting role that he allows to both of them - and a tiny but of Ryan Reynolds too, if you are eagle-eyed, here. It's factory fodder, and you won't remember it by Christmas - but it's still nice to see some folks having fun on a big screen with no pretence whatsoever.

title: Great movie of the year so far
text: Even though there's so much happening in the movie, you'll never feel lost because it has been directed with such structure and complexity at the same time...

title: Dumb fun, but fun nonetheless
text: Another film watched only after all better options had been exhausted. But I have to admit, ultimately I was entertained. The comedic acting was a bit over the top, but tolerable. The CGI was, frankly, poor and unnecessary, for the most part, though I don't know that action audiences really care about realism. (To be honest, it might have been a better picture with a lot less of the action). There are sufficient action movie tropes, as well as a few bits of social commentary which will probably be viewed as woke by cynical action aficionados, (the subtext of Lemon and Tangerine is decidedly not a brotherly love). But it takes all kinds to make a film. Finally, the attempt to tie everything together as fate seemed a bit forced, unless it was meant facetiously, then it was perfectly on point. No need to overthink it, just enjoy the dumb fun. And as an added point, as a resident of Tokyo for nearly two decades, the film bears little resemblance. And I was unaware that Fuji-san was moved between Nagoya and Kyoto. I can still see it outside my back window.

title: Not sure why the low reviews
text: This isn't a film that is supposed to be dissected for its Shakespearean writing or artistic cinematography. It is just a fun-filled, non-stop action film!! It is highly entertaining with some really funny dialogue, some great fight scenes, a lot of high-paced action scenes and a few twists along the way. There were some witty lines throughout the film and the characters all very unique and interesting. GREAT CAST!! There wasn't a moment in the film where I was clock-watching or felt like the film was dragging. For a 2-hour film, it went by quite quickly and I felt entertained throughout. Good laughs and definitely worth the watch!!

title: surprising long-waited experience
text: First time since really long time that I enjoyed a film in a funny way not like a dramatic or heavy movie. Recently the superhero movies is controlling the action-comedy scene and apparently most of them sucks, they don't deliver the expected amount of comedy or even a well made action scene, however bullet train really surprised me especially in the chemistry between the characters and how they were able to deliver a real comedy and enjoyable scenes very smoothly.All the movie characters were great and in harmony but at the top of them stands Brian Tyree Henry and Aaron Taylor Johnson I wish they had more time and also Brad Pitt back to the good old days with this role.

title: Let's make a Guy Richie movie but set it on Japan. And make it really bad
text: Bullet Train is a movie that is all style and no substance. It has a cast and some action sequences, but it is ultimately a hollow and forgettable experience.The movie's biggest problem is it just dumb. The characters are all one-dimensional and the plot is full of holes. The movie also tries to be funny, but the jokes fall flat.Overall, Bullet Train is a disappointing movie. It has some good elements, but it is ultimately a forgettable experience.Here are some specific criticisms of the movie:The characters are all one-dimensional and underdeveloped.The plot is full of holes and inconsistencies.The jokes fall flat.The movie is too long and drags on at times.The action sequences are impressive, but they are not enough to save the movie.I would not recommend Bullet Train to anyone. It is a disappointing movie that is not worth your time.

title: Pitt carried this one. Too much marvel humor.
text: Brad is awesome. We love Brad. Some of the best action and comedy happened between him and Aaron Taylor-Johnson. Just about every kill in this movie was brutal and darkly comedic, which impressed me considering how often a small group in the theater was laughing by themselves. The comedy is definitely hit-and-miss. Big hits, big misses; which is still more than I expected.What was sold as a simple job gone wrong quickly became overburdened with way too many anime backstories. Don't bother trying to keep up with all that, because where this movie really shines is in its camera play, physical comedy, and impressive needle drops. I enjoyed myself more imagining I was watching a dope music video.

title: Fantastic
text: David Leitch, whose successful credits include Deadpool 2, Hobbs & Shaw and Atomic Blonde, seems thoroughly inspired by greats like Quentin Tarantino and David Fincher in his direction, Rare seeing Brad Pitt in a movie like this but from what I understand the director is a good friend. A fun and crazy film full of twists and turns, The film certainly keeps you on your toes.

title: It ran out of steam towards the end
text: The beginning of the movie was a bit confusing and uninteresting, but as it went on the story started to come into fruition and it became intriguing. However, I felt like the last 30 or so minutes of the movie was predictable which caused me to lose interest. Also it felt a bit anti climatic when the white death showed up as he didn't seem that imposing and have more of an interesting impact as I expected. I liked the different types of characters which made the movie more entertaining. The action scenes were good, but it's funny how unrealistic it was towards the end where the train is damaged and somehow some of the characters survive.

title: Most fun watch of my life
text:
I can't really explain what it was but this movie was just a comedy masterpiece in my eyes. The jokes were funny, original and absurd. Brad Pitt was a fantastic pick as the main character. The pacing was great because I was laughing all the time. This movie is packed full of jokes and its not getting boring because its so well executed. The other killers are really well written as well, funny background stories etc. The action was nice and the fights were creative. Also the introductions tof all the other killers were great. CGI was not too bad, but you can sometimes really see that its CGI. If you get the chance, watch it, good acting, good action, funny jokes, creative location and characters, of course very brutal. 10/10
I dont have a point where I can lower my 10 Stars to a lower rating :)

title: Pacy, edgy, comic actioner that tries much too hard to ape the styles of Ritchie, Tarantino, Vaughn et al
text: In pacy actioner "Bullet Train" various hired assasins (inc Brad Pitt, Zazie Beetz, Aaron Taylor-Johnson (meh) & Brian Tyree Henry) zig-zag on a Tokyo to Kyoto train with the likes of Michael Shannon, Andrew Koji, Joey King (meh) & Channing Tatum (in cameo - like Ryan Reynolds & Sandra Bullock) in a punchy plot about revenge & a briefcase of cash. It packs plenty in, but in trying so hard to ape the admirable styles of Guy Ritchie, Quentin Tarantino, Matthew Vaughn and/or Jane Goldman, director David Leitch & writer Zak Olkewicz come across more contrived than inspired. It's a fun romp, but its ilk has been done so much better by the aforementioned others.

title: SPIN-OFF FOR LEMON & TANGERINE
text: Seen this movie 3 times in theatres now, and all I can think about it how we need a spin-off for Lemon (Brian Tyree Henry) and Tangerine. (Aaron Taylor-Johnson)I know Brad Pitt as Ladybug was the main protagonist, but Lemon and Tangerine were a whole other level because they fitted so well together.The way the movie has a little bit of Guy Ritchie and Quintin Tarantino is so much fun.Like a Ritchie-esque movie, Lemon and Tangerine bicker the whole time, mostly about Thomas the Tank Engine lol, every character gets his own introduction (even the Fiji bottle) and in the end of the movie, it gets a bit like Tarantino.I think this is my favourite summer movie of 2022, and I think it is also my favourite movie of the year.

title: Way better than i expected
text: The trailer for this film was oozing cool but in a way that prior films have done so, only to later on show that all the coolness of those films were used up in those trailer shots.That's not the case here. We get Title cards, theme songs, big howls after kills and much more in this fun and well choreographed film.Some of the acting talent in here aren't utilized very well but it doesn't reduce your enjoyment of the film.I do feel like this film would have been way more appropriate for the likes of Ryan Reynolds instead of Brad Pitt.While the film is cool, its story interesting and its plot twists exciting, there's a very big cloud of racism and orientalism on full display here.It is a film starring mostly white western actors in Japan.And that does leave a bad taste in my mouth at the end of the film but you take what you can get from this movie and move along.

title: ¬´ Oh no thats mansplaining ¬ª Best Quote!
text: This movie definitely deserves your money, good songs, great characters, good jokes (some not so much and out of time), but overall a very good movie.Without a doubt I will see you again.

title: A Fun Departure
text: Enjoyed Brad's relaxed comedic performance and his chemistry with Sandra Bullock even though she wasn't on screen much.. This movie is a nice escape with a variety of interesting characters who hold their own and plenty of action. Could have done with a bit less of the violent flashbacks but worth seeing overall.

title: Cheesey as hell
text: Action was great. The comedy missed more than it landed. I thought the script killed Brad Pitt's character, seemed to me that he was a cheap rip off of the Dude from the big lewbowski. Also it dragged on way too long, should have wrapped up a half hour earlier. The two cockney characters were funny but ultimately the film fell flat.

title: Decent enough
text: "Bullet train" could of been awesome. Its a stylish action movie with plenty of comedy and cool shots. But alot of the humour just didn't land for me.The movies very visual, has alot of ace fight sequences and has alot of character. Aaron Taylor Johnson for example is great in the movie. But then there are other characters that were just annoying. The guy that kept talking about Thomas the tank engine (ye that's in there) pretty much ruined the film. But it's a decent watch if you can get passed him.

title: Greatest
text: An extremely entertaining movie which is filled with memorable instances. An anticipated movie of this year. Undoubtedly you will love this movie and the storyline.

title: Sometimes style over substance works
text: Yes it is a comedy action flick full of stunts, defying physic moments, basic humor.. however it still manages to be fun.One of the things that works for sure is the cast, no matter how ridiculous the performance it seems everyone did their part great and there was even room for surprising and fun cameos.The story is also interesting enough to keep the spectator glued to the screen and although they still somehow bring the Russian villain stereotype for the 1000th time, if you manage your expectations you will still enjoy it.Another interesting aspect that worked for me was the mix of different cultures and languages being represented, it adds a sense of mysticism and also it seems to bring more style to the whole movie atmosphere.As a whole it was a fast paced, adrenaline pumped, fun at times, experience and I also enjoyed seeing Brad Pitt as the lead on this one, I feel he did a terrific job!If you are looking for a chill weekend action movie give it a go!

title: Perfect.
text: A movie that spreads perfection. Had too much while watching this! Must watch. Everything is explained at the end. No questions remained. Even after the after credits.

title: Fun and hilarious Bullet Train is a thrill ride from beginning to end with an epic soundtrack!
text: After watching this movie 3 months ago with my Dad I'm going to do my best not to give anything away talk about my thoughts, what I enjoyed most about the film and my conclusion! Brad Pitt is fun to watch in this film I saw the trailer for this advertised on YouTube & it left me with more questions than answers! It's full of entertaining and surprising action scenes, lots of celebrities both main stars & cameos! Watching this in the theatre makes me want to ride a real Bullet Train! I loved the soundtrack to this go check it out for yourself after I've seen this I looked them up in the search section on music videos! Overall even though the trailers that played before this movie weren't great I still had a fun time watching this from beginning to end and that's why I'm giving this one a 7/10 hope you'll like it just as much as I did!!! XD.

title: The Good The Bad and The Hilarious
text: David Leitch achieved what Tarantino has never been able to - blend violence and comedy in a perfect balance to produce pure entertainment. Train is the Best Picture this year by far, though it clearly won't take home an Oscar. Watching Bullet Train is like feasting on a 260-layer cake (Guiness world record - looked it up). Pulp Fiction by comparison is a 7-layer cake, whose comedy seldom lands (watch it again and you'll probably agree). The Jackie Chan flavoring of the fight scenes was delicious and incredibly well-executed by Pitt. I was howling throughout, while my wife was appalled by the violence. By the time the movie ended my stomach was aching - 260-layer cakes will do that.Among the layers; Channing Tatum and Sandra Bullock cameos in a tit for tat for Brad's appearance in Lost City. Jackie Chan-esque fight scenes with brief cases and laptops as weapons and shields. Gun play without the guns being fired during fight scenes. The pause button hit during quite room and snack car fight scenes. The bottle of designer water as a rolling gag and its hero-anti-hero role. The perfect chemistry between the twins, Lemon and Tangerine that includes a tremendous running gag with their names and a truck load of tangerines. Bad Bunny, the WWE wrestler (I'm a big fan) as a Mexican assassin and his boot fetish. Stayin' Alive as the theme song, the movie's central theme and Bad Bunny's (aka John Travolta's) boot fetish. Brief case battles with the inflatable Anime doll. The scenes are so deep in movie Easter Eggs you feel like David Leitch just made an omelet out of your brain. That or you've been run over by a Bullet Train. Go see it! A+

title: Amazing wonderful
text: David Leitch never fails to entertain us ever. His all movies are super amazing the characters he chooses are just on point. He is one of my favourite directors.

title: Energetic high octane filmmaking with a lot of humor, craft, and passion that does feel somewhat overwhelming in its length and excess
text: On a Japanese bullet train traveling from Tokyo to Kyoto, anxiety ridden assassin Ladybug (Brad Pitt) is trying a new take on "self-actualization" and is assigned what he thinks will be a straight forward "snatch and grab" mission, with no killing, of grabbing a briefcase full of money being escorted by assassin duo Tangerine (Aaron Taylor-Johnson) and Lemon (Brian Tree Henry) who are transporting it along with the son (Logan Lerman) of Russian crime lord The White Death (Michael Shannon), to The White Death in Kyoto. While Ladybug manages to grab the briefcase with relative ease, Ladybug's attempts to disembark the train are thwarted every time as he keeps encountering assassins and criminals who have grudges against Ladybug. Meanwhile another assassin, known as The Prince (Joey King), enacts her own plans involving a blackmailed underling of The White Death with The Father (Andrew Koji).Bullet Train is an adaptation of the 2010 Japanses novel Maria Beetle written by Kotaro Isaka. Initially Antoine Fuqua had intended to direct the film as a serious action thriller, but eventually the film went for a more comedic slant during the development process (rather fitting as Maria Beetle was written as more of a dark comedy). The film was one of the larger projects worked on during the COVD 19 Pandemic as it was greenlit by Sony in 2020 who were most likely sold on the A-list cast combined with a limited location that would make filming easier. The movie comes to us from David Leitch whose prior credits include co-directing John Wick, directing Atomic Blonde, Hobbs & Shaw, and of course Deadpool 2. With such an established pedigree, Bullet Train seems like it's poised for high octane fun, and it does deliver on that front, but it's also the kind of film that feels like it could've been improved with some trimming and going smaller on some things.Despite Brad Pitt being front and center on the marketing, the movie's really more of an ensemble piece and plays like Guy Ritchie by way of Under Siege 2 (I'm kind of struggling for comparison). The movie is very much a character piece with a comedy of errors execution as Brad Pitt's Ladybug isn't a hard knuckle action protagonist and for the most part when he kills people in this move it's usually by accident as he tries to repeat his self-actualization mantras and overcome his bad luck much to the annoyance of his handler and the various assassins he encounters. Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry are very fun playing assassin "Twin brothers" with the latter having a funny running joke about how Thomas the Tank Engine taught him everything he needs to know about people and how he's never wrong when it comes to reading them. We also have Joey King playing The Prince who's been gender-swapped from the character in the book, but they do find a way of making it work in context. King is despicably good as The Prince as she's a very manipulative character who's pretty much the polar opposite of Ladybug as she plans 5 steps ahead of her target, is extraordinarily lucky, and completely lacks remorse, empathy, or mercy making her a truly hateful antagonist.While the movie has a good setup, it feels massively overstuffed, from what I understand Bullet Train is fairly faithful to the source novel (which I've admittedly not read) but it is the kind of thing that feels like stuff that was originally happening over several pages of exposition has been compressed into a cutaway montage as is the case with The Wolf played by Benito A. Mart√≠nez Ocasio aka Bad Bunny who's one of many flashbacks the movie does with The Wolf's backstory going on for awhile and it almost feels like you're watching cliff notes from one of Robert Rodriguez's action films. The movie feels massively overstuffed with how many things are going on with this train as the focal point and while I get that's meant to be the central joke I think the movie does wear thin with a just over two hour run time and the relentless quick cut Guy Ritchie-esque execution that I felt less exhilarated and more exhausted by it. For me Nobody which was also made by the producers of this film and the John Wick films was the better version of this story especially as they're both pretty similar with them both being mixes of John Wick style action and dark comedy but Nobody was better paced and more focused, so I'll probably watch that again before I rewatch Bullet Train.If you are a fan of the David Leitch and 87North produced action films you'll probably find something to appreciate here, but it has a lot of issues I noticed with the last 87North film I saw, Day Shift, in that they're both too long and too overstuffed. Bullet Train does have some good action scenes and humorous moments, but it also feels like it needed to be pared down to something less unwieldly.

title: Nauseatingly violent and shallow
text: A film of its time that caters to a generation of filmgoers with short attention spans. Nil character development develops into a multiple death gorequest of individuals that you don't really care about.

title: Once again no test of subtitles. Just a romp
text: First .. once again film makers don't beta test subtitles. Hard to read against background .So many streamed series and films just have small white text that's hard to read against light backgroundUse Korean standard black or white with boxed contrast.Film is just a romp and not to be taken seriously. Slightly different to standard thriller script. Looks Tarantino influenced but not to extreme.Lots of style from a generation of films but fast moving and the comedic thread carries it through.Sort of glad i didn't go to cinema to see but enjoying on NOW TV.Have a beer, settle down and enjoy the romp.

title: Loved it
text: The soundtrack of the movie is to die for. All song alignments are so apt and fitting, and fun to listen to too! Loved it :D I've been listening to it on repeat now haha.

title: The argument was unexpected for a film of this type
text: Of course the movie was one of those "over CGI" ones but I think the argument was solid. I don't like much this type of films (marvel style) where there are guys jumping from trains and all of that but I think this one just hits different. The argument for the most key parts of the film was not that predictable and I enjoyed the overall story.I recommend this movie for you to check out. The cinema experience is always the best, of course, and I'd recommend it as well for those like me that don't like this cgi types of films.Also, just a quick comment, I imagined this movie to be 150+ million USD (budget) but it turns out to be less than 90 million. I was kind of impressed by it, just a little.

title: Fantastic movie
text: This is what you call a box office blockbuster. The Bullet Train is an amazing movie and Brad Pitt showed yet again he is the best. You surely cannot miss this movie, an amazing one, to say the least...

title: Was ok
text: Nice action movie combined with light comedy. Brad Pitt still looking good. There were too many characters, which is mainly due to having altogether , the Japanese, the Russian, the Brit's and the Americans. Sandra Bullok's character was totally unnecessary, also she had too much make up.

title: So nice and sweet movie
text: I was excited about the movie ever since I saw the trailer but I have to say, it goes well beyond my expectations. Definitely a must watch for all Brad Pitt fans out there!

title: Bit of a Hollow Point but still a speedy well-aimed Bullet.
text: Director Leitch perhaps learned from Odenkirk's "Nobody" and this action ballet does not lean so heavily on the muscle of stunt men and women, but flexes the funny bone much more. As one of the producers said, the action was not just for action sake.It is almost like a Warner Brothers cartoon, where the carnage you speed through to pick for humor in the wreckage. Meep meep? The film drew a cavalcade of celebs, a handful uncredited.Brad Pitt in the Bugs Bunny role found the right tone for the film. He helps deliver a proper man-handling of self-help psychiatry, but the twin hearts of the film are Tangerine and Lemon. Their promo commercials caught my interest in a Guy Ritchie sort of way, their petty bickering bubbling up in blood bath scenarios followed through on that commercial promise.There is a mild meditation on luck/fate, but I wouldn't think too much about themes per se. It served its Friday night, turn-off-the-brain purpose for me, I hope it does for you as well.If not, the exits are clearly marked, but if you enjoy a simple and brisk ride, you may have as much trouble leaving the Bullet Train as Pitt did.

title: Hilariously fantastic!
text: I absolutely loved this! Brad was excellent, as were all the actors! I laughed out loud so many times! I would have sat through it again back to back! Giggled talking about it on the drive home. Definitely a 10/10 from me üçãüçä

title: Entertaining And Action Packed
text: This was a Japanese anime inspired film with action, blood and gore that would make Quentin Tarantino blush. It was enjoyable to watch and had lighthearted humor in it as well. It was a bit white washed with Americans playing Japanese roles but that's the Hollywood norm nowadays. Brad Pitt was his usual action star self. I think the standout performance was Joey King. She played the part of the malevolent and manipulative young girl very well. Her British accent was great considering she's an American. I actually thought this was a remake of an anime movie but it's actually based on a book.The cinematography was particularly good. Well done movie overall.

title: Only the bots liked it
text: It is incredible to see how many fake/bot accounts have been created to leave a 10 start review for this film.I how much of the marketing budget of this film is being spent on this bot reviews (very easy to spot a bot, it is usually name-12345).This movie was mediocre at best, with a mediocre screenplay and a director who made a lousy attempt to steal Tarantino's style.As a bonus, Bad Bunny shows why he should never quit his music business.

title: So many characters
text: A bit difficult to believe or follow, but plenty entertaining. Sort of like a Tarantino wanna-be. Lots of action. Colourful. Unusual locale. 460 more required characters, really? That's a whole lot of filler I have to put in to make this something I can submit. What else can I say? This movie is worth watching, better than a whole lot of garbage that they are putting out these days, you know? Wow, 200 more characters? Uh - well, how about a story? Okay. Once a man was born. He lived, and then he died. The end. Pretty good story? I know, it stunk, right? Yeah, I didn't plan this out well, but now I'm comm... Ha ha, I win.

title: Brilliant movie!
text: Amazing movie! Brat Pitt at his best, the whole cast gave an outstanding performance, the story had a brilliant dark humor. Don't listen to the bad reviews, they just don't get it!

title: Good
text: Great for some laughs and enjoyed the movie. I was pleasantly surprised. Really enjoyable this film - great acting, story linkage, fight scenes and the comedy was bang on, Bullet Train was a wild, action-packed ride that kept me laughing and engaged from beginning to end.

title: Decent movie but takes a while to warm up
text: I was watching this movie and at half an hour in I almost walked out. It felt a bit corny and confusing.But it got better from there and I enjoyed the rest of it.Seems to copy the style of Guy Richie and Tarantino.I thought there were a few too many characters on the movie and with all the flash backs it was a bit confusing.Worth watching though especially for the scenes of the Bullet Train which I have always wanted to ride.

title: Heart touching
text: The movie is one of the most fun movies I have watched in a long long long time. A thoroughly entertaining movie and a must watch for all Brad Pitt fans!

title: stylised, well-made fun - but feels a bit empty
text: A load of bizarre assassins and general bad guys find themselves on a train speeding its way across Japan.The characters range from quirky to goofy and everyone has a violent origin story.This plays out like a comic book with lots of bright colours and fast action sandwiched between clever, pithy dialogue.This is very well made with great acting, sets and frantic camera work.The story is nonsense - but you kind of get that by from the first scene.I really thought I would love this but I found it a bit tiresome - perhaps I am just getting too old for this sort of thing.The main issue is that the world is too fluid.When someone can chop down ten bad guys in a flash it is hard to care if another ten show up.When the lethality of bullets and samurai swords is so unpredictable - it is hard to get excited when someone draws their weapon.This is a really fun ride but it felt too long.It felt like there were a few too many silly backstories about how bad-ass #5 killed twenty nameless dudes, and too many tears spilt over fallen heroes who weren't quite dead.I think there is a lot to like here.But it feels like a fairground ride that you have to ride for over two hours - it is fun at first but after a bit you just want to sit down.

title: Enjoy, masti and fabulous
text: I was not into Hollywood movies till my friend took me to watch this light one. Amazed to see the visuals and entertaining concept of this movie. Need to watch more movies of this sort...

title: No likeable characters, dumb convoluted plot, just dumb
text: If you have seen one David Leitch directed movie, you have already seen this movie. There are no likeable characters in this turd - as these characters are like others you have seen in his other dumb movies. There is nothing new or thoughtful or good here. And that you have to watch these dumb characters interact in a dumb convoluted plot just makes it all a waste of time.Your life is ending one minute at a time and we shouldn't be wasting it interacting with vapid content like this. Everyone involved should feel shame. But it made made money, so all they will take from this mess is that that dumb movies make money and then we will get more dumb movies.What a waste of time, money and talent.

title: Thought it would be funnier
text: I gave this a 6 because of the filmmaking artistry and had work that went into making it, but the movie itself was average, and I even dozed off during one segment. Based on the trailer (when will I ever learn), I thought it would be quite funny, but Pitt was much funnier in the the Cohen Bros. Film 'Burn After Reading'. Some of the ad-libs in this were rather painful to watch (or at least they seemed like ad libs). Some have understandably compared this to a Guy Ritchie film, but I find his films much more clever. This one has some decent action sequences, but those didn't save it for me. Wouldn't recommend this one.

title: Amazing
text: Just a very refreshing movie, full of stars having a bit of fun and doing something different. Aaron Taylor Johnson is at his absolute best, very funny, very violent. Think of Snatch, Deadpool, and Kill Bill, Amazing soundtrack and performances, Movie was good! It's a bit silly and all over the place, but it was defiantly enjoyable.

title: Best movie
text: For each scholar who's gaining knowledge of film course and cinematography, the film is past notable. The digital digicam angles and the shape are past perfection!

title: Was a good watch
text: To be honest the beginning was almost discouraging, five minutes into the movie and I thought the chemistry between tangerine and lemon was not there, the prince girl tried too hard to come off as a psycho. And the comedy was a little stiff for my liking. But I stuck with it and it was quite okay. I enjoyed the fact that a lot of my favorites appeared in the movie though. But the movie was nothing spectacular. The action scenes were very good. I was going to give it a five before, but the movie became better from the middle and I actually laughed like twice at the jokes. So all in all it wasn't a bad movie.

title: Amazing
text: Bullet Train is an unstoppable thrilling movie. It grabs has grabbed my attention since the first minute. Such an interesting movie I love it, a movie you can't miss.

title: The book is better than the movie
text: I have to say this movie is not bad. But if someone read the book first and then watched the movie they will say the book is better than the movie for sure.There are some reasons why I said that.Firstly, Any characters from the book are vital, for example, The prince in the book is an innocent face teenager but she is a wily too. So in order to describe this wonderful character, The author used some memory that why she has this weird behavior and how she thinks killing people is power, and how she plans to do it again to her schoolmate. That's necessary for the audience to understand why she is this way.

title: Amazing favourite movie
text: The fight scenes are really well done. The quiet car scene is amazing it so funny and creative! I'm glad this movie was as bloody and gorey as it was too with some great kills, I love these hectic movies where everything links up and all means something without it losing its charm and Bullet Train does it perfectly. The movie is with direction of David Leitch and his previous movie are my fav.

title: Enjoyable to watch if you don't dig too deep
text: This film is what I expected not bad at all but if you start to dig deep and questions parts it'll start to ruin what the films about. The cast are brilliant and very funny but I feel a lot more characters could of had a bit more screen time but that doesn't make it bad at all. I found my self laughing and enjoying the film a lot however if you wanted a really good film to sit and proper get into like Batman or Nope, sadly this film isn't that. I do highly recommend giving if a watch as it is an outstanding film.

title: High hopes dashed in extreme violent blood
text: What are the producers and directors thinking? That we have become so bloodthirsty as movie goers that this would be entertaining? Brad Pitt is a good actor who does not need this kind of gore to support his acting. There are much better train movies out there that are riveting and don't cause squirming at 5min intervals. So disappointing.The Trailers in no way expose the level of slashing splattering and useless violence and gore. We only see action fight scenes with mixed comedic lines.Where are all the Hollywood elites who are incensed at senseless mass murders. This movie could of been entertaining with 5% of the violence, but that would require talented writers.

title: Assassins on a train
text: I had fun with Bullet Train (2022), and this movie is based on the book by Japanese author Kotaro Isaka. I have not read the book, but the movie makes me interested in checking it out.Brad Pitt and everyone else in the movie were great in the movie, especially Brad Pitt's character. Ladybug played by Brad Pitt was a charming character that you liked following while being funny and being great in action scenes.The action scenes were fun to watch. The action scenes looked cool and the ways they show them can be violent or funny in how it plays out, even in the 3rd act climax which was also both fun and funny.There were lots of funny moments mostly because the main character is likable, and the train looked good with effects and was believable. The different assassins on the train were interesting and one of them had a good backstory to explain why he does what he does.The movie had a funny ending that left me satisfied with what I saw. Bullet Train (2022) was a fun, funny, well-acted action-comedy movie that you will have fun with.

title: What Going to the Theater is All About
text: This movie is not going to win any Oscars, but it is a movie for anyone who wants t have a great time for 2 hours. It is fun, witty, violent, fast paced, and exciting. The characters are all perfectly acted. I think the masses will have a great time with this movie from start to finish. It is a movie that feels plucked out of 2012 with over the top violence, hilarious dialogue, a fast paced story that ties everything in very well. I highly recommend seeing this in the theaters if you can!

title: Just good ole fashioned fun
text: This movies just for fun and Brad Pitt in a completely relaxed role which is a bonus for us all. Everyone in this does good and the dialogue is wonderful and witty. Give it a try and don't take it too serious.

title: Amazing movie
text: I am now no longer going to present out any spoilers however the film has 2 cameos so one can take your breath away. Love it while there are unique appearances you don't expect!

title: my 2nd favorite action movie in this year
text:
Let me first start by saying I just happen to glance at a few of the 1 star reviews and they almost were as funny as this movie is. They all complained about the gory violence being the reasoning behind their poor review, which is clearly in the description of why its rated R. If gore or ANYthing bothers you enough to make a review about it I suggest you not be lazy and check prior to seeing any film....
Now that I got that out the way. Took my wife to see this film Friday and from the beginning I knew we would like it. Starts off in a older samurai back story setting then you get to Brad shortly after who still looks good and gives you that classic Pitt feel. He's so comedic with out trying lol. Im not going to give a full broken down review of the entire film but will say it has everything in it from laughing, crying, action, gore and I want to say there might have been a quick scene of nudity but extremely brief. If you're a fan of Atlanta, Brian Henry does a great job in this as well. I highly recommend. Oh and you only get Sandra bullock for a quick 5 minutes at the end.

title: Frenetic tongue-in-cheek mayhem - not great but still fun
text: A diverse group of assassins simultaneously embark on a Shinkansen train travelling from Tokyo to Kyoto at 200+ mph and soon knives, bullets, fists, and bodies are flying. Former stuntman and fight-choreographer David Leitch directs this silly but entertaining big-budget actioner. Although far-fetched, the plot is reasonably clever (and nicely 'tied up' in the final reel), and the ensemble cast, their material, and the action 'set-pieces' are generally good (if a touch of 'cartoon physics' is ignored). The film tries a bit too hard to achieve the dead-pan flair of 'Pulp Fiction' (1994) or the causal-cleverness of 'Snatch' (2000), but remains entertaining in its own right.

title: Subarashi kuso eiga
text: Great time. Have seen anything so original in a long time. So much fun. I highly recommend it. Great cast, great food and plushies too. Google translate it.

title: Watched it today. Will forget it tomorrow.
text: David Leitch's "Bullet Train" starring Brad Pitt is essentially a colorfully and stylistically packaged work of mediocracy. This is not to discount the overall viewing experience, which I have to admit was pretty fun and engaging, but walking out of the theatre felt like you watched something that you're not going to remember after a good night's sleep.Bullet Train is extremely stylistic and it has a plot that is interesting enough to give that style some substance. But that substance always seems to be the surface and never grips you in with anything to emotionally invest in. The writing at some points feel poor, almost as if you're watching an AI try to piece together an interesting conversation based on every high octane action crime film from 10 years ago. The whole "Thomas the Steam Engine" gig was cringe from the beginning, and so was the entire character of Joey King's "Prince"; which I found to be utterly irritating and an eye-sore to look at.Don't get me wrong. It's not in any way a bad movie. I'd even say it's decently above average. And it was fairly interesting and to some extent engaging. It also does its best to present the movie in a somewhat different style from what we're all used to. But they all just don't seem to leave a lasting impression. It's not a waste of time if you decide to go watch it, but you wouldn't be missing out on anything if you didn't either.

title: Gravy train for Hollywood stars
text: I suppose you have to be be English to wonder what on earth is going on with the accents? The rest of the world can count itself lucky that it won't know any different.The sound engineer should be diverted to another track and made to work on the real Thomas the tank engine !Don't buy a large drink when you see this film, because it will take real discipline to return to the auditorium when you leave to use the toilet.The best bit was Sandra Bullocks face. That was the only bit of film that held my interest.

title: Entertaining, but somewhat messy train ride.
text: Bullet Train is a new action comedy directed by David Leitch, the director of Atomic Blonde, Deadpool 2 and Fast & Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw.The film is about the criminal codenamed Ladybug (Brad Pitt), who tries to steal a suitcase from other criminals for his mission. If he manages to successfully end this mission, he wants to take it easy with his criminal life and tries to make a start with this during this mission.The suitcase he tries to steal is in the hands of twins Tangerine (Aaron Taylor Johnson) and Lemon (Brian Tyree Henry). The twins are sitting together in the fastest train in the world in Japan to deliver the suitcase, which is why Ladybug also board this train. On entering the train, Ladybug learns that the train is filled with wrong people from the criminal world who have problems with each other. Ladybug now has to get hold of the suitcase as quickly as possible and then leave the train as quickly as possible without getting the wrong people after her.Director David Leitch already had a history before this film with Brad Pitt as his stunt double in other action films. They worked well together on this film. Despite the fact that the film is promoted as a Brad Pitt film, he still shares a lot of time with the other cast members of the film, who sometimes even manage to overshadow him.David Leitch knows how to use the environment in which the film takes place in beautiful and creative ways. Despite the fact that the space of a train compartment seems small, it still manages to provide exciting and entertaining action scenes here. He has enough surprising train compartments to use in his film. Furthermore, he seems to be somewhat inspired by films by Robert Rodriguez and Quentin Tarantino and seems to take over elements of their films in a respectful, yet somewhat copied way.The film is further based on the Japanese novel "Maria Beetle" and the final screenplay is written by Zak Olkewicz. Unfortunately, this screenplay is only the first screenplay, which he wrote himself without the collaboration of other writers. Despite the fact that he has managed to provide an entertaining film, it can be seen from the film that this is only his first written screenplay, because the film has its messy sides. The story often jumps from the main chronological story to flashbacks or imaginative previews of the various characters in the film. This sometimes makes it difficult to follow the entire movie exactly and to remember all the details.Thanks to the many trailers of the movie that give away too much about the movie itself and the comedy moments, many things can come across as predictable. For a better experience of this movie, you should try to avoid the trailers. Then you're more likely to laugh at the movie's comedy. Yet many comedy moments are a bit on the predictable side, especially if you are familiar with an average action comedy. Zak Olkewicz sometimes seems to come across with his writing as if he thinks he is funnier than he actually is.Another problem of the film is the size of the film cast, because each different character carries some extra baggage in the front of the story. This makes the film sometimes a bit too full, because every character has almost its own background story, comedy or action style. The cast knows how to do good and entertaining work, but not every actor gets the same amount of time. Some are used more for a short comedy moment, or play an entertaining cameo. Some characters seem almost unnecessary or sometimes provide a more long-winded feeling. With a smaller movie cast and a more focused story, they could have had a better movie. The playing time could have been shorter, so that the entire film could have come across more appropriately.

title: Awesome
text: It's been see you later when you consider that Brad Pitt has performed in a comedy film however he's nevertheless were given the allure, perhaps even more! Loved him for his allure withinside the film and the film too changed into amazing!

title: Very entertaining
text: I usually like these kind of movies, and John Wick is right up my alley, so it's no surprise that I really enjoyed the ride in this train. David Leitch comes from a stunt background so his movies usually have very good fights and stunts, then you add a layer of coolness sprinkled with a pint of comedy and his movies tend to be really enjoyable and the definition of very well executed entertainment. The cast is also very good with Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry stealing the show. I might be alone here, but I did find Brad Pitt to be a bit miscast, as this role was clearly meant for someone like Ryan Reynolds and Pitt lacks the comedic chops to pull it off perfectly. He's not bad by any means, it's just a bit of a nitpick. Everything else was a joy to watch and I was thoroughly entertained throughout. It's a bit hollow and I don't know if I want to re-watch it many times, hence the note, but I can still highly recommend this for fans of the genre.

title: Such a good acting
text: I think it's about time that the American fraternity goes for someone other than Hiroyuki Sanada. He does an amazing job in all his roles but other Japanese actors could be just as great.

title: Amazing scenery, kinetic cinematography and glorious cast more than make up for the movie's shortcomings
text: A relentless, frenetic experience that employs successfully tested proportions of humor, unflinching slapstick action and graphic violence. The spectacular, creatively choreographed Japanese high-speed themed set engulfs an outstanding ensemble cast led by Brad Pitt. A well-made film with undeniable superficial virtues, but not many deeper ones, which are enough for a -mostly- entertaining two hours of viewing.The sets are a feast for the eyes throughout the film, detailing the aesthetics of Japanese culture inside the Bullet Train's different thematic wagons (as if taken from different video game tracks).The other great asset of the film is the awesome ensemble cast. The actors fulfill their mission with passion. The deliberately over-the-top acting sticks hand-to-hand with the hyperkinetic action (which is filmed with precision and clarity), while duets like the one of the twins impress with their chemistry. In a rather goofy performance that suits his comedic style, Brad Pitt entertains and is the film's highlight as the most politically correct -and unlucky- hitman we've seen in cinema. You can't help but laugh your heart out watching him struggle to keep the modern narrative of self-improvement against dangerous enemies that want to spill his blood, but also mocking himself on the occasion of the setbacks that he happens to stumble on! But as good as Pitt is (once again), it would be unfair to suggest that "Bullet Train" is a one man show. Even the cameos of all the well-known stars that appeared for the smallest amount of time are absolutely worthy to be mentioned.

title: Great
text: I am so proud to see Japanese actors and Japanese traditions spreading their wings to American cinema. The culture has been captured wonderfully! Truly enjoyable!

title: Bullet speed wild ride with loads of fun
text: If it wasn't for the finale, probably would rate this movie even 8. It was so close to this, but yet it was too much in the last scenes.But lets go back to the beginning. I wasn't expecting much when I went to the cinema, but with every station this movie was getting more and more amusing.Brad Pitt in absolute top shape. It's like his best from "Mr and Mrs Smith" and "Inglorious Bastards". Funny, mysterious.Tangerine and Lemon - those two were absolutely superb. For the first time probably I was totally for the bad guys. I was worried that there would be too much meaningless monologues, but the amount was just right to make the right climate... and this reference to Diesel and Tomas was just hilarious (but probably only parents would understand it the right way).As a spectator, throughout the whole movie, I wasn't sure who is who and why the do what they do. Sure, I had my suspicions but hey... each time someone was dead I had to rethink it all over again. That was the fun, really.The big finale on the train ... well it was this little too much to feel really, really satisfied with the movie. Entire movie was wild and fast, but I was enjoying it and there was not even one scene where it got me serious thinking whether something is possible or not, it was all connected so seamlessly and the the final battle happened... it wasn't so bad, but it was just too much.Overall impression is great though. Solid piece of entertainment there, good acting, very expressive characters. Definitely worth seeing for every fan of Tarantino :)

title: Fun, but could've easily been so much better.
text: The issue was the amateurish screenplay trying to be smart, but ultimately becoming cheesy and infantile. There were lots of plot and technical issues and some overboard action where not needed, and not enough where needed. The pop culture got annoying pretty quickly, and the cheesy characters tried to be shown off with Tarantino flair, but ended up just being obnoxious. But still, thanks in part to Pitt's stellar charisma and performance, it was a fun and entertaining ride. It's a shame a seasoned writer wasn't at least consulted to up the ante in the writing department to fix the lost opportunity to make this a great film.

title: Thoroughly enjoyable
text: An exhilarating ride from first to last - just like a Bullet Train. A story about an underworld murder mystery with flavours of gang rivalry, family feud and personal vendettas, which all connect.There are exciting and diverse characters(assassins) with intuitive names. I loved 'Lemon'. He loves Thomas & Friends, the cartoon show but finds himself in trouble when he has to drive the train!Brad Pitt is 'Ladybug' who is furious with his luck as he always lands into trouble and people die without him even trying. There is a subtle comment on fate and that however hard you may try to control it, some things are just not in your hand.Filled with some decent action, better comedy and little gore Bullet Train is a good one-time watch.

title: Action copycat movie
text: Trying to be Guy Ritchie, this is one of those movies with excessive action with a very shallow storyline with everything reused and reused again. Try wiping your nose 10x with the same tissue. It isn't funny.Since Tarantino tried to be Scorcese (and couldn't), this type of movie and directors have been piling up. That kinda funny+violence humor, the funny nicknames, The Villain, The Killer, The Thing in The Briefcase, all misused, plus the impossible action scenes... old, overused, it's like John Wick 1 to1.287, same old, same old. It's like fried chicken with fried potatoes with sundae: Wanna more fat? Wait, we have mayo.Nothing new, old jokes, old story, old plot, old, old. Old.It's one of those productions to fill up the streaming services: "10K+ titles!". They just don't tell you they're all the freaking same.The difference is that you have Brad Pitt (which is maybe becoming a Steven Seagal of this century after Once Upon a Time...) and other good actors in the cast that makes you think it'll be something nice. But it isn't. Come one, be reasonable and honest. It is not, period.

title: modern day samurai?
text: A good presentation of the bullet train to the world with a finite set of twists & turns via some backstories with some good action sequences and a story of a gang leader raising up the ladder to become an underworld kingmaker.The school girl kinda characterisation was one of the good antagonist roles in the film that was enjoyable due to the artists' casual act throughout. Brad Pitt gave the same kinda casual act but not sure why it wasn't that enjoyable for me, it might be for his fans though.And the most interesting part of the plot for me was the karma part that makes you think backwards in the film in the end and connect the dots with not so much complexity but in a very straightforward manner, you'd probably like this, if you like spirituality even a bit of it.There were many mockeries kinda sequences in the film especially the ones that come in between the action sequences, which could've been avoided to make it even more serious & interesting.Overall, it is a one-time watchable decent flick, if you've time to kill.

title: Can't wait for the Prequel!!
text: If Quentin Tarantino and Jackie Chan had a baby, it would be this movie. Fun to watch and I loved all of the surprise cameos. Such a great cast and characters. I especially loved the interaction between the twins. We need a Bolivia prequel please! YES Keanu needs to show up as Barry. And more Bad Bunny! I'm going to have to get the book now.

title: Jerry Welbach grows up to be in Bullet Train
text: After marrying Sam and things not working out, of course, Jerry Welbach continues his hapless path. He becomes an assassin in an organization of killers and thieves and after a nervous breakdown and some much needed therapy ends up on a high speed train to retrieve a case under the watchful eye of his handler Maria. You'll wonder who is double crossing whom and whether this was Tarantino rip-off of an Asian action flick minus the tricky dialog with loads of explanatory, explosive flashbacks. Regardless, this is a fun thrill ride that barely makes sense but you can't help cheering for Jerry the whole ride!

title: Nice
text: Bullet train is a wonderfully filmed and tremendously enjoyable trip from beginning to end that never takes itself too seriously. It is fun, stylish, and brimming with energy, in large part because to Brad pitt endearing interpretation of a Unlucky Assassin character.

title: Violence combines with music
text: It looks like a super long MV of the background music which is always about vision effect, killing, and pleasure. The plot contains lots of coincidences, a considerable group of killers gathering on one train, all aiming for their own mission.

title: Great
text: This movie is incredibly entertaining thanks to Brad pitt and his enthusiastic performance. It is humorous and fast-paced, and you have to constantly reminding yourself that it is based on a Beautifully written novel .

title: Good fun but a bit messy
text: First of all I'll begin by saying the film has style. And I love that style. It feels fun, bouncy and light - nothing to take too seriously. Also, the action is great (similar to John Wick style which I absolutely adore). But other than that, the film does suffer from an over complicated plot with so many twists and turns you can barely keep up.The film is VERY fast paced, and introduces so many different characters at a time that you're left wondering who's who anymore. Sure, the film offers several flashback sequences and returns to these throughout to ensure consistency and to make sure you as the audience can just about keep up with the pace of this movie. But when there's so many plots going on at once, it begins to lose itself slightly, and soon becomes a bit messy in places, with a few holes throughout. For example, the 'Wolf' assassin trying to kill Brad Pitt's 'Ladybug' when he knew the actual person who killed his family was a woman called 'the Hornet'. That was a bit odd to me. I had to make up and guess a reason for this, which was purely the fact he maybe recognised Brad Pitt's character in that split second of seeing him?However saying this, the films style allows for this messy plot, as it's so fun and wild you don't seem to care too much what's going on, so it justifies it in a sense, which I can just about cope with. And none of this takes away from the enjoyment of the movie itself.For me, it's mainly the political references again that lets this movie down. Comments such as 'you look like any other white homeless man' and calling a girl 'Prince' and having her say 'I don't need to be a part of someone else's story, you're all part of mine' which is a cry at feminism, then of course another feminism boost when someone refers to God as 'She'. A film doesn't need to rely on cheap political jokes and references like this to make a film entertaining and if anything, it just irritates me because it ruins and spoils the experience of the movie. Sure, people need to feel represented and whatnot, but having racial comments about white men isn't going to achieve anything. Is it a case of making others feel better by slandering white men? If so how is that fair? Because if it was the other way around, it would not be tolerated...Whenever Hollywood realises this and comes to their senses, I will stop talking about it. Until then, I will continue to call it out.For that reason, it just scraped a 6/10.

title: Adult, Funny Humor, Non-Stop Action - Peak Enjoyment
text: This is the 2nd or 3rd review I ever post on IMDB. Very few movies impress me. But this one did. It was wild fun from beginning to end, and I'm not just talking about the action.The humor, the adult, non-cringy one I might add, was spot-on and VERY well served. It wasn't too much nor too little but I was laughing almost non-stop. It's like a breath of fresh air in an industry clogged by childish, cringy and eye-rolling attempt at humor.The action scenes were really well done, the acting was extremely good, from all actors, and there's literally nothing bad I can say about this movie.Go in fully expecting peak enjoyment and you'll get it. I promise you that!

title: A Few Laughs
text: NOT as funny as I thought it would be. Beautifully shot, completely far-fetched. Extremely well acted, a lot of fight scenes so never a dull moment. I just hoped for so much more here and it didn't really deliver. Each actor kind of brought you into their own world with their little stories, and that was cool. In the end I am still not sure if the white devil and the guy with the cane were family or not. I recommend if you have nothing better to watch.

title: An idiotic waste of time
text: I cannot fathom how this absurd thing they call a "movie" can actually get a 7.4 rating.I couldn't even finish watching it (yes it's THAT bad).I loathe these dialogues which exist only to "give context" , even a "comical" one to the story.If context needs to be explained, either by off screen voice or worse, by the actors themselves, or WORSE within a totally unnatural dialogue... Believe me, grab a book instead, or even an audiobook.FURTHERMORE, when those "contexts" bring NOTHING to the story, you know you're in the presence of mediocrity.MOREOVER, when the story itself doesn't start to make sense before 20 minutes of painful watching, you know that it's even more interesting to watch paint dry.Why do these actors (who admittedly have great movies in their past) accept to act in absurd efforts like these is flabbergasting.AVOID AT ALL COST.

title: Enjoyable mess with good surprises
text: One thing I couldn't get out of my head while watching: The pacing is broken. Very quick action scenes (that are over too quickly) are followed by long, outdrawn scenes of dialogue. That wouldn't be an issue, if they wouldn't follow the same topics over and over again - or they wouldn't devolve into being overly silly.The third act however makes up for its shortcomings with a few good surprises and cameos.

title: I love this movie
text: No way they released on my favourite book Maria Beetle , that too with the likes of Brad Pitt and King. Was a thriller and super entertaining movie. Surely going to watch it again, loved the movie.

title: Bonkers, but fun
text: This movie is if The Gentlemen or Snatch took place on a bullet train. It ranges from pretty crazy to absolute bonkers and the latter was a bit too much for me at times.Though the movie was pretty fun I did notice jokes didn't land for me. For example there is this running Thomas The Train Engine joke throughout the movie. It's witty at the start but does run its course fairly quickly. I could also add the dialogue in general sometimes tried a bit too much.There's also a theme of faith and luck throughtout the movie which I did like. This theme makes the craziness a bit more digestible, but like I said it's still a bit too much for me at times.Action movies aren't my go-to, but the most of the fights in this were very well-executed. So if you just wanna see great action, this is your movie for sure.

title: Nice
text: I read the novel a while ago and was a little nervous, but this is a whole different case. Brad Pitt and Joey King do fantastic work as actors! Definitely on pace with the novel's story, and the performers performed an excellent job!

title: Overall solid 7! Very decent, though mediocre in parts
text:
ConsOk acting overall.Story was pretty decent but was a little slow
Enjoyed the action scenes (but they were no John wick)
Won't watch again
No real depth to any character
Not sure why that introduce random famous side charactersPros
Fun movie
Hooked on the odd occasion
Quirky gimmicks
Decent soundtrack
Good looking peopleOverall I would probably not watch it again.I didn't have high expectations and new that I would kind of love and hate it. The story was a bit flat but still kept me engaged at times. The action scenes were ok and enjoyable. The premise of the story was decent too and I don't think had been done before.Overall
7.2/10.

title: Nice
text: Pitt feels himself very comfortable and confident in that role.. The film captures and gives back to the viewer the great sense of adventure of action that packed subtle comedic scenes.

title: Above average action, comedy film
text:
Bullet Train is exactly what I thought it was going to be, a fun action popcorn eater.What is there to say about this film other than stupid and over the type, but it is just stupid and over the top enough to be entertaining. This film contains a very basic plot and doesn't go anywhere you wouldn't expect. The films abundance and overusage of CGI while in other films I'd consider a weakness actually works here it fits the theme and style of the film very well, but I have seen better CGI then again I've also seen worse.By the end of the film what truly kept it engaging and fun was the writing and this well put together cast. Everyone played their respected roles so well, I particularly enjoyed the twins "Tangerine" (Aaron Taylor-Johnson) and "Lemon" (Brian Tyree Henry) both actors had great chemistry and the bickering of their characters was just hilarious to me. Brad Pitt was obviously great and he played his role very well. Also there are some great cameos that really were a joy to watch, I won't say who so as to keep that a surprise.What stood out the most for me through this entire film and perhaps it's just me but this entire film looked, felt, and played out like it was directed by Guy Ritchie. The comedy, the characters, and the way the story was told just felt a lot like a Guy Ritchie film, like The Gentleman not saying these films are similar but it just had that feel. But The Gentleman is way better, if you haven't seen The Gentleman before I would highly recommend that film.At the end of it all I can't help but feel a tad bit disappointed because I wanted this film to be more and I wanted to enjoy it more. Not to say this was a bad film far from it, I was just hoping this film would've been more than I anticipated it to be.I can't say this is a must see in theaters but I can definitely say this is the perfect film to go out with the bros, make it a guys night, and have a good time.IMDb: 7/10
Letterboxd: 3/5Watched in Theaters.

title: Nice
text: It is worth viewing because of how it approaches the events and Brad Pitt endearing lead performance. It has a quick pace, an amusing and fascinating tale, and a self-conscious manner .

title: Fun, crazy and over the top
text: Can't deny saying, I love an original movie... and Bullet train comes with a kind of original idea with loads of fun. The characters are fun and likable (although they all are bad guys), the action scenes are well choreographed, the violence and gore is just enough to satisfy me and not got too gory, the jokes are well timed, the cameos are hilarious... it had it all to become a real good action flick, set on a bullet train through Japan.I was just missing something... I don't know what it was, but it was lacking something genuine I think. It all was well thought out - but it was connecting for me sometimes and there were a few plot holes!That been said, I did have a really great time with this movie. I would give it a solid 7/10.

title: Yuck
text: This is the type of movie that is good for grade schoolers with no brains. It is so obvious and loose that there is nothing to the script. If you enjoy beat-em-up that is fake and wild theories that are paper thin then this is your movie. I mean, they stop in the middle of a brawl to answer the phone??? Really??? Maybe some one's kind of humor but totally eluded me.A thought crossed my mind that if young people watch this they would get inspired to be a hell raiser with no apparent focus. I can't even comment on the acting because one does not need to act to be in this movie. An insifferable over two hour movie that the time could be better spent doing breathing exercises.

title: The Big Pretender
text: I don't even know where to start. It feels like this movie is a big pretender. It pretends to be witty, funny, intelligent, with good character development and fighting scenes, being able to tell multiple story lines, with good acting and being some ingenious combination of a whodunnit and an action movie. This movie is none of these things. It's garbled mediocrity.Take for instance the two brothers, The first time they talk about being black&white brothers, about Thomas the Tank Engine and about their nicknames (Lemon and Tangerine) it sounds interesting. But then this keeps repeating throughout the movie and it is an absolute drag. Not funny at all. How believable is it that two people who've known eachother all their lives talk about these things all the time, anyway?Furthermore, Brad Pitt's character feels totally out of place (even accounting for the fact that he's just filling in for someone) and the others are even less interesting. However, we spend a big part of the movie looking at some of their back story. Looking back, that is just wasted time. It goes nowhere.The jokes are forced. The acting feels sloppy. The characters are walking cliches and the way they make decisions and form alliances is too rushed and ridiculous in most cases. And finally, the overall story is unimaginative and senseless to the point of being boring.I'm being very, very generous giving it 6/10 for this bad attempt at a Quentin Tarantino imitation.

title: Nice
text: Brilliant film with Brad Pitt was brilliant as always at the center, fun and exciting film that always keeps you going. Brilliant story line, which was well developed.

title: Super fun, exciting movie
