text: Absolutely loved this film from start to finish, great humour and cast was too notch, definitely a cross between Guy Ritchie's Lock stock/Snatch and Tarantino's Kill Bill Vol 1, with a fun anime influence.

title: Very entertaining, because...
text: Another action, comedy, thriller by David Leitch, as he's good at doing, a great cast (even had a scene of a few seconds cameo by Ryan Reynolds) to which I'd add it included the kind of humour I like from Guy Ritchie directed movies, a extremely well chosen soundtrack I loved and which reminds me of the Tarantino's Kill Bill trilogy, and finally perfect special effects for a non science-fiction; that's why.So would i recommend it for its entertainment value? Of course I would; for its suspense, maybe not, although it certainly is unpredictable and has lots of action and as for action, there's plenty.

title: Good
text: I thought this was an incredible movie based on a good story from the novel that had a good mix of action and humour throughout along with a good cast too.

title: Big dumb fun
text: Leave your brain at the door and enjoy this mad daft blast of a movie. I loved the book this was based on so was really looking forward to it. As nearly always the case it's not as good as the book bit it is fun..Brad Pitt has fun, there's lots of very big star cameos. Great one liners and lots of action but it dies outstay it's welcome a bit. Plot? A briefcase on a train with a lot of killers with different agendas who inevitably clash. No classic but fun all the same.

title: Nice
text: The characters have an endearing relationship and are funny and enjoyable in addition to having good music blending and a touching plot with a beautiful story to its core of the movie .

title: Much Ado About Nothing
text: Based on the novel "Maria Beetle" (Mariabitoru) by Kotaro Isaka, "Bullet Train" is a speedy rush of non-stop action and endless lip-flapping wisecracks set in a bullet train hailing from Tokyo, Japan. With the city's glitzy and grimy neon-lit surroundings serving as backdrop to the tale of assassins finding themselves pitted against one another the movie is one sonic whoosh of a flick.Lead star Brad Pitt is the center of this whirlpool of flung furniture and smashed faces as he navigates his way through the long length of this seemingly endless train. The trite clich√©d Action tropes, annoying pc and diarrheic verbiage that passes off as humor make this a seemingly endless movie proving that there's no worse film than a bad Action film. The cameos by a fruity Channing Tatum, facially-swelled Sandra Bullock and barely there Ryan Reynolds provide brief respites from an unending 2 hour Odyssey of watch checking and snooze-inducing torture.A surprise hit that filled screens and emptied wallets, "Bullet Train" is a (barely) watchable teaser that's overall a disappointing waste of talent (and money) involved. Pass this.

title: Bullet trash
text: Honestly, this is one of the worst movies I watched recently, it's not fun at all, and I'll never trust the reviews ever again. I don't know who thinks this movie is good, it's plain stupid. It's just my honest review , and I don't recommend this movie. There's so many good action/comedies to watch so I recommend you to skip this trash and find another movie to spend your time on... acting is bad, plot is bad, the whole movie is bad even Brad Pitt disappointed in this one and he couldn't save this movie from being trash. I bet he thinks the same after seeing this "trying too hard to be fun and interesting" movie.

title: Suprinsingly fun!
text: Bullet Train is a ridiculous, over the top, fun comedy action thriller that never stops!After seeing the trailer for this about 19875 times I had extremely low expectations for this and wow was I wrong. The jokes tend to land most of the time and the best thing about this... It doesn't take itself serious. It knows it's ridiculously stupid and that makes the film more fun. It doesn't try and make sense of the stupid like other films would (like a fast and the furious). It was much more gory than I would have imagined as well.The negatives on this film are mostly a messy plot, some bad cgi and a couple moments I was taken out of the film by some serious FF moments. I do also believe this movie could have been trimmed down in certain parts as it does seemingly go on forever.The positives are, fun, action packed, cool shots, great comedy, great acting and great choreography. (A couple of fun cameos as well!)I think this is a great date night movie but a must see as soon as it's out of theaters.

title: So good - you must see it!!
text: I went into this not knowing what to expect - loved the many twists and turns in the story. A very strong cast indeed, some very big actors playing very small parts which was interesting! I just enjoy the simple things in life so for me it was really funny, fast paced, sad at times, but it was great. I'm sure if you are somebody who likes to analyse every little detail of films, then you will find something to fault. But if you want to have a laugh and a good time, do it! P.s. There's a fair bit of blood at parts which originally I did wince at.

title: Less Thomas The Tank Please
text: Bullet Train shamelessly rips off everything from Tarantino to Guy Ritchie and does a good job at times doing it. It's more funny comedy than action movie and that may turn some off but the funnier bits are done really well. Bullet Train may well be up there as one of the comedies of the year.Brad Pitt gives a great comedic performance and all the actors do well in their roles. Some great cameos from the likes of Sandra Bullock, Channing Tatum & Ryan Reynolds are worked in well fo add to the movie. What let's the movie down quite a bit is sometimes they go back to the same well too many times. Flashbacks are in abundance and some are good however by the time the water bottle gets It's own flashback, something has gone seriously wrong.The last half hour is a bit of a train wreck (Pardon the pun) with awful CGI and characters dropping in and out from nowhere. It's a shame really as up to that point Bullet Train was great.(Also less thomas the tank is required. Funny the first 50 times, not so much thereafter).

title: Very fabulous
text: It's a lighthearted action movie that made me smile while yet having me feel the stress in the scenes. The scenes on the bullet train are thrilling and fascinating. The best part of the movie is the second half, which amps up the excitement and fun. Be ready for an exciting cinematic journey that will leave you reeling with good action sequences, excitement, comedy, and happiness.

title: Entertaining & Fun
text: 2022 has not be good for movies, certainly this one pays off well. The cast was good but the best was how beautifully all the characters were put and placed in the movie, giving importance. Brad Pitt was the leading star, without a doubt and from the start till the very end, it is fun, it is entertaining and it is worth the time.There are some surprise characters in the movie, which i think might be there for a sequel and this one do deserve one.It has action, it has humor, it has good scenes, good effects, even the Japanese take of Stayin Alive was good and heard it for the first time.Must watch Do watch.

title: just a big mess of thrill, fun and gore
text: Probably the best movie of the year, really fast paced, just enough funny bits, a little bit of gore, a nice chunk of action, a little bit of a backstory for every character gives the movie a nice weight, no forced wokeness. Just great.Kinda of overabundance of big stars but i didn't mind.It's just a fun movie to see, would probably watch again.

title: What a fun ride!
text: Bullet Train started off with not quite assuring, but the convoluted plot of the film then began to be interesting to follow. Although originality wasn't the film's greatest forte at least it's still engaging until the very end. The comedy didn't always work, but the action scenes were really fun to watch. Interestingly, the film sometimes more interested in being a character study than the usual action sensation. Brad Pitt owned this film entirely.

title: Good
text: The best action, comedy, or thriller I've possibly ever seen in recent time. In addition to elevating superbly created characters, the writing is really tight as usual Pitt has done great justice to the role .

title: Not sure about this one!
text: Trying too hard to resemble a Guy Ritchie/ Tarantino movie and failing. Some ok bits but lots of cheesy humour, and one particularly terrible attempt at a cockney accent. Not worth the hype.

title: Golden Raspberry Award 2022
text: Bad script. An unnatural mashup of everything, resulting a broken mayonnaise. Worst Brad Pitt movie ever. I wanted to leave the cinema, but I fell asleep. Golden Raspberry Award 2022.

title: Only for fun
text: I really enjoyed the movie. Pure fun. Didn't think too much about some unrealistic situations and the excessive CGI.Brad Pitt is great here. Perfect role for him. But, overall great cast and solid performances except for Bad Bunny.He's obviously not an actor. I didn't like him in Narcos Mexico. Nor here. I understand he's only a marketing strategy, as many other Reggaeton singers trying to "acting" decently.So, overall if you love Tarantino movies and Brad Pitt's usual great performances like in Fight club or Inglorious Bastards, this one is for you.Solid 7/10.

title: TLDR - Definitely deserves a 7.8 at a minimum
text: My wife and I loved this movie when we saw it in IMAX the other day. I want to preface that I don't think it's necessary to watch it in IMAX, but we upgraded our tickets just in case.The movie has great comedy and action. Brad Pitt is incredible is this movie, and the rest of the cast makes the movie great. The thing I love most about this movie is that it is definitely made for entertainment, and not thinking it was the summer blockbuster IMO. That's what makes me love the movie that much more. My wife and I both agreed we would turn around and watch the movie again as soon as it ended.I was a fan of the wittiness and interesting action scenes. The movie's pace was great in my opinion. With a little over a 2 hour run time, it may seem too long. But the 2 hours was just right in my opinion, because of the connections to different points it references back to from earlier in the movie. Aaron Taylor-Johnson is also one of my favorite actors, so I'm a little biased on his performance (which was terrific btw). Taylor-Johnson does an incredible job with his character, and reminds me a lot of his role in Kick-Ass. I might be highlighting him, but really everyone in the movie played their part amazingly. Each actor made a connection to me through their characters. I loved each character's growth, or lack of, through the 2 hour run time.I'm probably rambling a little bit, but I would say this movie deserves at least a 7.8 due to the entertainment value and hilarious cameos (the trailers did a great job of hiding them). Personally, I gave it a 10 because it hit all the points I was looking for a movie this year. It may not be everyone's cup of tea, but the seriousness, comedy, and action was just *chef's kiss* perfect for me.

title: Good movie
text: My heart is with Ladybug (Brad Pitt). Pitt has played the character so wonderfully and I feel that he has added a lot of extra perspective to the character than how it has been presented in the book..

title: Cigarrillo Seguaro or what
text: A plot that keeps throwing in more and more well paced to the end. Excellent cast. Stunning cinematography and yes! Good music! Bravo! It delivered everything I expected since I saw the trailer and lots more. A cult classic is born for my collection. This is what is called entertainment. I loved all the characters, the comedy, the action and the CG. Howling with the Wolf woooooooooooooo.

title: Full Tilt, Action Packed Madness
text: If you're a fan of action this is a pure action movie. There is light hearted comedy sprinkled into every action packed scene (which is, quite literally, all of them) to alleviate some of the non-stop gun pointing and sword wielding.This movie starts at a level 9/10 on the action scale and ends at a level 1000/10. The stunts are continually outdone, becoming more outrageous, and really pushing the limits of what is capable with special effects in this day and age.Brad Pitt is a fine actor. He carries this movie on his shoulders with the wacky duo of Lemon and Tangerine and Prince also showing themselves to be formidable actors.The acting is good, the technical effects are even better. It's a smorgasbord of instantaneous reflexes, special effect wows, and a lot of gore.There's a bit of everything here, which I guess is also the weak point of this movie. There is SO much going on that it's hard to focus on the story. I honestly can't tell you who the White Death are or what the suitcase was for or who is chasing who. There's just a million pieces of visual and story information hurling at you at light speed that it's really hard to follow the story and appreciate everything else this movie offers at the same time.The director really took a maximalist approach, fitting in as much candy into the jar as possible, until it overflows and you get a cavities from eating all of it.This is definitely a movie that requires repeat viewings to take in everything that happens. It's a good movie, bordering on great, but it suffers from too much going on at once.

title: Nice
text: Fantastic film Brad Pitt did an excellent job and kept my attention throughout. I wasn't disappointed because the story felt unique and exciting. I'll probably watch it again. It's worth seeing because of the approach it takes to the events and Brad Pitt's appealing lead performance. It moves quickly, has a humorous and engaging story, and is self-conscious.

title: Thomas the tanked Bullet train
text: I didn't expect much here, just some plain action and fun, but it was actually very boring. The action is of course choreographed well but the dialogue is like someone asked ChatGPT to "create a Tarantino script with lots of hitmen on a Japanese Train".Of course the gallery also reads like a modern stock photography where any clich√© is represented.Now this could have worked fine for a while but as with so many modern films it's a long movie - 2 hours. Earlier, only the artsy films were long movies and the standard fare clocked in at 1:45 max. But now any generic action movie can be between 2 and 3 hours.This is odd since in today's fast-paced media landscape, audiences (who go for generic films) have shorter attention spans and don't necessarily want to sit through a movie that is overly long.So just because you don't have to use a cinema for an extra half hour it doesn't mean that you can just squeeze in 1000 references to Thomas the Tank engine.

title: The real rating should be -256.
text: It is a pity the movie ratings can't be negative numbers, otherwise I would give this movie a cool -256 points.The worst film of Brad Pitt. Poor attempt to be Kill Bill. No script whatsoever, not funny, brainless violence and grip and guts and blood the whole movie.Waste of time and movie and intellectual and esthetic insult for those who decided to go and watch it.You have been warned....

title: Chitty chitty with an S and some Bang Bang!
text: Bereft of any emotional or intellectual qualities! Just a slasher, shooter, The Raid- type film trying so, so hard to be even a little funny! Probably made for the Asian market, with it's parent-children subplot, where a child would do anything for the parent, and double for the parent of a male child. The flashbacks are all about loss and protection, and add nothing to the story in the present.Trying to be a Quentin Tarrantino and The Matrix lovechild, this film is more Dumb and Dumber with Train to Busan without zombies, barely!Obviously directed at a much younger audience that like violence and gore, it doesn't hide the very Yin-Yang juxtaposition of good versus evil. The bad guy wanting to be good versus the bad guy wanting to do bad, the lucky versus the unlucky, and the fate versus manifest destiny tropes abound and bore on board this train to nowhere!

title: Recommended it
text: The movie is absolutely sick. It is very well possible that it might just turn out to be one of the highest grossing movies of the year.. It would be well deserved too!

title: Fun, silly, but the third act hinders it.
text: Bullet Train is a 2022 action comedy starring Brad Pitt as Ladybug, who is an unlucky assassin that gets involved into a complicated mess alongside other killers. The first two acts are very fun, funny, and interesting. All of the assassins are developed pretty well and they all have different motives. It's virtually a whodunit for a large portion of the film too. Though its final 20 minutes are not great. The film's last sequence is a non-stop gore fest that feels generic and lacks the fun of the previous 100 minutes. It's a fun time at the movies, but it should have been trimmed.

title: amazing
text: The Bullet Train is a movie I had been waiting for so long. Ever since I read the book, I really wanted a movie adaptation and after watching the movie, I am stoked!!!

title: Kept me hooked !
text: Enjoyable , entertaining , fun , enjoyed right from the start . Brad was amazing through out the movie , hoping for a sequel to pop out soon. It was not at all boring all the lead actors did a great job not to forget Joey she was too good.

title: Nice
text: It's like John Wick with a wicked sense of humour. I'm glad I discovered this was playing earlier than I had anticipated. The action was exhilarating, Brad Pitt made a comeback, and I found myself caring for individuals I didn't expect to care about. The timing couldn't have been better for the comedy.

title: The Train Stops a Bit too Much
text: Bullet Train is super fun, at times. Brad Pitt is great, and the action sequences are fantastic. The problem is everything else. There are too many main characters, and not enough character development. The story is bland and predictable. The cast is great, but the script is so pedestrian that no one is able to have a really good performance aside from Pitt. Even with all of its flaws, Bullet Train was still very enjoyable. If this came out on Netflix, it would be one of their best action films. But it didn't. Bullet Train is a blockbuster movie, and an average one at that. Fun, dumb, forgettable.

title: Best and good
text: It has a wicked sense of humour like John Wick. I just watched a movie with a family of six on a Thursday afternoon. They were rolling around on the ground laughing as hard as I was laughing. I refer to extended, loud guffaws. It's actually that good, though. Although a little complicated, the plot is simple to follow, and the action scenes are spectacular.

title: Fun, but not perfect.
text:
Turn off your Spidey Sense and enjoy a colourful, thrilling, witty Action flick (which doesn't make a whole lot of sense, but well).First of all, what's not so great:
The last act is a drag. The film (and some characters) overstay their welcome, too many plot elements and too much happening outside the train, which gives insight to the obvious studio set.Also Joey King is 100% forgettable. I instantly forgot about her character after the credits rolled.Now, too the good stuff:
Cinematography. Nothing to add. Wonderful.Brad Pitt is SO much fun. Always a joy to see on screen. This dude just has fun doing these movies and you can feel it through the screen.The side characters are fun as well.Lighting, Colour grading and the dialogue are a big plus, too.Just a joy to experience if you want a fun time.Cut some at the very start and throughout the last 40 minutes and this would be the perfect comedic Action flick. More Pitt in the future!7/10.

title: a spoof of an action movie
text: Bullet Train is so cheesy, cranky, quirky that any movie fan feels punked.There are no jokes that make you laugh, the action scenes are too violent.If you want to watch some fun action movies than watch The Gray Man, Bad Spies or Red Notice or Knight & Day.This is the first time Brad Pitt can not save the movie.Bullet Train is nothing but a big letdown.

title: The perfect movie to turn your brain off during
text: You know, for a movie called, "Bullet Train" that takes place on a fast-moving bullet train this movie definitely wasn't as fast as one.Right out of the gate I'm going to say that this movie might work for some while not for others. There are multiple reasons for this and I'll get into each one and what I thought of them. Starting off with the story for this movie and for me, I just found it lacking. The story for this movie is an interesting one and if you look up the plot for the original book it could've worked if some factors changed. Now, I haven't read the original book so I can't say much about how much was changed for this adaptation so maybe everything that happens in this movie might work for the book but not visual media, for example, the plot twists in this movie. I will admit there's one in here that unless you're really paying attention to the movie it will go over your head but the others you can easily figure them out. I will say that in regards to the story for this movie, it's good if you shut your brain off while watching the movie and not think too hard.The next aspect that'll split people is the pacing of this movie. For me, the pacing just didn't work and I thought this movie should've been shorter. A lot of things in this movie happen that I just feel like could've been cut out and nothing would've been missing from the movie. There are two segments in this movie that come to mind, one that already is short enough to just be a deleted scene and another that goes on for a bit. I know action movies need breathing room from all the action scenes in them but the slower scenes in this movie just didn't intrigue me. This could be due to how many characters there are which does tie into the pacing issue. Because of how many characters there are, the movie tries to flesh them out and give them all backstories when they aren't necessary. There were maybe one or two characters, other than the main character, who really needed backstories given for them.I don't know what everybody is going to think about the characters themselves though but to me I couldn't really get into them. Despite them getting backstories I still couldn't grow to really care about any of them to wanting to see them live. There's one character in this movie that honestly could've been written out of the movie entirely and I wouldn't have cared other than that means the runtime would be shortened. I will say though in regards to the characters that it isn't the actors faults as all of the actors give it their all but the writing.The writing is the third aspect that will for sure divide people as some will enjoy the campiness of it along with the humour but for me the humour just didn't work. Pretty much each character got one personality trait and had to stick to it. None of them were given room to grow and change as characters instead all just stay flat characters. Most of the writing is dedicated to the humour in this movie and like I said this will be divisive between people depending on your type of humour. If you enjoy slapstick humour or surreal humour then this movie is for you but for everybody else there might be one of two jokes that'll work.But like I said the actors all did their jobs really well and made each character stand out with their one character trait. The standouts for me in this movie are Brad Pitt, Joey King, who plays Prince, and Aaron Taylor-Johnson, who plays Tangerine. Brad Pitt takes his one character trait and portrays it to perfection and makes for this weird oddball character that's enjoyable to watch. While Joey King on the other hand plays this character that you have no clue what they're going to do next. She plays this manipulative mentally unstable character to perfection that I definitely wouldn't look down on her.Now this movie is first and foremost an action flick so the action for this movie needs to be good and with it being confined to a bullet train it would be right? Well the action in this movie is pretty good but given the setting could've been better. I'm just going to side track here for a second to talk about the design of the train and my thoughts on it. I feel like the train easily could've been a character in and of itself with the right production design and here it doesn't work. The train is still well designed but I wish there were more rooms that looked different from each other or had a special feature to it like the quiet car. I feel like it's because of the design of the cars that the action scenes felt like they were missing something. Now, don't get me wrong I did enjoy the fight scenes in this movie and I felt like they were really well done but how much cooler could they have been if they were fighting in like a car with bunk beds in it since this is an overnight train. I also feel like it was during these actions that David Leith, the director, directing shined the best. The action scenes were directed with perfection with not too much editing in them and having them easy so that the audience can easily follow what's happening in them.But you know what I can easily forgive everything bad in this movie as the soundtrack for this movie was amazing. From the musical score to the songs used in this movie it felt appropriate and fit in perfectly. Also, this movie gave me a japanese version of an already great song and made it better somehow.In the end, Bullet train might not work for everybody but for those who want a movie to turn their brains off and enjoy this is the perfect movie for you. I give Bullet Train a 6/10.

title: Great concept
text: It was absolutely a rollercoaster ride. The movie had so many twists and turns that kept us going with excitement throughout the movie!great cast, the perfect director, the right level of.

title: Entertaining movie but a bad comedy
text: Bullet Train is difficult to review. It fails at being what it is supposed to be - a comedy, but on the other hand it is a very well crafted movie with many great aspects.It is obvious that the writers and director know their craft. The movie is professionally done and follows all the rules of how to create a great movie.The plots all fit together and in the end even naturally merge into one big one. And at no point does a plot feel out of place.Almost every scene contains either a setup or a payoff, there is almost nothing in this movie that could be removed without hurting some other part. The "Diesel" payoff might be the best of the movie and even though it wasn't particularly deep or complex, it just worked very very well because it had a lot of different setups that touched the viewer in different ways.The characters are another strong point, every character has a strong motiviation to be there and they all act according to their unique personality.And wow, the cast... very diverse, good actors, memorable faces and lots of characters that look familiar but not familiar enough to recognize them. Best example is "White Death", he seemed familiar but I could not figure out that it is Michael Shannon.And even "famous" actor Brad Pitt did not overshadow his role with his fame or personality.The biggest/only issue is the comedy aspect of the movie. Humor is hit-or-miss, sadly mostly miss, but it tries really hard to be funny. So hard, almost all of it seems forced and it ruins many dialogues. But the movie still was entertaining from beginning to end and a few jokes were pretty good.I feel like if the movie didn't have comedy and focused on the darker and more serious aspects it could have been a great mystery action thriller. Instead we got a bad comedy forced into a good movie with a lot of potential.

title: Nice
text: For every student who is learning movie direction and cinematography, the movie is beyond amazing. The camera angles and the structure are beyond perfection!

title: An entertaining ride that does not go off track
text: I expected way worse from Bullet Train. It feels like we've been overwhelmed lately by these by-the-numbers action films lead by recognizable movie stars. There is an ocean of them and I can barely tell them apart much less remember half of them. Films like the Grey Man, Red Notice, Kate (2021), Six Underground, The Old Guard. It looks like they exist in a plane somewhere between the slickness of John Wick action and the humour and sensibility of Family Guy. I would be too much credit to say they're formulaic but they tend to have the thinnest plot with the most boring characters.The key element that separates Bullet train from these other movies is a certain amount of flair in the execution.The movie tells the story of Brad Pitt, who is basically playing a version of The Dude from the Big Lebowski. Half unscrupulous killer, half hippy slacker. He is tasked to get on the Bullet Train to recover a briefcase full of cash. Unbeknownst to him, it seems that everybody in the Japanese underworld is also apparently on the train, for a bunch of different reason. As such it is a merry gallery of characters, should I say stereotypes, going at each other. It is not exactly high art but the tone is irreverent enough and it does not take itself too seriously, yet at the same time the action is treated with respect. The film achieves a tonal equilibria that keeps you engaged, and at this point that is frankly as good as it gets. Same thing can be said of the plot, it is nothing groundbreaking, but is sufficiently convoluted that it will make you guessing on how it is going to unfold.The thing I liked the most about the film was the comic relief duo of Lemon and Tangerine. Brothers and partners in crime, their dynamic veers between police detectives in a buddy movie and old married couple. However the actors charisma makes them endearing and somewhat relatable. I almost wish the movie would have focused on them as protagonist. Unfortunately the story does not give them much to do, and they have no agency. And also, while I adore those actors, iit is clear this movie was built around Pitt and he is the draw.You're left wondering if there is anything it could have done better? I would have enjoyed a bit more if it had given the script more gravitas, more heft and have the protagonist a bit more grounded. The humour and the setup are a bit too quippy and giddy. The humour comes primarily from the randomness of the situations.As such Bullet train is a good film, but despite the heightened japanese-inspired neon stylistic look, the faux-ironic use of music and the levity of the script it does leave you with an overall sense of blandness.

title: Wonderful
text: The movie goes above and beyond all my expectations from it and it comes to me as no surprise since it stars Brad Pitt and Joey King - Great casting!!

title: A Train Wreck of entertainment 7/10
text: Bullet Train is one heck of a ride for all it's viewers. It's funny and full of fun and action packed. Director David Leitch has done a great job with adapting the book by K√¥tar√¥ Isaka to the big screen.The plot centers around multiple assassins and bounty hunters who all unite in one place (a fast train in modern-day Japan). Slowly, it is revealed to the characters that their missions have a lot in common, perhaps intentionally.As much as I enjoyed the fast pacing and humorous tone of the film, I did feel like a lot of plot points were left either unfinished or just cut short. Many interesting characters to me seemed to just appear and die for nothing.The peak of the movie for me were the duo Lemon and Tangerine (Brian Tyree Henry and Aaron Taylor Johnson respectively). I loved every moment of them on screen, their chemistry was great and I really enjoyed all their interactions.Aside of the rest of the cast, I think Lemon and Tangerine were really my favorites and the ones to hold the whole humor and soul of the film.The movie uses a lot of pop culture references and different styles of genre to keep its tone uplifting: you have russian mobsters, Yakooza Japanese gangs, Mexican cartels. As much as it's fun all the use of different materials, I did assume it was all just a huge fuss, a lot of random combinations for a OK movie.Is this movie at the end worth watching? Sure, it is entertaining and holds lot to it, but nothing more, one of those movies you might not remember looking back. As I said, a Train wreck.

title: Excited
text: Such roles make Brad Pitt seem like the human he is instead of the usual God he looks like in all his other movies. Amazing comedic timing and his look was also so fitting for the movie theme!

title: Overall a mess, but it's fine
text: I've seen worse movies this year. Bullet Train is definitely not the best movie of the year, in fact, I won't even list it on the top 10 movies of the year.The characters could have been better, better scripts would make a big change - considering the actors are nice.The move itself can be nice, it reminds me one of A24 studios films. Some people will enjoy it, some won't. Anyway, it's worth seeing Brad Pitt on the screen.

title: Sell out...
text: The hype got me...People gave it high reviews and it has Brad Pitt and a couple of decent actors.... And... Oh my God ... This is an absolute joke of a movie... It makes John wick look sophisticated and realistic ....imagine that... And the painfully cringe attempts at comedy...Lol the actors are telling jokes like they're reading their lines on cue cards...They're trying waaay too hard...and lol and Brad Pitt acting like an old man trying to be cool and funny ....look... there's stupid fun...and this one is just stupid with no fun...it's not even entertaining or badass... It's... Actually it's not anything lol... It's time wasting lol... You'll thank me later... Remember I warned you because I fell for it and wasted two hours on this.

title: Enjoyable romp
text: Pretty enjoyable silly film. Didn't warm to it straight away as thought it was too slapstick but got more in to it as it went on. A big pull for me was the unpredictability. Never had a clue how it was going to end.Some characters were a bit over the top and some of the dialogue was a bit too contrived at times. Also it felt a little long for the type of film it was. Actually thought it was near the end and only 50 mins had past (it's on just over 2 hours).Having said that it kept me entertained and I loved the comic book gore in the action scenes. Not sure I've ever seen Brad Pitt give a bad performance and this was another top outing for him. A few nice cameos too. Try and guess the female voice on the phone, you'll kick yourself when you find out.

title: Like this
text: I absolutely adore Aaron Taylor Johnson. He is such a glorious actor and I think he deserves more fame. Nonetheless, he is such a beautiful bonus to this film.

title: Lucky Number Slevin with even less brains
text: I enjoyed this movie, but really because I didn't go into it expecting it to be anything more than an also-ran.We've seen this style of movie before in the likes of Tarantino classics like Pulp Fiction, or an Edgar Wright or Guy Ritchie standard. Lots of style and lots of frenetic story telling. I consider them punk neo-noir.The aim is something like "overwhelm your audience with tons of characters and tons of exposition vis a vis flashbacks and hopefully earn your big twists along the way." Whereas films like Kill Bill and Hot Fuzz and Snatch do this masterfully, this movie comes up a bit short. It's just not as cleanly done and clever as those movies are are tying it all together in a neat bow. That's a writing failing.Aside from that, the movie is well paced and well directed and a lot of fun to watch. The cameos are welcome, the product placements are eye rolling and embarrassing, but I think it's easy to look past by the end of the movie.

title: Bravoooooooo
text: Wowwwwwwww was this. Incredible, fun, thrilling, funny, witty, full of great actors/actresses and superb acting. Full of fun surprises, I haven't watched cool movie like this in such a long time. I love How Brad been playing in such great roles. His becoming one of those actors who just get better by age. He picks perfect movies to play. Just watch this movie you will not regret it. It's sooooooo goood. One of those movies that I would watch it more than once. Bunch of clever lines, none stop action. Definitely in my top 10 favorite movies of all time now. I had so much fun watching this. Just excellent!!!

title: WHY YOU'LL WANT TO SEE THIS FILM NOW!
text: Question: What do Quentin Tarantino, Robert Rodriquez, Guy Ritchie, and David Leitch have in common? Answer: Everything!These industry and fan respected directors belong to an elite group of filmmakers who typically operate in a rarified corner of the motion picture industry where few others would dare visit (nor would they want to). If it's untamed, completely unapologetic entertainment you're looking for this Summer (2022), you'll easily find it here.Bullet Train embodies many genres, and the kind of quick action scenes that are at times nearly debilitating to the senses. While it is true that real Bullet Trains are common in Japan, it's highly unlikely they'll ever transport this eclectic collection of passengers who also happen to be deadly assassins. These killers each have a mission to complete, but apparently, they also harbor very deep-seated grudges against each other. Like a real bullet train that can reach speeds up to 268 mph, the film's pace is correspondingly swift. Scenes fly by in a flash. Blink and you'll miss something. Then, just when your brain begins to process a previous moment - WHAM! You're on to the next scene.There's enough ultra violence and sadomasochistic behavior here, and in such great abundance, it makes "A Clockwork Orange" (1971) look like "The Sound of Music" (1965). I confess I winced once or twice at certain blood-gushing scenes, but stuntman/director David Leitch brilliantly infuses just the right amount of dark humor that makes even the goriest moments more palatable to digest.This is the kind of film that makes you quietly exhale when the end credits begin to roll. It's as if you had been holding your breath the entire 2:08 minute run time. The screenplay by Zak Olkewicz is so brilliant it's like looking through a prism, the optics of which are often so glaringly opaque you begin to think "Did I really just see that? Even the most astute audiences will have to pay close attention to this film because there are quite a lot of carefully placed elements containing foreshadowing and clues, all ingeniously hidden in marvelous plain sight.Bullet Train is based on the 2010 novel, "Maria Beetle," by Japanese writer Kotaro Isaka. For acting, it stars a delightfully laid back Brad Pitt in the role of a Zen-style serial assassin who is forced to do battle with his fellow killers while speeding along in the fictionalized "Tokaido Shrinkansen" bullet train. In addition to Pitt, the hard working cast includes sterling, truly memorable performances by Joey King, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Brian Tyree Henr, Andrew Koji, Hiroyuki Sanada, Michael Shannon, Benito A. Martinez Ocasio and a too-fleeting cameo by Sandra Bullock.No major spoilers here as usual, but I can reveal that a real life Bullet Train traveling from Tokyo to Kyoto takes 2 hours and 8 minutes, the exact run time of the film.

title: Surprisingly fantastic, definitely not perfect though
text: The movie, I'd say, comes out very strong with fairly perfect humor and greatly paced scenes and fights. As you start to get through the movie it starts to show some of its flaws though. It starts to kinda of run on and some of the humor tropes ended prematurely and other overstayed their welcome. I will say, I went to this movie expecting to see a movie I was gonna forget pretty quickly, but it was way better then I expected still. The movie had some really great stylistic choices and was pretty great cinematically too. There were some over the top cgi parts that could have been avoided to keep the movie slightly more grounded, but it was certainly more bearable then a marvel movie. Overall I'd give it a 65 out of 100.

title: Great action flick
text: Some parts of the movie are not super believable but otherwise much better than average action movie. Actually made me laugh quite a bit, which is rare in new movies for me.The only part of the movie that was painfully agenda inducing was calling God a 'she' but otherwise it was minimal on that too.For today, a clear 10. Great work by Antoine Fuqua, he is what makes the difference in making a movie more logical and tense than the John Wick's director.And the Carter character was pure genius. Could not select a better face for that moment. I almost choked on my popcorn, and that was an iconic joke both for purely the movie and in general the meta of the whole hollywood.

title: Had a pretty good time!
text: This is one of those instances where style takes precedence over substance! Yet, to my amazement, I'm not infuriated, on the contrary, I loved the showboating aspect. I feel the film's sumptuous visuals alongside a funky, energetic soundtrack add up to the all-around ambiance.I know, at the end of the day, it all comes down to everyone's personal preference, and some of you may as well not be in agreement and you know, that's fine but if you ask me, I had a pretty good time.Yes, it has got pacing issues, some scenes are overly stretched, and that too without any apparent reason, and Yes, the writing is indeed a bit convoluted and seems lost at times with that many characters on board (a dozen); still, the film stood out for its quirky, flashy outlook, especially from a presentation point of view.And yeah one more thing, the humor functions well with almost all the jokes landing where they are supposed to. Moreover, I cherished the brotherly banter between Tangerine and Lemon; all those Thomas - The Tank Engine references were hilarious.

title: Disabled love child of Reservoir dogs and kill bill
text: This movie tries so hard to be a Tarantino movie; the music, style, story, over the top gore, yet it's fails so spectacularly.First, the plot is overcomplicated. It does not feel organic and the tension gets ruined by dumb jokes. The story revolves around the bullet train that only stops for exactly 1 minute. It does not stop when it's windows are breaking, when people fire guns on it and staff is dying. Also more than half of it is completly empty all the time, so scenes can play out. (There is some explanation near the end, but it does not explain the start). Nothing makes any sense on this train. The main villain is a russian mobster who runs a japanese gang that has multiple black guys as ninjas. What's next? The Bloods with an indian leader and eskimo members?Second, the humour. There are some decent jokes and funny scenes, but they are over-shadowed by the amount of bad ones. They joke about thomas the tank engine and their dumb codenames throughout the movie like it was so funny the first 10 times. It's almost as bad as Love and Thunder.Third, the casting and acting. The girl from the kssing booth cosplays as Dolores Umbridge with zero charisma and presence. She's directly states at the start of the movie that she's gonna be a cliche 2022 strong girlboss smartass aroggant female "character". That dialogue was so bad I almost head-butted the screen.Lemon and tangerine? Well, they are the comedic due, but i already told you about the comedy. Both of them are incompetent jesters who in the movie kill a bunch of people but in real life would probably not be able to deal with a child.Lastly, Pitt's character. One second he's a competent well trained assassin, the next he gets defeated by a smart-toilet. Enough said.This movie is not unwatchable but i would not give it more than 4/10.

title: Really funny, really over-the-top
text: Very entertaining & ambitious but it's reach exceeds its grasp. Ridiculous but self-aware. The all-star cast does some of their best work. Slick action, lighting, & well written comedy. But don't take it too serious.

title: Mind Blowing movie
text: Love this kind of movie. Brilliant performances by the two newcomers...... Director did a superb job. Stunts and action scenes are perfect...............

title: Definitely a Fun Action and Adventure Flick
text: There is a lot of really fin and unique aspects of this movie; despite the fact that it is not as good as it could be. The story of an enlightened assassin that becomes entangled in a dynamic twisted adventure involving the crossroads of colorful characters attempting to kill each other and stay alive. Brad Pitt is fun and colorful intros role. He is multi-talented-both funny and lethal in this one. The supporting cast of characters are just slight of cartoonish, but fun to watch. Japan and the train are terrific as the setting and are as much a character as any of the cast. David Leitch's direction and cinematography are very good and visually unique. The action and fight choreography are, as expected, very top rate. This is, at its core, an action and martial arts film starring Brad Pitt. There are a lot of surprises and cameos, which make watching even more fun. It has elements of Kill Bill, Pulp Fiction, John Wick, and more-all of which make Andrew Koji, of Warrior is good here. Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Bryan Tyree Henry are very good as "twin" assassins. Sandra Bullock a nice addition. The movie does suffer from silliness at some parts, which is where it falls from great to very good. Michael Shannon is also very good in this. The music is good. Still worth seeing.

title: Inspiring
text: This is such a classic action drama and there's no one better who could have been chosen for the role of the protagonist. Exceptional performance by the case!

title: Absurd, yet fun!
text: It's a fun premise, feels like the Knives Out movies crossed with the Jason Bourne movies. Some good twists and turns, hilarious moments, and ridiculous moments to guarantee loads of fun.I have a few problems with it. There were some plot holes to obvious to ignore that took away from the "wowness" factor of the plot development. Also, some of the acting is a bit forced, and Brad Pitt, while a stud and a fun actor to watch on screen, is a bit too much like himself. The movie tries too hard to get the audience to like him. Additionally, some people might just find it too, well, stupid to enjoy. And lastly, way too much forced profanity people. It feels like the producers just sat in a room and discussed how they could make the movie more "adult" and obscene (which, being someone who knows people who have worked in Hollywood close to many popular celebrities and producers, is something I can attest is a REAL thing), and one of their conclusions was to just throw in more F-bombs. It felt unnecessary and unnatural, and frankly, it was just distracting. It felt natural in movies like "Goodfellas" or "District 9," but not this one.Other than that, it's a barrel of laughs and fun. Some cool fight scenes and cameos to boot. Don't take it seriously, because it certainly didn't itself. Grab a bag of popcorn and let it take you in.

title: I had so much fun watching this movie well deserved
text:
What a brilliant movie excellent acting it was beyond expectations I watched this film just because of brad Pitt his performance is amazing just like once upon time in Hollywood wow,,
this movie is so entertaining! I mean yo it is fast and sometimes u can miss whats said becasue of accents of the characters but not too bad where u are lost in a scene. It all ties in together at the end too. I gave it 4 because there are a couple scenes that's a lil too cliche but other than that this is a fantastic train ride to watch over all brad Pitt it seems so good his acting is mind blowing well this movie deserve 10/10 and worth to watch,
All you can find in this movie actions,thriller, comedy, also waiting for ott release..

title: Pulp fiction on a train
text: Fast paced thriller that Quentin Tarantino forgot to make with all the gore, twists and turns. It's all happening on the ultra punctual 200mph bullet train in Japan. There's even a snake on board to keep everyone on edge. The movie is full of intrigue and watching it on the big screen with pop corn is exciting. Lots of familiar faces with a super brief cameo appearance from Ryan Reynolds. Overall quite enjoyable.The movie is full of intrigue and watching it on the big screen with pop corn is exciting. Lots of familiar faces with a super brief cameo appearance from Ryan Reynolds. Overall quite enjoyable.

title: An instant classic. Kurosawa meets Tarantino
text: Funny, high action, fast paced who-dunnot Samurai film with Latin tele-novela drama influences and Japanese culture visual appeal.this is an instant classic that should be studied in every film school.

title: Forever blowing bubbles
text: Very entertaining film, full of action and comedy. It's a crazy film, over the top even but it's enjoyable and I liked the various different characters and their back stories. There's a lack of good films this summer at the cinema but fortunately this was a good one to watch.

title: Garbage movie
text: What a train wreck! Extreme violence every five minutes trying to be funny, but are just repulsing. Uninteresting and fake people trying to be cool, and not succeeding. Bad and over written dialogue that goes nowhere and makes no sense.All the locations including the train are just flashing by, there's no real sense of grounding, or being there. I felt that this movie was around 15 years to late. Maybe some of it could have worked then, but now - it just feels like - nothing. Just a big waste of time and money.I understand that Brad Pit gets a lot of money for doing this film, but please man, have some dignity! You're a good actor, choose good roles. Please.

title: Being honest, wasn't expecting that.
text: This movie is flying around 7/10 - 8/10. It's a 7.5/10 more precisely.It needed some bits and pieces to make it even better.It's fast paced and 2 hours flew by just like that. I didn't know really what to expect but i wasn't expecting it to be that good. All the time you are on the edge with a new surprise, new mystery, new faces etc.Full of action. A lot of action.Deaths, crashes, injuries, shooting, blood, funny jokes you name it. This movie has everything needed to pass the time watching something without the need to think about a lot. Everything is right there in front of you.The cast is a very good selection and everyone is amazing at the their role. Brad Pitt's role is funny and on the spot. There are many other respectable actors in this movie.

title: Captivating action sequences and entertaining plot. This is what I call a good laugh.
text: "Bullet Train" is basically a parody of action movies. There is nothing new under the sun: the whole plot and setting are predictable. The dialogues, especially in the first half, are well written and they gradually build up the tension. I had a good laugh and I liked almost all the characters. I truly enjoyed Tangerine and Lemon, who were such a funny and powerful duo that performed the most comedic parts. Brad Pitt was charismatic and he fitted quite well the role of Ladybug. I appreciated the short Bad Bunny and Zazie Beetz cameos, while Kimura and Prince were absolutely unbearable: they were distracting and their presence often stalled the plot. Joey King was particularly insufferable and I did not like her performance at all.I liked the editing, there were a few short sequences that explained some story elements. The director managed to portray flashbacks or small sub-plots in just a bunch of minutes. These scenes were well integrated with the main timeline and they were well placed along the film. Special effects and CGI were decent for a flick of this kind. Stunts were amazingly coordinated and directed. The quality of these dynamic parts slightly dropped towards the end. The epilogue was quite trivial and lazy, screenwriters could come up with something a bit better. Overall it is a nice movie that will make you spend two enjoyable hours, perfect if you just want to relax with something easygoing.

title: Likely movie
text: A must watch enjoyable piece of content. You won't realize how 2 hours went. The best parts are Brad Pitt and fight scenes. An absolute thriller with a perfect twisting.

title: Speeding Bullet to Good Times.
text: The Good: Bullet Train is like if Quentin Tarantino and Guy Ritchie had an anime baby version of Suicide Squad. And, surprisingly, it really works. This movie is a ton of fun; a neon, hyper violent ensemble piece set in a confined space (two types of films I feel like I don't see enough of).The action is glorious and well choreographed and the editing (while mostly. Concerned with style over efficient storytelling) keeps the film high energy and snappy. If you're a fan of smug, self aware action comedies, this movie is perfect for you.This movie has some truly inventive and fun cinematography and I like how the train itself (as well as a water bottle) sort of become characters. For a movie called "Bullet Train" it lives up to its namesake by being super fast paced and never letting things get dull.The cast is also truly excellent. Pitt is effortlessly charming and likeable. Aaron Taylor Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry are so good in this movie, not only did I want to see more of them together, but would legitimately want to see a prequel just about them. Even side actors (like Bad Bunny, Logan Lerman, Zazie Beetz, to name a few) excel in their small roles.But, of all the actors, Joey King of all people surprised me the most. I've never been a fan of hers, but I'll admit when I'm wrong: I've probably judged King based off of the bad performances in BAD MOVIES. While she isn't winning an Oscar here, she's really good and surprisingly convincing.Also, that Bad Bunny sequence is one of the best parts of the movie. The perfect example of delivering exposition via montage in a fun, efficient, and shocking way.The Bad: Bullet Train is a bit in love with itself and as I mentioned before, it's edited for the purposes of style, which means the movie is a bit confusing at times.There are also a lot of overused flashbacks that kind of reminded me of a hyperactive kid begging for attention. We really didn't need to see a bride vomiting blood and bleeding from her eyes OVER AND OVER again. What I would've loved is more backstory for Pitt's character or the Twins, not constant reminders of what happens when people get poisoned with Boomslang poison, you know?Oh and the product placement is extremely distracting. I knew this was a Sony Pictures film from the get go because of how often brands are just shoved in your face. No, I don't want an Audi and overpriced Fiji water, movie.The Ugly: One little detail I really liked about this movie is how it deals with women fighting. We do not get Black Widow, where 100 lb women toss men double their weight around. What we do get are female assassins using disguises, deception, and toxins to achieve their goals. When they do fight men head to head, they lose. Because of course they would.Ironically, the two women in the movie I'm referring to are easily the most intimidating villains in the film. One of them is so scary because you feel she could exist in real life, using her looks, age, and biases of the men around her to manipulate people to achieve her goals. Much scarier than if she was able to just body Brad Pitt or Aaron Taylor Johnson.

title: Very fun to watch!
text: This was a great movie to see in theater. Lots of action, comedy and a little thriller/gore mixed in. Fun to see familiar faces, and the Tangerine and Lemon duo was awesome.

title: Stylish yet a little convoluted
text: This movie has a lot of directing style to it, and I always commend directors having a unique take for making movies, but there's a little too much quippy-ness and twists. I like the story but some of it I kinda have to look over some stuff to praise it. Some of the twists and turns feel like they're added for not much reason, but I kinda like how convoluted the story is. It remind me a lot of "Bad Times at the El Royale," except unlike that movie, the story beats in this actually make you go "oh okay. That makes sense". There's also some goofy stuff that happens that are a little unrealistic but again, all part of the fun, and this movie clearly doesn't intend for those parts to be so serious so I'll allow it. This movie is just a fun time with a colorful cast of characters and lots of twists and turns but you have to turn your brain off a bit for the full enjoyment. Also spoiler alert ryan reynolds shows up out of nowhere and there's your warning.

title: Such a good acting
text: You're on the edge of your seat during every scene because of how exciting and entertaining the action is. Being both comical and badass at the same time, Brad Pitt really brings the action to life. Although the other actors are all excellent, Brad Pitt and Sandra Bullock's talent really jumps out in this film.

title: Great action. Comedy falls flat.
text: I really didn't like the first half. Comedy falls flat and leagues behind the wit and tension of Pulp Fiction, Kill Bill, Lock Stock & Two Smoking Barrels and Snatch. I enjoyed Brad Pitt's performance and some of the characters grew on me in the second half. Most of the action is great and was entertaining enough to provide a decent score despite the issues. Some of the dialogue in scenes is poorly acted and directed and attempted humour in the script is cringeworthy at times. Didn't laugh once and the almost cartoonish feel and at times look of the film sucked most tension out of it. I think there was some wrong casting. I like the White Death actor but he was unconvincing for this role. My biggest complaint is with the script and director.

title: Gratuitous and nauseating + Misleading Trailer
text: What the hell was this supposed to be, and how can dreck like this have a 7.5 rating?Nearly non-stop gratuitous gore, violence of any and all flavors - oh and projectile vomiting by an entire wedding party - without enough "humor" to offset it.From the trailer I saw in the theater I expected some violence and knew this was in the "black humor" genre but I found this so incredibly bad that I walked out of the theater after 30 very long minutes. Probably first time in my life I've done that. Felt like I needed to take a shower afterwards.And this is from the same hollywood that lectures us on gun violence?

title: Good movie
text: I don't understand the 1's and I don't understand the the 10's. Ik was really good, fun (sometimes even hilarious), great casting, but there are way better movies.And the people who gave a 1. What would you give movies like Sharknado? Is that better than this?Well, just sit back and take a big bowl of popcorn and some drink and just enjoy this movie.It's original, my huisbrand said he was happy it did't happen in america for once, I loved all the Cameo's and I would watch it again. A solid 7.

title: Nonstop action mixed with great comedy
text:
If you want absolute nonstop action, tons of comedy mixed with tons of fighting, blood and suspense...this is THAT MOVIE....!!For pure entertainment it should get a Best Picture award.And Brad Pitt best actor.The First Thing my wife and I said when we walked out of the theater: "I can't wait to see that movie again!"
So funny and entertaining.Sincere thanks to everyone who made it.

title: Less boring story, more cool actions please
text: There is no real plot or story here. This is just battle royale on a train between assassins. You can have a movie with only actions and no plot if the actions are good (for example John Wick 3). I'm sad to say the action scenes are not that good. They felt clunky most of the times. And the movie focuses too much on the story, and thus have less time for the characters to perform.Also, some characters felt very lackluster. The movie takes lots of time showing you their background and past and then kills them in 2 minutes. I was sitting there thinking "that's it?" for like 5-6 times throughout the movie.

title: Outstanding
text: After watching the first 30 seconds of the trailer, I knew I had to watch this film. And voila! The movie is just as spectacular as the trailer, if not, even better!

title: A fun 120 that should have been 90
text:
*spoiler free*
The film has many faults, but pace and not being fun isn't one of them. The plot is Paper thin and the accents from Lemon & Tangerine are poor and simply not needed - it's gives it a weak Guy Ritchie take that the film never quite shakes off. But if you can look past that you do get a fun action film that doesn't take itself too seriously, does bring the odd genuine laugh and despite the large number of fight scenes, does very well to keep each set piece interesting and gripping.It's a solid film, nowhere near perfect but very much worth a watch, even if it only ends up reminding you of a dozen or so films that have walked this path and in a far more spectacular fashion.

title: Fantastic
text: Action movie director David Leitch can never go wrong when expanding his filmography. The Bullet Train is just another name in his long list of iconic action films! Bullet Train is without a doubt one of the most exhilarating films I've seen this year. The battle scenes were absolutely excellent, especially those involving Brad Pitt. You will be on the edge of your seat from beginning to conclusion. It's also rather amusing. The links made bring the plot together quite well.

title: fun action movie but a bit too long to be savor at its peak
text: "Bullet Train" is an action-packed thrill ride that keeps you on the edge of your seat from start to finish. Directed by David Leitch and featuring an all-star cast, the film follows a group of assassins and hitmen who find themselves on a speeding train from Tokyo to Morioka.One of the strengths of "Bullet Train" is its relentless action sequences that are choreographed to perfection. The fight scenes are intense and well-executed, with each character bringing their own unique fighting style to the table. The film also has a great soundtrack that complements the action on screen, adding to the overall excitement.However, the film's main weakness is its length. At almost two and a half hours, "Bullet Train" feels unnecessarily long and could have benefited from some trimming. There are a few plot threads that could have been cut or condensed without affecting the overall story, and some of the action scenes could have been tightened up to keep the pace moving.Despite its length, "Bullet Train" is still an enjoyable movie that is worth seeing for fans of action films. The cast is impressive, with standout performances from Brad Pitt, Zazie Beetz, and Andrew Koji. While it may not be the most groundbreaking movie in terms of plot or character development, it delivers on its promise of being a fun and thrilling action movie.

title: Great
text: The best movie of 2022!!! Great acting from all of the cast. It was interesting from the beginning until the end. Reminded me of Tarantino movie but in light version. 10/10.

title: Trash!!!!
text: I seriously wanted to like this movie and I thought that I was going to like it until I began watching this crap!!! Two of my baby daddies were in this film yet it still sucked!!!! Lol I hate that my baby daddies Brad Pitt and Channing Tatum were involved in this train wreck because they both are such great actors!!! The story was all over the place and just when I thought I had it figured out, more stupidity takes place!!! I tried to make sense of this horrendous movie but there were too many potholes and things that just didn't make sense!!! For a movie to be good it has to at least make sense!!! You can't just throw in a bunch of dumb fighting and death scenes and think your going to make a good movie in which I believe is what they tried to do here. It would've been an okay movie if it would've had a real plot and a good ending but this movie had neither!!! I'm sooooooooooo glad I didn't pay to see this movie or else I'd really be upset.

title: Decent action packed film with some funny scenes
text: Its a dumb, funny action packed film. Loved the Thomas the train show references, some other scenes were funny, but sometimes it got a little confusing and unnecessarily long for the story in general. Brad pit was silly here, kind of felt like he was just trying to have fun. The rest of the cast was okay (Aaron Taylor was great though), but the movie never took itself seriously. Cool sound visual and sound effects, It was quite fun to watch once, but definitely not something i would watch again. Btw loved all the cameos! There were a couple of actors i never expected to see here lol. Anyways, It's Okay.

title: Nice
text: Some sequences were a little too long, especially in the first half, and it wasn't precisely predictable, but it lacked suspense. You know everyone on the train is somehow connected, so the stories will eventually combine, but you have no idea how it will happen, since there is no excitement.

title: A hybrid of Kill Bill and Murder on the Orient Express
text: The biggest complaint I have about this movie was the audio. It was really difficult to understand what was being said, which made it just as difficult to understand what was going on. The British accents were impossible to decipher and even Brad Pitt's audio suffered. I wondered whether I wanted to stay, but halfway through things began to pick up, and by the end I found it to be fun and enjoyable. I'd even like to see it again, perhaps on Netflix someday. My best insight was that this comedy of violence was inspired by a cross between Kill Bill and Murder on the Orient Express. Am I right, or is this just a haphazard coincidence? Anyway, if you plan on seeing this movie, dig in for lots of confusion, lots of blood and violence, a bunch of surprises, and lots of fun. Of course, this movie is for adults. Don't even think about bringing your kids.

title: Very good bullet train movie
text: Full marks for Brad Pitt and joey king's acting! It was an interesting duo to star together but they did a phenomenal job in their respective characters.

title: Bullet Train - A fun, blood-filled, action-packed comedy
text: Bullet Train definitely gave Deadpool 2 (also directed by David Leitch) and 21 Jump Street energy because of its comedy and absurd violence. It also reminded much of Quentin Tarantino's narrative and filmmaking style in films such as Kill Bill Vol 1 and 2, Django Unchained and The Hateful Eight. I would say Bullet Train is a more comedic version of Kill Bill because of the films unique assassins, for blending in the martial arts genre, and because blood tends to splatter everywhere!The story was quite simple - A typical case of putting different characters, with seemingly different yet connected agendas, into an isolated space. There was a recurring theme of "fate" and "luck" in the film, which I could not take too seriously. However, I suppose it appealed to the films melodramatic nature.I enjoyed the film's overall colourful look and its lighthearted and vibrant soundtrack as it corresponded with the beautiful neon lights of Tokyo.The assassin pair, codenamed "Tangerine" and "Lemon" played by Aaron Taylor Johnson and Bryan Tyree Henry provided the standout performances for me. I could not help but enjoy Johnson cursing left right and centre with his thick British accent while Henry proceeds to analyze people by comparing them to various trains from the animated children show Thomas and Friends, which centres on an anthropomorphic train, Thomas the Tank Engine. It was certainly iconic, considering everything takes places on a train! (Lol). Brad Pitt gave an okay-to-good job as the assassin codenamed, "Ladybug". It was certainly nothing groundbreaking from Pitt. It definitely gave Deadpool vibes - the clumsy yet smart character, with a few tricks up his sleeves.The action was cool. There were many fun, on-the-fly close-combat encounters among the assassins. Leitch has certainly proved that he knows how to make great, multifaceted colourful action sequences.Overall, Bullet Train was an entertaining watch and is definitely worth the watch for those interested in the action/comedy genre.That's all from meYours sincerely,AKA The Cinephile.

title: Entertaining action
text: There are not many writers that can keep you entertained without much of a story and I take my hat off to the writers of this movie they procured a top line cast who because of their talent could keep you engaged add on to that the none stop action and you forget about the story as it becomes secondary to the entertainment. It is wacky funny at times gory each member of the cast engages the viewer taking their mind off the lack of any solid story as you just enjoy the here and now of the acting. Not as good as some have compared to Tarantino and 100 times better than any Guy Richie who I think is massively overrated.

title: 10/10 movie, amazing.
text: We went to see this film in 'IMAX', I have to say it was so immersive it just took the viewing experience to another level. The film was jammed with comedy, action, and gore. Brad pitts' acting was on point, similar to the way he acted in 'the lost city', the twins performance was also excellent. The cinematography was terrific, you could tell it was made with a high budget, everything about this movie was perfect. I really would recommend 'bullet train' to anyone. A sequel is a must.

title: Tarantino's greatest hits??
text: I kind of feel like this movie is half Pulp Fiction and half Kill Bill...with Aldo Raines in the lead. And without QT's dialogue, style and soundtrack (although the music here is decent). That being said I didn't hate this movie. It's very action filled, visually stimulating, and really pretty funny. Good to see at least once, preferably in the theater.

title: A Runaway Train of a Film
text: At around the 100 minute mark of this film I sat in the theatre thinking that the movie was about to wrap up. I looked down at my watch and realized that there was about 25 minutes. The movie feels longer than it is and limps to the finish line (literally and figuratively). There isn't enough of a story here to fill out the whole movie. Despite all that, Pitt and crew attempt to make a 'one location' action film that has some neat ideas, funny jokes, and engaging action scenes. This is a perfect example of a 'Sunday-Afternoon-movie'. Turn the movie on and do the laundry while they are explaining the plot to you.

title: Wonderful movie
text: Anyway, it was pretty good; the actors' performances were excellent all over, and it wasn't simply Brad Pitt doing the most of the heavy lifting. There were a lot of celebrity cameos, but my favourite was Channing Tatum, who felt tit-for-tat after Brad Pitt's participation in The Lost City. I was also relieved to hear Kimiko from the lads speak for the first time lol.

title: It is a very entertaining, funny, fast movie.
text: It is a very entertaining, funny, fast movie. The action is almost non-stop. There's always something going on. It has a comedy element, but not enough to make you laugh out loud. He laughs every now and then. Fight scenes are good. The injury scenes are also realistic. The story flows. It is not difficult to put the pieces together, but it is necessary to follow. If you play on the phone, you will miss most of the details. Of course, there are logic errors, but the flow of the movie does not allow you to fall into these errors. So I wasn't too bothered. Directing, stage designs, colors used were successful. It's a quality movie. The cast is already champions league. With a little more work, it could have been 8. I give 7 out of 7.5.

title: Nice
text: Brad Pitt stars as assassin Ladybug, who is on the hunt for a concealed briefcase while being pursued by five other assassins on a fast-moving train. A solidly entertaining thriller picture, with witty language and unusual characters riding seamlessly alongside fast-paced action situations. One of my favourite movies of 2022, and one that has been highly awaited.

title: Better than I thought!
text: When I saw the trailers I thought this would be quite a stupid movie but it's actually funny and entertaining! Forget about the facts about Tokyo, Japan and the Shinkansen as nothing is plausible. Obviously but it doesn't matter. Brad Pitt does an excellent job here. Some of the cameos are great as well (no spoiler). Sanada is good as well but maybe Hollywood should give chance to other Japanese actors to play in movies as well?The plot in itself is not very surprising but what makes the movie good are the action scenes and the hilarious dialogues.By the way, there's a comment in the goofs section that is wrong. The Tokaido Shinkansen almost never ride south and between Nagoya and Kyoto (where they are supposed to be in the last part), it's actually riding west and north.

title: Nice
text: Brad Pitt acting was One of my favorite narrative styles in the film Hilarious moments Several moments of interactions with rest of the Assassins that pay off well Writing is perfect for the movie , good casting.

title: Chaotic and messy but just about entertaining enough
text: Bullet Train is one of those films that manages to defy expectations in all the wrong ways.It assembles a stellar ensemble cast and has an exciting premise with lots of promise, but fails to convert these elements into the film it could have been.There are a few reasons for this I feel.The tone was way off which was largely due to the script. It tried too hard to be funny and often wasn't, which cut through any semblance of tension or threat. There was too much clunky exposition detailing backstories which threw off the pacing. It was congested with characters who came and went too quickly. The action was fairly uninspiring and not particularly well put together.Still, it managed to keep me somewhat entertained and if you can look past these flaws there's a good time to be had with this film. It's just a shame as the trailer promised so much and I expected a lot more from this film.

title: Superb
text: I think it's the best action, comedy, or thriller I've watched recently. Pitt has done an excellent job in the role, and the script is incredibly tight as always. Additionally, the characters are brilliantly created. This comedy-action movie was fantastic. In this movie, Joey King, Brad Pitt, and the rest of the actors all performed an outstanding job. The movie's storyline was intriguing, amusing, and compelling.

title: Looking for action, adrenaline and fun? Bullet train it's a solid choice
text: "Bullet train" is a movie that successfully achieves its goals, that are provide action, entertainment and fun. Nothing in my opinion is particularly standing out, but everything is perfectly appropriate to craft a movie that keeps you always engaged and satisfied at the end. This is done through good and funny characters and great performances by actors that is evident enjoyed playing them. Furthermore the plot is sufficiently interesting to hook the viewer and justify the well shot choreographies. The only thing that was off in few instances was the CGI but since the movie doesn't pretend to be highly realistic, it's something that overall can be accepted without big issues.In the end I suggest "Bullet train" to whoever wants to see a funny movie, packed with action and violence (though played for fun) and with a simple plot.

title: I can't give it zero stars here...
text: 'Bullet Train' (2022)This movie stars Brad Pitt, the voice of Sandra Bullock, and a few cameos from recognizable names, (I can't say for certain who they are beyond the first, because even getting as far as I did into the film was an absolute chore).In screenwriting, one of the golden rules is to avoid having the dialogue deliver exposition, at all cost, wherever possible. The films starts with a moment of promise, and rapidly slides into a script so amateur that at times it felt like cast was speaking the bits between the dialogue, rather than the dialogue itself.As for the dialogue, when it wasn't exposition delivered like someone rewriting a shopping list, it was - to put it kindly - banal at best.The gratuitous violence at points seemed to be there to embellish pointless conversations, simply to extend the films runtime.The trailer made it look like a combination of Quentin Tarantino and Guy Ritchie's films. The result is a combination of Quentin's Tarantino and Guy Ritchie's films if they were translated through the eyes of a film school drop out who worships those filmmakers, but bailed their education before getting past the Logline class saying, 'I got this', and strutting off with all the confidence of Mike Tyson in his prime, while weighing in at a sickly 135lbs and sucking a vape pen for 90% of his waking hours.If clich√©s and tropes could speak, they'd tell you this movie is tragically so full of them that if feels less like it was written, and more like it was assembled of all the worst bits of those other filmmakers' filmographies.I've watched a lot of movies and tv series over the years. And yes, sometimes I've tapped the 'fast forward' button in some slow parts. I've even watched them at 2x speed to get through some of the worst offenders quicker. In this film, I kept wishing the theatre had a fast forward option... including for some of the fight scenes.Making a feature film is a monumental effort. As a viewer, I'm someone who commits to a film. I'm someone who believes that if you've reached the half-way point, you owe it to the filmmakers and the story to finish it, out of respect for their efforts.And yet despite my best effort, sitting through 3/4 of 'Bullet Train', it stands as the worst movie I've seen in decades, becoming the 3rd movie I've ever walked out of in my entire life.Everyone watching this movie is getting robbed. Even if you see it for free.Save your money. And your time. Heck, this movie wasn't even worth its poster.It gets a well-earned 0/10.

title: Just go with it!
text: I was not sure about going from the mixed reviews... however I'm so glad I went, it's fun and a bit off the wall but I really enjoyed it. Don't take it seriously and go with it, the Japanese element is amazing as well with great performances.

title: Calm vs Furios - self healing in action.
text: Made in best traditions of action films Bullet train is an allusion on detective. Making fun of common layers used by directors to show characters backgrounds, motivations- that is what Leitch brought from Deadpool together with Ryan Reynolds cameo. Blood ,Absurd, too many people dealing with one task.Ladybug tries to come through all levels of acceptance understand more. He is not one of those who are trying to do another job, though his skills staying with him forever. The last job. Guess it might be as well last mission of Bruce Wayne after working out childhood traumas with psychologist (or any other retired superhero).Each and every character are build up beautifully even the Bottle of Water. But talking about White Death - Michael Shannon brings wrong narrative to film with his brilliant acting: russians are threatening and can outsmart you.
