Nope - those are just inadequate, impulsive, furious but nothing to do with smart beings. Joe King impressed me with quotes at the end of the film - I know how hard the pronunciation is with completely different articulation system. Tangerine is handsome as well as Ladybug- both of them gained brilliant come back with this movie. Zazie Beetz and Logan Lerman are cool as always - rare but always top of the top.Listening to the dialogs was a pure pleasure, and not because this are well-made, but because the accent variety is a mix of all possible cultural representations. I grew fond of English\American -Asian coexisting atmosphere. Colors, sound -amazing. I would watch it again, and again, with a specific mood.Main thought occurred to me as - luck is what you carrying within you.

title: Best action movie of the Summer
text: Saw it today and it is hands down the best action movie of the summer! Brad Pitt is amazing as the main character Lady Bug! The other cast in the movie are all amazing as well! I highly recommend this movie to anyone!

title: Comedy movie
text: This was the first movie I viewed on early release, so I was anticipating it. In an attempt to keep out spoilers, I thought it would either be Japanese or Korean just because the title kept bringing back memories of Train to Busan.

title: Guy Ritchie lite
text: I've barely seen a movie more intent on mimicking the style of guy Richie... And while it's not fully successful its slightly B level variance of the insanely over edited action comedy does a good job at entertaining. The complex premise is fun to parse out: a variety of different assassins are on the same train with slightly different goals, but all chasing the same briefcase. If there weren't so much blood and cursing, it could be a remake of what's up, Doc. A lot of backstory and character work is done by the talented cast, which includes Brad Pitt, Joey, King, Brian, Tyree Henry, Aaron Taylor Johnson, and Bad Bunny. On the big sweeping parts, it's succeeds, but it's in the margins, the details of how tightly it's edited and how well the plot is developed that it comes up a little short..

title: BULLET TRAIN NOT FAST ENOUGH
text: Well, this 2 hours and 7 minutes I'll never get back, it's nice to see a movie of A-List actors, suddenly become D-List actors. There was nothing funny about this film, it was and is a total disaster sorts like Hurricane Ian currently hitting the West Coast of Florida. This movie was lets throw something on the screen and make a few bucks. It has no rhyme or reason, it's not funny, it's rather stupid on all fronts. What saves this train wreck from total disaster is the ending credits, and even they were slow. If this is the best Brad Pitt can do, maybe he needs to stop doing it cause it sucks.

title: On the verge of being great...
text: I could say A LOT of positive things about this movie. Long story short:90% is pure gold. The acting is very good. The action is stylish and perfectly entertaining. Most of the characters are fun to watch. The cinematography, music, storylines, dialogue (mostly), etc... It's all very well-crafted, and this comes from someone who can be very tough on action movies. It felt like an anime come to live on the big screen and I was constantly entertained and interested.The other 10%, however, are all in the third act. The movie ends pretty underwhelmingly considering everything that you would expect to happen. The action and story go completely off the rails in the last 20 minutes or so, if you ask me.The final fight is set up to happen in this epic and awesome way...only for it to get dragged out so long that it turns into a slapstick comedy in the end (literally).Deaths that you are wishing for to happen in a satisfying way sadly aren't fulfilled, and this only gets worse considering the brutal ways likeable characters get killed off in this movie.Bullet Train could have been one of the best action flicks of this year, maybe even of the last several. But an underwhelming third act and lack of satisfying pay-offs didn't bring it home for me sadly. That being said, it's still a bonkers ride to experience with some mates and snacks!

title: Great
text: Brad Pitt's exuberant performance makes this movie immensely engaging. It moves quickly and is funny. The projected serenity of the movie is enhanced by an overabundance of appearances and unexpected appearances. Even while it occasionally seems slow for a bullet train, it always makes up ground. Along with the abundance of mystery, humour, and action, the connections formed between seemingly unrelated components of the plot help to weave it all together.

title: Joey King is non-stop
text: Joey king comes through with a brand new film with her greatest twist to date: she's not the lead. While she may not be in every scene, the scenes she's in will stick with you thanks to her general UK accent. In all seriousness, she actually does decent in this one as she has to go between "evil British girl who loves to be evil" and "regular girl Joey King" so she did fine. Luckily Joey King brings that Joey King charm in the fact that you wish her character dies, which makes her a reliable performer across her filmography. You can tell she was having fun as well So it was interesting to see her in a film that isn't terrible and one where she didn't give a terrible performance, I just hope it never happens again.

title: Nice
text: In this incredibly suspenseful action movie, Brad Pitt plays assassin Ladybug, who is on the hunt for a hidden suitcase while being pursued by five other assassins on a speeding train. A genuinely enjoyable thriller movie with fast-paced action moments riding neatly with funny banter and oddball characters. One of my favourite movies of 2022, and one that has been eagerly anticipated.

title: If Tarantino's less intelligent sibling made a Marvel movie
text: 'Bullet Train' is a fun 'beat-em-up', visually stylish and fast-paced and lies in a similar genre to 'Kill Bill' or the 'John Wick' films (or the Yakuza video games), but lacks any distinctive character of it's own.The stunts are technically impressive, though very 'green screeny' and the cuts, bruises and gunshots inflicted lack visceral impact being more like comic book affects - except when they do cause actual harm, which is sometimes played for humour and other times intended to be moving. This juxtaposition of maudlin emotional scenes with desensitised hyper-violence will be familiar to viewers of the aforementioned films (and films like Dead Pool).I did enjoy the Tangerine and Lemon duo (played by a swaggering Aaron Taylor Johnson and the disarming Brain Tyree Henry), but they were probably best in small doses, whilst Brad Pitt's self-help obsessed ageing hitman just about carried the movie but failed to really connect. Meanwhile, Joey King's 'Prince' was a little too convincing as an annoying smug narcissist.A number of Hollywood actors turn up in cameos, personally I'm not a fan of this trend - it feels like a lazy in-joke and that the cast are having more fun than the audience.Other running 'jokes' revolve around Thomas the Tank Engine and a hi-tech toilet, amusing but asinine.The setting - a Japanese high speed train - could have led to some more interesting cultural insights, yet I learnt nothing new (and probably reinforced some stereotypes) and the fact that this was filmed in California probably didn't help.It was visually entertaining, but superficial and, for the all the money thrown at the project , the film looked a bit cheap (maybe it's that HD crispness combined with the digital fakery?).If none of this is selling it to you, I should add that I quite enjoyed it.My girlfriend fell asleep halfway through and on awakening said, 'oh, are they still fighting?'

title: Nice
text: I'm really happy I learned that this was playing earlier than I had anticipated. The action was exciting, Brad Pitt has made a comeback, and I cared about characters I didn't think I would. The comedy was spot-on and the timing couldn't have been better. No review need to be negative, and if it is, the author must have been anticipating an action movie from around 2010.

title: A non-standard and interesting absurd comedy action
text: The ensemble cast in this film displayed exceptional harmony, adding to the movie's overall cohesiveness. Additionally, the use of color effects and transitions were artfully executed, demonstrating the filmmakers' attention to detail. What stood out to me the most was the film's refreshing and well-timed humor, which perfectly balanced the action elements. The well-crafted plot kept me engaged throughout, as all of the events were intricately connected and seamlessly resolved. The final part of the movie was particularly outstanding, solidifying its place as a cinematic gem. Overall, I would give this film an 7/10 rating. With its winning combination of action and absurd comedy, it is a top contender in its genre, and definitely worth watching.

title: Great movie
text: Enjoyable piece of content and a must watch if you are a fan of Brad pit, Brad pit is rocking even at such an age of his life, The movie made me a fan of David Leitch and his work, I have seen his earlier films such as dead pool and hobs and show this is all new and fresh.

title: 7 closer to a 6
text:

title: Was ok
text: Sandra Bullock's makeup was horrific.Was like a Monty python movie crossed with Pulp Fiction.Interesting at times and tedious at others. A few funny parts.

title: There's too many MFing hitmen in this MFing movie!
text: I don't know how Samuel L. Jackson was not in this movie. He was probably occupied elsewhere because I know people have to had called him in. Everyone else was there: Brad Pitt, Channing Tatum and Sandra Bullock - repaying Brad for the cameo in their movie, Ryan Reynolds (because that's how nice Canadians are), Andrew Koji and Hiroyuki Sanada (frankly I expected more of them), Michael Shannon, Zazie Beets (in withdrawal from Deadpool movies?), a quirky Black and White duo of fast talking and philosophizing Brits, even Masi Oka was there, apparently teleporting around for no good reason. Many others, too.The film is a Quentin Tarantino homage from beginning to end, based on a Japanese book, set in a bullet train with some Guy Ritchie stuff sprinkled in and many cameos. The whole moral of the movie was that fate makes all actors meet eventually (paraphrasing here). Was it good? Don't know. I was entertained, that's all i can say. It made little sense, logically, but it didn't matter. It was like Train to Busan with known actors instead of zombies.

title: Best movie
text: Exciting cinema experience that will leave you reeling from thrills, enjoyable action sequences, humor, and the joy of real sentiment wolf is more interesting and fun to watch. Say that it has to be one of the greatest action movies I've watched in a long time. A must watch move for sure.

title: Strange, Funny, Fast Moving, Dark Comedy.... Fun!
text: Review from: "Reel Tunez: The Radio Show All About the Movies" - Where to start? First, Yes... see it. This is a entertaining, odd, strange, fun movie. It wasn't what I expected and was a bit more dark comedy than anything. It was a bit like if (maybe) Breaking Bad had been a dark comedy movie with a few more hit men. It also had vibes of "Kingsman". It's really hard to describe, but I'd suggest that if you in expecting something strange, violent, and with some humor you probably shouldn't laugh at (but will), then you'll enjoy it.Brad Pitt did a great job in this role, and you'll see some familiar faces. All the actors were great in this movie.Definitely NOT for kids. I'd give Bullet Train a 5.9 rating. Unlike many on IMDB, I have a tough rating scale, but anything over a 5.0 (on my scale) is a decent movie. Above a 6 is a pretty darn good movie. Above a 7 is a VERY good movie. Above an 8 is phenomenal. Above a 9 is a MUST SEE "masterpiece" of a movie (something that likely will fall under "a classic" over time).

title: Great movie
text: If Snowpiercer and Busanhaeng could do it, why couldn't this story? I was eager to see what kind of compelling story it would have if everything happened on a single train voyage. They made a great deal out of "fate," but in reality the film is just a star-studded ensemble, most of whom don't have much screen time but enjoy it anyhow. Therefore, if you want to enjoy it, watch it for enjoyment rather than to understand it.

title: Halfway good
text: It did its job as an action comedy, but with everything being on a surface level it would've been better packed as a 90-min film. Perhaps David Leitch was targeting senile audiences in the first place as there are so many prolonged sequences wasted on the repeated explanatory flashbacks. With a lot of one-dimensional characters, the revenge plot showed conspicuously on the other side as the singular serious aspect of the story, only to be failed miserably by a Hollywood clich√© of last-minute swapping bodies. The abundance of technical shots and unnecessary slow motion in this felt like an attempt to make this film sophisticated but fell rather hard under the pretentious filmmaking process only halfway to being actually great. Brian Tyree Henry and Aaron Taylor-Johnson would've been far more interesting main characters, both plot-wise and visual-wise. I also have high hopes for Karen Fukuhara's role in this, which apparently crumbles in a non-existent way.

title: Nice bullet train movie
text: The movie keeps you gripped all along and it's about time that we got a powerful action film. The storyline definitely is more of a classic but the direction makes up for it!

title: Fun little romp
text: This is a fun little film which I was skeptic about as most Hollywood films that come hate their audience members and preach to them telling them how bad they are/were.This film doesn't do any of that, or at least it's subtle. It's made by a stuntman-turned-director and is a popcorn-stuffing-your-mouth fest for the middle of the first-half all the way through the end. It's well acted with a lot of talented people and is, can I say, a little wholesome albeit violent (not as violent as they say it is except for one assassin who uses venom to annihilate targets).Nobody is safe on the train, and we see main characters picked off at random times. It's pretty funny actually and a breath of fresh air coming from Hollyweird.The best part of the film is when they announce new assassins even in the third act and they're really popular actors you wouldn't think would be in the movie for a small period of time.The negatives are is that it's very slow in the first act and the CGI is almost obvious CGI. There's the word "man-splaining" in the film which is a made-up political term disparaging an entire gender but it IS subtle and ironic when you see the scene. I doubt it's meant to be ironic but I'll let it slide (just this once).7/10 good popcorn flick.

title: entertained and happy
text:
With an excellent direction, a well-written script, and very funny, it's easily a solid 8, I rated it a 10 because of the unjustified low rating.In my opinion, the humor is suited for all ages,
, The cast does such a great job
the thing that stood up to me is the music it's on another level, the samurai fight was surprisingly very good,and
the way they presented the character's background is spot-on funny
the negative side for the plot was that the twists were a little overkill, but not too much, at least not enough to take me out of it
its rare to see comedy-action this good
overall I recommend watching it ,its worth it.

title: Fun
text: A fun action flick and date movie. Got surprise cameos too. Would not recommend for kids, has a lot of language, bloody fights scenes, and a brief sex scene. A little bit of Kill Bill taken as inspiration here. You got a snake, knives, automatic weapons, vomit, water, poison, swords, bombs, and the train. You got a lot of flashbacks, which I thought was overdone, but how else you going to give background on your characters. The script was ok but on the nose, as they say. Characters think out loud too much. It's a little predictable but you don't go to a movie like this for the story. You go to watch guys kick some ass. Oh yes, bears repeating, plenty of explosions. Have fun!

title: Bad Tarantino
text: God what a waste of my time! I had high expectations about this movie, especially after reading all these good reviews here on IMBD... However, I found it long, boring and NOT FUNNY. I should have listened to my friends who stopped watching it after 15minutes as it seemed already hopeless.The characters are shallow, the dialogues are boring and the story is just not interesting nor engaging. I am really surprised with all these reviewers who found it funny, it might be cultural.It's like a nightmare version of a Tarantino movie, sort of Pulp Fiction going very wrong.My advice: skip it if you have other options.

title: Best movie
text: The film is really thrilling. It's made at the strains of the Dead pool collection however it surely has greater appeal as it stars Brad Pitt of course.

title: Average
text: For the majority of Bullet Train, I found myself very entertained. However towards the end it went completely off the rails. (No pun intended) As well as a couple of characters feeling totally pointless. It also tried to have a message about fate and luck that went nowhere. If some of these issues were fixed, I would've given it a solid 7.

title: The most fun I've had at the cinema in a long time!
text: What an adrenaline rush this movie was! From the opening scene to the absurdity of the last scene, Bullet Train had me grinning from ear to ear. Peel away all the the layers of this film and you can absolutely see how much creativity Director David Letcher put into this project. I would love to compare Bullet Train to the likes of a Quentin Tarlentino or Guy Ritchie film but it seriously is it's own thing and needs to be seen by any fan of high-octane action.The standout performances in this film of course come from Brad Pitt, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, and Brian Tyree Henry, but some cameos absolutely took me by surprise and each actor played there parts equally as well! If you were on the fence about this one don't be, this is by far one of the most fun experiences I have had at the movies in a long long time!

title: Wild, fun, and an action thrill ride.
text: 3.5 out of 5 stars.Bullet train is a pretty fair wild action comedy film. It is cheesy. It is wild. It has one of those plots where it all ties together. The action is entertaining. Brad Pitt and the cast ensemble did good. The performances can be tacky. Director David Leitch knows how to make a fast paced fun action film with adding some style like Tarantino would do.The plot is good. It may be confusing as it introduces a lot of characters in the train. Where every assassin has there own agenda. While it all ties together on why they are all on the same train.There is a couple of fun cameos that make an appearance. Sure, the direction did not take itself serious with its narrative structure and the humor does get a little loss and loses its concept of creating laughs. The humor is more cheesy and tacky than actually being funny.The climax of the film does pay off with a violent action sequence showdown. And can be a bit bloody. The visual effects are decent. The script is cheesy. The cast is having a lot of fun.It is one entertaining film to see. It may not have a memorable impact.

title: Nice

Very interesting, and I have nothing but praise for everyone involved in making the film. I hope there will be a sequel! The movie is just as compelling as the book. When making a movie from such a fantastic novel, it is admirable to preserve such a degree of excellence.

title: Fun and random

title: Amazing

title: Joey King makes a cute but tenacious villain
text: "Bullet Train" has everything going for it: big names in Brad Pitt, Sandra Bullock, and Channing Tatum; good cinematography; interestingly-choreographed fight scenes; and an outstanding soundtrack. Unfortunately the dialogue tries too hard to be tongue in cheek, failing to have a witty punch in the end. I actually get bored in the middle, almost falling asleep. And that's bad for a movie that is a Brad Pitt vehicle. The most fun part is the Joey King character. Her perfect innocent young girl face is suitable to that of an assassin you least expect. Her British accent is also superb. I have only known Joey King in "The Act," portraying a Munchausen by Proxy victim. What a contrast of two roles. She is a really good actress. Besides all of the scenes with her in "Bullet Train," the only other entertaining scenes are the ones with Brad Pitt acting all carefree and Zen-like. That's about it, though. If you are looking to pay to rent this now, I would wait until it becomes free.

title: Nice

On the other hand it does mean they are in for a treat when they grow up and start watching the far better action/comedy films that predate this utter garbage.

title: Best movie I've ever seen in my life

title: Zippety fast ride
text: Ending up in a CG mess that tries to say something about karma, Bullet Train isn't the Pulp Fiction on rails it thinks it is. What it is, though, is a whole dollop of fun. Buoyed by Leitch's expert eye for action as well as one of the most hilariously disposable A-list casts around, the film has Friday night written all over it.The action is first-class, and Brad Pitt and Aaron Taylor-Johnson are having a blast - but with all that hyperactive style and cartoonish violence, it starts to lose it's hold towards the ending. The climax felt funny and parodical, rather than intense.My Rating : 6/10.

title: Amazing
text: One of the most entertaining, clever, and exciting dark comedic action movies I've ever seen. Although I dislike action films, my brother had me see this one. I actually enjoyed seeing that, though I'm not telling him that. I may watch it again. Excellent story and plot; I enjoyed the way the story turned out. A must-see family movie that I absolutely loved. This is one of the best bullet train movies, and it's also one of the most superlative.

title: Upton Lark.
text: Having decided against seeing this one at the cinema, it's arrival on Sky movies gave me a chance to see it. I think it was the right call, as away from the pressures of the Silver Screen the film's stylish charms, though lack of substance, were more forgivable.A contract killer, suffering a crisis of confidence, agrees to an easy task, retrieving a briefcase from the Bullet Train as it passes between Tokyo and Kyoto. The operative, codenamed "Ladybug" (Brad Pitt) is unaware though that the briefcase is in the possession of two East London Hitmen, 'Tangerine" (Aaron Taylor-Johnson) and 'Lemon' (Brian Tyree Henry) who are returning it to a notorious Yakuza boss, along with his son (Logan Lerman) who they have liberated. Also, on the train is 'Prince' (Joey King), who also has eyes on the case and has gone to terrible lengths to ensure that Yuichi Kimura (Andrew Koji) is on board as well.I know in that first paragraph I came close to using "Style over Substance" as a criticism. I do dislike that phrase, both because it's a boring review cliche' but also because it supposes, in this visual medium, that the style has markedly lesser value. It also would suggest that I didn't like the film, which isn't true either. I liked the performances, even the particularly mannered ones. Taylor-Johnson and Henry both struggle with their cockney accents, but not so much that it undermines their back and forth. Lemon's obsession with "Thomas the Tank Engine" is perhaps the most "I am quirky!" element that the film has, but it pays back into the story in ways that propel it forward. In fact I was impressed by the cleverness of the story and how the call-backs figured back into the narrative, even with a couple of aspects that surprised me. It did make me laugh a couple of times too.The ending was a little underwhelming, after what had come previously, and you do need a healthy acceptance of the unrealness of the world, to make it through some of the earlier scenes. The CGI in those final moments could have been better too.I can't imagine I'll feel the need to come back to the film very often, but it was a surprisingly enjoyable ride.

title: Best movie
text: The experience of the complete film changed into so thrilling and colorful. It couldn't be completed any higher, now no longer via way of means of the directors, now no longer via way of means of the actors.

title: Nice action drama but...
text: Bullet Train is an entertaining action drama. The movie started with a promising note but felt flat by the end. One of the reasons was that the director had to handle so many characters due to which some of them felt wasted even after they were hyped. The performances by the cast members were okay, not good or great. The action scenes were good but the movie had some pacing issues. The climax and the suspense part was average and could have been much better. It felt little bit rushed.Overall, it was an entertaining action drama which you should give a try. You will enjoy it even after many drawbacks.

title: Nice

The dialogue is excellent, the tale has unexpected turns and twists, the characters each have their own distinct peculiarities, and of course, the battle scenes are not only expertly choreographed but also hilarious.

title: All aboard the Cringe Express
text: I knew this was gonna be bad as soon as I saw the word SONY in the opener. This movie tries so hard to be cool like Snatch, Lock Stock & 2 Smoking Barrels. The characters are cringe, esp Lemon and Tangerine. One has a fixation with Thomas the Tank engine because I guess thats supposed to be funny? Neither character is believable as an assassin, one of them is obese.The dialogue photography was bad, cutting between 2 shots with their heads centered in the frame. Why try to reinvent the wheel? The camera isn't allowed to fixate on anything for more than 2 seconds because the children enjoying this movie would lose interest.Brad Pitt's character is on a bluetooth call the first 15 min of the movie. It's tiresome. It reminded me of video games where someone is constantly blabbing in your ear over a radio. The banter is eye-roll inducing.. "Take the gun" she says as his hand hovers over it. Not even 2 minutes later "i sHoULd'Ve tAkEn tHe gUn!" was this written by children? A setup and payoff only 2 minutes apart?Then the "We killed 16.. no it was 17 people!" argument cuts to a mindless violent montage showing 17 people murdered for a tasteless throwaway joke. These movies are manufactured BY baby-brains FOR baby-brains.Brad Pitt's a great actor, but even he can't save this uninspired, unwatchable trash. Save yourself some time, there are hundreds of movies better than this. I only made it 20 minutes then deleted it. Forever.

title: Fantastic
text: Based on Kotaro Isaka's Japanese novel "Maria Beetle," "Bullet Train" is an action comedy movie. Brad Pitt, Joey King, and Aaron Taylor-Johnson feature in the action-packed movie "Fast & Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw," which was directed by David Leitch ("Atomic Blonde," "Deadpool 2," and "Fast & Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw").

title: Enjoyable Fun
text: Bullet Train is a fun movie. Brad Pitt seems to be having a lot of fun with it. Other characters also seem a lot of fun. There are some unpredictable moments that were enjoyable. The stylized action suffices but I can see that it could have been done much more stylishly or in a more fun way. The movie delivers on its promise of a fun trip on the fast train.Karen Fukuhara was a pleasant surprise in it but felt under utilized- she is great in The Boys.Joey King as also fun to watch.Sandra Bullock felt shoehorned in.Bryan Tyrie Henry was a lot of fun.Now I am just writing words because IMDb requires 600 characters and apparently I have not written enough- hopefully this will get me over.

title: So good movie
text: This film seizes your attention right away and won't let go. It's a funny swirl of hilarious character after hilarious character and epic battle after epic battle. Everyone works brilliantly, and Brad Pitt excels in his major role.

title: Bullet Train Review
text: An absolute blast of a movie to watch. Definitely one of the more enjoyable films to have come out this year. It's definitely a turn your brain off type of movie as if you think about it logistically for too long, then the film's logic doesn't really make any sense especially in the finale. If you can suspend your disbelief for just a little bit then I think you'll have a blast. The action is really fun and engaging most of the time. It feels very creative and that's desperately needed in action films nowadays. The humor was surprisingly really funny. There were multiple points in the film where I found myself laughing which I don't really do a lot. Part of it might be potential bias though because every Thomas & Friends joke they made, which was a lot, got a laugh out of me. All of the performances are pretty good and the characters that get that are allowed time to shine are really fun. Lemon and Tangerine are easily the best part of the film. Their dynamic is a lot of fun and Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry's performances and charisma were great. The film can feel a little bloated though character wise. Some people are in there really just to say "Hey look it's this actor/singer you recognize" instead of actually having an interesting fleshed out character. The pacing of this film is awkward a lot of the time. The film really does feel like a Bullet Train as it speeds through every plot point with sometimes not enough time to just slow down for a minute to let the audience catch their breath. This shows at the end because for the last 15 minutes, the film definitely starts to feel a little too long. As I mentioned earlier, if you think about the story for longer than 10 seconds, it doesn't make a lot of sense. There are seriously no cameras on this train, The White Death really banked on everyone showing up to this thing and got extremely lucky that everyone did, why would the White Death trust a random person he's never met before with the briefcase without checking if there's an explosive or not. Like I said, if you turn your brain off then you can have a good time but I definitely did take the story into account. If you want a fun action movie to just sit back and enjoy then I would definitely recommend checking this out.

title: Best movie
text: It's a comedic action blockbuster that made me laugh while still having me feel the tension in the scenes. The bullet train scenes are both fascinating and thrilling. The second half of the movie is the best since it turns up the heat and delight.

title: improv?
text: The plot promises an action mistery comedy but it seems more lilke improv. It tryin to much to be funny at the cost of logic.Actors appear magically (Sandra B.) to deliver ... i dont now what.The only believable acting and dialog is the one of The white death gangsta.Mediocre comedy at best.

title: Brad Pitt is back and better than ever
text: In Bullet Train, the latest absurd action spectacle from Atomic Blonde and Hobbs & Shaw director David Leitch, Brian Tyree Henry plays an assassin with the codename Lemon, who is partnered with his "twin brother" Tangerine (Aaron Taylor-Johnson). Almost as a point of pride, Lemon states that everything he learned came from watching Thomas the Tank Engine, going so far as to compare everyone he meets to various characters from the show, and even keeping a sticker book of characters to illustrate his point. In the middle of the insanity that is Bullet Train, Lemon mentions that Thomas says "simple is always better," almost as if writer Zak Olkewicz (adapting the novel "Maria Beetle" from K√¥tar√¥ Isaka) is poking fun at how convoluted and wild this film is going to get. While Thomas might be right most of the time, it's the ridiculousness and twisty nature of Bullet Train that makes this film such a wild ride. In Bullet Train, Brad Pitt plays Ladybug, an assassin coming back to the job, despite being worried about his bad luck. His handler Maria Beetle (Sandra Bullock) assigns Ladybug with collecting a briefcase from a bullet train going from Tokyo to Kyoto. Of course, Ladybug's return mission isn't as easy as it sounds, as the train is packed with other assassins, each with their own missions and targets. Lemon and Tangerine are trying to take the aforementioned suitcase to the organized crime leader The White Death (Michael Shannon), while trying to protect his son, known only as The Son (Logan Lerman). Bullet Train is a film that knows how preposterous it can get and revels in that silliness. This is a film that has an origin story for a Fiji water bottle, and again, did I mention samurai Michael Shannon? Bullet Train is knowingly absurd and has plenty of fun with the wild lengths it can go, and for the most part, that keeps Bullet Train on the rails.

title: The trailers do no justice
text: I came into this movie thinking, "Meh, I might as well see it, it's the last thing on my list I remotely want to watch in theatres this week, I've already seen everything else," because the trailers I'd seen so far has all been relatively tame and just uninteresting. Fast forward to me now having seen it, it's quite amazing. I'm very glad I saw this one. It's funny, it's well-written, it has turns, unexpected turns, it has a cohesive plot that never once made me think, "Would this really happen?" or, "What's happening? How is this related to that?" Never, it all clicked, it all made sense. I left the theatre having been very satisfied by the ending, feeling there were zero loose ends or unanswered questions, and also feeling glad I went to see it. The action, if anything, wasn't even a highlight for me. The action was good, but the fact that it actually served the story and never felt too forced was the best part of it all.

title: Not worth the time
text: Hm, 22 mins in. A boring set-up in the famous bullet train. The same main characters talking and talking and talking. Some scenes interrupting with combat actions without much context to the main line of the story. They seem to be there just to create some bloody scenes for attention. No subtlety, no slow build up for tension, just cut, new scene, boom... The good old craftsmanship of making good and satisfying movies getting lost to cater to the short attention span of todays viewers. Sad. I am not sure, why this kind of movies gets such a good average rating. It is like going to an exhibition with Hunter Biden paintings. Overpriced trash.

title: A Tarantino/Ritchie film covered in glitter.
text: This Tarantino/Ritchie style movie attracted loads of glittery names, Pitt, Tatum, Bullock, Reynolds et al. Unfortunately this steamer was created in the style of Guy Tarantino and Quentin Ritchie. Simply awful and a pale shadow of who this director was trying to emulate. The storyline is so tangled and preposterous that it disappears up its own backside pretty early on. Now, credit where credit is due. Pitt tries hard. Really hard. He tries to drag it along with some great acting but even he seems incredulous at certain points during the film. Tatum and Reynolds will attend the opening of an envelope at the moment and god knows what Bullock was thinking.A turd covered in glitter is still a turd.

title: Intresting
text: I wish Andrew Koji had a bigger role in the film though. But irrespective of his screen time, just his presence also is a great addition in thAmazing comedic timing and hise film.

title: Fun, Action Packed Film Not Meant To Be Taken Seriously (At All)
text: Bullet Train is a fun film hands down. It boasts of a formidable band of characters led by Brad Pitt, Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry, whose quirks are wildly entertaining, easily the film's strongest assets. The stunts & action scenes did not disappoint either, as the creativity of the filmmakers behind Deadpool 2 was happily front & center. As for its visual appeal, the overall theme of a neon-jungle Japan and the slick design of the bullet train itself, score a magnitude of points in style, paving the way for an eye catching viewing experience reminiscent of Tarantino's films. Director David Leitch' pace & Jonathan Sela's camera work are notable as well, as they leave no dull moment through well executed & flashy flashbacks, interesting monologues & positively unexpected POVs.As for the film's downsides, the story does careen off its tracks and when it does, the ludicrousness becomes a chore to fathom. Also, the script's attempts to be witty and cute can sometimes fall flat, accounting for the film's most desperate & awkward moments (like that ending).Ultimately, Bullet Train is a film brimming with energy from its charismatic cast that oozes with chemistry, its action-packed premise & drool-worthy visual flavor. If only the storytelling was up to par, the film could've been an unforgettable. For now, happy to settle with its entertainment factor.

title: One of the Smartest Movies in a While
text: I've seen a lot of people calling this movie "dumb" even with the positive qualifier of "dumb fun" but I really don't think that is fair to this film. In fact, I think the creators of this movie are perhaps the smartest people in action right now. The whole of Phase 4 of the MCU I've been getting what I would call "action fatigue". Many "action sequences" have been lacking in creativity and style. I've found myself bored in the theater. But this movie knew how to use the set and the props to make things engaging. The characters are eccentric, sure, but they're so engaging and you can't help but love watching them bicker in the absurd situation they find themselves in. Not a single plot thread is left unresolved, and never does the movie have a dull moment. None of the talent feels wasted, although you'll certainly find yourself wanting more. This is a rare movie I will be rewatching for many years to come. Bullet Train has succeeded in building a 2 hour whirlwind of thrilling action, compelling characters, beautiful cinematography, engaging and snappy dialogue, and if that's what makes a movie "dumb" then Martin Scorsese can suck it.

title: An enjoyable ride
text:
Well this film was definitely hit and miss, the hits, the action scenes were endless, the runtime of the movie was over two hours but it flew by, which is always a good thing, which means you have enjoyed the movie.The misses were the cgi effects which were many and it stood out a mile. Did it really detract from the overall movie, in truth no it didn't which again is a plus.Now a lot of reviewers have said it's a rip of Tarantino style films, we'll sort of but then again what movie is original these days.See this film, switch off your brain and enjoy it. I am hoping they make the other two films of the trilogy, this being the second novel out of three
See this film.

title: Excited
text: This is such an epic action movie!!!! A big big salute to the stuntmen for such clean and dramatic stunts. Truly enjoyed watching it! Brad Pitt also did a good job.

title: A Visually Stunning and Action-Packed Ride with a Few Bumps in the Humor Department
text: I haven't seen a movie as action-packed as 'Bullet Train' in a long time. The relentless two-hour run time can be a bit overwhelming to watch, especially since the theater I saw it in was set to a scorching 30 degrees Celsius, but it's a good kind of exhausting.The film is very stylishly made and visually stunning. The acting is excellent, and the characters are all polished and cool, as one would expect from a movie about assassins. The train itself is also an interesting setting, and even though the film takes place in a single location, it never feels that way. The pace is so fast that it feels like you're zipping around the globe.The only downside is that the humor falls a bit flat. Many attempts at jokes failed to elicit even a smile from me. While there are some laughs scattered throughout, the hit-to-miss ratio is skewed towards the latter.Despite that, 'Bullet Train' is still a blast to watch. The endless cameos, twists, and unexpected moments keep you on the edge of your seat. I'd give it a 7 out of 10.

title: Outstanding movie
text: A bit of detective part when they find the briefcase, I love the part when I saw this. The Bullet Train is an amazing amazing movie.The movie offers the right amount of crispiness, and definitely has a lot of meat, especially in the first half.

title: An awkward comedy
text: First of all, Bad Bunny doesn't have an mexican face. I'm tired of that yankee though that all latinos are the same when we are different enough. That was a real deal breaker to me, and got me off the movie.If we exclude the fact that all yankees are narcissists enough to teach that North America is a different continent from Central and South America, Brad Pitt does a great job acting like a white privileged dude who tries to be social conscious. I think his role is perfect and does a great job.This movie is almost exclusively an awkward comedy, but not in a bad sense of the word. It has a lot of "we are not fighting lady, please excuse the noise". The joke gets old quicker than the movie acknowledge it.I'd say it is 80% comedy and 20% action. A great CGI ending with a few punches here and there.

title: IF IMDB could have a zero rating
text: Just wasted my sleep, no concept and nothing makes sense at all.Tried too hard to be a Guy Ritchie movie but there is only one Guy Ritchie that pulls out a crossover story movie with a fantastic epilogue. This was not even close to it. Impractical fiction, Guy breaking a glass from outside of the train at 200mph , Brad pitt walking out as if has just crashed a bike, they overdid the comedy cause there was hardly any funny scence or chemistry between lemon and Tangerine. Too.much story built on The Hornet charactwr but there she comes and there she goes in like 10 minsThe only good part was how Brad Pitt acted throughout the movie.

title: Decent enough though it seems a little familiar
text: Five assassins board a bullet train in Tokyo each seemingly with different objective. However, as events begin to unravel it soon transpires that these 5 assassins being on the train is no coincidence and somebody has big plans for them all!!!Despite the plot revolving around a bunch of assassins, Bullet Train has a sort of playful light-hearted feel about it, which, at the very least, makes for a superficially enjoyable film. I thought that Tangerine and Lemon made a good double act and I thought that Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Henry were superb in their respective roles. They reminded me a bit of Vincent and Jules from Pulp Fiction (only with cockney accents). Lemon using Thomas the tank engine characters as a means to determine a persons character was as bizarre as it sounds, but it was quite amusing.The story itself is OK, but doesn't really offer much that we haven't seen before. In fact, had this film not been based on a book I would have assumed it was made up of bits and pieces that had been left on Quentin Tarantino's cutting room floor (then again depending on when the book was written there's every chance that this could still be true). The film benefits from good performances, a light comic feel and some nice cinematography which in many ways is a good thing as the story itself lacks urgency and the climax is also a bit messy.Looking at the acting then it's fair to say that everybody does a pretty decent job (Henry, Taylor-Johnson, King, Shannon and Sanada are all on top form). Brad Pitt is arguably the star draw here, but I've noticed a slight laziness in his performances in recent years and for me he was outperformed by nearly all of the other main stars of this film.I found it to be reasonably enjoyable, but not quite as good as its current 7.3 rating suggests. It has a 'Taranito lite' feel about it which does the film a bit of a disservice if you compare it to some of Tarantino's better work. It's still worth a look though.

title: Bullet train awesome movie
text: Superb plot and amazing story, loved how the story goes around. A must watch family film, adored it to the core. Is very beautiful this bullet train movie and it's very super movie and one of the best bullet train movie.

title: The Fast Blast of 2022 Action Cinema; Very Fun!
text: Although 30 minutes too long, the excellent cast, bloody action, the bullet train-speeding pace and the popcorn-fun entertainment value make Bullet Train an absolute blast of an action movie. These days, there are way too many action-thrillers revolving around assassins, cops or bad guys that just fall flat and fail to properly entertain the audience and provide a substantial experience. But we also get some occasional action-comedies with the spotlight on assassins that only work out infrequently, including The Hitman's Bodyguard and this new can't-miss flick directed by David Leitch.This film has an almost-even focus each on five assassins completing their missions when they each collide on a bullet train in Japan. Coming from the director of the fantastic Deadpool 2, this movie offers a fast-paced experience on the train-tracks with extremely violent and bloody action sequences, excessive swearing, characters who by themselves are worth seeing this movie for, and of course, humour that consists of jokes every minute or two.Bullet Train is a very stylish action movie. It begins with the perfect cinematography, using lots of different colours during certain sequences and lifelike audio quality that makes you feel like you're in the moment, as well as very fast but super-smooth camerawork during the action, fights or quick moves. As said, this makes for a very entertaining and also a hilarious action-comedy, although an entire half hour could probably be cropped.And if the action, laughs, songs and music weren't enough, what's unexpectedly the best and most distinguishable part of this movie is the fun cast and each of their characters. The film's main actor is Brad Pitt who plays an assassin with a bad luck, alongside the extremely memorable actors Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry as their own duo whose chemistry together is so enjoyable, it's enough to easily make the film better than Ryan Reynolds' and Samuel L. Jackson's duo in The Hitman's Bodyguard. This all gets better as they collide with Pitt, as well as Joey King and Andrew Koji throughout the film.If you liked this review, check out the full review and other reviews at aussieboyreviews.

title: An easy journey of fun and west ham references
text: The movie entirely encapsulates a good laugh and non-sensical approach of an action movie. The movie flows between jokes and slight feels and makes you bond with each character unwillingly. It's not the best written and is ridiculous but when every other movie is filled with marvel, it's a nice breathe on an action movie. I really enjoyed it, I am also a west ham fan so the renditions of forever blowing bubbles through the cinema imax speakers was something I genuinely could only compare to London stadium/Upton Park. It doesn't take itself seriously and plays on the visual and computer game esk tropes, so highly recommend for good fun. Additionally, the actor/cameo choice was perfect with some sketch Cockney accents.

title: I liked this movie, it felt like Oldbody, but it played like Smoking Aces.
text: Despite hilarious banter from actors like Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry Bullet Train avoided falling into a "buddy comedy" category without over-doing the murder-on-a-train element. The story, however, certainly did not under-do anything about gory homicides that happen on one subway ride.Where are the police in this film? Masi Oka tried his best, but I think honestly I can say that Zazie Beetz stole part of the thunder with her performance as The Hornet. From what I saw this movie is worth a rewatch because between the naming scheme Lemon and Tangerine concocted or the explosive drama of trying to free one's captive loved ones the movie coalesced under the watchful guidance of anti-hero Brad Pitt's character 'Ladybug'.The story had enough flashbacks to tell viewers more about the characters. As to say that the plot was clear enough. I was surprised when Ryan Reynolds was in the scene. The ending, I thought wasn't completely clear. All of the characters sort of got away with their individual crimes? Despite personal vendettas vigilantism seemed to hold steady throughout the movie where characters pretty much got what they deserved. I'd look for a Bullet Train Two, but I don't think that there will be one. At least not any time soon. 7/10.

title: Wonderful
text: The movie is a perfect blend of suspense and comedy and it's definitely worth watching! It's thoroughly enjoyable and it's bound to keep you gripped to your seat through and through.

title: A Quentin Tarantino knock off
text: 100% the title. It was entertaining but felt forced. The main character intros, the filming perspective, sets, dialogue. The whole thing felt like some sort of homage to Tarantino. Ended up falling asleep. But wife and kid loved it so guess it can't be all that bad. Just more so fodder for the masses than a genuine story that has anything to offer beyond a thin story line and a ton of action. Once I saw the directors previous films it all made sense and I guess this is just his style, which similar to Tarantino, heavily borrows from other films. So much so that it is s little bit on the nose. Six of ten.

title: Wonderful movie
text: Enjoyable. It doesn't take itself even remotely serious and is overall, a good jab at the pretentiousness of modern cinema. I love the multiple-perspective approach to story telling. It's a hard thing to pull off but I think Bullet Train nailed it.

title: Great first half
text: I loved the first 2/3 of this movie, absolutely loved it. The plot felt so interwoven, clever, and stylish - even though it was cheesy as all hell, and certainly not to everyone's tastes.It's such a shame that in the last 1/3 of the movie, I got the same kind of feeling that I got when I watched the last season of Game of Thrones. The writing suddenly got lazier in favor of a more over-the-top spectacle, which honestly wasn't playing to the film's strengths. It feels like they wove this amazing witty plot during the first part of the film, but then struggled to round it off in a satisfying way.

title: Mix of Quentin Tarantino & Guy Ritchie
text: Mix of Quentin Tarantino & Guy Ritchie art.Movie has some problems with all that stuff were done in the train, with no clue or notice of the other passengers. Nice mix of plot with flashback elements. Also, to watch movie is needed some concentration to connect earlier events, and mission but its made to have fun with relaxing your brain. Cast is OK, acting also good. Has some slow-mo with good special effects.All in all - not bad. Mix of Quentin Tarantino & Guy Ritchie art.So just sit back and relax, enjoy watching it.Recommendations if your expectations are not too high like some of Users that gave reviews.

title: Outstanding movie
text: Must watch thriller.Bullet Train has Action, drama, suspense, humor and more twists than a David fincher movie. Stunt and action part of the movie is extraordinary as the director of the movie was a stuntman.

title: Has some moments but not compelling
text: Full of cliches that go on and on. The acting is not the problem so much as we have seen all his before. The movie just seemed slap shot in a way that every scene was like something too familiar. I knew the movie was just blah when I could not wait for it to end and was checking the time on my phone. If you have watched movies for more than 20 years consistantly, this movie will just not have enough to fullfill your dietary requirements for a good movie.

title: Intresting
text: It's been so long since Brad Pitt has played in a comedy movie but he's still got the charm, maybe even more! Loved him for his charm in the movie and the movie too was amazing!

title: That was like an overdose of action and comedy for my taste .
text:
Bullet Train.Five assassins are taking the same high-speed moving Bullet train before they realize that their missions have something in common.Bullet Train is a fun full of action movie and sometimes a bloody one , it is one the most original movies these days ,I'll give it that , especially when it comes to introducing the characters and their back stories / side stories , it was very unique and effective of course . However , things turns out to be a bit silly for my taste and just some perfectly made action scenes full of nonsense .I really do have mixed feelings about this one , because I liked most of the characters especially Leadybug, Lemon, Tangerine and Prince.It's always great to see Brad Pitt ,in a different world this time and he did just perfect.As I mentioned before, what the film is trying to sell here is more than I could buy , I tried to enjoy it more , but it's just not my thing and here I can say I'm definitely not a fan of action movies ,I will never be .David Leitch did great either , but once again ...
Finally , I appreciate the attempt of creating something crazy ,something chaotic until it all makes sense and I really appreciate the comedy in this movie ,especially between the twins.Bullet Train was Disappointing .

title: Masterpiece
text:
I have a question
What's wrong with the critics?I enjoyed every second of it.every character every scene .Just ignore those so called movie critics . Probebly Sony didn't pay them to write flattering things .I will watch it again. Highly recommended.

title: Fun time at the theater, but...
text: Bullet Train is an action comedy that revolves around Ladybug, a 'trying to be zen' assassin who has been tasked with stealing a briefcase of a high speed bullet train in Japan.The action in this movie is great and not shaky for once, the visuals are stunning (the lightning and the interior was done very well), acting is also on point especially from Brad Pitt, Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry.The one thing the movie is lacking is the storyline. While it seemed i triguing throughout the movie and you can sense a kind of a Orient Express storyline, at the end it kind of fell apart and got convoluted, basically not the closure I thought it would be.

title: Great movie
text: After "Once upon a time in Hollywood", Brad Pitt once again nailed the humor part. Ladybug is one of my favorite characters of Brad Pitt. Action, Fun & Entertainment.

title: Thomas the Tank Engine at high speed
text: I found this ferroequinological film an interesting mixture of certain aspects of 'Train to Busan', 'The Commuter' and 'Snatch'. Maybe Brad Pitt thought of the idea of the Lemon and Tangerine Cockney characters when he played the Pikey boxer in 'Snatch'. If it wasn't him, then the Cockney banter bouncing between Lemon and Tangerine added to the comedy element. I really hope no trains were damaged in the making of this film. I also hope that Messrs. Tatum and Reynolds and Ms. Bullock received some compensation for their brief but pivotal appearances. Perhaps they were given a few thousand Yen? That's all folks!

title: Insultingly Offensive
text: Saw the great ratings and reviews, I thought I was in for a treat but within 15 minutes I was already bored out of my mind and looking at my watch. Seriously, where do these new directors and writers come from? They can't write a decent script? 15 minutes and I was literally screaming inside for the characters to "shut up."Is this suppose to be funny? All the talking and random talking, is it some sort of humor I'm unfamiliar with? It's like background noise trying to distract you from the plot? If there is one? Literally, shut up and tell the story. Stop the noise pollution and only include dialogs that are required for the plot. Is that so hard?This film reminds me of Copshop and I wouldn't be surprised if it is from the same people. It is utterly insult to the intelligence with all the noise, incoherent dribbles, random shifting scenes, etc... simply annoying,...This film is such a swing and a miss. Learn to tell a story, in coherent sequence. You are filing in Japan, use JAPANESE music. It's not that hard. Not only is this film bad, it is offensively bad.1/10.

title: Fun, Goofy, and Surprisingly Brilliant
text: The action is really good and enjoyable, the directing is very stylistic (which in this case works) and the comedy fits (not perfectly but almost). I think my only critiques would be that it was unnecessarily bloody and didn't need that much swearing, but that's only a loss of one star in my book. The other loss of a star is just because it's not one of my favorite movies. The movie has a super interesting and unique premise, but halfway through the movie I determined this movie was just gonna be fun but meaningless (which is okay), but it ties up everything in the end with a good message. The last star knockoff is that the good message wasn't really communicated too well, but it was there and good. I do personally believe it's all about how you frame things.

title: Wonderful
text: Action scenes were handled and executed better than I had anticipated. The acting is excellent since Brad Pitt displayed his personality. Bryan Tyree Henry stood out and did an excellent job at pulling off a British accent. Also outstanding is the tempo. The movie's first half moves along quickly, and there are several terrific passages that utilise timing. Although the second half of the movie moves quickly as well, I think the first half is better.

title: Great
text: Pitt in a film like this, but from what I've heard, the filmmaker is a close friend of his. The humour is hit and miss, but overall it is a fairly entertaining movie. They also pay off everything that is set up along the way, making it a rewarding viewing.

title: Nice

title: Take the Train!
text: If you're looking for fun ride you need to catch this train! More twists and turns than my last Vegas cab ride but much more enjoyable.I truly expected to hate this for some reason, but I had a couple of hours to kill so what the heck. I was quickly swept up in the characters and the many side stories each of them had, all very easy to follow. There was plenty of humor mixed in, which helped soften some of the excessive violence. This train never slowed as the action and high drama raced along. My large popcorn was gone 10 minutes down the track.At times it reminded me of some of the vintage King Fu movies with some Quinton influence throw in and a side of Guy Ritchie. With all that being said it was still a unique and exciting film that never went off track. Get your ticket!

title: Nice
text: It combines a fantastic tale with an ideal cast led by an ideal director. It's ideal for someone who enjoys martial arts! In contrast to most movies, which tend to view it more as a theatrical component, the art in this instance has been introduced and portrayed just as it is.

title: What a Ride!
text: My husband and I just saw this and we both give it a solid "A"!! It was like a wittier, more playful version of a Guy Ritchie gangster film.The cast is great (Brad is at his best), the storyline is engaging, the action is nonstop, there are some nice plot twists and the dialogue is sardonic and clever! Don't sleep on this one, it is a hidden gem! üòä

title: A film for idiots
text: Every now and then, a film will come along with hype, swagger and a quirky-cool cast of trendy B-listers paired with a smattering of A-list actors desperate to be relevant.Bullet Train is a film that desperately wants to be cool, and believes the only way to do it is to steal every single idea it can from Quentin Tarantino and Guy Ritchie, stick it in a blender with neon, comic violence and samurai swords and hope for the best.This heap of garbage has no charm, no soul and no idea. It's a mess of horrible visuals, terrible performances and mind-numbing dialogue. The Tangerine and Lemon characters represent the absolute worse of what film students think is clever - perhaps the most dislikable duo in cinematic history, whose every screen moment is an ugly stain on a strip of celluloid. And come on, Brad Pitt... your twitchy, loveable rogue shtick was boring five minutes after 12 Monkeys came out.There is nothing to redeem this tortuous and predictable nonsense. It's been made for people with the absolute lowest level of intelligence think TikTok is the pinnacle of human achievement.

title: Highly recommend

It's an action film with a plot similar to Smoking Aces. An ensemble cast having a few different stories in it, among which Brad Pitt's story as a man named Ladybug, despite being the star, may be deemed just as vital as the others.

title: So good movie

title: Amazing movie

title: Unbelievably bad

title: action packed from start to finish, witty and unique!

I would love to see a prequel movie of him and lemon kicking ass. Brad pitt was incredible too, as always. I need more movies in the bullet train universe!! FANTASTIC!!

title: Great movie. Must watch!
text: Amazing time watching this movie. It was a great action/ comedy movie with a lot of your favorite actors. 2 hours long and definitely worth the watch.

title: Awesome movie
text: The performances of Joey King and Brad Pitt is superb! They made a fascinating acting pair, and they each did fantastic jobs as their individual personas. Action movie director David Leitch can never go wrong when expanding his filmography. The Bullet Train is simply one of his many well-known action films!

title: Great movie
text: This film is a good time with loads of laughs, but it's also action-packed and moves quickly. Action, levity, and Pitt? Triple-check everything! Settle in with some popcorn if that describes you.

title: Amazingly stupid
text: While this film has been produced with technical skill and a lot of money, the only truly astounding thing about it is the breathtakingly bad script and sloppy direction. True, the actions scenes are great and the violence is overwhelming. However, all of it is delivered with such an insanely smug attitude and the filmmakers appear to be really pleased with themselves. It is all pretension, though, and no substance. Of course, nobody expects here characters that are more than one-dimensional, but how about some funny dialogues! There is just no quality or originality to be found in this film. Ripping off Tarantino is bad enough, since Tarantino's old tricks have become boring and he himself moved on. But not knowing how to copy him and thus writing a truly prepotent script is an insult. Needless to say that this film never ever gets close to be either funny or thrilling.

title: Best movie
text: Really amazing plot for a action comedy movie, especially the dialogues and reactions surprised me by how funny and awesome they were and they made absolute sense.

title: Good job
text: Top points for Brad Pitt and Joey King's performances! It was an unusual pairing, yet they did an outstanding job in their respective roles. David Leitch can never go wrong when it comes to expanding his action picture portfolio. The Bullet Train is simply another name in his long list of iconic action films!

title: Don't understand the low reviews?
text: This movie was way better than I had expected, it didn't take itself too seriously, had great visuals, acting and story.I usually check IMDB reviews before wasting my time on a rubbish movie, I hadn't this time as a family member was interested in watching. I'm so glad I didn't check as I would have missed out on this fun movie as there seems to be a lot of low scores I completely disagree with.I was constantly engaged during this movie with lots of silly but funny references and a feeling of "can't wait to see what happens next". All the questions I had were all answered and all came together nicely.I saw a review about how it unrealistic it is because of certain train policies- its a movie not a documentary !!!!Even if this is not your kind of film, it was still very well done, really don't understand the low reviews. I had great fun watching it.

title: Superb movie
text: It's a humorous action movie that had me laugh aloud while simultaneously making me feel the tension in the situations. The bullet train scenes are riveting and thrilling. The movie's second half, where the action and excitement pick up, is its best. Complete amusement.

title: Mind the generation gap?
text: I love a Tarantino. I love a John Wick. Brad Pitt having fun is always a blast (True Romance, The Lost City, Fight Club). But Bullet Train? "Nope". I walked out after 45 minutes.It's not funny, it's not thrilling. It's stupid. It's not even that good to look at. Ignore the zillions of 10 star user reviews (do they seem fake?) and see what the critics are saying.Or am I missing something? Maybe I'm just too old for this (55). Maybe I'm comparing it to the wrong films. Did you like Deadpool? Do you like Guy Richie? Then maybe you'll like Bullet Train. If not... please mind the gap.

title: Nice
text: If you want to chuckle, this is a fantastic small rapid moving cigar tube. Great people, entertaining screenplay, and exciting action. Brad Pitt stars as assassin Ladybug, who is on the hunt for a concealed briefcase while being pursued by five other assassins on a fast-moving train. A highly anticipated film that has to be one of my favourites of 2022. The battle scenes were absolutely excellent, especially those involving Brad Pitt.

title: Great
text: Brad plays an older male action movie hitman .The battle scenes were absolutely excellent, especially those involving Brad Pitt. An overabundance of appearances and surprise appearances contribute to the film's represented zen and joy. While it appears to be slow, for a bullet train, it always manages to catch up. Along with the abundance of mystery, humour, and action, the connections formed between seemingly unrelated components of the plot help to weave it all together.

title: Fantastic
text: I can't recall the last time I saw a film that was as intense as 'Bullet Train.' Two hours of nonstop action. I can't recall the last time I saw a film that was as intense as 'Bullet Train.' Two hours of nonstop action. This is a beautifully crafted film. It's fantastic. title: Not even close!
text: How is this an "action comedy"?I found my self after 40 minutes not caring about anything or anyone in the movie. So I asked those around me and they couldnt agree more.They tried their best to do a Tarantino setup with backround stories and fast paced witty conversations, but it fell flat every single time.I didnt even smile on the inside. title: Best
text: Without having any knowledge of the history, I went to see this film. I merely hoped that it would be adequate. I was pleasantly impressed by the unexpected characters, style, and cinematography (I won't provide any spoilers here). One of the funniest, wittiest, action-packed, dark comedy action movies I've ever watched is without a doubt this one. Each character has their own distinctive idiosyncrasies, the banter is excellent, the plot occasionally takes unexpected turns, and of course, the battle scenes are not only expertly choreographed but also hilarious.

title: MUST WATCH
text: This was a great action movie! Everything tied in well and made sense! There was great plot and character development throughout! This movie was so good we named our fish Bullet! There was also funny cameos by well known actors!
