title: Made me lol
text: Great film, pure fun and action...could easily watch this again and again. The film critics really do not know what they talking about...good, no brain entertainment.

title: Trained assassins
text: This bullet train makes too many stops in between fight scenes. Fight scenes that feel all too familiar, much like the rest of this exercise in style. Style being something the film has in spades, but spades do not amount to Smokin' Aces. While Aaron Taylor-Johnson effervescently chews the scenery like he is auditioning for a Guy Ritchie movie, and Brad Pitt is amusing despite his one-note character bordering on lame, the story is sluggish and bloated with lazy exposition and lukewarm action. Had director David Leitch (Deadpool 2) taken a smaller, as in less expensive, approach and embraced the fundamentals of an exploitation actioner, Bullet Train could have been a wonderfully ferocious little cult film. Unfortunately, while this one is begging so endearingly to be liked, style is no substitute for excitement.Grade: C.

title: What a great ride!
text: Non-stop roller coaster of action. Great comedic timing with some serious drama in between. Never a dull moment and THIS is why we go to the movies! Loved everything about it and it is certainly a film I can see over and over again.

title: OK that was fun
text: This movie was a blast. It was exactly what you want from a movie in theater. Fun, funny, action, some heart, and cool visuals. It was funnier than I expected as it didn't take itself too serious. I highly recommend this movie. If you don't go watch this we'll you're a diesel.

title: So much fun!
text: I made my best friend go to this with me because I was very intrigued. She had no idea who was in it or what it was about. We both loved this movie so much!! I leaned over at one point as said, "I find myself strangely attracted to the dude with the mustache." I thought she was going to wet her pants she was laughing so hard. I had bo idea he was Wanda's twin from the Avengers until I looked him up. He was my favorite part of the movie. And while I love the person who shows up at the end, she might have been the only slightly flat character. Seriously, the dialogue is fast-paced and just plain awesome. Each actor was perfect for the part. . I will be watching it again.

title: The Best
text: So good! This is one of the best(and funniest) movies I've ever seen! Loved this movie! Bryan Tyree Henry was so good! The Thomas the Tank Engine bit was so funny. I thought it was going to be really gory but it's just a lot of spray blood. Every single moment made me laugh so hard. If you don't like this you might need to have your sense of humor looked at. I'm just kidding... kind of. Also, The "White Death" was such a good character. The part where he says, "You aren't CARTER!?!" And when Brad Pitt was just the best. I wanted to see this for so long and loved when I finally saw it. Ten out of 10.

title: A TV movie for a Friday afternoon
text: Black comedy can be entertaining if you have the right actors and jokes.Bullet Train tried hard to mimic Guy Ritchie and Quentin Tarantino style but the cast fell short.I love brad, but this time it felt he was forced into his character. The two British assassins kept reminding me of Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels.Overall, it felt you are watching a Chines version of Guy Ritchie and Quentin Tarantino movie.

title: Fast as a train
text: Best movie i've seen in the recent years. Everything about it from its pace, cast, and scenario just makes it a joy to watch, every scene is perfectly executed and the comedy is top notch. It always blows up your expectations and makes you wonder what will happen next, i truly recommend this movie to anyone looking for a long action comedy experience, great action, great comedy, great story. Every actor seems to be giving 100% dedication to their roles thus making them appear natural and spontaneous on every scene. Overrall its still one of the few good movies to come out these last years, dont forget to watch it.

title: Fun film
text: I really enjoyed this superb film.For starters, Brad Pitt was in my opinion, at his funniest.Secondly, there's a few surprise guest appearances.And lastly, the whole film altogether captured my full attention. What a work of art. If you enjoyed Deadpool 2, as well as John Wick, I'm sure this film will feel close to home.

title: Fun, entertaining and fast paced like the train
text: Absolutely loved this film! The casting is great. It has a good storyline that connects the different characters seamlessly. The action sequences are great and do not feel unnecessary. Joey king was the only actor that felt a little out of place. If you don't watch this film- you're a Diesel.

title: Trying to be funny but fails
text: The film is trying to combine an action thriller with supposedly intelligent humor and is failing miserably at both: it is not exciting nor funny.The humor is not funny and the stupidity ruins the action. What is left is an absurdist story in a train with lots of action but no story and no intelligence. Frequent flash backs try to explain the story along the way but often distract more than they add and are also over the top.I watched until the end but it took effort to do so: really glad that I did not go to the cinema and buy a ticket to see it. Do not believe the high ratings in IMDB!!!!

title: What an absolute blast of a movie
text: Bullet train is a awesome movie fill with action and comedy. Brad Pitt and Joey King did awesome job in this movie. I really liked Joey King acting and character in this movie. The movie was Fast pace like bullet train. Really enjoyed the character and story of the movie yeah it was bit dragged at the start but overall it a banger of a movie.The ending was cool all character are on train for a purpose that's revealed at the end by the white death himself. I reminded of movies like Murder on the Orient Express etc. The first 30/45 took a bit of setup, but once the movie started rolling it really found a very funny groove. I really enjoyed this movie. Just saw an early screening and don't understand why the review aren't higher. I haven't had this much fun at a movie in a while! A couple of surprise cameos too were hilarious! Definitely worth checking out.

title: Beautifully Hilarious.
text: Way more hilarious than I expected it to be. Every character is extremely eccentric and over-the-top. They're extremely likeable or extremely HATABLE... talking about you, Prince. She's pure evil. Quite literally the incarnation of Satan of I'd had to guess myself.The lighting and shots were fun and exciting to look it. The movie has an exotic underground cyber tone and I love it. Overall a light-hearted action comedy. Sit back and enjoy what it throws at you without taking it too seriously. It doesn't take itself too seriously and it is aware of it.There is a scene with a cameo from another famous actor that I thought was hilarious. A few short scenes with him added a very fun twist to the overall movie.

title: Great.
text: I really, really liked Bullet Train. And you know what? I didn't expect to. The humor as well as the violence seemed forced and overdone in the trailers. Still, I remained interested in the film, I just never expected it to actually be good-until the reviews arrived. After thousands of people showered this movie with praise, I went in cautiously optimistic.As it is, I think Bullet Train - a funny and violent movie that is decidedly one of the best movies of 2022 - just proved my point perfectly. 8 stars out of 10.

title: Breath of Fresh Air
text: I had an absolute blast watching this. Someone still knows how to write an action movie, shoot it perfectly, and fill out the cast with amazing actors. The dialogue is smart, the pacing near perfect, and the action scenes were exquisitely shot. There wasn't a single actor who wasn't immensely interesting and, considering the rather large cast of characters, that's no easy feat. I was getting close to giving up on ever finding a simple, fun action movie considering Hollywood's ineptitude to write interesting characters and giving them smart dialogue. If smartly paced offbeat action comedies are your thing, you can't do much better.

title: Amazing in its Boredom
text: The Producer and Director of this film managed to do the impossible; Take and exciting action-adventure premise and turn it into one of the most boring films of the season. Watching it made me realize why it went to Netflix so fast. It's storyline was almost incoherent and the character development was worthless. It could have been a much more thrilling flick if they had done it aboard an Amtrak train. At least then we could have had the added excitement of being stopped for a slow moving Freight train and maybe some road construction. My big question is why was there never a bartender in the club car? Seems like they were losing a lot of money with that move. But alas, maybe that will answer be revealed in the sequel. Can't wait for it.

title: Enjoyable
text:
This movie was enjoyable.Too many critics on here
Just take it for what it's worth, it's a movie.People complaining about the originality of the Tokyo scenes or how it's trying to be a Tarantino movie.Chill out
It's just an action movie that can almost be considered a full out comedy.It's a classic Ryan Reynolds movie without Ryan being Ryan in it.He got a 2 second part in it without opening his mouth!That's the perfect part for him.I would recommend this movie.IMBD requires more characters so here is a list of flowers:
Violets
Roses
Tulips
Lilacs
Snap dragons
Orchids
Petunias.

title: Good dumb fun
text: In the day of sequels and prequels it's nice to have an original movie that might not contain the plot of a masterful movie like memento or Tarantino films or the emotions of a movie made by Christopher Nolan, but the movie is a masterpiece in itself with it's spectacular visuals and great cast that delivers their best performance. The movie is also like a heavy metal concert with only having a minor lull at the very beginning when Brad Pitt is boarding the train. This is a movie made for adrenaline/fight loving junkies who want nothing but action for a couple hours rather then being engaged in deep thought. For those that loved movies like John Wick this movie is definitely worth checking out.

title: Going to start calling out the diesels in my life
text: Certainly in my top 5 pieces of train media, behind Snowpiercer, Train to Busan, Thomas the tank engine (loved the recurring motif), and ahead of Murder on the Orient Express.Generally just a really entertaining, ridiculously gory, funny flick that's perfect for a hot summer day.

title: Fiji waters big break
text: What can I say... was I not entertained. Yes..yes I was. It is brash, colorful, fast paced, and pretty enjoyable. I'm all about the quirky and this has it in spades. The jovial Pitt who is down on his luck was very entertaining. And probably the best part was the wack a mole cast of cameos all over this movie. You had people popping up from beginning to the end. The action sequences were ridiculous in the best way. This is not a tour de force of acting greatness but I mostly don't enjoy the ones that think to much of themselves. If you like 80's action, samurai movies, the three stooges, John Wick, and Fiji water then I think you found your Patton. Enjoy.

title: This movie should be good but isn't.
text: The amazing cast, how could it suck?! I saw knives out and their cast and it was fantastic! Well, it did! It was so impossible I can't even comprehend. I know Bond movies and the like have huge holes, but nobody on the train seems to notice or care? I will see, I wanted to watch to the end, only because I hoped to see all the characters die a horrible death :). It needs more comedy to be ironic and funny, it needs more believable action to be an action movie. It isn't satire either. I am curious how the cast signed on other than they heard/saw Knives Out and said "great cast works". What a disappointment.

title: Surprisingly great!
text: This is not my typical movie but since I am a fan of Brad Pitt I thought I would give it a go because he isn't half bad to watch anyway no matter what he's doing! Well it didn't disappoint. He was so funny! I loved his character. Without any spoilers I will say I love the other characters as well. Lots of good chemistry, lots of good jokes all the way around. It was even fine that they were on a bullet train the whole time and that is saying something. So if you are on the fence I say watch it. I'm glad Brad Pitt is still making good movies and I hope he continues! I'm thinking he must have a great sense of humor in real life!

title: Bullets of fun
text: Fun, fast, and witty. The story can be a bit confusing/convoluted but it keeps you in your feet. Great action and characters with a star studded cast and quiet a few surprising cameos. This one was more fun than I was expecting.

title: Fun and full of action
text: This film is full of action from the get go, it's super fun and has some great jokes throughout and really great characters. It's also really bright and colourful which is super pleasing to the eye. The story isn't the strongest I've ever seen but I really enjoyed the film the whole way through! It also reignited my love for Aaron Tyler-Johnson..

title: A cool concept, comedic, but a bit bragged in the last act
text: Bullet train is one of those Tarantino movies where the story is really about nothing, but achieves its success through comedy, stylised violence, satire etc.I have heard some people say that it tried too much and failed. But it's not true, it did entertain me for three fourth of the movie. The last one fourth was however a bit bragged.This movie tried to copy Tarantino's formula. And it did the formula perfect as possible except it missed one thing. In all Tarantino movies, the ending was the best way possible it could have been written. The ending gave us the satisfaction. Even if pulp fiction has nothing to say, the last act (The Bonnie situation) ended with a blast in the restaurant scene.However, it seemed like the writer didn't knew how to end this movie. Thus I think it felt like the writer rushed the ending without any consideration.So, if they had took the ending into some consideration and fixed it, Bullet train might have been one of the best movies of 2022.~My rating - 8/10.

title: entertaining and funny
text: A very entertaining movie to watch. Only one thing that really bothered me was joey king. They could have gone with someone who doesn't have a punchable face tbh.

title: A surprisingly great film.
text:
Bullet Train was a fun-filled, action packed two hours. After it seems to start off slow, You'll get your worth of entertainment and laughs.Brad Pitt carried this film, and Tangerine and Lemon felt like a Jules-Vincent style duo. The story started off confusing but you figure out everything and get your answers fairly quick. They don't miss a detail in this film.Comedy: 8/10
Action: 10/10
Story: 8/10
Acting: 10/10
Soundtrack: 10/10Overall: 9/10 great film, would see it again.

title: Brilliant fast-paced movie
text: Talk about action packed. It's non-stop action with brilliant likeable characters/assassins. Throughout the movie you're never quite sure who's going to live to tell the tell or who's going to bite the bullet ('scuse the pun).Brad Pitt is excellent as Ladybird. These are his best kind of roles, he plays dry humour brilliantly and it feels like the role was tailor made for him. There were a few surprise celeb actor appearances. Made me laugh out loud at times. Great soundtrack too.Normally during a movie I double screen a bit but I didn't double screen once! Highly recommend you watch, you won't regret it.

title: Most entertaining movies I've seen in along time
text: Wearing its Tarantino inspiration on its sleeves this movie is a puire 2 hours runtime action packed ride.Great performance by great acactors carries the oberall chaos on screen at pretty much all time.The trailer hinted at a fun movie but it overdelivered on that promise in my opinion, as I said before this is the most entertaining movie I'vr seen in a long time in a year pacvk full of great movies.Some people may call it style over substance but I personally think styld is substance in this flick, with so many movies and shows nowadays having pacing issues it is refreshing to see one that is paced like .... a bullet train!Highly recommended!

title: Maybe it's a parody of a Tarantino film?
text: Just awful. Really really stupid. This film tries waaaaaaay too hard! There are a lot of reviews saying that this movie is trying to be Quentin Tarantino film. They are not wrong. But a Tarantino film, this is NOT! But then again, maybe I viewed this film entirely wrong. Maybe it's a parody of a Tarantino film. If so, that would make a little more sense. But if that's what it was trying to do it missed that mark as well. I like this genre a lot, that's why this movie was SO disappointing. Even going in with low expectations after watching the trailer, I was still let down. I'm really just embarrassed for the actors.

title: A pleasant surprise
text: It's been a while since I've come across such a well written action movie like this , the writing was brilliant. Quinton Terintino Kill Bill meets the cohen brothers. An instant classic movie. Joey King was phenomenal she has earned her acting chops in this movie . This movie kept me on the edge of my seat while also making laugh. Loved the numerous guest appearances. A movie I'll watch a lot more. Stay for the credits. This is a movie worthy of the two plus hours the time went by to fast. Brad Pitt play is role so well was like the movie was written for him. Loved the deep Japanese pop colours in this movie. At times, this movie reminded me of watching an anime made into a live action.

title: Enjoyed it
text: I thoroughly enjoyed this film. The action was good, comedy was perfect, the British accent makes everything sound better. It's perfect for a relaxing bit of fun. Brad Pitt should definitely be in more comedy roles.The story follows an operative working for (someone?). He has to recover a case of cash. Meanwhile two other wetwork guys are also after the case. There's a mysterious girl who also after the case. All hell breaks loose when they realize that they are all connected to one another. Lots of fun, violence and blood but nothing too crazy. Doesn't need to be taken so seriously and it's a really good film to watch on a Saturday night.

title: Wow, lovely casting and fun action
text: Best pop corn movie in 2022..such a good piece of action movie with funny dialogue, good twist and engaging story. Loved brat's swag, all the character did their job in best way.enjoy watching this flick, won't regret...

title: It's a 9 out of 10 For Me. üöÜ üêº
text: A High Energy Action Comedy with Good Performances, Great Action and a Such an Amazing Script.Things I Liked -1. The Script is Ornate and you can feel the Intricacies whilst watching the movie. When the Little Girl First Appears on Screen and Her Motive, I thought to myself "Oh this is Really Good".2. The Twins LOL. Whenever they are In a scene whether alone of in a scene together, it's so good.3. The Cinematography is Great and also I love the Setting.4. The Action Scenes are energetic and lively and I loved the Comedic Violence, it was fun. They are NOT generic action scenes.Critism -1. It Goes on for Too long.Overall, an Excellently Put Together Movie.

title: Worthy
text:
It's really amazing to see Brad Pitt in an action comic role,
And he definitely nailed the character Ladybug.The story is a kind of rollercoaster ride with amazing plot, comedy action,etc.In total a worthy package.DEFINITELY RECOMMEND.

title: Totally unexpected violent and hilarious film
text: So much of this movie was done to the prefect timing of the lines that were delivered. Since this is a retelling of an old novel and has already been done in cinema before this was just fun to watch.Brad Pitt from pretty boy to psycho drama and everything in-between this just seemed like he was having fun! The same kind of standard that he had for Once Upon a Time in Hollywood. Not an Oscar worthy performance but certainly one that was based on his love for the script and not the mountain of cash he was certainly paid. Same with Aaron Taylor-Johnson going from bumbling superhero to superhuman twin, to time reversing agent to a hitman that's not to be messed with just shows how far he has come from those first Kick-Ass movies. His brother in arms Brain Tyree Henry was just another great addition to the cast together they help carry this movie when Pitt isnt about!The timing and direction of the movie cannot be understated with so many one-liners coming through takes a lot of well prepared actors and crew to get them to land and Leitch has certainly taken his Deadpool 2 lessons and brought them to the forefront of the movie. Action was slick to the john wick level that we know and love from recent action movies with his stun training this add another level that not many directors are able to accomplish in this modern age where many of the downfalls are covered with jump cuts!Overall its a great film that i can happily watch again, a proper no holds bar action comedy.

title: Horrible
text: God what a horrible disjointed movie. Just awful. I even tried to watch it twice. Just so bad cliche nonsense. Not funny in the least. Then come here and see all the fake 10's just ridiculous. Dolts!

title: Ultra-Violent...and a TON of fun!
text: Early conversations surrounding the new Brad Pitt action flick BULLET TRAIN label this film as "Ultra-Violent".They say this as if it is a bad thing.Directed by David Leitch (DEADPOOL 2) with a screenplay by Zak Olkewicz (FEAR STREET: PART TWO) and based on the book Kotaro Isaka, BULLET TRAIN is (no arguing here) an Ultra-Violent action flick in every sense of the term, set on the famed titular Japanese Bullet Train and follows an operative by the codename Ladybug (played by Pitt who you know from such gentle fair as FIGHT CLUB and INGLORIOUS BASTERDS) who's easy "snatch and grab" job is nothing easy thanks to the appearance of various other nefarious individuals who also are looking for that case.Following in the footsteps of such similarily-violent flicks as NO COUNTRY FOR OLD MEN, TRAINING DAY, FARGO and just about anything Directed by Quentin Tarantino, Director Leitch uses the violence, mayhem and bloodshed to ADD to the story (which all of the aforementioned films also did with great affect) and not "just" to be violent. And that's an important distinction here. If the ultra-violence is fun and important to moving the story and plot along (and not just there to be gratuitous), then the movie can succeed quite well - and this one does.What also makes these types of movies succeed is the plotting - which is sharp by writer Okewicz - and the twists and turns that you do not see coming - but make sense along the way (and will reward the viewer upon repeated viewing) and Bullet Train does this as well. It is a smartly made film that is crisply directed with some terrific action sequences (though, if I'm being fair, at times the CGI is not as good as it could/should be), but it is entertaining as all get out.Leading us through this mayhem is the always charming and charismatic Pitt who parlays the "goofball" personae of a person in just a little over his head but comes out on top due to luck (or skill) - you be the judge. Pitt is the perfect performer for the audience to become invested in as he is the one that you need to be rooting for throughout - and you do from just about the beginning.Leitch, wisely then, surrounded Pitt with some terrific character actors in this venture. From Aaron Taylor-Johnson (KICK-ASS) to Brian Tyree Henry (GET OUT) to Joey King (THE CONJURING) to the always terrific Hiroyuki Sanada (MORTAL COMBAT) and a host of others who do extended cameos - and to name them would be to spoil the fun of them. They all understand what type of film they are in and all seem to be having a good time going along with it all.And why not? Bullet Train is a delight in the cinema - for those of you who like action and violence that is pretty spectacular and over the top. It is a heckuva lotta fun.Letter Grade: A-8 Stars (Out of 10) and you can take that to the Bank(ofMarquis)

title: Beautiful, beautiful chaos
text: What a fun freaking film this was. I remember seeing the trailer for the first time and being convinced I would hate this movie. And then I rolled my eyes at it every time I saw it. Then, I saw an alternate trailer that made me change my tune. I thought "okay, maybe I'd give it a chance."I am very happy that I did. This movie was mania incarnate. It was so stylish and eye catching, but the film itself was downright enjoyable. The performances by all the actors were great. I loved how wide of a net this story cast yet it was so stunningly simple. A great interweaving tale with a vivacious cast.This was my surprise movie of 2022. An artful movie lovers kind of movie packed with stunts, comedy, emotion, and purpose. It was absolutely weird as hell, and there were some imperfect moments. But this was true entertainment. For the full two hours, it brings the heat.

title: Brad as Thomas the Tank Engine
text: Basically 'Smokin' Aces' but on a train instead of in a hotel.A stylish high pace and brutal violence make up 'Bullet Train'. The non-stop action is very comedic throughout, most of which comes from Pitt who is an assassin going through a existential crisis.Aaron Taylor-Johnson is really good as well. He's long been a favourite of mine, and he continues to prove his worth. Good casting choice for Kraven. I do have my doubts about punching through a train windshield, even with those gargantuan rings.With 'Atomic Blonde', 'Deadpool 2', and now this, David Leitch is proving to be a top Hollywood director when it comes to action genre. Let's just forget about 'Hobbs & Shaw'. His stunts and past involvement in so many big films have definitely groomed him to be the go to guy for these types of films going forward.

title: Fast paced action movie with a great cast.
text: David Leitch is obviously a fan of Quentin Tarantino and/or Guy Ritchie. His style of directing is very similar and that's for obvious reasons a good thing. It's entertaining, very fast-paced, not one second without action, some good one liners, but and in this case a big BUT it's all a tiny bit too exaggerated. That's the only reason I don't score Bullet Train higher. It had the potential to be a gem of a movie but certain scenes are just too over the top, certainly in the last part of the movie. For the rest it's a pure joy to watch, with very good camerawork, great action scenes and kills. The cast consists of top class actors so that certainly helped making this action movie a success. It won't please everybody, some people just don't like this genre, but if you're a fan of Tarantino, Ritchie or in this case Leitch you won't be disappointed.

title: This is a bad movie
text: This is a bad movie. I repeat, this is a bad movie. Glad it is already leaked online. This is a bad movie. Not much more to say other than this is a bad movie.

title: Watch This Movie, Just Trust Me
text: Okay, so from the trailer I expected descent action and that's about it. Frankly, I doubted I could even sit through it... But I wanted brain candy and decided to chance it. I wanted to just switch off and not have to think, you know? This movie is that, but on steroids. I don't think I've been imposed by a shoot um up movie's plotting, but here we are. It is littered with so many Chekhov guns (only some of which are actual guns). A water bottle is a Chekhov gun in this. That should give you a vague idea of how wild it is.Go in knowing absolutely nothing. You can expect exactly what the trailer promises, and then just let the magic happen. I laughed out loud multiple times. I slowly came to realize I wouldn't be able to predict absolutely anything. And as I gave myself over to that, I had the most fun I've had in a very long while. So could you.

title: FInally a great movie!
text: The movie should be a show, and it is a show indeed. It doesn't try to preach, just lets you enjoy the rideA mix of different styles of filmmaking, with a good dose of dark humor, excellent acting and memorable characters.Tarantino and Guy Ritchie paved a way and David Leitch gave the formula his dark comedy spin.Absolutely loved the cameos and the acting, as well as the plot. It doesn't give you the feeling of something tremendous, but you can still rewatch the movie at least a few times over and have a great time.I doubt there will be a second movie, but considering other movies and shows being released today, it's like a breath of a fresh air. This may and hopefully will bring to life a new and original franchise.The only reason why I took out couple of stars was the missing scene. A glaring plothole that could and should have been explained in otherwise most excellent movie.Absolutely advised for all!

title: Lemon & Tangerine
text: It was very enjoyable to watch in the cinema. Absurd, comedy, action is very good. The script is ok, I like the twists. Acting was very good. I also liked the action and fight scenes. Although it was a silly movie, it was a fun movie.

title: Messy, but Exciting, Engaging and Even Creative
text: Five assassins board a Bullet train in Tokyo, Japan. Ladybug fills in for Carver who had to call in sick. With the guidance of Maria Beetle, Ladybug searches for a briefcase waiting for a deadly leader of a crime syndicate known as White Death. What he does not know is that other assassins are on the board looking for the same briefcase. He wants to complete his mission with as little violence as possible. The task does not go the way he would like...Action is my favorite genre of film. I am a fan David Leitch's work. He directed the first John Wick, Atomic Blonde and Deadpool 2. There is no doubt that I was going to see this movie. Bullet Train has a lot going for it. First of all, it has a great setup for an action thriller as a group of assassins boarding the same bullet train. Sounds like a lot of danger already right? This movie not only takes advantage of that premise, but also the setting itself, the train. Here, there are a few different rooms that the characters travel through. For example, is one room where the characters must remain quiet. Despite that, there is a fight that breaks out and the two assassins cannot scream when they hit each other. This is how you write a creative set piece as well as a fun bit in the movie's world. Little details like this go a long way to make the movie fresh from other action comedies. This is just one way the movie utilizes it's premise.The story is not messy, but it is very fun and interesting. It is like a big giant puzzle and each of the characters are pieces to the puzzle to find out what plan is being hatched. It helps that the movie feels like a battle royal where the five assassins and a few other characters go out of their way to threaten and kill each other. What surprised me is that a few characters that I thought would have a bigger role ended up dying quickly. Anyone can die here so do not get attached. The part where the movie gets messy is how all of the characters have their stories connected in some way. It becomes a little hard to follow at times and many instances feel rather coincidental. Still, the movie does a great job building tension and leading up to its epic climax by having each stop grow more tense.As for the characters, I like most of them. Brad Pitt as Ladybug is as charming and likable as ever while playing the chill guy in a deadly scenario well. I like how Ladybug is the one person who would rather talk everything out than kill people. However, there are three standouts here. The assassins played by Brian Tyree Henry and Aaron-Taylor Johnson are comedy gold. They bring the best humor with their chemistry, banter and references to Thomas the Tank Engine. They handle their dramatic scenes just as well as their comedic ones. Honestly, they could have been the main characters and the movie would have worked just as well. The other standout is Hiroyuki Sanada as the Elder. He does not have the biggest role, but his character is very compelling and cool. Sanada's presence gives the film the serious atmosphere and heart when it needs it while showing how great of a fighter he is. Joey King as the Prince is a pretty intimidating evil young woman. I was actually kind of scared of her in a few scenes. She is scarier than some of the buff assassins around.The rest of the cast is really good, but some of the actors are wasted. Because this is a movie where anyone can die, a few characters are killed off pretty early. While I appreciate a movie where no one is safe, it does sadly lead to a few characters getting wasted. This is my only major gripe about the story because there are a few really cool characters that are taken out so soon. Overall, this cast is fantastic and each person brings something unique and fresh to the table. I just wish a few characters had more to do.The action in this movie is solid. There is some great camerawork and stunt work in the fighting. As I said earlier, I love the fight in the quiet car. I also love the one on one fights between Ladybug and the Hornet as well as him and the Wolf. What I like about the action here is the buildup. Ladybug does what he can to avoid these assassins and fight with them, but once he gets caught, he uses every thing he can to fight back. The climactic battle is amazing. It is bloody, brutal and it utilizes the train setting perfectly. The comedy is mostly funny as well. There are a couple gags that I rolled my eyes at, but I couldn't help but smile at the Thomas references, the craziness of the fights, the banter between Lemon and Tangerine and Ladybug's confusion on how this all involves him. This movie works great as an action comedy.Despite that, I wonder how comedic David Leitch wanted the movie to be. Sure it has Brad Pitt punching a cutesy Japanese character, but some of the characters have some pretty dark and serious backstory. The third act is much darker than the rest of the film. While the movie is comedic, there are some dark elements to it for sure. The tone and style of the movie reminds me a bit from Guy Ritchie. I think Leitch took some inspiration from Ritchie with the stylish way the plot advances as well as the pacing of the film. I really enjoyed the way the movie is edited because it helped keep the movie going at a fast pace without forgetting to flesh out the characters.While the movie is far from perfect, I had a blast with Bullet Train. It made me laugh with its humor, it engaged me with its story and it exhilarated me with its set pieces. There is even some creativity within the action and world of this film. This movie is insane and I enjoyed it from start to finish. If you are looking for a fun and violent action movie, this is definitely worth checking out.

title: Guy Ritchie Warmed Over
text: This is much in the vein of Guy Ritchie's 'The Gentlemen'. Lots of flashbacks as the characters tell stories about how they got to where they are now. After all it takes place on a train and the writers and director lack the skill to make that interesting.The humor is at the 10 year old boy level and the morality of all the characters is missing, making it hard to enjoy. Then the one person who is human clashes so much with the rest of the story that you feel preached to. The whole film is just an empty, vacuous, immoral action film. Stupid plot points and twists to move the story forward in an absurd predictable manner or to just introduce an over-the-top idiotic action sequence.I'm guessing there is a market for this drivel - after all Guy Ritchie is still making films - but if you want any semblance of a logical story with characters having 3 dimensions, this one isn't it.

title: A Funny Cultural Action Comedy Laced With Revenge
text:
Watched Bullet Train with Brad Pitt(Ad Astra) as Ladybug, Aaron Taylor-Johnson(Tenet) as Tangerine, Brian Tyree Henry(Godzilla Vs. Kong, Eternals) as Lemon, Joey King(The Kissing Booth Trilogy) as Prince, Andrew Koji(Snake Eyes) as Yuichi Kimura/The Father, Hiroyuki Sanada(Avengers: Endgame) as The Elder, Bad Bunny as The Wolf, Zazie Beetz( Deadpool 2, Joker) as The Hornet, Sandra Bullock(Oceans 8) as Maria Beetle and Michael Shannon(Knives Out) as White Deathwith John Wick Chapter 4 Moved to next this was the next best thing also from the Co-Director of the first film also loved
I enjoyed more than I thought also loved it didn't take itself too seriously also Pitts Ladybug is trying to find innerpeace but stuff goes from 0 to 100 everything that can go wrong does Wrong loved it similar to nobody but is a tad more serious The Elder and White Death are tied to a revenge plot but still doesnt shy away from comedy I think The John Wick, Anime and Samurai Community will like itGreat Score By Dominic Lewis (The Kings Man), Cinematography by Jonathan Sela(Hobbs & Shaw) ,and Direction By David Leitch(John Wick) A Funny Cultural Action Comedy Laced With Revenge 9/10.

title: Twisty & hilariously violent
text: Lots of hilarious moments - second half even better than the first half so stick it through. Pacing was on point. It felt like a puzzle and comedy in one. This was favorite role I've seen for Brad Pitt, I think it for him very well. The setting of Japan seemed to work and add a childlike quality (cartoons) softening the tone this movie could otherwise be. Believe it or not there's even a moment or two of heartfelt depth among all the silly moments. I also liked the random famous celebrities shown throughout the movie. I would highly recommend you watch with friends, you will have a good laugh.

title: A really fun movie.
text: Brad Pitt is a great actor, with great comedic timing, and he puts it to good use in this movie. The supporting cast also do a great job. When the actors are believable then you can really enjoy the action.The concept of a' killers on a train' comedy is very entertaining. Can't say enough about Brad Pitt's acting. What a talent.You have to watch some of the credits at the end to see the actual end of the movie.I gave it an 8 because 1) it was entertaining 2) great acting, 3) excellent cinematography and 4) good pace.Joey King also did a good job.Lemon and Tangerine have a real chemistry which enlivens their scenes.

title: Tarantino wannabe
text: I just spent two hours and seven minutes watching a movie that wishes it was made by Tarantino. What a waste. The Director or the writer, I can imagine idolize Tarantino. Therefore, they tried to imitate it with a stylized Japanese live action anime/manga movie with American and British actors. Why would anybody give it more than two stars is beyond me. Also, there's a trend in movie making this year, all dumb plot lines with great actors i.e "everything everywhere all at once" another unbelievably stupid movie. Stylized, gore, and blood splattering all over the place is the norm for people to give it more than two stars.

title: Snatch's younger brother
text: A movie very similar to Brad Pitt's old movie Snatch. Same kind of format and jokes, but not quite at that level. Also very similar to Deadpool. How the story goes and the plot twists throughout remind my a lot of the directors previous work (Deadpool 2). All in all, a fun movie. Also enjoyed the small nod to Ryan Reynolds the same way Brad Pitt starred in Deadpool 2 for a blink of a second. That couldn't have been coincidental.

title: Even Quentin Tarantino Would be Proud of this Masterpiece!
text: David Leitch Is simply outstanding with this masterpiece! It's such a Pulp Fiction meets Once Upon a Time in Hollywood with a bit of skill Bill thrown in for good measure. Entertaining from the word go!!Five assassins on a bullet train, a twisted plot, a money bag, a murder, a snake, many hidden motives and some bizarre twists and turns with on a Japanese canvas. It's for action, more action and plenty that will make you smile. It's just one of those movies you have to watch! It starts off east with a pretty straight forward plot of retrieving a bag from a train, an easy snatch and run kinda assignments but fate has much in store so don't scoff at fate!

title: This movie was overhyped as usual ...
text: I found this movie boring because other movies of this genre have been made before. So, this movie was somewhat predictable. And because of this predictability the movie became boring as the minutes went by. If you want a time waster then this is your movie, otherwise, look elsewhere for something with a bit more originality and less predictability.

title: Really fun, and funny and bloody spoof of action movies
text: A really, really fun spoof of action movies and the Tarantino dialog in Pulp Fiction, Kill Bill, etc.Rather than the self assurance of Samuel L. Jackson, you have the comically self doubting - and polite - assassin of Brad Pitt.The fight scenes in the middle of a crowded train are over the top, and all the blood spurts, splashes, and pools all over the place. But no one the train notices how the main characters have cuts and bruises all over. (They are told to keep their voices lower.)There are no soliloquies about what the French call Big Macs or the meaning of Like a Virgin from Reservoir Dogs, but there are sillier, satires of that style of dialog where killers sound like they are in French New Wave film.And like a lot of action movies, it has a twisty plot, an all powerful bad guy and revenge back stories.So grab a couple of beers and just have fun with it. And make sure you go through the credits to watch the final scene, which is a nice kicker.

title: Highly entertaining
text: Greetings from Lithuania."Bullet Train" (2022) was a bloody good entertainment. This is a throwback movie to flicks made in early 2000, and naturally to Quentin Tarantino's movies. I found this movie to be extremely smart, funny and highly entertaining. To my surprise, this is one of my favorites so far this year.I loved the colorful characters and the way they were presented as well as their fate. There was Wolf who would i loved to see in a whole movie. No spoilers, but most of their outcome was superbly ingenues and also kinda realistic. Put in some hilarious cameos and this train was a hell of an entertainment.Overall, "Bullet Train" was way better than expected. Very smart and funny script, good performances and superb directing made this flick highly entertaining to me.

title: Well critics were wrong
text: First time I heard of this movie I was a bit worried. I started to think that Brad Pitt is starting to play in some weird movies because the world does not take him seriously as in the past. One week before the movie got released I saw the score on Metacritic. It was something around 50. I started to be skeptical about the movie and thought it is not worth my time. A few days after release I heard some people saying that it is quite worth the watch. I believed them and decided to make my friends join me. Sadly I had to not bring on the reviews because they wouldn't have gone.Now I can say that the movie surprised me in a very good way. The cast was amazing and Brad Pitt once again showed the world how amazing an actor he is and how can he do a huge amount of different roles. The performation of other actors such as a Tyrre Henry and Taylor Johnson were also really good. Throughout the whole movie, you could see Leitch's signature style. His style of humor was very well handled in this movie. There was also a huge amount of surprising scenes.Since this is a review without spoilers I will not say anymore so u can be surprised as I was. Go check it out, guys.8/10.

title: Brad Pitt's Action Drama Funny & Action-packed, but often slips from the tracks of Logic.
text:
Bullet Train (2022) :
Movie Review -Brad Pitt stars in the out-and-out action comedy of David Leitch, which is made for only one purpose: entertainment! No matter how it comes. My oldest memories of watching those films whose stories take place on a running train take me back to the pre-code era, i.e., "Shanghai Express" (1932), starring the emerging sensation of that time, Marlene Dietrich. Alfred Hitchcock made "The Lady Vanishes" (1938) and Junya Sato made Japanese flick, "The Bullet Train," which was adopted by Ravi Chopra in 1980 as "The Burning Train" (probably, the most memorable and known attempt on that subject in Indian cinema). David Leitch has previously directed films like "Atomic Blonde" (2016), "Deadpool 2" (2018), " Fast & Furious Presents: Hobbs & Shaw" (2019) and he produced " Nobody" (2021). So we know that he's a good filmmaker, right? Then what's wrong with him that he had to make a film like "Bullet Train"? Something is definitely wrong. Something terrible and big, or maybe he just wanted to see the lower side of his skills and therefore decided to uncover them with this action comedy. Bullet Train has no logic, nothing at all, yet all it tries to do is entertain you.The film is about a trained killer, Ladybug (Brad Pitt), who wants to give up life but is pulled back in by his handler, Maria Beetle (Sandra Bullock), in order to collect a briefcase full of money and gold on a bullet train heading from Tokyo to Kyoto. Well, the operation seems easy, but there's a catch to it - as always. Onboard the train, he and other competing assassins, The Prince (Joey King), Tangerine (Aaron Taylor-Johnson), Lemon (Brian Tyree Henry), Yuichi (Andrew Koji), Yuichi's Father (Hiroyuki Sanada), The Wolf (Benito A Mart√≠nez Ocasio), and Hornet (Zazie Beetz), discover their objectives are all connected with the White Death (Michael Shannon). During the killing spree, friends are lost and gained, secrets are revealed, vengeance is exacted, and so on. It all happens with a kick of dark humour, illogical scenes and black comedy.Bullet Train's narrative collapses entirely due to highly illogical conflicts in the screenplay. I agree they are funny, but we are not watching a British crime comedy of the 90s or any Abbott & Costello film from the 40s to enjoy those segments now. This crime comedy genre is difficult, especially when there's a lot of violence involved. You have to understand the impact of the outcome and how people are gonna react to it. A dead man can't just suddenly wake up. At least that's what he was shown a moment ago. He was hit with a couple of bullets, yet he awakens. A man can jump and climb on a running bullet train and carry it for the next five minutes. It's just that luck factor, which has been used again and again, and don't tell me luck happens to everybody at the same time, same place, and multiple times. Nobody is going to believe that, even in the last phase of cinematic liberty. It makes you laugh, yes, but from another angle. That's a silly one, I guess.The performances by the actors were quite decent considering the kind of peculiar characters they were playing. On some occasions, it seems they are over-acting, but maybe that was the demand of the script. Brad Pitt shines in the action and comedy scenes, but the scope isn't fulfilled. Joey King plays a bad-ass girl with an innocent face, which is too unrealistic to believe. Lemon and Tangerine, aka Brian Tyree Henry and Aaron Taylor-Johnson's black and white combination, is crispy. In the supporting roles, Andrew Koji, Hiroyuki Sanada, Michael Shannon, Benito A Mart√≠nez Ocasio and Zazie Beetz are okay, while Sandra Bullock's cameo is passable.The technical aspects of Bullet Train are satisfactory. The background score and cinematography work most of the time. The best part is the editing, because the film never bores you nor gives you any nappy moments, despite the horrible writing. This two-hour plus ride runs like a Bullet Train, and the crew member called "editor" deserves a special mention for that. David Leitch repeats a few cliches and sparks from his own previous films, only to make you feel that you are watching an David Leitch film. Most of the time, you pass the scene with a silly laugh, but there's a laugh, and that's all that matters. It is just about making sense where Bullet Train slips out of the track. If there is a limit to insensible and unreasonable patterns, believe me, Bullet Train is completely unaware of that. However, a spoonful of entertainment is there, if not a plateful of blockbuster watch.RATING - 4/10*

title: laughing out loud !!!!
text:
Starting with the Tokaido Shinkansen in 1964. The Shinkansen
colloquially known in English as the bullet train, is a network of high-speed railway lines in Japan. Initially, it was built to connect distant Japanese regions with Tokyo, the capital, to aid economic growth and development. High-speed bullet train Tokaido Shinkansen upon which the film was based.Brad Pitt and Brian Tyree Henry BRUTAL Fight Breaks Out On A Train, old lady said shh. I can't stop laughing watch the old lady is funny. Still a good movie, and a lot of great cameos. The movie is 2 hours. If this is the best Brad Pitt can do, maybe he needs to stop doing it cause it sucks.

title: Pretty good
text: I actually really enjoyed this one ! The entire cast were outstanding, Brad Pitt was great, but I wouldn't even say he is the main character, Lemon and tangerine were top notch too, it's hard to choose a favourite.The story itself was pretty good, the action was really good, the comedic timing and mix of seriousness was also well balanced I think.I wasn't expecting much with this one which is why I put it off for so long, thinking the 2 hours will feel very dragged out but I don't think I looked at my watch once which is always good.I really liked it, I am pleasantly surprised with this movie and can definitely see myself watching it again.

title: Ridiculous but fun comedy all the same
text: It very much has a feel of Deadpool vs a Tarantino film so would recommend if you like thost styles - of course it is ridiculously over the top action and make-up-as-you-go-along plot twists that you can't take seriously with the comedy script, they're not even shy of the constant Fiji water product placement, the script generally made me laugh all the same - there's enough laughs to outweigh of a few bits of cringe.The production was pretty impressive, and they got some decent actors probably because of their connection with the director - most of it worked well.The cameos were pretty amusing too!

title: Lemon and tangerine üîù
text:
Perfect......just Perfect
Simple and beautiful movie. All characters has been successfully written. There no needed scenes
There is also all kind of funny stuff throughout the whole movie
Also you can watch it with your family
Brad pitt has been involved right into his character
The movie's themes are just accurately chosen also the songs that has been added are perfect.All the cast are perfect it only a second part as bullet train follows the steps of rush hour that also is top rated movie
If you want to chill just watch it and don't overthink twice just be ready to indulge into a hilarious funny movie.

title: One of the most stupid film ever
text: A pointless film, that feels like it was scripted by writers wired on cocaine. The train was nice - a good commercial for Japanese rail travel, but a highly convoluted ramen bowl of ideas and storylines. Great performances from everyone, dodgy accents abound,, but I'd say that whilst all the individual performers are talented skilled and versatile, collectively they are trapped within a hackneyed and cliched script of appalling banality. It's like a Guy Richie film without Guy Richie. It's actually also rather boring.I think if you're between the ages of 15 and 35 you'd probably enjoy it. Otherwise you'll at best tolerate it for 45 mins.

title: Brad Pitt + Japan = Fun
text: Can't complain really. It's rare that we get such a star studded film these days and this feels like a new role for Brad. It was ultimately a silly movie but rarely had annoying moments.

title: Yes
text: I love this movie. It doesn't feel like an action movie that tries to add humor. It's a funny movie with an action story line. Went to see it again and still loved it.

title: Top Movie
text: "Bullet Train" is an exhilarating thrill ride that never lets up! From start to finish, this action-packed film keeps you on the edge of your seat with its fast-paced plot, intense performances, and stunning visuals. The ensemble cast, led by a charismatic Brad Pitt, delivers top-notch performances, each character bringing a unique energy to the screen.The film's stylish direction and sleek cinematography capture the adrenaline-fueled chaos of a high-speed train heist flawlessly. The script is smart, filled with unexpected twists and turns that keep you guessing until the very end.The action sequences are masterfully choreographed, delivering heart-pounding excitement and showcasing impressive stunt work. The film also explores deeper themes of trust, redemption, and the complexities of human nature, adding depth to the pulse-pounding narrative. The production design and visual effects are superb, creating a visually stunning world that immerses you in the story.Overall, "Bullet Train" is a must-see for action movie fans, delivering non-stop thrills, stellar performances, and a captivating storyline. Strap yourself in and get ready for a wild ride!

title: Crazy Train!
text: This movie is pure chaotic fun, crazy violence and insanity at every turn. The characters are funny, and I can't get enough of Brad Pit. Some people might complain on the confusing plot, but in a movie like this the plot is secondary to the action and jokes.

title: Hits its target
text: Bullet Train is everything I expected from a Brad Pitt action flick about assassins, and I ended up having a great time with this, I would most definitely see it in theaters if I could and it's one of the best pure action flicks I've seen this yearBullet Train does an amazing job weaving all of these different story lines into one location and one succinct narrative, the character introductions are all very slick and each character gets a fair amount of screen time, besides Sandra Bullock, Brian Tyree Henry is an absolute scene stealer, I could not get enough of that man and his counterpart whenever they were on screen together, they were hilarious and charming.Brad Pitt puts on a badass performance playing a brilliant main character, and the ending had me riveted, and I was certainly not expecting Sandra Bullock to show upA-

title: I'm glad this was not a John Wick facsimile. - Fun, fast, gory, dark humor, witty with good performances
text: TL;DR - Fun, fast, gory, dark humor, witty with good performances, and decent action. If this combination sounds like you will have fun, you will have fun and then some. A little sag here and there but the quiet moments are welcome as the movie was surprisingly fast-paced for most of it.Do not go in expecting a John Wick-type watch considering the director, just go in as you did the first time you ever watched John Wick, you did not expect the experience but enjoyed it by the end.The GoodAaron Taylor near steals the show out from everyone, I will be keeping an eye on his work going forward.I was surprised by his performance in Nocturnal Animals but his bigger Marvel performance always stuck out in my head. With this film, I no longer see him as the Quicksilver from Avengers AOU, but as a good versatile actor I enjoy watching.Pitt kept up the entire film, bringing in a very 'just done with this but can't stop doing it' performance, I genuinely enjoyed his version of the 'wants to get out of the life' vibe he kept throughout the movie.It was a great performance and I am glad it was not just a John Wick facsimile where Pitt is a retired badass and just decimates everything in his path but rather an accidental badass who is just quick on his feet, sometimes not so quick.Brian, Koji, and Sanada, and Joey King make a great supporting cast with Brian having the largest role of them all, the comedy also works well for the most part, but wherever the comedy doesn't work the movie just keeps a good pace that you don't really dwell on it, there is always something that works around the bend.The story is not really the point here, and that works well for the type of movie it is trying to be, fast, fun, and fck3d up in many places.The BadThere is just a little bit of sag that kind of lingers around here and there throughout, and the third act may have gone a little bit overboard but not so far out there that it ruins the experience. Although the movie would definitely have been a more streamlined experience with 10 or maybe 15 minutes shaved off.Some parts of the plot may be considered a little convoluted and convenient, but there is sort of an in-story explanation for the same which kind of works, but if you are someone who needs everything to make sense in a movie you will probably find it grating.ConclusionAfter 2 of my previous theatre watches JW Dominion and Thor L&D and really not enjoying them both, this felt like a good re-charge for me and a fun theatre experience. I would suggest everyone go out there and give it a one-time watch, this is a fun group watch with friends.

title: Non Stop
text: This film is hyperactive but that's by no means a negative... I left entertained and in lighter spirits.After introductions are made the story is delivered like a Japanese bullet train, it only ever stops for the intended amount before propelling you to the next destination!This has everything an action/thriller desires and the cast and crew have delivered splendidlyWill be picking up a physical copy.

title: This Train Game is Insane - and Lame
text:
Yeah, this film was fast, heading somewhere spefic, but I wasn't too happy with the hourney.To tell the honest, I don't even like assassin films - but Brad....
So, I laughed maybe three times, hence three stars.Lots of blood and guts, not really my cup of tea - specially not when it's glamorised.Would not be recommending to others.

title: HUGELY underrated
text: One of the most surprising films of the last 10 years for me. Stylish, full of incredible action sequences and jaw dropping reveals. Fun, fun, fun from start to finish. One of the most enjoyable 2 hours I've had in years. Incredibly talented cast, who are clearly having a ball. Could not recommend it more. Also, no spoilers, but the cameos are HILARIOUS. Run, don't walk! I'll be seeing it again!

title: Great humor meets chaotic action
text: I found this movie highly entertaining. I was a little wary going in because I'd seen a lot of this movie through trailers and marketing and usually that means very little comes across when you're watching the film because, well, they showed you the best parts before you came to the theater. But it was surprisingly packed to the gills with action and humor that wasn't shown and I definitely enjoyed. I've heard the dialogue being akin to Pulp Fiction and other similar styles, and while I think the dialogue was humorous, there's some spots where you might find it falls flat, but for me that was not the case. I think the writer and director also did a great job at coming up with a ton of plot devices and keeping track of them throughout. The casual viewer may forget/miss one or two and get a little confused, but if you didn't then you'll find it gives a feeling of everything coming full circle. I especially want to shout out Aaron-Taylor Johnson's performance, everything he did was spot on and I loved it. Overall, it was very comedic, lots of great chaotic action, and a blast throughout.

title: Finally a great movie!
text: Spoiler Free Review!Bullet Train is one of the only movies to come out in years where the story unfolds as you watch it. Most recent movies you know the ending as soon as the movie starts, but not this one.It is a bit gory, but my god is it fun, exciting and highly entertaining. Brad Pitt is amazing and so is the rest of the cast. The casting director needs a raise.There are plenty of twist and turns to keep you guessing. Expectations are constantly subverted, but in a good way. Whoever wrote the story also needs a raise.And finally let's talk about the director. He managed to fit an action packed, fun thrill ride on a train. He also deserves a raise.

title: Bullet Train
text: Hired killer Ladybug (Brad Pitt) wants out, but is sent on a mission to retrieve a briefcase from on board the Bullet Train. It would seem though that there are many other killers on board the train also looking for the case.After a rather disorienting, fast moving start, riddled with flashbacks and characters, you start to settle into this wonderful film and its bizarre and very funny story. There are plenty of twists and flashbacks explaining why each killer is there and one by one they start bumping into each other trying to get the case and do each other in - think Tarantino meets What's Up Doc travelling at 300kph with a lot of blood and dark humour. The key to the success of this film though is that every colourful character in it, is glorious, with Pitt, full of self doubt, absolutely perfect. Such a lot of fun.

title: Wait, that wasn't woke...
text: ... and what a relief.Great ride. Entertaining from beginning to end :)Fun, entertaining, action, solid chuckles, and good side stories to fill in the movie.I enjoyed all the characters and how they fit into the story. Brits were probably the most fun for me. Brad brought respectful acting to the screen. Twists and turns made for a entertaining couple hours. Fighting scenes were well done.If I were to critique anything it would be the blue screen of the Bullet Train. That was a bit of a bust, but not a deal breaker. Can't win them all.Not very often we get to avoid a Hollywoke lecture in theatre's. It was a nice break.

title: If your local cinema has dolby go see it in dolby!!!
text: From the director of John Wick 3 comes this funny action thriller set on a bullet train traveling through Japan and based on a little known book from Japan. Brad Pitt Sandra Bullock and other stars make this $90 million movie a surprise hit at the box office which right now is slowing down after doing quite well during this still pandemic year. Be sure to stay after the main credits for a little scene.

title: Noice.
text: I hadn't heard much about it, and conned the family into watching it based just upon Brad Pitts involvement. We were very pleasantly surprised. It really plays out a bit like a Guy Ritchie film. For those who are not familiar, he essentially creates what seems like dumb Hollywood style action flicks, which then happily play out as much more complex and satisfying experiences. Bullet Train is clever, multi-layered, well acted and well made. It's time twisted narrative slow drips us enough clues to keep you guessing until the end. The characters are stylised but still somewhat believable. Watch it and be entertained.

title: They don't make 'em like they used to!
text: The Good: Top-notch cast, flashy visuals, non-stop action, v. Funny script.The Bad: Exhausting to watch (maybe that's the idea?).The Verdict: Wow, this movie is just darn fun! Like, before everything got dark, psychological, and political (The Bourne/Batman Begins Effect). I had a blast in the cinema watching this. Though I was the only one chuckling throughout in an audience of maybe 10 people. The characters "Lemon" and "Tangerine" almost had me choking on my popcorn! I dunno, maybe I'm old enough to "get" the "Thomas The Tank Engine References", or maybe the other 9 people took life too seriously, but I don't care either way. Think "Assassins" meets "Snatch" meets "Narrow Margin" meets "The Mexican" and you're probably halfway there!

title: I wondered why it was so bad...
text: ... until I checked on who the director was and discovered it was the same person that created the equally awful John Wick 3. Someone needs to stop giving this guy funding! It's no secret that the quality of films has steadily being getting worse over the years. Once upon a time films were made with a solid script, brilliant character development, excellent cinematography and a great plot. Now you have utter turds being made like Bullet Train with zero thought to character development, no plot to speak of and a style reminiscent of a budget music video made with a three year old waving the camera. These 'movies' seem to appeal to the current generation, probably because no thought is involved and they've been brought up on a diet if drivel so know no better. Bullet Train is bad. REALLY bad. John Wick 3 bad. Can someone in a position of authority please stop green lighting this crap!

title: You really can't predict this one...
text: Every time you think you have the story figured out, something random happens. Awesome. Hilarious. Kinda reminded me of Crank with the way it was filmed. I really got a kick out of The Water Bottle's whole life being filmed. It's hard to find a movie where you can't predict the ending; normally you can have movies figured out a few minutes in. Also, the cameo I won't name so it doesn't ruin it -- cheeky. Loved it. Also, the overall aesthetic of the movie is great. We did not expect this to be this good. Honestly assumed it'd be some cheesy comedy with a few laughs. I literally said, after we watched the trailer, "I bet we just saw the whole thing, but let's give it a shot.". That's how movies usually are. But nah. Total surprise. Awesome work.

title: Such a fun movie to watch!
text: The movie had a great style and humor. I'm not really a fan of Brad Pitt, and he is basically the same guy he plays in every movie in the past two decades, but he did well here. The cameos were awesome and of course makes the fast paced story even more exciting. The movie tried to go for a bigger meaning towards the end. I felt like it more or less hit it, but really didn't have to go for that. I'm totally down for just random shoot them up movies.The one thing that did bother me about this movie was the usual people talk too much when they shouldn't, and don't talk when they should. But it's a movie, so...

title: a must watch
text: I wish more action films could have this much character development and great dialog. It was also perfectly cast and they nailed it with the ending. Every roll no matter how small is given a back story which happily draws the viewer into the multiple plot lines which all interconnect in the end. It helps to notice every detail as they will revisit points that can be easily overlooked in the moment but that may also be part of the fun for. Another stellar performance by Brad Pitt and supporting rolls are woven in with perfect harmony. Just a great overall experience and definitely one worth rewatching as well.

title: Unfunny. Lame. Boring. Borefest.
text:
I am not fond of leaving harsh critic, but if I didn't I wouldn't be doing my job. I tried to go past 20 minute mark but it was unfathomable and excruciating torture. For instance:-It tries to be like Nobody with 17 kills against a background of Humphrey Bogart music.... newsflash not everyone digs it
-It tries to be Kill Bill with some painful Latin song of vomit scene at wedding and overacting by the Latino assassin... not everyone loves that kind of mariachi-esque music
-The whole Lemon and Tangerine scenes are just unfunny, unintelligble... newsflash... British humor is not universal. Majority of the world (I reckon even Japanese audience too!) can care less about dumb British Humor... The characters got way more screen time than they deserved and Brad Pitt seemed to be the extra if anything than main protagonist.. We tuned in for Brad Pitt not others..
-Even Brad Pitt's starting therapy scene was just plain boringDespite cinematic stylization and artistry, it failed to captivate me. I had to plot through each excruciating scenes...This movie doesn't know if it wants to be Kill Bill or Pulp Fiction (BOTH which I didn't like as I think even Quentin Tarantino movies are garbage... I know I will get a lot of flak for it..) or John Wick or Nobody. I hate when movies can't decide if it wants to be "serious" or "comedy". Why not stick to one genre instead of making a scatterbrained pile of hot mess which is all over the place? Even Finnegan's Wake has more coherent plot line - insert dead pan emoji.If you look at David Leitch's track record you will realize he has a record of making bad movies such as Atomic Blonde. I mean I didn't watch Calvin and Hobbes.. but hey, if I see the title Fast and Furious, it will be hard pass. Why do Hollywood STILL think people are interested in Marvel or F&F type of garbage blockbuster? Please do not insult intelligence.Finally I will say this. Just yesterday a Twitter post came up on Hitchcock's The Birds and I was in all praises: No CGI. No boilerplate/templates. No dumb plot twists. No wokeism. No cheesy dialogues. In one word Masterpiece.Point being, you don't really need billion dollar budget to make a good movie. (Heck David Leith's bio reads as "Billion dollar director". Yeah dude. Take your billion dollar profit and shove it under your pillow if you think boxoffice profit is all that it matters in life.It's really not difficult making good movies. Just like an author can create relentless in beauty in a txt file of notepad, or Eminem craft artistry with no background music or an unknown Youtuber can tell beautiful story in 144p vertiical screne without any jump cuts or filligrees or close up camera angle and other cringe fests... a TRUE talent lies when one can execute with minimal effort and maximum efficiency.All those p-rn eyefest and candy... yet lands nowhere. Sorry. And as someone mentioned, yup if you are a teenager it will appeal to you.

title: The best time I had in the cinema this year.
text: It's entertaining, colourful, perfectly paced, funny and action packed. It takes some inspiration of Guy Ritchie movies, the way the story is told, the humour, british guys doing being funny in England,... but i like those Ritchie movies so i loved that there was a similar style here. The cast is great, they work perfectly well with each other, my personal favorite character was Lemon, I loved that guy. I loved the buildup this movie has. It begins with a simple job, and as the movie progresses, that job gets more complicated because more people are involved with it and everyone wants something. It never failed to have my attention and it was just so much fun. That's what this movie's goal is and it delivers. So just have and open mind and have a great time watching this.

title: Excellent wild & fun ride - my kinda movie
text: The first minutes I wasn't really sure about the film and what was going to happen, since I stopped watching trailers years ago.However, you pretty much can't go wrong with Brad Pitt and I ghad no clue that this movie was packed with star power and all sorts of cameos!Boy, get ready for some thrill ride, twists, twisted humor and the occasional Japanese style gore, the likes of which Kill Bill provided. (just my reference, don't blame me for not being an anime fan etc ;)Superb fun until the end, can't help but thinking there are a lot of "Diesel's" reviewing this.Also seeing / hearing Brian Tyree (ball smoke) Henry and his twin with a South London accent was brilliant, cushty mate.Was really refreshing and something different!
