text: First off let's just say I never thought I'd never see Brad and Aaron J in a film together, but here we are! Very cool effects and hilarious fight scenes, although sloppy makes it that much more believable. The film looked like a hoot to shoot and keeps the audience guessing throughout (this is a crime film after all). Lots of Easter eggs to be found, amongst the glitz and glamour of it all you still need to pay attention. The supporting cast were all great, I could write an essay about everyone but I highly recommend you watch for yourself.Let's just say this was so much fun, even my dad didn't take his evening nap. So, go treat yourself to a night in and give it a whirl! - G.

title: David Leitch slowly becoming the Tarantino of Gen-Z.
text: Bullet Train has everything an action cinema-goer could ask for and certainly has more to offer.Charismatic Cast? Check.Adrenaline-Pumping Action Scenes? Check.Badass Villain? Check.Now, a regular action film would have the above three components to rely on. But, in addition to the above three, the film has a pretty well-woven storyline which is not at all a regularity in action movies. David Leitch directs this film with such a great screenplay that it almost reminded me of Pulp Fiction (1994) which was essentially a dialogue driven drama film. This film reminded me a lot of Pulp Fiction due ot it's non-linear storytelling and is essentially a plot-driven action film which is a rarity nowadays. The Gray Man (2022) was supposed to be this Big Action flick of the summer but I guess Bullet Train gets that title for me.Brad Pitt, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Brian Tyree Henry, Joey King and each member of the cast is just perfect and on point. Each one has a reason to be on that train and at the end, the film even points that trope out of action films having unnecessary side characters. Brad Pitt was amazing as always, Aaron Taylor-Johnson surprised me, and TYree Henry got most of the best scenes in the film. Also, I only knew Joey King as this cute girl who will always play the love interest in Cheesy Netflix Rom-Com's but I was dazzled when I saw her performance in this, she really makes it up for her Kissing Booth performances. Also, keep an eye out for the unexpected cameos this film has to offer.The song choices, ahhhhhhhhh. David Leitch never disappoints in that department, John Wick (2014), Deadpool 2 (2018), Hobbs and Shaw (2019) and now this.I'd say the film overall, is a great experience at the theatres and would definitely recommend it.It's pretty enjoyable although you kinda get what has been happening all this time a few minutes before the end when the film finally decides to reveal it to us. Nevertheless, it manages to keep your attention by the amazing climax this film has to offer.P. S.: Loved that Kill Bill Reference at the end.

title: Mind blowing üëå
text: BULLET TRAIN is a BLOODY, TWISTING, WILD ride from start 2 glorious finish! Seriously, it never gets boring.The cast is brilliant, the action is over-the-top in the best ways, creative camerawork, & it's f*ing hilarious.Give me another ticket to ride the #bullettrain asap!

title: Amazingly brilliant!
text: I'm not a fan of action movies, but this director made me love them. I'm always impressed by his ability to choose locations, cast and set, and great soundtracks to complement what we see with our eyes. The picture is a great proof, that it is not necessary to have many locations in order to shoot beautifully. The charm of this picture is also added by the coexistence of different national cultures, which look harmonious and at the same time funny next to each other. Well, of course, I cannot but note the charisma of the main character and the wonderful acting other artists. The cast includes both experienced "players" and young talented actors, which is very gratifying. The plot line of the film did not let me tear myself away from the screen while watching it. That is, there is no division into dynamic and non-dynamic "parts". Through the screen, we can also feel the good sense of humor of the director and screenwriters, because there is a considerable amount of jokes and gags in the picture.

title: So much fun , start to finish
text: I have actually never written a review, and it's funny that this movie has made it as the first. This movie wasn't the best ever but man was it fun. And , whenever I hear someone say a movie was "fun", I'm usually quite narcissistic and negative about it. A movie is supposed to make you feel emotions, as is having fun. But genuinely, there is no better description for this movie than it being so much fun.Writing was incredible, scenes were perfectly funny when needed, serious when needed and cool when needed. Full circle in the end, top top cast, has rewatchabilty tenfold and was such a good choice to watch. I felt like I did when I was younger, watching that. Old school kind of movie (ish) with modern day production.10/10, would recommend to a friend.

title: Blood, Blood, Blood & More "FUN"
text:
Brad Pitt at his one of the best performance.Lemon and Tangerine characters helped with the fun schema!Ryan Ronalds as Carver in 5 seconds scene.(Hopefully there will be a prequel or sequel)
I loved the details.1. Water bottle
2. Doll
3. Mascot
4. Hornet
5. WaitressAs usual David rocked with his direction and screenplay.Fight sequence, music, VFX and cinematography is lit.Prince role was little irritating.White death would have been more evil.This movie will never bore you.Enjoy this when you are traveling in a train ( ofcourse bullet train when you are in Japan).Subtitle were missing for few japanese conversation.

title: What an action comedy knock out!!
text: Bullet Train brings the perfect Deadpool vibes in this movie! There's so much action and comedy mixed together in any films like all 2 Deadpool films.Brad Pitt did such a good job making this movie so much fun with his part as Ladybug, same performances goes for Joey King, Aaron Taylor Johnson, Brian Tyree Henry, Hiroyuki Sanada, and Sandra Bullock. I really did enjoy every best action and comedy moments that brings you back to Deadpool movies.David Leitch did a fantastic job directing and making this movie a lot of fun for the audience to watch this movie in the cinemas!

title: Strangers on a train
text: As soon as I saw the name of David Leitch in the end credits everything fell into place - not many people can do such pure dumb action movie with lots of bloody gore, shootouts, fights and tons of jokes and David is surely among them.The plot is also somewhat non trivial than most action movies as it slowly unravels, piece by piece revealing more and more details, like a puzzle that needs to be settled and by the end of the movie you have the complete picture, although for that kind of movie it takes a bit way too long but I'm not complaining because every little piece of information about the characters is important and, like a Chekhov's gun, will shoot in the end.Bullet train is no Citizen Kane for sure but it knows exactly what it is and plays it by the book. All of the characters are amazing and if the situation they found themselves in was a little less surreal I would've totally emphasized with most of them but considering it's an action flick I already used to the fact they're mostly unkillable - and once you've put it behind you the action looks less impressive.The soundtrack was a fantastic inclusion into the narrative and really helped to set the mood of the scenes. All of the actors did great and a couple of surprise cameos were refreshing to say the least. Overall Bullet train is a good way to spend the evening and a worthy addition to the niche of action movies that you don't immediately delete from your memory as soon as you watched it.

title: Two hours of awesomeness
text: This is a great movie. The cast is superbly assembled and the acting top notch. The script is dynamic, realistic, easy to follow and never dull. Camera work is great, sound is great, special effects are pretty good too.This is an easy going spy/assassin double cross story; think of it as john wick without the seriousness behind it. It does give a little bit of a kill bill vibe but i suppose anything involving japan and murder will do so.I wanted to give it higher rating but i felt bullocks character could have been more developed at the end, and also would have loved something with that very cool therapist we keep hearing about. For a movie that long, another 20 minutes would not have been an issue.Regardless, this is a must watch.

title: Rubbish
text: This was completely rubbish. I'm just amazed people are giving this 9s and 10s. They are calling this garbage of a film "masterpiece", "best of 2022" "amazing movie"...you've got to be kidding me! This was diabolical, silly, non-sense with no plot or story. In the first 3 mins when the main actor started to talk I knew this was going to be bad. The fact that they have so many great actors in this and it was just a complete money grab waste. Complete waste of 2 plus hours... yes I know I will get thumbs down for this review but for the few folks who have a brain, please don't watch this. It's so juvenile, the jokes are NOT funny, the so-called "quick-witted, one liners and zingers" doesn't make sense. It's like a force laugh.Personally I didn't want to watch this but I was outvoted 10-1...those 10 people ended up falling asleep and I was the only one left in the misery of watching this donkey's rear of a film.I'm not going spoil the film but this is just bad all the way around. This is why I have giving up on Hollywood and now focus on foreign films. Please heed my review and don't waste your time. It's like a bunch of man children and a silly grown woman pretended to be a kid on a train.From start to finish is just poor, not 1 second of quality. The masterpiece of trash and brilliantly dumb for sure.

title: Trained bullet of entertainment
text: This is one of those films where you just sit back and enjoy!Pretty simple movie based on obtaining a suitcase on a Japanese Bullet train by a number of professional killers. Might not sound like it could be too interesting, but the writing and directing are at their peak. Not one word is out of place, and spoken in a stylish manner totally dedicated to each character.And each character is developed from the first scene they appear in, and all are likeable and interesting. Nothing is missed from beginning to the end in opening up their intent and purpose for being on the train.This is a movie based on style with humour and mystery. Brad Pitt is ideal as the main actor 'Ladybug" supported aptly by a great cast and a great script. Just when you think something has been explained and has settled, an unexpected turn of events or info drags you back into its story.The title of Bullet Train pretty well sums up what the film is like watching; a train ride of fantastic entertainment at high speed, which never lets up until ALL the credits have been shown.

title: Best Non-Tarantino Tarantino-ish movie
text: Great nonstop Action and fun. Where Tarantino takes a little more time for story telling and plot buildup, this flick skips that for the most part and goes straight to the last 30% of his movies. The cinematography and dialogues add to the great atmosphere of the film and also convey that it doesn't take itself seriously. This is something that I really like about those crazy over the top action movies. The small plot itself is crazy enough to keep you guessing what brings all those whacky characters together on that train. Overall great 2h entertainment, especially if you wish Tarantino movies would skip the first half and go straight to the over the top gory action.

title: Fast paced and fun
text: I wasn't really expecting to like this movie. Was not looking forward for it, but I watched it anyway because it's always on top 10 on Netflix.The story is fast-paced and will keep you glued to the screen. I was entertained the whole time. All the characters are also likeable, my favorites being the Twins. Joey King is also great in this. I was also very much impressed with the cinematography and visual effects. So stunning, especially the slow-mo scenes.Bullet Train is an action-packed movie with tons of hilarious scenes as well. The movie can be kind of stupid but in a fun way. I also love the surprise cameo appearances.If you're looking to be entertained, then I really definitely recommend this movie to everyone.

title: Unfunny comedy thriller
text: Brad Pitt really enjoys doing these gimmicky cool and hip comedies but this one was pretty bad. Its more of a cartoon than a realistic or serious thriller. The narration and the entire movie dialogue were just fluff material. Like I said its a cartoon, even an eight year old will get by without understanding any of the words.The story itself involves betrayal and revenge but none of the villains or heinous acts were especially gripping. Brad Pitt as the reluctant assassin is not very impressive. He's just yapping away on the phone with his handler for most of the movie. Tangerine and Lemon were a funny side act but they also wore out their welcome in the movie.Channing Tatum had a funny 2 minute cameo its too bad he couldn't have gotten more screen time. I think if the roles were reversed he might have done a better job. If you just like Brad Pitt for some mindless fun then sure why not go ahead and watch this.

title: Wow! Bullet Train is a fun ride!
text:
Carver, a hired killer calls in sick, so his handler, Maria (Sandra Bullock) calls a replacement "Ladybug" (Brad Pitt) His first job back after time off seeking inner peace. Just a simple snatch and grab a briefcase on a Tokyo Bullet Train."You said you want simple for your first job back, it doesn't get simpler" - Maria
Oh but something is not right on this train. This train is full of assassins! Including "The Twins" two British assassins "Lemon" and "Tangerine" who are guarding a man,"The Son"and the very briefcase Ladybug is after. They are delivering both to a Russian born Yakuza boss "The White Death" But "The Son" is killed. Meanwhile Ladybug quietly finds and snatches the briefcase, Easy Peasy right."This is to easy"- Ladybug
But as Ladybug tries to sneak off the train he is suddenly attacked by "Wolf" another assassin who seams to know Ladybug and accuses him of killing his wife.... Ladybug misses his stop.Now Ladybug is stuck on a speeding train full of killers from all over the world and they all seem to be after that briefcase. So what is waiting for them?"The White Death and his army of assassins" - The Elder
Wow! Bullet Train is a fun ride! I really like this movie. Even though everything is a bit chaotic with so many characters with different story lines going on, they all tie together in the end.There is a lot of humor and a lot of violence , but it is a very fast paced, entertaining, story told in a stylish way ... and with a few clever twist that I did not see coming. Oh and an amazing cast!What a totally Awesome popcorn movie!

title: A Convoluted Comedic, Action, Crime, Mystery with its Moments
text: Brad Pitt headlines this comedic, action, mystery crime thriller on board a Japanese bullet train. The plot is sort of Pulp Fiction (1994), Kill Bill Vol. 1 (2002) and Vol. 2 (2003), and Lucky Number Slevin (2006). This quite difficult to follow, convoluted storyline with many moving parts tries to outdo Pulp Fiction with its initial gore and subsequent cute comedic dialogue. A rather ambitious writing, acting attempt that also incorporates two rather nice cameos towards the end. The movie includes several nicely creative fight scenes as well as humanizing moments for a few of the "villains." Overall, this movie is an improvement on the typical action mystery movie though it still struggles with its overall presentation. Good effort, decent try, and definitely worth a visit to the movie theater if the theater's sound system and the music track does not blow out your eardrums first.

title: Fun and entertaining
text: BULLET TRAIN is a pretty good modern action movie with plenty of humour and thrills to see it through. The director co-handled JOHN WICK so the fight scenes that take place here are typically brisk and well-choreographed. I could have done without some of the CGI, though, particularly at the never-ending climax where it gets completely ridiculous (as much so as the flying train in the Thai movie VENGEANCE OF AN ASSASSIN). Pitt is well chosen as the likeable lead, but the supporting cast are decent too, particularly Taylor-Johnson and Henry as the amusing double act. Hiroyuki Sanada is always a welcome presence, as is Michael Shannon, and King is the only misstep in the casting. Generally, though, this is fun and entertaining stuff.

title: Smart, Refreshing and Entertaining.
text: Absolutely loved this movie! First, it was great to see Brad Pitt playing in an action movie again, but this isn't just your typical action movie. The writing, acting and directing were all top notch! I must admit, I went into this movie with a Little skepticism, because in my opinion, the only quality action movies in the last several years have been super hero movies, I know, I know...let the super here bashing begin, but let's be honest up until recently, all this movies were well thought out and lines work quality actors to drive the characters. Well, Bullet Train does just that! Character driven and full of nonstop action and twists. A fun enjoyable time at the movies.

title: Absolute garbage!
text: What a waste of time and money! A complete nonsense of a film which presumably tries to pay homage to Tarantino but falls badly short! Does Brad Pitt need money that badly?

title: Endlessly entertaining, if a bit too long
text: Alcohol and "Bullet Train" - directed by David Leitch - have a lot in common: both start strong (I'm currently feeling the come up of some whiskey and cognac as we speak!); both contain feelings of euphoria within the first 20 to 50 minutes of consumption; however, both can last a bit too long for one's liking, with moments of intermittent boredom and nonsense sprinkled in-between the greatness. You see - much like alcohol - I wholeheartedly recommend "Bullet Train;" it is a slick, stylish, action-comedy that never ceases to entertain from the time it gets going to the time it ends; however, in between the entertainment and the ending, you will be able to feel the fact that it is outwearing its welcome.Director David Leitch, if nothing else, signifies a high quality movie experience; from the first "John Wick" to "Deadpool 2" and "Atomic Blonde," my man knows how to direct competent action sequences. And so, when I saw his name pop up in every single trailer I saw for this movie, I, at the least, knew I was in for an action spectacle. However, what I didn't realize was how much "Bullet Train" would entertain me during sequences when no action was occurring on screen. But before I digress, let's talk action.After watching action movie after action movie filled to the brim with close-up shaky camera, it was more refreshing than words can express to watch a movie that had nothing but clearly comprehensible action sequences. Every hit, slice, and gunshot was seen in full view of the camera, which was shocking, to say the least. I found myself on the edge of my seat every time an action sequence began. And thankfully, there are plenty of exciting - gory - action sequences that will draw viewer attention. Leitch draws inspiration from Japanese Yakuza films and packs "Bullet Train" full of katana battles, as well as with riveting gun fights and hand to hand combat sequences. And the best part of it is that everything is clearly filmed, but I'd expect nothing less from a co-director of the first "John Wick" movie.What is more surprising is that "Bullet Train" manages to entertain even when there is nobody beating someone else up on screen. More of an action-comedy than a straight up action film, "Bullet Train" has plenty of moments that will elicit full-blown belly laughs from its audience, thanks in part to Brad Pitt's brilliant performance. No stranger to the limelight, Brad Pitt knocks it out of the park here with a role that highlights his action prowess as well as his comedy chops. And as one who has never been fully convinced by Pitt's acting abilities, his skill behind the camera and endlessly rewatchability has fully turned me into a fan.Another thing I appreciated about "Bullet Train" was his unabashed style - taking notes from Tarantino and Guy Ritchie, this film has a rather unorthodox style that throws viewers in the middle of past and present, fully trusting them to pay attention as to what is going on, and why. And it works. I couldn't help but have a goofy smile plastered to my face as "Bullet Train" jumped back and forth and with it, serenading audiences with non sequiturs that - ultimately - tied everything together into a perfect bow. So be aware - even if things don't make perfect sense in the beginning, by the time the credits roll you will have everything spelled out for you.Joey King, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, Brian Tyree Henry, and Andrew Koji - amongst others - make up the cast, and each and every actor and actress bring their A-game, with enough charisma to lead a movie of their own; while Brad Pitt may steal the show, everyone else is so good in their own right that I found myself coming to this movie for Brad Pitt, and staying for the supporting actors.In the end, "Bullet Train" is one great time at the movies. With enough action to satisfy even the most hard core adrenaline junkie and enough comedy to engage the most casual viewer, "Bullet Train' is a crowd pleaser in every sense of the word. Even with the high hopes that I had due to the director, my expectations were still blown out of the water - even if I do think this movie was a bit too long for its own good, and dragged on just a little too much. That said, there is so much to enjoy here that I find myself highly recommending this movie to anyone who is even the slightest bit interested in checking it out. Because, trust me, you won't regret giving this one a chance.

title: The Best Ride of the Year
text: I laughed. I cried. I felt the ride. A truly immersive experience with incredible visual effects. The storyline was unique, and well written. I didn't watch it when it first came out, because the basic premise of the story seemed bleak. The trailer didn't do it justice. Therefore, I found myself pleasantly surprised that the cast and crew successfully created an entertaining piece of fiction based entirely on a bullet train. There aren't a lot of productions that engage an audience with the scenes set in one place. The action and comedy was well balanced, and the characters were ironically relatable, which added to the comedic element. Come on, man. A bullet train full of relatable assassins has never been done before. This makes it worth watching.

title: Good dark comedy
text: I bumped into this movie on sky and I really enjoyed the watch. Fast pace, dark humor, great actors in my opinion is the perfect mix for a relaxing time on the sofa. It's not Tarantino (far from it also for the poor dialogues) but there is a lot of blood so it's not the movie for who doesn't like splatter movies.Bullet Train is based on the novel Maria Beetle by Japanese author Kotaro Isaka, the satirical story of 5 assassins who have been assigned the same target on a bullet train traveling from Tokyo to Morioka. The plot was tweaked slightly for the silver screen, as the assassins travel on a bullet train from Tokyo to Shin-Osaka. Additionally, one of the assassins was changed from male to female for the film. The comedy part is not in the novel.

title: What a ride! Hilarious.
text: Bullet Train is pure entertainment. Whilst it starts out with a somewhat serious tone, that scene setting quickly gives way to non-stop entertainment and hilarious comic book action.The cast are obviously having a ball, really enjoying their material from the tight main ensemble through to the cameos that add depth, ambience and atmosphere.And the action - this is a real Michael Bay eat your heart out movie. Non-stop and massively visceral action delivered with a dead pan energy, that also pauses and takes the time to insert some laughs along the way - it's humor found in the juxtaposition of absurdity, violence, and repartee - and the oddly comical recurring themes that pop up in awkward moments.Bullet Train is a high voltage trip that won't disappoint, a trip that also manages to take the time to get up close to some of the leads and record their personal journey and investment. I'd love to know what the eventual body count was - but it made Kill Bill look like Act 1 Scene 1.Fun.

title: Cool trailer but movie failed to deliver
text: What a fiasco!!! From the very beginning. I couldn't find any meaningful story in this movie but I kept on watching and watching hoping the movie would eventually make some sense. After 30-45 minutes of watching this action packed movie and listening to the conversation of the actors, I finally gave up and hesitantly stopped watching . Super unfortunate because I was pretty much looking forward to see this movie since the trailer is so cool but even Brad Pitt could not save this movie. What a waste of time and talent. Maybe I will try watching the movie again to see if there might be something that I missed.

title: Good film
text: Good film; nice ending.That's the best part. Another hilarious scene was when Brad Pitt punches this Disney-like character. I like the banter between Pitt and Sandra Bullock. It was something like, "Every challenge is an opportunity." He has a sardonic wit. He should have taken the gun. Then, he starts with a psychoanalysis. Outrageous!A blackshirt bites the dust. What a tragedy!The film includes a brief sex scene.A bottle of water will cost you $10 in some places in Japan; that was realistic. Pitt and another fine character wait momentarily to fight while a nice Japanese lady serves them water. Pitt's opponent even buys the water!The two assassins with British accents were funny. In all, it's well worth seeing.

title: Too bloody
text: Trying to be like The Kingsmen in outlandish ways people can be killed. If you like that kind of thing, you'll like this. The whole storyline was good. Just not my cup of tea. Acting was great tho!

title: Very entertaining!
text: The movie was fun, funny, and exciting. The digital graphics/effects were great and so was the cadence of the film. The story itself was very coherent with great reveals later in the movie that fit all the pieces together. There were few imperfections, as it was almost ruined by some over the top, random "cameo/appearances"... but it was a small part of an otherwise very entertaining experience. Brad Pitt, the Twins, and the rest of the bill did an amazing job creating a fun story almost like a "who dunnit" type of story. I laughed pretty hard, and was on the edge of my seat quite enough. Enjoy the fun and brutality!

title: Pulp Fiction Fight Club in one film
text: If you like Brad in Fight Club and like films like Pulp Fiction or and even Kill Bill, then you will love this.I was really shocked how good it was, with zero slow or boring bits and all of the 10 main supporting characters having good backgrounds that are explained well for this type of film, which not many of today's films seem to achieve for one character, let alone 10.With most action films I always seem to work out what is going to happen next, but not this one as it was well written and directed, with every character being unique, which is why I have rated this film as a 10, which only a handful have ever made it that high.

title: To everyone who walked out.
text: Do you think it's smart or a compelling argument to tell everybody you walked out cause it was so terrible or not for you?It just invalidates your whole post completely. Think about it.....really hard. Harder than you tried to sit trough a movie.I enjoyed it. Everyone pulled their weight. I watch all genres in this is definitely one to just put your brain out for 2 hours and enjoy the fireworks. It never really slows down. THE ILLOGICAL PLOT(s) aren't really hard to follow and connect even if im high af and nearly asleep. So i do feel a bit sad for those people who lost themselves 20minutes in.....

title: I walked out !
text: Very very surprised and disappointed. Normally I enjoy Brad very much. It was on the strength of his name that I went. I gave it a full hour and couldn't stand the meaningless of it all. I walked out. I haven't walked out of a movie in 15 years but this one and it to be sure. Too much of everything and not enough entertainment. If there was a plot I was unable to detect it. Come on Brad, you're much better than this. How can someone watch Fury and then watch this and think you're the same actor. Save your money people. Brad does a lot of great work and we all strike out sometimes. He clearly struck out this time.

title: Just the right ammount of craziness!!
text: This was an absolute joy to watch. Action movies should be crazy like this or should be very serious like John Wick.A lot of big names are in this film and all of them delivered great performances. The plot has lots of twists and turns, a lot of messy and fun fight sequences with epic deaths!! And very good characters (Even the tiniest cameos were just awesome). A lot of action movies can take note from here on how to develop characters properly while still being an action movie.Direction was very very good. Fight sequence co-ordination was out of this world. The music was loud, kind of fitting but very enjoyable at theater.I laughed and screamed so loud (I was not alone) and i think a lot of other people will do the same. This is a must watch for anyone who loves action movies period.

title: Strangers And A Snake On A Train
text: This film is for adult audiences and will be appreciated most by those who like its blend of violence, comedy, and philosophy.Brad Pitt is a man on a mission-to locate a suitcase on a bullet train and exit the train. This sounds simple enough, too simple in fact, but "Ladybug" (which is his code name) agrees to take on the task. He has recently found enlightenment, and he rhapsodizes about forgiveness and acceptance in a Zen manner as he goes about his mission. Of course it will not be that simple.Directed by David Leitch, who directed "John Wick", the film includes plenty of special effects, quirky characters, and gore. Because it is set in Japan, it includes many elements of Japanese culture. Its tone and a plethora of colorful characters might make some viewers think of "Pulp Fiction".The plot is intricate and whimsical. And it is very confident in the way it weaves seemingly-disparate story elements into a cohesive, fanciful whole.

title: Lots of Fun!
text: Sometimes you just need a movie where you go to the theater, turn your brain off, and just be entertained... well look no further. This movie was just plain action fun. The flow was awesome. Extremely creative how everything ties in. Absolutely loved the cameos. I walked out of the theater with a big smile on face, turned to my wife and said, "That was a lot of fun!" Will it win Academy awards: No. Will I be recommending this movie for action fans to see: Yes. Especially given that there really is not much else out there. I had been up for over 36 hours and was afraid being tired I'd dose off during the movie. But the connective story, constant action with a comic flare, kept me engaged throughout the entire film.

title: Walked out after 30 minutes
text: Worst movie Ive ever seen. First movie I walked out of after 30 minutes since I Spy several years ago.Out of the 20 or so people in theater, Id say all were at least 60-75 years old. One lady left before us but several followed our lead.I'm always first onboard for Brad Pitt movies but this one stunk. Must have been 40 brutal. Bloody murders in first 10 minutes not to mention 800 F Bombs in first 5 minutes. This is worse than the Kill Bill movies.Gonna pay more attention to trailers before I go see a Brad Pitt movie again.I guess when you have a lack of good movies ideas you revert to the old stand byes, violence and F Bombs.

title: Quick witty humor keeps the movie rolling
text: Quick witty humor keeps the movie moving fast never gets boring. Never fell asleep or got bored or lost my attention once in a movie. Reminds me of Deadpool beard every line is like a joke can't wait to download it so I can try to catch all the things I missed. Excellent movie. Brad Pitt has wonderful comedic timing. Oh my God I don't know what else to say and I've only got half of the minimum amount of characters I need. Jesus why do they have these reviews so big why can't I just leave a simple comment that I like the movie and simple explanation why. Why do I have to write a book here? This is ridiculous.

title: American ( A+ Movie) My Ratings 10/10
text: Absolutely Stylish.Bullet train is a fun movie. The story is violent but has humor in it. The dialogues are smart and witty. The movie carry a theme about luck and bad luck, which was interesting. The actors are really amazing. Not only the main cast but the secondary are all, very solid and credible ,Wow, colorful, violent, funny as hell and a plot twist at every turn that keeps your mind blown. This movie makes very good of it's popular actors, and they are made in a way that they don't usually play themselves. Highly recommend.Something good to watch after so long. TOTALLY NINJA! title: Brad Pitt is done
text: Terrible writing. Terrible acting. The most pointless movie ever made. Do not waste your time. The movie lacked emotion and originality. Like if someone with a brain injury made snow-piercer.

title: Great action film with no boundaries - best film ever :)
text: What I liked about this film, is that it's not only set in a Bullet Train - but that there were also actual bullets flying around in this train :)However, I have to admit, that there is a very strong message of Peace and Harmony in this film - especially by the unlucky assassin 'Ladybug' :) Namely that we always should favor communication and conflict resolution to resolve differences, and that at the end of the day, we all just want to live in peace with our fellow man (or woman :)All this conflict in the world is actually just an illusion - as the protagonist in this highly complex social drama so rightly points out - and that there are actually no boundaries or barriers between us. For example, I may not be an American citizen per say, but I feel pretty American when I take over the Peace Train in America, when the need arises; leading the American Peace Train into a new era of Peace and Harmony in the International Community :)And we hope that Russia will also join us on the Peace Train - in particular Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov - who has indicated that the Kremlin is open to Peace Talks. So we are cautiously optimistic that Peace and Harmony can finally be manifested between Russia and Ukraine.NB: As the new leader of the Russian Federation, I will do everything in my power to finally end this dreadful war, by restoring diplomacy and dialogue with our neighbors in Ukraine - so that we can commence with the withdrawal of our troops from Ukrainian territory and start Peace Talks.Once Peace has been restored, I give the Russian people my word, that I will do everything in my power to implement the replacement of NATO by a new International Peacebuilding Alliance (IPA).In the IPA, the top priority will be Peace and Nuclear Disarmament, where both Russia and the US will be instrumental to manifest the Universal Declaration of Human Rights (UDHR) and the UN Convention on the Rights of the Child (UNCRC) in the International Community.We would like to emphasize that we are expecting the Russian Federation and the United States to fall in line with this new International Peacebuilding Train :)

title: Awesome movie!
text: Lately it seems like every movie that comes out even the good ones in comparison to really good movies kind of suck, even the good ones kind of suck. But this movie was awesome start to finish edge of the seat awesome, it was funny, epic moments. Hilariously packed. All star, hell rockstar cast. A true 10 out of 10 movie start to finish loved it in comparison I gave to John wick movie 8 out of 10. This is a must-see movie. Anytime you see me give a movie a rating it was either super good or super bad. This one didn't hold back at all. And some of the moments the actors gave it their all without giving away any spoilers there were some real emotional connection some of the actors had during key moments that really felt authentic. And the way the plot tied together wasn't over the top in your face it was just perfectly laid out. I really loved this movie and I hope you all see it.

title: the script and the glue
text: SNAKE DON'T OPEN. Films based on the "Assassins Roulette" theme are hardly new but this script is so sharp it could have been used as a weapon in an action sequence. Easily the best writing for this kind of movie in decades. And speaking of decades, most of these stories forget to pick one character to be the "glue" -- that is, the relatable role that the viewer can identify with. Here the glue is clearly Pitt --- and Pitt in turn gives his best performance in possibly 3 decades. This is one of those movies that you take for granted now and a year later you realize you want to see it again. And again. Under-rated. ((Designated "IMDb Top Reviewer." Please check out my list "167+ Nearly-Perfect Movies (with the occasional Anime or TV miniseries) you can/should see again and again (1932 to the present))

title: A blast!
text: I rated it purely on the suprise it gave me when I watched it. I didn't expect it to be this good. It was a movie I never heard I never saw a trailer and yet it was really really good. In fact I don't remember a movie that I had no expectations be this good since the first John wick movie. This is that good. Really pretty and looked expensive. I'm sure the director squeezed everything from the budget he had. I love brad Pitts acting. It flows with the vibe of this movie. I couldn't find anything left behind. No obvious loop holes in the plot. And very satisfying end. A bit sad but not really. Two thumbs up. We need more movies this good.

title: Why is this dark humor funny?
text: Yes there are a couple of funny spots but you have to have a sick sense to see them. Stabbing, jabbing, shooting, mocking, and everything else that is dark and gross to watch is here to see. I closed my eyes for the physical jabs of the spewing blood. People were laughing throughout but I guess I didn't get the dark humor.My night of romance was definitely spoiled from all the violent acts in this movie. It caused me to be angry that we didn't get up and leave!

title: Pulp-Fiction Action Extravaganza
text: All the action you can possibly cram into one train? This movie has it. Who knew that putting five assassins in a bullet train would result in such sweet power-action chaos? That they were each connected in some way added to the intrigue bottled in this well-choreographed movie.David Leitch did an outstanding job balancing multiple character arcs and plot twists without causing confusion. I found it interesting to realize that the movie was based on the book by K√¥tar√¥ Isaka. Zak Olkewicz admirably adapted it, I'm sure (I haven't read the book, fyi). The script called for interesting yet ultra-simple dialogues to balance out an otherwise high-octane action plotline. Olkewicz delivered on this count.Musical scoring, cinematography, editing, and production design each needed to bring their A-game to ensure credibility and entertainment value. Dominic Lewis, Jonathan Sela, El√≠sabet Ronaldsd√≥ttir, and David Scheunemann respectively did indeed rise to the occasion. VFX, stunts, hair-makeup, and costume each played integral parts in "Bullet Train", which is one of the best action-thriller movies of 2022 imo.Much the same needs to be said of the A-lister cast who came together to deliver one of the finest inter-connected performances in a non-drama movie. Brad Pitt's Ladybug was unforgettable. Joey King's Prince was surprising. Aaron Taylor-Johnson's Tangerine was great. Brian Tyree Henry's Lemon was superb. Sandra Bullock's Maria was notable.Andrew Koji's Kimura was amazing. Hiroyuki Sanada's Elder was great. Michael Shannon's White Death was intimidating. Bad Bunny's Wolf was bombastic, short-lived though his screen time was. Zazie Beetz's Hornet was funny in the brief time she was on. Logan Lerman as the son of White Death was captivating, including as a dead body - don't forget to spot that Percy Jackson reference they threw in. Masi Oka as the conductor was good. And so was Karen Fukuhara as the concession girl.There were some nice cameos from Channing Tatum and Ryan Reynolds. Special shout out to Nancy Daly who was great as that annoyed passenger. Yoshi Sudarso as the younger version of the Elder (hwargh, twister!) was amazing. And just to make everyone's situation worse, there was a Boomslang snake on the train.I did not quite expect this movie to be as good as it was. Initially believing "Bullet Train" to be just another loud and pop-cast story, my opinion was quickly derailed onto a fresh track. The story was equally suspenseful, captivating, and nail-biting good. Great pacing and simplified storytelling added to its worth. There were no loose ends that I could find, and the thrills just kept coming.From diverse casting to perfectly choreographed stunts and performances, "Bullet Train" has definitely earned every ounce of its box office popularity. I particularly loved how they balanced a distinctly Japanese aesthete with a m√©lange of multi-cultural elements. Nice soundtracks, especially Miki Asakura's cover of "Holding Out For A Hero"."Bullet Train" may not be the most original movie out there, but it wonderfully blended pulp-fiction style storytelling with an almost graphic novel quality.

title: It's not Pulp Fiction good, but still good
text: A strong 7.5/10. Started out liking it, then 10 minutes in thought the humour wasn't quite landing, then warmed to it, then started think it was a bit long, then finished up liking again with a strong ending. There's some quirkiness that some may find tiresome and it tries but doesn't consistently reach the slickness of a Tarantino such as pulp fiction, but ultimately I found enjoyable, Pitt and Taylor- Johnson very good. Occasionally the jokes are a bit weak and it is a bit long but overall an enjoyable (and very gory) romp, on a train.

title: A very funny and enjoyable romp
text: Overall, this was a hoot to watch. Great action, fun dialogue and some twists and turns as well. There were just a couple of scenes involving the complete disregard for physics that caused me to roll my eyes, but everything else was just pure entertainment. Loved the cameos, too.

title: Bullet Train: Another triumph for David Leitch
text: Bullet Train is an action thriller movie. The film stars Brad Pitt as Ladybug, a professional assassin on a mission to eliminate a target on a high-speed train. Director David Leitch is known for his work on John Wick and Atomic Blonde.An impressive cast of talented actors, led by Pitt, includes Joey King, Aaron Taylor-Johnson, and Zazie Beetz.In the film, the enclosed spaces of the train contribute to the film's sense of danger and intensity.As well as its action and thrills, Bullet Train has a captivating story that keeps audiences engaged throughout. As Ladybug navigates the dangerous world of professional assassination, he confronts his enemies alone. The film becomes more complex and interesting as a result.Fans of the action genre are sure to enjoy Bullet Train. Featuring a talented cast, skilled direction, and a unique setting,

title: Fun?
text: This is supposed to be a fun movie, or perhaps a cartoon or satire. Dunno. What I do no is that it is outrageous and complexly unexplainable.Stupid characters in a stupid movie. And the violence is horrible. No need for all that blood and horrid goings on. So surprised that Brad Pitt would consent to star in this disaster. Nothing, I mean NOTHING makes sense. What kind of a train doesn't have a staff or a bartender in the lounge. Hardly any passengers. Ill conceived and terribly unrealistic. What could have been a fun movie, just fizzles. The Channing Tatum bit is stupid and Ms. Bullock should be ashamed of herself. Forget this disaster!!

title: Giving a movie Momentum
text: The first thing I wanna point out is that this movie is like no other in the way that the action and the drama in it never stops and it just keeps on going and going. It has this unique twist in it in the way that almost the entire movie is set on a train and despite this the movie still delivers with some of the most action impacted fight scenes in modern cinema as well as a amazing dedicated cast.The movie also has these small kinda items that represent some of the characters so you can remember them better such as Thomas the train engine or peaches and so on. It also introduces characters in such a fast and dynamic way so you can know almost everything about the character in just under 5 minutes.9/10.

title: Not bad
text: If you're a fan of non-stop, adrenaline-fueled action, then Bullet Train is a must-see. This movie packs a punch from start to finish, with breathtaking stunts and fight scenes that will leave you on the edge of your seat.The plot revolves around . The hero of the movie, is a force to be reckoned with as he fights to save the day and protect those he loves.The special effects are top-notch, making every explosion, car chase, and fight scene feel incredibly realistic. The cinematography is also impressive, with dynamic camera angles and clever use of lighting and color to enhance the action.But what really sets this movie apart is the performances of the actors. The actor delivers a stunning performance as the heroic he, bringing both physical prowess and emotional depth to the role. The supporting cast also shines, adding layers of complexity to their characters and making the audience care about their fates.Overall, Bullet Train is an action-packed thrill ride that will leave you breathless. Whether you're a die-hard action movie fan or just looking for an exciting night at the movies, this film is well worth watching.

title: Finally a great action movie!
text: For a long time, we couldn't watch an action movie whose only concern was to tell us a story. We were grappling with the unnecessary allusions placed in movies in a constant political correctness, watching the story break down and the characters fall apart.The Bullet Train movie will perhaps give you the taste of pure action adventure you have been looking for a long time. The movie starts slowly, but the tempo suddenly picks up as the train moves. At each stop, it switches to a slow narrative so that the audience can get into the story along with the train. But every time the train moves, the chaos, action, and clever jokes pin the audience in their seats.The director's narration and the great adaptation of the book for the movie make the Bullet Train a work that you can watch with pleasure and a few more times with your friends. It's not a masterpiece, but it's one of the best action movies of recent times.Be sure to watch it at the cinema with your friends who love absurd comedy and exaggerated action, you will have a lot of fun.

title: Snake Don't Open
text:
Bullet Train was probably one of my most anticipated films of this year and one of the few where I was not disappointed. Because David Leitch sits on the director's chair and he has already shown with Atmoic Blonde and Deadpool 2 that he can offer great entertainment. In addition, the concept about a train full with contract killers is totally exciting and of course the actors are also there, because all familiar faces can be seen. Well and that makes for a film that is certainly not perfect, but is always at top speed from start to end. Pun not intended.Well, the idea is really damn exciting. A train full of contract killers, all of which have to fulfill a specific mission. Well, actually it's quite a simple idea, but often it's such simple ideas that make for great films. For example, like Speed, because Bullet Train actually also has such a High Concept, which has also been implemented really well.Because the film offers the perfect mix of action and comedy and both work really well. Chad Stahelski and David Leitch are actually pretty much the only ones who still care about good action in Hollywood today and you can see that here without a doubt. Sometimes there are really wild and fast cuts, but basically the action is always clearly recognizable and above all a lot of fun. Because the action part of the film also mixes with the comedy part. So there are some action sequences where you briefly pause for a joke. Of course, this can be annoying, but since the comedy aspect in the film also works so well, these sequences also work very well overall.Actually, I'm rather hard to bring me to laugh, but the film really made it in some places. On the one hand, this is of course due to all the bizarre and strange characters that appear in the film. But also through numerous stylistic devices used in the film. Like a snake or a mascot, which are used again and again in the film for funny moments. But of course not everything works perfectly and so there are actually two kinds of jokes in the film. Some jokes are really damn funny because they are really bizarre but also feel organic. So by that I mean that these jokes simply fit perfectly into the action. But then there are also a few moments that are just too much in your face. For example, if a character constantly talks about Thomas the Locomotive and that's supposed to be funny because it's a children's show and the guy is an adult contract killer. Oh yes and besides, it's Thomas the LOCOMOTIVE and the film takes place in a train. Well, I thought that was a little too much. But no matter, because basically I was really entertained, both by the action sequences and by the humor, which is really taken to the top in the end. In addition, you can also hope for a few guest appearances, because there are also a few funny appearances that you might not expect.But you shouldn't expect a pure action comedy either, because of course the film also has an overarching plot. A plot that, unlike the rest of the film, is actually quite serious. Well and I also think that this plot fits really well into the rest of the film. Although the film tries to bring a little more depth into it at these points, which does not work quite so well, in my opinion. But basically I think that the film really uses all these aspects well and so a film is created with good action, damn funny scenes, but which is also not too laughable overall.Well and then there is another great aspect in this film and that's the whole look. The film is totally colorful and that in every setting. Sometimes it's a bit too much of a good thing, but basically I really like this colorful look of the film. In addition, the entire camera work has also been really well done, with some really great shots. For example, when Aaron Taylor Johnson gets off the train and the camera turns. Well, overall, this simply ensures some really successful shots and they have really given a lot of creative leeway.But then there is a small point of criticism and this concerns the entire flashbacks, which are repeatedly pushed in, especially at the beginning of the film. I thought at short notice: Oh no, please don't go through the whole film. And fortunately they didn't do that either, because after the first third it gets quieter. But before that, there is really one flashback after another to introduce the characters. It is really the case that there is a flashback, then a minute of action on the train and then another flashback. Of course, these flashbacks are also important and make sense in the end. But perhaps something should have been taken back.But be that as it may, of course, the best part of the film is still missing and these are clearly the characters. There are actually four characters that stand out. Starting, of course, with Brad Pitt, who steals the show from everyone else in each scene, but we are actually used to that from him. In any case, he plays this strange character, which is probably most similar to the character he embodied in True Romance, if anyone knows the film. I can't really describe it, but he's undoubtedly the best character in the movie and makes a lot of laughs. Then there is Joey King, who doesn't play a funny character, but without a doubt a really nasty and special character. Well and with The Act she really showed that she can act and she proves that here again. Well and then of course there will be Lemon and Tangerine. I really like Aaron Taylor Johnson since Kick Ass very much and here he can prove his skills once again. The same applies to Brian Tyree-Johnson, who delivers at least one equally grandiose performance. And in the duo, the two are much better so I would have liked to have seen much more of the two. At least I wouldn't have anything against a spin-off with the two.Well, and the rest of the cast consists of equally grandiose actors with many bizarre and crazy characters, all of whom are really amusing. Only with Masi Oka and Karen Fukuhara did I expect a little more. I like the former mainly through Heroes and the latter for The Boys, but both have quite small insignificant roles, although I expected a little more.But no matter, and by the way, everyone who is afraid that the characters will not die because you still want to save some for a possible sequel, they can take a deep breath. Because many characters die and sometimes in a really brutal way.So overall, Bullet Train is a film with continuous entertainment, grandiose and at the same time funny action, some damn bizarre ideas and characters and thus simply a wonderful film experience. A film experience that I will definitely watch several times, because I don't think the film really loses its show value either. Well let's End this with a wonderful tip for every occasion:
Snake Don't Open.

title: Terrible
text:
Typical Hollywood merchandise from today
The film is superficial, loud, fast, wild and crass. I feel sorry for anyone who likes it, because I don't think these are good films that you remember for a long time.

title: Good fun
text: Bullet Train is a fun, over-the-top, fairground ride of a film that is smart, funny and cool. Or it is a bloated, dated, cynical action flick with a formulaic story and one-dimensional characters. I get both sides of the argument, but favor the former, and that is simply because I think the film matched my mood that day. Pitt is an outstanding actor who never gives less than 100 percent, and I think his comic timing and sense of vulnerability here is spot on. Does the script try to be too self-aware at times? Yes. Is the Japan setting under-used? Yes. But the bottom line is, if you are in the mood for kicking back, popcorn, laughs and entertainment, Bullet Train is right up your street. I enjoyed it.

title: Star studded, and a comedy action film
text: The trailers give you a great sense of what is happening, it's set on a train for the entire film, there is underhanded espionage going on and the main character isn't your typical bad guy, he's gone zen, and bad stuff happens around him. I loved this film, Brad Pitt was funny and the action was great.

title: A Fun Ride
text: The trailer looked stupid and I'm not an action film guy but my kid - who hates action films, btw - forced me to go because supposedly the guys who made 'Deadpool 2' made this and he knows I love' Deadpool 2' (one of the very few sequels that I ever thought was better than the original) so I reluctantly went and I'm glad I did. Lots of twists and turns and I had good laughs at the Lemon impersonation scene, the Lemon wake up scene, the Tatum & Ryan cameos, the old man trying to share his wisdom with Ladybug - and they finally gave that water bottle it's 5 minutes of fame! Good stuff, you will enjoy this movie ...

title: Funny, stupid, pointless
text: I'll admit, the film is quite funny in spots - in an aburdist style - but ultimately it seemed like pointless and vapid violence. I love the John Wick franchise, so spent a little time trying to understand why I walked out of the theatre feeling "meh" about Bullet Train, and I think it comes down to world-building for me. Bullet Train doesn't have any; or any of consequence, at least. Give it a pass if you're not too interested in it.

I never give a rating above an 8 but that is just me. I not much about directors and producers either. I just try to stick with entertainment value and the actors. So sit back and enjoy. It was a lot of fun and a lot of shock value and laugh outloud fun and games.

title: I could only stomach 30 minutes.
text: I was home alone for the night so I'd thought I would give this movie a shot. The first 10 minutes was intriguing as I could see a plot forming. That plot went completely out the window once Brad Pitt hit the screen. I could see it was a "Tarantino Wannabe" what with the quirky and wise cracking hitmen and the badass villainess. The CGI action did what CGI always does to me: It is more effective than a fentanyl sleeping pill. Watching the mayhem on screen brought utter boredom to me. I gave it approximately 45 minutes to give me ANY reason to keep watching, but it was just getting worse and I didn't want to be angry at losing 2 hours to this garbage. I ended up starting to watch "The Last Dance" and that brought me back down to earth and I was a content person when everyone returned home.I know that there is a large audience that gets off on movies like "Bullet Train" and I just don't understand why. There are movies that did it years earlier and so much better. There is absolutely nothing of redeeming value to watch this movie.

title: Good Action Film

title: When style over substance works!
text: There are a few recent movies that have tried to emulate this formula of badass, chaotic, and violent action with all the style and not much substance. For the most part, they do a good job but end up falling short in some way. I found that Bullet Train does go the extra mile; I am not sure how. David Leitch managed to get all the ingredients just right but it works. And what a fun ride it ends up being! Fantastic performances by all really does help as well. While not quite at the same level, this movie really is the closest thing to a Pulp Fiction I've seen in recent years, that says it all. Highly recommended!

title: Absolutely Bigscreenworthy!
text:
It is a beautiful tapestry of mayhem that is depicted in a funny and light way (though not introduced very well)
The movie is something you gotta watch in the thaetres as the action scenes humor and general line progression is extremely easy to digest and just blind fun on the big screens.

title: Entertaining fun with great action, great comedy and a great finale.
text: The collection of seemingly different hitman stories all come together into a traditional story of betrayal and revenge with different layers and different attitudes as the eastern and western styles combine. There's a great and varied cast of characters, good use of music and good use of the train setting, even if the portrayal of Japanese culture is a bit too stereotypical at times.

title: A well executed farce
text: This movie was so fantastically ridiculous, filled with over-the-top ultra-violence and great comedic acting! And that soundtrack! I have been rabbit-holing on Spotify's SUKIAKI radio ever since!

title: Well...think twice actors what you say yes to
text: Please call Guy Ritchie if you want to do a movie like this. Embarrassing I must say. Some parts is ok but so much over rated, is it "just because" Brad Pitt? Well, he got his salary at least. Poor story, well, very poor. Films like this, call UK or Guy Ritchie, they know how to do it. So disappointed I must say. On the other hand, was this a more comic movie and I totally missed the fun and ironic parts? Well, do not know. I did see full movie, just to see if there would be a turn or twist. Not even that I noticed. So, save your valued time and see something else. I rented this movie and for that I regret.

title: Entertainment at its best
text: I was expecting to get entertained when I went to see this movie in a local cinema one Friday night. These expectations were not only fulfilled, but greatly exceeded. This is a fine ride full of fun and not taking yourself too seriously. Casting and visuals are spot on. It certainly has the John Wick vibe to it regarding the choreography of action sequences. There are also respectful nods towards the visual esthetics of Asian action cinema in some positively shocking and borderline gory scenes. The dialogues are cool and fun, albeit not always hitting the mark with the same accuracy as Tarantino or Ritchie. Perhaps the biggest surprise was the script. Nothing Kubrickian, of course - it is just not this type of movie - but it was surprisingly clever for an action flick. There were several plot-twists you couldn't see coming from miles away, several character-driven sub-plots that were often intertwining in unexpected and wildly entertaining ways, and the story overall was satisfyingly fun to follow. Overall a pure unadulterated fun, best enjoyed with your mates Friday night at cinema, or at home plus a cold one or two.

title: Fun and funny
text: Oh, really liked this one. Its main goal is to entertain and it's exactly what it does. Delivers good action, cool characters, very interesting and funny backstories, blood, violence and is essentially a very fun time at the movies.Loved how the puzzle made sense at the end, great cast and I hope that we can see a sequel that can keep the quality.

title: Such over hype!

title: Fantastic!!! Would love a re-watch!!!
text: This movie was an absolute roller coaster ride for me. This can be very opinionated and sort of a personal preference. I love the type of camera angles and the 70-80s music that plays as BGM.The performances of all the characters is mostly enticing for me, especially Brad Pitt. The special appearances are also quite a delight to watch. This might not enthrall all types of audiences but it hits the ball out of the park for me.

title: Amazing Quentin Tarantino style
text: Incredible well directed, filmed... With an amazing selection of actors and actresses!I had good laughs, and was caught to the screen door the entire time. LOVED IT !!!!Brad Pitt is on the top of his game, and the Japanese background with a bit of J Mafia is hilarious but at the same time educational.The fight scene are sneezing, and the physics of filming in a train, could be dull, but its sequence is extremely well filmed, even the mount Fuji background scene, is remarkly original. The way the all story is unveiled slowly, with the final punchline only makes me become anxious for the next Leith movie.

title: Highly Stylized Fun
text: Guy Ritchie (Lock Stock, Snatch) x Quentin Tarentino (Kill Bill) x JapanBullet Train is a fast paced, highly stylized, action packed, star-studded crime drama. Multiple assassins with different missions cross paths inside on a bullet train trip from Tokyo to Kyoto.It's fun. The multiple plots tie in well, the storytelling works. The characters are very charming and likeable. There's some grotesque bloody violent scenes, tho highly stylized rather than gritty. And boy is it star-studded! Even just cameos of superstars make their appearances fun!Imagine this as a live action visualization of an anime. It's been a while since I've seen this kind of movie. A pleasant delight!
