text: I stan almost all the characters in this movie, especially Brian and Brad Pitt. They are all has unique and strong character that could take the audience's sympathy. The story, action, and comedy feels balance and refreshing.Really worth to watch and your money to buy the ticket!

title: Fun and Full of Action
text: I'm the type of guy who criticizes modern movies but I feel this was just a movie for fun. It wasn't for any plot or character arcs or endless sequels. It was pretty great and made me laugh several times. It was full of good action, a lot of blood, but still cool.I also liked the true meaning of the movie which was "things happen because of fate." They referenced it subtly in the movie which made it really nice.I just really enjoyed it and found it fun and enjoyable. Cool cameos, references, actors and messages. But if you a person that criticizes movies in every area (basically me) then don't watch this movie because you might not like it.

title: So boring!
text: The trailer of the movie was interesting, but after the movie, I couldn't help but say that it had all the best scenes of the movie. You can watch the trailer and skip the movie... I really expected a lot from this movie because the reviews I read said that the movie is not boring at any point. But surprise surprise, it was really boring! After watching it for an hour, I wondered if I should just stop. But I watched it to the end anyway. About five minutes from the end of the movie was quite tolerable to watch. I give one star to Brad Pitt and one star to split between Ryan Reynolds and Channing tatum.

title: Unexpected good movie
text: Saw this movie with my friends and I wasn't expecting anything since the title and promotional poster seemed very cliche. However, the movie had all the cliches but done right.Very good camera work and character intro with manga like montage. It was expected but new at the same time. Even the product placement for the Fuji water was done so well that you don't even hate it as a product placement.The fight scenes were done well and several shots of the usual mafia gang fight. Brad Pitt's character might be a bit too "bystander" hero type, but still moved the movie forward without making it too awkward.I would recommend this movie for an easy date night and enjoy the camera work.

title: Even better the second time
text: It's funny how sometimes, when you rewatch a movie, the complaints you had about it before are either gone or aren't as prominent. The first time I watched Bullet Train, I would have rated it a low 8, maybe high 7. I had some trouble keeping track of who was who and why they were on the train. This time, I didn't have that problem and followed it fairly well. If anything, it's in the second half, specifically the last act, where the plot, for lack of a better term, goes off the rails with twist after twist, making for a very convoluted film. But honestly, that's part of the fun: seeing what reveal comes next and how all of the characters are connected. I also thought the character of the Wolf was entirely unnecessary, as he didn't seem to be that connected to the other characters. But, on a second viewing, I realized that I likely wasn't paying attention the first time, as he was connected. Finally, I thought the effects on the train looked terrible. Now, while they aren't fantastic, they look a lot better than I remember. Maybe it's due to getting a new TV in between viewings.The cast and characters are a ton of fun in various different ways. We've got Brad Pitt as a snatch and grab artist dealing with mental health issues caused by him constantly bringing others bad luck. We've got Aaron Taylor Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry as "twin" assassins, one of whom swears constantly and the other of whom judges people based on Thomas the Tank Engine. We've got two more assassins who are mainly there to give us some super cool fight scenes. We've got a teen girl who's a complete nut case. And we've got the villain, with the reveal of who plays him and the fact that he's almost impossible to defeat earning some of the biggest laughs.The dialogue is sharp, witty, and accompanied by some great visual gags. For example, the twins argue on the number of guys they killed on their last job. The film then flashes back to the job and has them in the moment counting the kills as they happen. The music is catchy, including Japanese covers of some popular American songs, like Holding Out For A Hero. It's well paced, with not a single dull moment. And the action, especially the climax, is fast paced, well choreographed, shot, and edited, brutal, and a ton of fun.Overall, Bullet Train is a darn good time that was even better the second time around. I would actually like to see a sequel, but if they don't make one, at least we still have one heck of a fun movie.

title: wild, funny, and ingenious
text: In Bullet Train, Brad Pitt is a genial criminal who's been working on himself in therapy and needs to steal a briefcase on a train that has an inexplicable number of professional killers on board. This leads to a series of crazy fights and weird plot twists.Brad Pitt is terrifically funny as Ladybug (almost everyone here has a codename or alias). He's a shambling, charming, everyman who just happens to be terrifically good at fighting. The rest of the cast is also marvelous, including Joey King as an innocent-presenting psychopath and Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Tyree Henry as bantering killers.One thing I don't see anyone talking about in the user reviews is the ingenious construction. Even though it's true that much of this can be picked apart, from minute to minute the way it unfolds, and the clever throughlines like that water bottle, have a lovely intricacy to it. Everything fits together neatly, at least until you start thinking about it after.The other thing about this movie is that it is a contemplation of fate. Everyone in the film talks about fate and luck (Ladybug talks about his bad luck, King's character Prince talks about her good luck). I wouldn't say the movie's philosophy of fate is especially consistent, but that may be because the movie is more concerned with how fate is perceived than what it actually is.(Director David Leitch's follow-up movie, The Fall Guy, talks about wrapping the central thesis of a film in the tasty bacon of action scenes, and this movie appears to be exactly that.)So come for the action, vibe on the goofy philosophizing, observe the construction, take note of the plot holes, and have a good time.Highly recommended.

title: Utterly overrated
text: Pathetic attempt to knock off Tarantino, budget blown on well-known actors topping off end of their cinematography with predictable American-trash action and corny one-liners. 2 stars at best.

title: Decent movie - lots of laughs and some great action scenes
text: The blurb for this movie provides an interesting-sounding plot with multiple assassins on a train, travelling from Tokyo to Kyoto, from which professonal thief Brad Pitt must steal a briefcase.The characters are a mixed bag of eccentrics, all somehow connected to the Japanese mafia and all with their various foibles and insecurities which brings many of them to life in an engaging way.Overall, the storyline just doesn't really work but even so the movie is fun and definitely worth a look if you want a fun couple of hours just vegging out with a group of mates or even on your own, so I'd definitely recommend it.

title: Good black mood
text: A little boring begging but good outcome. Bad Bunny was click bait in the trailer, his participation was no more than 3 minutes representing as always a Mexican narco with sepia too mainstream.

title: What Walts Watching
text: If Directors Quentin Tarantino, Matthew Vaughn and Guy Richie had a movie baby it would be Christened, "Bullet Train".In fact, Director David Leitch is responsible for this non-stop action, comedy, thriller movie filmed mostly on a Bullet Train speeding to Kyoto, based on a book by Kotaro Osaka.This is possibly the most violent, darkly hilarious movie I've watched since the mind bending "Everything, Everywhere, All At Once", but it may not be everybody's cup of tea.They say: The end of the line is just the beginning.I say: No, once you've reached the end of the line at Kyoto the film is mostly sorted and done, but what a ride.The butt ugly Brad Pitt plays "Ladybug" who looks like every white homeless man you've ever seen in this all star cast.Pitt is at that stage in his career where he just wants to have a great time on and off screen.As "Ladybug" he's an extremely unlucky assassin determined to do his job peacefully.So he even leaves his gun in his locker, but still manages to create some carnage on the worlds fastest train."Ladybug's" mission puts him on a collision course with lethal adversaries from around the globe.It's like the Olympics of bad guys.Representing the UK are "Tangerine" and "Lemon" the most unlikely twins who steal some of the best scenes.Aaron Taylor-Johnson who plays the first fruit was actually in Vaughns' "Kick Ass" so he's no stranger to this type of wise-cracking movie, while "Lemon" is actually American actor Bryan Tyree Henry who pulls off a great British accent.Playing for Japan is Hiroyuki Sanada as "The Elder" and not even "Ladybug" has time for his stories and wisdom.Actor and composer, Bad Bunny is wearing Spains colours as "Wolf".While Joey King as "Prince" makes the best assassin on this commute.Theres more but that would require a spoiler alert, plus very funny cameos from some huge Hollywood Walk of Fame A-Listers.It's all leading to a meeting with the soulless, psychotic "White Death" gangster whose waiting on the final platform."Bullet Train" rolls out like a first player gaming experience.All these villains are connected, but with conflicting objectives-on the world's fastest thrill-ride through Japan.The train itself is one of the stars.Its central casting name is actually Shinkansen."Bullet Train" is just its colloquial name in English and it's now middle aged like this reviewer and its marquee star.Despite the movies best efforts, over its history there has not been a single passenger fatality or injury on board a Bullet Train due to derailments or collisions."Bullet Train" is like a bloody Movie World thrill ride with Brad Pitt as your tour guide.Watch on a big screen before it goes to a streaming service...it won't be the same experience.

title: Very fun action movie, worth the cinema ticket
text: This movie was really fun, the action is non-stop and spectacular from the beginning to the end, and the characters are charming and quirky. The script is good enough and they get you invested and wishing your favourite characters could escape that mess alive. Also, the cinematography is great, the exotic Japanese setup helps a lot with that. It's very colourful and visually attractive.Apart from that, they have Brad Pitt...he is still in great form and able to provide the eye candy. He gives a great performance and has a very good comedic timing. The rest of the cast are doing great too. And I loved the other stars cameos.

title: The Little Train that Couldn't.
text: Not even Pitt could save this movie. Rarely have I been so disappointed in a film... nothing original, funny or even interesting. Pitt played himself, which all know needs a partner to reflex off of. Love Pitt but this gets a low, low rating from me.

title: Movie of the year contender
text: Bullet Train is by far the best movie I've seen so far this year. The action & comedy blend well and there are even some emotional moments within the story that bring it all together. Brad Pitt is the main character but Brian Tyree Henry's role as Lemon stole the show to me. Originally introduced as an Antagonist (one of many) his superior acting in both tense and humorous moments stood out in what I would call a breakout performance. Visually this movie is amazing. Effects aren't too over the top and the color grading was flawless. The plot itself was a very different approach than expected. The attempt to keep things as simple as possible but it only became more chaotic overtime. The random enemy cameos were dope as well. They were interesting enough to fit perfectly where they were without overstaying or wanting more. Overall this movie was a great one. Definitely recommend it !

title: Good movie, but
text: I am writing this to say there are so many bots giving 10 star reviews. Look at all the 10/10 reviews and tell me how many of the usernames are in the format of Name-String of numbers, (eg "brgds-4023")good movie tho.

title: Very clever plot
text: Funny, fast-paced, very smart. This is an action movie of the old mold. On top of that it adds on a ton of really cool characters and a plot that is perfectly tied together. We have like 15 people with unique goals on the same train. And everything comes perfectly together. All storylines intermix in clever ways and there are no dull moments in the movie. It's an action movie for smart guys who like a fast and clever plot.I can't praise it enough. It really was a huge surprise all the way. Maybe some will think it's a bit low-brow or simple theme wise, but for the genre it does it all and then some. Brad Pitt is amazing here. This is the sort of stuff that should get an Oscar. He is both funny and cool. Aaron Taylor-Johnson is amazing. So is his friend here, Brian Tyree Henry. Only one who was not perfect acting wise for this action comedy was "the girl". She played a tough girl character and it came off as very fake. All her lines were forced. She wasn't terrible though. And besides this I was blown away by how good the acting was in the movie. This is top level and that's totally unheard off in such silly comedies. I started to like quite a few characters quite a lot. There are like 6 different actors here who by themselves could carry the movie. How often does this happen? Maybe in The Godfather and Casino, but seldom in such silly action flicks.So the movie works in all the ways it tries to. Acting, special effects, action. But by far the best part is the tight and clever plot where all elements interact in clever ways and everything is constantly referred back to. This movie is hype. But it's not only for action fans. If you like detective stories you are going to love this movie. If you like puzzle movies this one will be a classic in your eyes. Of course the shallowness of the plot does make it a one-time watch. There is nothing to it besides what you see. But many comedies are like this. It's just very, very fun to watch. I had a huge blast.

title: One of the best movie in the last few years
text: Man... I loved this movie so much. I had way too much fun. Everything happens fast, but everything makes sense... the jokes about luck in the movie are amazingly done. The characters all have some kind of development to the point where you see yourself attached to all the characters. And one of the best things in this movie is this: no political propaganda, just fun, action and so on... maybe that is the reason some critics did not like it much, because it did not added anything to their agenda. Anyways, I recommend this movie to anyone, it has a lot of violence, but no sensual things, so it usually ok to watch with kids depending of your culture...

title: Horrible
text: What a ridiculous excuse of a movie. A bunch of assassins with horrible English accents, all trying to kill each other for a briefcase of money. The plot is stupid, tiring, and just plain boring. Plus to add insult to injury, they attempt to make killing people humorous, which it is not. I can't believe I wasted $26 for me and my Wife to watch this ridiculous crap.

title: Solid Action comedy
text: Plenty of laughs in the theatre, and compelling action to keep you interested and on the edge of your seat. It's definitely a bit convoluted, but a really fun popcorn movie by any standard.

title: Wow
text: Very ironic and action-packed film that blends comedy and violence in a practically perfect way, giving the viewer a very enjoyable and entertaining film that never tires. The narrative is surprisingly linear even if it doesn't seem like it at first glance and manages to render very well even if shot all on a train practically until the end. There are many twists and turns and all the characters are very characterized, even those who appear for a very short time before leaving the scene and this makes the film much deeper than one would expect. In particular there are two particularly well done characters and they are Ladybug who represents the comic part of the film and Lemon is the one who makes a greater contribution to the continuity of the film.

title: Really enjoyed it.
text: I was expecting this film to surround Brad Pitt relentlessly and for it to be 2 hours of him, boy was I wrong.So many characters in this film with their own agendas and screen time, is what makes this film really fun without getting bored.Even the slow parts are filled with slick acting and quick word play, Aaron Taylor-Johnson stole this part of it and did it brilliantly.Everything worked its way up to an unpredictable, yet, partially unbelievable at points climax, but I didn't care.The film has comedy, mucho violence and was just a joy from start to finish.It reminded me slightly of Kill Bill, but, who doesn't love Kill Bill?Definitely give it a watch.

title: Slower than a speeding tortoise
text: First off, this is a gratuitous copy of the legendary Pulp Fiction. However it is not even close to half as good.The plot: some men on a train fight about old scores, over a briefcase of money.OK Good things. Joey King is great, Brad Pitt is good. Aaron Taylor-Johnson is very good and Michael Shannon -although only in for 5 minutes- is great.The rest are very average.Bad things. Dialogue is not that witty, stilted in places and just repeated rather than spoken with feeling. The entire plot is ridiculous. The whole thing smacks of buffoonery and not the good kind.Who might like this? Childish cartoon fans who love surreal buffoonery. People who have no care about what they watch as long as something is making a noise.Who will hate it? Most people.My review is more exciting than the film so...The end.

title: 0 to 200mph on the comedy train
text: This movie was funnier then I thought it would be, with just the right touch of heart. Fast past and fast moving, the title cards (a nice throw back to the silent films) kept you in place so a you could see all the scenery as it goes by. And the scenery was exceptional! The Action was well placed and moved along. For a movie that takes place in one train there was enough variety in every part of the train to keep it interesting.Well worth the price of admission.

title: Such a lovely time at cinemas <3
text: For just 86mil $ this film made a perfect job with this kind of giant cast and this much of quality cgi.Surprises during the film made me smile. Seeing Pitt's face and watching him on screen with this much of screen time felt so good after a long time. I liked the action sequences and some of the comedy really made me chuckle or even laugh and I ended up having a good time.I am glad we get to watch this film, where the films are supposed to be watched, at the cinemas.I also would like to see this film at a home cinema system with 4k bluray copy.Only thing I can complain about is , at my imax cinema they showed this film with 2.35:1 aspect ratio despite I'd thought since I am paying extra to go to Imax I'd have a 1.90:1 aspect ratio. They was a disappointment. I don't know if it's the same everywhere.

title: All aboard the Bullet Train!!
text: The movie is filled with action, characters, blood, plot twists, and more to talk about it for a long time! Wanted to point this out that three cast members from a recent film that was in theaters are in this film again that makes it so ironic and funny. The movie was a whole blast, it was great, and entertaining to watch again in my opinion.

title: All style, no substance
text: As "Bullet Train" (2022 release; 128 min) opens, we are introduced to "The Father", who watches as his young son is recovering in the hospital. We then go to "Ladybug", the Brad Pitt character who is walking as the Japanese cover of "Stayin' Alive" blasts from the big screen. Ladybug is just taking a new high-risk job, this time he needs to recover a brief case full of money from a bullet train going from Tokyo to Kyoto... At this point we are less than 10 min into the movie.Couple of comments: this is the latest big budget movie from director David Leitch ("Atomic Blonde", "Deadpool 2"). Here he brings us a tale involving multiple hitmen who are all on the same bullet train going towards Kyoto. First of all, don't worry about the plot. It is nigh impossible to follow. So we are left to enjoy the stylish production set on board of the bullet train, and the many, many, many tightly scripted fights. This would've been a complete waste of time but for the charming lead performance by Brad Pitt. But in the end, this film is all style, and little to no substance. One final note: the real life bullet train from Tokyo to Kyoto runs 2 hrs. 8 minutes, the exact running time of the movie."Bullet Train" opened in US theaters in early August and has done quite well at the box office. The Labor Day early evening screening where I saw this at here in Cincinnati was very well attended. If you are a fan of Brad Pitt, or love action movies without much substance, I'd readily suggest you check this out, and draw your own conclusion.

title: Highly recommend
text: This movie is one of those movies that you watch whenever you want because it's incredibly entertaining and it doesn't matter if you take this movie seriously or you don't, because you will have a good time watching this either way,incredible work from david leitch, I thought his style is very unique and smooth and it was very suitable for the movie, great character work from all the actors aron taylor johnson joey king but specially brian tyree henry who I thought was fantastic and brad pitt is great as always, the cinematography is outstanding and very well done and it's one of the best things in the movie , this movie is truly fantastic and I hope we get more of this kind of movies as soon as possible.Please go watch it .

title: amazing movie...
text: I thoroughly enjoyed all the twists & turns Bullet Train ride took me on. The plot was full of variety and really engaged one as an audience member. I loved the character development & backstories that were given to draw from. This was such a great time and I didn't want it to end.

title: Well worth a watch. Slick action, well written characters, and a lot of fun
text: I watched Bullet Train recently, and went in expecting very little. The trailer looked pretty average, and the initial reviews suggested the film was mediocre at best. Instead I was surprised to find a well made, well acted film with a story that kept me watching. It's an ensemble cast film with a number of characters on their own stories, with Brad Pitt as 'Ladybug' being the point the plot pivots around.It's entertaining, filled with action and yet not too gory to become too serious. It's funny, with an array of interesting and well fleshed out characters.Perhaps most impressive of all for me was Aaron Taylor-Johnson playing a cockney hitman. I honestly had no idea it was him from his Kick Ass fays, and even after knowing this I can still barely tell. He and his partner were a great duo and added a lot to the film.Throw the characters, plot, and action into the neon lit world of night time Japan and you get something pretty different to the usual action flick.

title: Extremely entertaining. Not perfect by any means but completely perfect for what it is.
text: Extremely entertaining. Not perfect by any means but completely perfect for what it is.You won't be bored for one minute. Fast paced and fulled with adrenaline and action packed scenes. A bit crazy too.The script is well written and there's not one hole in it.The production, editing and effects are too notch, and you will want to enjoy watching it in 4k on a big screen, very cool.I loved the difference characters and its quite funny and has loads of dark humor.A bit predictable at times and makes some cool references to other movies with cameos included.Ending is very satisfying and even though its a ling movie it feels very short.As I said, watch it if you want something action thrilling and entertaining.

title: Lackluster
text: 1. $90 million budget well spent. But the finished product failed to resonate with me.This film had lots of potential but the second and third act totally ruined up the nice build-up the first act was carrying. It was such a shame though, I thoroughly enjoyed the first act with its stylish visual feast, meticulous, immersive and entertaining tone with a stacked cast and surprising cameos. David Leitch did a wonderful direction, it was the terrible script and the poorly written dialogues that ruined the film for me.2. $90 million budget well spent. But the finished product failed to resonate with me.This film had lots of potential but the second and third act totally ruined up the nice build-up the first act was carrying. It was such a shame though, I thoroughly enjoyed the first act with its stylish visual feast, meticulous, immersive and entertaining tone with a stacked cast and surprising cameos. David Leitch did a wonderful direction, it was the terrible script and the poorly written dialogues that ruined the film for me.

title: Train to Busan meets Murder on the Orient Express and John Wick!
text: A stylish action comedy taking place on a 2 hour Bullet train filled with would be Assassins.The action is good, the comedy is jokes and the characters are unique and interesting.The plot gets a bit convoluted at times with so many characters and so many flashbacks. By the end of it, the film feels much longer than two hours, it probably could have ended earlier, but it's an enjoyable, funny and unique watch.

title: Watch it if you wanna have a great time!
text: What a fun movie. The humor mixed in with the serious bids creates a perfect balance and you never get bored. Everything is moving fast, and even though almost everything is set on the bullet train you dont get tired of seeing the same setting because every time their surroundings are used in a different way. I laughed out loud a few times and I also cried. I loved every character (except the daughter of the White Death but I don't really know why I just found her very annoying at times). I loved the dynamic between Lemon and his brother and Brad Pitt's character is just so lovable.Overall this film is a fun experience, I'd defiantly re-watch it sometime in the future. Its a great film to watch with company for sure.

title: Surprisingly fun
text: Did not expect to enjoy this as much as I did.Just a high action thrill ride which is genuinely funny.Expected this to just be a Netflix-like cash grab with big name lead Brad Pitt.But no genuinely a fun movie nothing Oscar worthy but really worth a watch.

title: SLOW START BUT FUN WATCH.
text: In the start I thought that I am gonna regret about this movie but then the fun begin and the comedy by brad pitt and the punch lines of the movies hooks you up till the last along with the suspense of the film and in the regret turns into gratefulness.

title: not good
text: I like Brad Pitt's movies, unfortunately this one is exception. I did not like bullet train at all, totally disappointing. The movie is like collection of a number of small clips, like patch work. It is very hard to focus, because it passes one part and then another, there is no easy flow. Each clip is different from the other parts. The story is weird, unrealistic and inconsistent. There are many violent fight scenes. The cast is also very strange . After corona pandemic, i expected an enjoyable top movie but this one far from it, I am writing this review because i wanted to tell that it is too bad.

title: My Scorecard (8)
text: Funny, strange, eclectic, exhilarating, exaggerated, unrealistic, superstitious.Bullet train is all this and more.Unique characters fight on a train full of strange people, from way too polite waitresses that can't see a violent rumble right under their noses, to huge anime mascottes that block paths and hide secrets. Everything in this movie seems real but, at the same time, it's too grotesque to be true.Every charachter has a backstory, which is shown with flashbacks just when you need it to be known, and are the embodiment of almost every criminal stereotype ever shown on film (they just missed the italian mafia). I really liked how David Leitch portraied their own special desires and reasons to do what they do on that train, they even made me feel for Tangerine and his super strange obsession with Thomas the Tank Engine (he was my favourite).I don't have much to say on this movie; it might have been entertaining, even strange but, above all, surely worth the watch.Nice movie._____________________________________________SCORECARDIn a range from 1 to 5, i'll give a value to each entry written below. The final mark will be the weighted sum of each fraction:Subject (2.5) = 3/5 Development of the Subject (1.5) = 1/5 Direction/Screenplay (2) = 4/5 Attention (1) = 1/5 Recitation (1.5) = 4/5 Musical Score (0.5) = 2/5Final Mark: (2.5 x 2/5) + (1.5 x 5/5) + (2 x 5/5) + (1 x 5/5) + (1.5 x 5/5) + (0.5 x 5/5) = 7.5+ 0.5 Bonus (really good ending, funny and exhilarating chain of events) = 8.

title: Best action comedy of 2022
text: We all love a good action flick staring Brad Pitt, but went in with low expectations and was very very wrong! Funny from start to finish, with excellent action sequences and a star studded cast! Pitt ages like a fine wine and puts in a typical Pitt-esq performance as Mr Ladybug! Aaron Taylor-Johnson as tangerine is excellent alongside Brian Tyree Henry as Lemon and look out for some great cameos! The action scenes are superbly choreographed, with some spot on comedy slapstick timing! If you've got strong stomach, don't mind gratuitous violence and like you action/comedy, give it a watch! Highly enjoyable!

title: All Aboard the Thrill Ride of the Year
text: I had a blast watching Bullet Train. The intensity is enough to get anyone locked into their seat, scared for the next move. The buildup of a thrill ride is strong and captivating. There's so many cameos, and the movie includes such an amazing cast. I couldn't be happier with each performance. And even though we're getting these pieces of the puzzle and think we know how the mystery is going throughout, it was a major shock to see how the big twist goes down. I couldn't believe all of these minor pieces would fit into such a huge frame. And let's not forget the perfect humor that was very unique but fun nonetheless. There are some corny scenes, but I could look past them pretty easily, because the thrill, mystery, comedy, and visuals make up for it. One plot point in particular I'd like to point out is a species of snake that's pretty key to the movie. It makes no sense to those out there who understand snakes, but it's just a fun addition for those who might not understand what they're seeing. I'd love to see a sequel, and really hope to see one in the future. This movie has some pretty good potential to become a classic.

title: Ugggh
text:
Painful. Bullet in the head please!Never recommend this one
Not my style of movie.Plus I hate movies that happen all
On one green screen .......................................................
........................................................................................................

title: People love to criticise. Excellent film
text: This film hasn't had a lot of hype and thus has so far lived off the perceptions of the super critical "film buffs". I enjoyed this far far more than some big film releases recently that have a lot of exposure, are enjoyable to a degree but fall a bit flat.This film is fun, witty and action packed from the start of the film to the end..The story is easy to follow but has plenty of twists and turns..every actor plays their part brilliantly and the camera work / imagination of the director and creative team really is first rate. I think it's an instant classic which I'm going to watch many times.

title: Fun ride
text: Been looking forward to seeing this for awhile now, and it did not disappoint. The ensemble cast adds to the fun element--everything is so fast-paced and light and airy that you don't even have time to get bored--the characters are engaging enough, and the ample plot twists keep you on your toes.Yes, the Pulp-fictionesque dialog especially between the Lemon and Tangerine characters feels unearned, but there's enough originality in Ladybug's (Brad Pitt) reluctant-warrior trope that this feels like a worthwhile addition to the canon of action-comedies. The action scenes were fun to watch, although some of the stunts beggared disbelief even in an action movie. A man jumping on to and holding on to the nose/tail of a moving bullet train, and said man successfully punching through the windshield glass with his bare hands even though I understand he is an action movie-elite-assassin character? Really?But this was such a fun ride I didn't really mind the cartoonish elements.

title: Highly recommend!
text: Such a fun movie! Really loved all the different aspects, my head was gone for a bit there trying to piece it all together but the hilarious moments from every single actor far overweighed that.If you're after a laugh, give this one a watch. Fight scenes were pretty good too. 9/10 from me, highly recommended.

title: Why we go to the movies
text: We go to the movies to be entertained and this movie accomplishes that!The actors all did great and it's quite a ride. Loved the flashbacks and character building. Brad Pitt was silly (in a good way).If you're into a wild ride, you'll dig this film.

title: I didn't expect the film originally.
text: I thought it's a terrible thing that many elements in the film originally, but I'm wrong so bad, it gave me a lot of funny experience as well, if you would like to have a chill night, it's a good one for you.

title: Funny and Fast paced thriller
text: The movie has so many twist and turns. Its amazing and refreshing to see such comedy movie after a long time.Its one of the rare movie, you will love to watch it twice.

title: Absolute Train Wreck of a movie!
text: Don't waste your money on this disjointed film!! Not a single laugh was heard in the audience. Gratuitous gore. Not sure why the good reviews. Hands down in the top three worst movies ever/

title: Lost in Transblabblebrox
text: Always painful to sit through a film trying too hard to be edgy. This was excruciating. Endless yammering, garbled slathering, muddled babbling, awkward preening and sword fights. Brad cranked it up to maximum vapidity with this one. At least in Snatch he was being intentionally annoying and incomprehensible. Here he's just a mealymouthed, permastoned, mentally invalid, mouth breathing snowflake. His most autobiographical role to date. The script is hacky, the action cheesy, the acting atrocious, the direction kitschy. It's as if the filmmakers literally set out to make the worst trainwreck possible. Hell, this dumpster fire wasn't even filmed in Japan. Hollywood just doesn't know how to make interesting, original films anymore. At least it wasn't another cookiecutter superhero mcmovie, I'll give it that. I guess they're trying as best they can, can't ask any more from these bugs than that.

title: Dreadful. A real stinker.
text: One of the rare times that the imdb score led me into a super stinker of a movie. What the heck is going on with this rating? I can only guess that it's because it's still pretty new.People who liked this seem to have really liked it and described it as campy fun. I am not one of these people.I regret taking the time to slog through this almost as much as I regret not pulling the plug after 20 minutes, when it was clear that this was more wreck than train.There are a few moments of cuteness, but that's as close as it gets to comedy.Proceed having been warned that if you're in the "don't like" group, I recommend an early exit.

title: No.
text: Well, I'm not getting my money back... so here is a review of the first 20 mins:It's just not very good. Rewatch Snatch, or anything by Tarantino."Hold on - you didn't watch the whole film... you can't post a critical review you less you watch the whole thi-"No. I watched enough to know I wasted ¬£4.99 on a film that is trying to be something it's not. Actually it's trying (very hard) to be something that it is: which is a bad film... with bad characters... and unbearable dialog.The only positive is that it's broad in how derivative it is - taking in several genres and mashing them up. Unfortunately the result is simply unpleasant to watch. I can handle a popcorn actioner - but this just feels like a pointless flashy waste of time.Shame - because I paid for it, and I was really expecting it to be good.Watching Age Of Adeline now instead, which is weird - but better.

title: Nope a waste of time
text: Too much talking and not enough action. Action begins at the end of the movie and nothing ever made sense with the dumb snake. If I could get my $20 back from wasting my time on this boring movie I would! DONT WASTE YOUR TIME, CHOOSE ANOTHER MOVIE BUT NOT THIS ONE! You welcome.

title: Very Boring
text: I don't know how people are rating nowadays.. I guess they don't see any movies expect sci-fi and superhero genre. Very bad movie. No logic at all. Person hanging in a bullet train. Physics just died den. And stopped watching after half of the movie becoz I already knew what's gonna happen.

title: Way off track
text: Neither funny, nor engaging.Some really annoying characters, with annoying accents.It won't be winning awards anytime soon; at least films like Kingsman have an amount of subtlety and humour in between the fight scenes; this was just like one long fight scene.I realise it's not a film to be taken seriously, but I think you need a certain degree of believability, Bullet Train has not one iota.Some real cliched scenes, cliched characters and cliched dialogue, proving just about anything can be made these days - makes you wonder how bad the Batwoman film must be..........I'll be waiting for the replacement bus service.

title: This is how Good actors fade out of their prime!
text: From the beginning to end, not even one thing is interesting about this movie. The story was heading in the wrong direction right from the beginning just like the train to nowhere. The over the top action and acting kills the little interest popping up here and there. The writer came up with the mother of the dumbest logics in the history of cinema.You tend to think that the story will catch up to speed at some point but only to realise that there's no story boarded on to this train but departed in the opposite direction.Wonder what made the actors agreeing to do this film and what convinced the executives of the stiudio to green light this pile of trash instead of a script.Don't waste your time on this wreck of excuse for a movie.

title: Typical action packed movie for a numb brain with lazy execution.
text: Fast paced edition, witty dialogue and a few funny moments, but most of the fight scenes are way too far fetched or conveniently done on "empty" spaces of the train for hours while -oh, shocking!- nobody notice them or even hear something (and, of course, it has an incredibly convenient and ridiculous ending with poor CGI).But, hey, if you only want to kick back, eat popcorn and numb your brain, this is for you.PS. Thank Jesus that Bad Bunny dies quickly cause, we get it, he appeals to some younger audiences, but a few seconds on screen of his dumb face and terrible acting is more than enough.

title: Inconsistent plot
text: The movie navigates constantly between the absurd and the pretending of being a master piece (trying to emulate -without success- other movies of the genre). Characters don't end up engaging between each other making the movie a bit odd and in some moments boring, just having the extreme action and violence as only way of trying to keep you tuned.

title: Awful schtick
text:
Could not believe how bad this was after reading some reviews, it's trying way too hard to be like something Tarantino would make or has made.Just absolute cringe at the 2 'mockney' assassins, seriously unfunny....the West Ham sticker on his smartphone lol.I could not even say that the movie has style over substance as their was none of either.Dreadful, cliched dialogue throughout.Save your money and re-watch Kill Bill or Pulp Fiction or DeathProof or Once Upon a Time in Mexico or Lock Stock & 2.....
Brad Pitt is so much better than this, 2 stars for the interior of the gorgeous bullet train.Thank you.

title: Yawn
text: Your 13 year old might like this and find it interesting but everyone else is going to be checking their watch after 25 minutes. It's long, cartoony and worst of all smug. I get having all these great actors is fun but they are wasted!I will keep writing bc I'm that annoyed that I stayed awake two hours.And where are the female characters? The only female is a young girl with way too much cosmetic tinkering and Sandra Bullock - who was great but she's on the phone the entire time! We don't even get to see her which is ridiculous!! Meanwhile we see Channing Tatum and Ryan Reynolds for no reason.And what a waste of Michael Shannon! Ok. I'm done. Don't watch this.

title: It is as bad as the title makes it sound
text: It wasn't even a good action flick... everything was so contrived there may have well been no plot. Thought maybe we'd get something with a plot like Inglorious Bastard, but this movie is in it's own class - "don't waste your time"

title: It's not like what I expected!!!
text: I was excited to book a ticket for watching it , but unfortunately the storyline was not good at all.I'm really disappointed !!!I really wanted to leave the cinema during the middle of the movie.

title: Not very good movie I don't think people like it
text: When I was in the movie watching lots of talking especially you especially you Brad Pitt is not very good mourners of the actor lots of stuff is missing there and plus I was watching I see the people in front of me they start leaving some people behind me lots of people that start leaving from the movie theater I think they doesn't like it doesn't like it it's not good movie I don't think I recommended to watch this movie for my friend or another people I hope everybody understand Not recommended If you see the movie the killer the Korean one I watched i enjoyed it more than the best movie of 2022 The killer Korean movie.

title: Unbelievable
text: I was come to see with high expectation, its brad pitt ! Must be something good, but really ended with full of disapointment, the jokes are boring, someone told me its a bad movie and i still watched it, and i regret it so much...

title: When I use the restroom there is some nudity
text: Netflix sent me a reminder to finish watching Bullet Train, wherever I stopped watching is the end of the movie. Also I watch Bullet Train on Netflix which is an endorsement for Netflix, so you guys could send me a check because I will accept it. So Bullet Train sucks because there were way too many characters that didn't matter to the plot or if they did matter, they should have tried harder. There is a bunch of dialogue in the movie which is just as meaningful if I were to put the movie on mute. Like if you're going to put so many words in a movie I would recommend using words that are less unnecessary. Minimum character limit met.

title: Political brainwash
text: It would of been nice movie if not pushing its political messages all over the place.It is sad to see that nowadays every second movie have secondary underly with subconscious messages.And then later people ar wondering why somewhere deep down in they base code is unexplainable hate to each other.To be clear. Im not fully supporting any of the existing regimes. They all have it's flaws. But keep these subconscious messages out of movies or state about them ahead so people who do not want to take part in your endless and pointless games can stay out of it.All that said. I believe that movies can return to the path where you can grasp inspiration, love to each other and see new perspectives of things you've haven't thought of.

title: Potential to be Great, but it's just a hot mess
text: There were so many great performances in this movie and the fight scenes were bloody, but well done. That said, the forced humor was neither cleavor nor original. Just out of place. Aaron Taylor-Johnson is brilliant and is the best part of this film. Brad Pitt is one of my favorite actors because has so much talent, but it's wasted on too many silly lines at the wrong times, so instead of adding to a scene, they take away the impact of what should have been really good scenes. GREAT CAMEOS!!! I won't spoil those for you. Bottom line, save your money. This will be on network TV faster than a bullet train.

title: Too stupid for me to watch
text: Not a real action. Not a real comedy. Not a real thriller. The story mixes everything and at the end the result is a low level "entertaining" stupid "nothing". Yeah, the roles are played well but who cares when the movie has no meaning at all and at the end the viewer is emptier and more inhumane than when he started watching it. I would give less stars but the actors and the movie staff have done much quality work (for something that can easily not exist at all and will not miss anyone). This is definitely not my kind of movie.

title: Exposition with a little bit of movie
text: This movie has talking.And talking.And talking.And talking.Admittedly, these are the closest we get to real movies these days.I can see why people might convince themselves it was entertaining.The worst is when their exposition is of more interesting stories than what you're actually watching - and this is chalk-full of those.Any of the stories they tell would have made a better movie.Maybe it's pure laziness. Who knows?I'm giving it 5 stars, even though I couldn't finish it - because it does have charming actors attempting their best to make it worth watching.It might be up someone's alley.And lets face it - movies are so horrible these days, 'lower than average rankings' deserve to have each 'level of bad' respected.This is solid 'meh'. The pinnacle of modern cinema.

title: Guy Ritchi-tino
text: As a standalone film it's quite entertaining and funny in places mostly because Pitt is a very good comic actor, but the film is just a 2022 version of an old genre, namely classic Tarantino and his rip off mockney copycat Guy Ritchie. Even to the extent a number of characters have ridiculously bad English accents.The premise isn't new either, a number of assassins (each more of a national stereotype than the last) are all onboard a (pulls random word from a dictionary) "train" looking for a (random word) "briefcase" for a (yep) "Russian gangster"It all leads to high jinx and loads of needless violence unless someone happens to be shushing them or walking past in which case they have a chat and a cuddle. All too obvious.Also at 2 hours it's very long for what it is, meaning a number of scenes are needless or drawn out. But it's entertaining I suppose so that's the most important thing I guess!

title: Seen it
text: Deadpool 1 & 2, The Kingsman 1 & 2, Mr. Nobody, Smoking Aces etc. Over the top action with luck being misused as "fate" to excuse any and all deus ex machina they could hamfist into the movie.I see people shocked at the low reviews, but maybe people are just tired of seeing the same movie? I mean Brad Pitt is essentially Domino from Deadpool 2 minus the super power to explain it all away.This movie is what it is and what it is; is a derivative, low effort, nonsense for the sake of nonsense fluff. Save yourself the time and watch The Kingsman for over the top characters with better plot, action, and story.

title: Quentin, is That You?
text: This was streaming on Netflix and I thought I'd give it a viewing. Let me preface by saying I'm a huge Brad Pitt fan. Almost immediately, I had a sense of deja vu, seemed like I'd already seen this movie. If imitation is the highest form of flattery, Mr. Tarantino must be very flattered. This had bits of Inglorious Basterds, Kill Bill, Pulp Fiction and the list goes on. Is there anyone in Hollywood that has a single original idea? The whole movie got on my nerves more than anything. Go ahead, hop on the train and make up your own mind. But for me, I'll stick with QT and avoid these too cool for school ripoffs.

title: Felt like 120 minutes of Graphic Violence
text: If you like a lot of graphic violence without much of a plot and some ok humor, then this is your movie. Brad Pitt does his usual comedic routines, and the rest of the cast do well enough with their lines, along with cameo appearances of Sandra Bullock and Ryan Reynolds, but it doesn't warrant the rating. I guess the director, who also did Deadpool 2, felt this was a formula that worked well and could be repeated, but it lacks the plots of Tarantino or Guy Ritchie that carry their movies. Directors need to focus less on CGI and graphic violence, and more on plots than movies like Bullet Train.

title: Extremely overrated a Tarantino wannaby
text: So what is Bullet train?It's a wannabe Tarantino flick that fails hardWhereas Mr T writes incredible dialogue this film fails miserably there is none of the clever witWhereas Mr T writes great character this film has pale facsimilesWhere Mr T writes fantastic story that weaves and interweaves a series of characters in a symphony of awesomeness this film is flat and dull and misses the mark by a mileWhere Mr T has fantastic gore that makes sense with the movie and is somehow not gratuitous but in fact sets the scene perfectly this films fails yet againDo your self a favour, don't bother watching this cheap rip off just go rewatch any one of Tarantinos films (except Hollywood that was a rare miss imho) and bask once more in excellence.

title: entertaining movie and a bit of comedy
text:
Story:
Five assassins aboard a swiftly-moving bullet train find out that their missions have something in common.Review:
if you looking for an entertaining movie and a bit of comedy this film is for you.The acting was great by all cast, the sceneries were beautifully filmed, and the story was ok but don't take it too seriously as this movie wasn't meant to be taken seriously in the first place, however, i didnt like it too much and i feel like i have seen this type of movies a lot before. This movie definitely felt like it was made by Quentin Tarantino you will understand once you watch it :)its a bit dragged and probably would be much better if it was shorter anyway its 6/10 for me.

title: Fun but boring (is that even possible?)
text: The visuals are great, the action is there but I just could not stomach this for more than 30 minutes. It is basically a compilation of fight scenes, stunts and so on. The story is just non-existent.You get the cheesy character titles on screen, barely any back story on them. Brad Pitt's character is somewhat intriguing, and it is fun to see him in such a role. But I found myself not caring about any of the characters at all. It is all just mindless action.May be if you are in a certain mood, this could be a 7/10, I might try watching it again at some point. For now, 4/10 just for the mindless but high quality action.

title: Violent and pointless boring movies
text: I picked this movie up today because it appeared in the recommended movies, but I immediately regretted it. The streets of Tokyo, the inside of the bullet train, and the Japanese spoken by people in this film are all FAKE. Casting also lacks a sense of unity. Suddenly Bad Bunny appeared as a wolf and and his line just said "NO!" in the non-speaking part. I didn't quite understand the concept of the movie and wasted 2 hours. The director of this movie may have been conscious of Tarantino in the 90's, but there is no doubt that it is clear CRAP. Even if a knife is stabbed into a person's body, that person will not die easily. I've been doing this trick over and over and it seems boring. I will never watch this movie again.

title: Dej√° Vu All Over Again
text: While I wasn't expecting to be surprised by anything in this movie due to so much being shown in the trailer, the bulk of the movie was a hyper-stylized echo of so many movies in the past. It isn't an homage when action sequences are beat for beat ripped from more interesting, and original, Jackie Chan efforts and the production design consists of a neon colored and mythological Japanese backdrop vomited from most of the "too cool for school" (I'm trying to bring that phrase back) action crap from the early 2Ks. I would like to say the dialog is close to being plagiarism, too, but that argument is dulled by the fact that those lines are what are given out as complementary phrase packages at most stock screenplay content providers to incentivise you to purchase a monthly subscription, thanks again Adobe (not a real thing).The movie has a few interesting characters and talented actors playing them (Lemon and Tangerine really grew on me), but the choices made by the director to keep only the "wink wink nudge nudge" takes was exhausting and got old, at least for me, before the halfway point of the film. It could also be a problem that with so many converging side characters, none were able to be attached to my emotional strings to where I cared what was going on, rooted for some, and rallied against others.As for a specific character misstep, it is difficult to understate how awkward a fit Michael Shannon was here; an actor who I have a great respect for regarding his ability to make a fictional character feel real in the world he inhabits. Here he was, like most of the characters, a recycled cardboard caricature of his archetype. I want Bill (Kill Bill) to philosophize about what Superman really represented in the frame of social commentary and what it meant to Bill's ambitions. I want Thanos to elucidate his reasoning to the point where the logic of his means might debatable justify his ends and people in the real world are triggered to discuss it, if only as an unserious devil's advocate.I understand that this movie may be understood by most as simply a fun and diverting action film that doesn't require the audience to deeply engage with any of it. Don't get me completely wrong, I laughed a couple times, had a smile on my face often, and was genuinely surprised in one particular event (train skylights be dangerous, bro). I even had a small sense of satisfaction when various scenes were shown to be interconnected. It just didn't do anything functionally new while wrapping that old hat in a shiny CG package and giving the result a title that Sony was able to buy the rights to.With it's overuse of digital effects, slick and hollow characters and dialog, and a plot that's as forgettable as the Japan they imagineered, Bullet Train came off less like an expression of skill and vision and more like the toys in the current boxes of Cracker Jack's, disposable.One last thing that bugs me, this movie spends 20 straight seconds following a Fiji Water bottle around as it moves through previously seen scenes. It's not just rolling about willy-nilly (bringing this back, too), blurry from the speed and agitation of its movement, it is actually framed in the bottom center of the entire screen (taking up half of the screen's height and a quarter of the width) and pausing from intermittently rotating to show the full logo several times for several seconds each time. This is more intrusive to the fourth wall than the FedEx infomercial that was Cast Away. I mean no subtlety at all. I sure am thirsty for the ancient and natural artesian life's nutrient that is Fijian spring water, though!All that being said, if you have never watched an action film made in the last two decades, this movie would likely be enjoyable to you. If anything, it could serve as cliff notes for techniques used in more capable shows. Enjoy!This review was brought to you by Adobe Screenplay Stock. "We write it so you don't have to!"

title: Not a Great film
text: I love Brad Pitt and have always enjoyed his films, but I didn't enjoy this, it went on too long.They had some good actors, but wasted opportunities, and led me feeling quite irritated and wanting it to finish.

title: Please make this train stop
text: This film is about 2 hours too long. Pitts character is whining the whole film and meant to be a B class operative compared to the others, yet in fight scenes they are not close. None of the characters really likeable except Mr White who has charisma.

title: Horrible
text: I usually don't rate movies, but for this one, I have to. By checking the high ratings at IMDB, I went to this movie. From start to end, it was horrible. There was basically no plot. I could laugh only a couple of times. Do not waste your time even if it is streamed in your channels.

title: 200 minutes of torture
text: Normally I do not write reviews. Just rate movies. So this case in question is a special one. I have not seen a worse movie than this one in 2022 and I am very selective with my movies. I would have rated it two stars instead of one if someone else would have been casted in Brad Pitt's role. Some of the good actors were casted without given due justice to their roles. What an underwhelming experience! For some reason, killing lots of people and destroying cities/infrastructure has become a norm in movies. It is like as if there is no value to human life. Or like heroes have become superheroes in movies that are not supposed to have superheroes. Where is the good old action?

title: This is fun?
text: This film says a lot about today's (American) culture. For those who thought it was fast and fun, I am sad for you. I could not watch it past 10 minutes. The language, inane dialogue, and of course, the incessant blood letting. Plot? I assume there may have been one, covered in blood of course. I didn't stay long enough to glean any semblance of one, other than two psychopaths discoursing and Brad Pitt searching for a briefcase. Are people so inured by Hollywood to see this as entertainment? Not knowing anything about it I thought it might be an interesting sojourn into Japanese/American cross culture. But if this is what the American society wants and needs to see then there is no hope for that nation. I'm sorry I could not give this less than 1/10.

title: Multiracial cast for a small story.
text: Once again, a Japanese story is taken to fill it with extravagant characters and try to please everyone with a multicolored cast and where female empowerment overwhelms. As happened with Godzilla, Ninja Assassin or Speed Racer, we can conclude that Americans have problems adapting films from the eastern empire. Leaving aside this erroneous statement that makes the film ugly, there are nice moments, two or three jokes, a quality edition, a careful direction and a satisfactory ending. Despite all Western efforts, the one who steals the film is a Japanese. Moral: Let's stop destroying Japanese stories once and for all. I give a five only because they did not advance in the disaster.

title: ADHD in a big screen
text:
OK, I know that for every negative opinion there is always a less bad one... or, in this case, lots of extremely generous reviews... but I don't understand how this piece of work can receive the applause of people who have already seen more than - let's say - half a dozen movies during their lifetimes!OK, I also realize that a lot of people go to the cinema to see an "action movie", without raising their quality bar too much, because not all movies have to be Oscar material... But this is too little, whatever the perspective of the analysis might be.It seems like a huge group of producers, screenwriters, directors, actors, etc, all with a severe case of attention disorder, have come together to make a film that is really frenetic, but in a bad way. Plastic characters and pointless events are thrown in the spectators' faces without great criteria, logic or originality, in a crescendo of "action" (here we go...) that culminates in the usual place the usual way.Really pitiful. (Even the "funny" appearances of mega-stars in hit-and-run roles...)
Simply tiring.

title: BORING AF ***
text:
So much blah blah ... poor action and useless violence!If you came for action, you better chose a different movie!Do not recommend at all. There is no action movie is very mixed up ... and all the movies happens on a train.Very heavy English accent , you have 5 different story's in the same train .. that leads to confusion till know I still don't know the purpose of the movie I don't recommend to watch it at the movies unless if you want to have some popcorn ...
Waist of $ for sure
Nothing else to add beside not worth it! Wait until you can watch it at home hahahaWe left before the movie ended ! 1hr in it was more then enough.

title: Disappointed
text: I went to see the movie because it was a thriller and because it had Brad Pitt on it.I loved Brad Pitt's character and his performance in the movie. Some of the other actors (especially Tangerine) where great too.But I hated the director's usual signatures: blood and guts everywhere, killing without a reason, (supposedly) comic remarks on dramatic scenes.I am a girl and I like when a director/producer takes into account that girls like action movies but they have to have some little kind of romance. This has none!I didn't like the narrative either. It has no line that takes you from the beginning of the movie to the end. It's just blood after blood without reason.Disappointed!

title: Vulgar Mess
text: Based on the reviews, I thought this was going to be fun. But, like many films in this genre, it was a vulgar mess of F bombs and violence with no one to root for and no one particularly appealing. A movie that stands as an assault on the senses is just lazy film making. The pleasant music behind people getting their heads blown off and such graphic violence as to numb the viewer has no point but just to fill the too long running time with as much carnage and foul language as possible. Sorry, I stopped watching at about 45 minutes in, so, maybe it got better, but I doubt it. Movies that make you feel like you need a shower afterward are just no my cup of tea. I guess I'm old fashioned. I like a good story that doesn't rely on repulsive filler to propel it.

title: So much potential but didn't deliver
text: My wife and I were so excited to see it, had a promising trailer, it looked awesome. We couldn't make it more than 15 minutes. Got a refund. It was like a Quentin Tarantino movie if he couldn't write a good story and said let's go as gory as we can. Swearing and jokes were trying too hard to give Deadpool vibes but missing the mark.

title: Bullet Train is a little of the rails...
text: This movie is goofy, wacky, and colorful that many will fine enjoyable if you want some senseless humor, but if you want something more you are coming to see the wrong movie.The action is alright with some new cool ways how to slaughter someone and so many Thomas the Tank Engine references that honestly made me feel that I should have just watch that. It seemed like they wanted to make a fun movie and have a fun time while doing it. Although the humor is rarely funny and the story is way to complicated for such a senseless film.Yes, it's not necessarily a bad movie but it sure isn't that good. You will keep a little smirk at times and want to walk out of the theatre at other timesWith that being said 5.1/10 stars.

title: Hot Garbage
text: Hot garbage oriented for tick tok crowd who doesn't know what good movie is. Terrible in every aspect of the way. Dubbing is out of sync in some places. Story is just a mess. Back and forward is a disaster. Was the whole crew high when they filmed it ? I mean it's just plan terrible. I thought Velma was bad. Wait until you watch this. Embarrassment and a waste of digital medium. Choppy tik tok dialogue is a total nonsense. We finally get to see product of tik tok generation in action. What a mess. I feel bad for these kids. Mental capacity is really in danger there. Don't even know what say anymore. Why so many characters to describe this mess.

title: Action packed comedy which most will enjoy
text: "Sorry I'm mansplaining" - Brad Pitt (Bullet Train, 2022) after killing a mass murdering poisoner assassin.Lots of actions, lots of atmosphere, fun quips and lots of comedy spoiled by just a few ham-jammed in PC commentary. No film that uses "mansplaining" unironically deserves anything other than a 1 - without this it would've been a 7.5/10. If I want sexism in films I'll enjoy some 1950s comedies.A cramped experience with 2 hrs across a somewhat unbelieavable scenario of a long bullet train ride in Japan where riders are oblivious to multiple people dying, a snake being loose, gunshots and fight scenes, Bullet Train is a fun, action packed comedy that is - conflictingly - an unnecessarily convoluted (and at times poorly paced) film. 2hrs appears to be about half hour too long and the multiple story lines do not help what could be an otherwise exciting flick.Brad Pitt shows his acting experience in spades playing an "unlucky" hippy-esque assassin (with some Mr. Smith vibes) who is doing whatever he can to not kill people with unexpected consequences.Joey King's frustratingly accurate faux-damsel in distress paired with the fantastic buddy comedy combo of Aaron Taylor-Johnson and Brian Henry give a lot to like and dislike about this film.Some notable cameos from Channing Tatum, Sandra Bullock and Ryan Reynolds add to the larger than life (and at times gruesome) comedy of decapitations, Japanese mascots, Japanese covers of classic 80s pop and sex perverts (?).Overall a mixed film with a satisfying conclusion which I think could've been a classic with a bit more work of the pacing, cut of an unnecessary storyline or two (Zazie Beetz's The Hornet is just painful) and an ending about half hour sooner. The deconstruction of Brad Pitts character was not too heavy and overall there's a fun mix of unique characters and excellent directing by David Leitch that will give you some hard Quentin Tarantino vibes.

title: Extremely Disappointing
text: 'Bullet Train' is not good. It's not good as an action flick. And it's not good as a spoof of action flicks. It's not good as a live action movie because all the action and backgrounds scream that it's not actually taking place on a train but on a sound stage. In fact in some scenes the train (clearly animated) seems to be going at jet speed while when the same exteriors are shown from inside the train through its windows, the train seems to be going 50 miles per hour. The special effects regarding the train are so poorly conceived (head-on crashes after which the train keeps on going), I had to laugh. And I did. The effects are a mess.But all is not lost. Let's get to the 'good'. Brad Pitt as the 'good assassin'; playing against type as a somehow laid back assassin is quite wonderful. He has great timing, great expressions, and he made me laugh (and that was his intention). Aaron Tyler-Johnson is fine as another assassin, as is Brian Tyree Henry as his partner. Sadly I missed some of their dialogue, spoken in a rich British street dialogue.And now for the 'bad'.Joey King as a very strange female assassin was disturbing. Whether the fault lies with Ms. King, or the character, or the direction, I wanted her to disappear from the film as soon as possible. Alert. She does not.There are flashbacks that are ill-timed. The film is just beginning to rev up, to catch fire, it has not yet grabbed the viewer, but suddenly, and unexpectedly, we are thrust back in time, ostensibly to tell us why a new character is about to do what he or she does. One thing for sure about story-telling, the viewer has to be committed to the story's present-day before being moved back into the past. And I was not yet so committed.As for the story, as unbelievable as the premise seems (a group of assassins somehow on the same train) once the premise is 'explained', the seeming coincidence is even less believable.As I said, I was very disappointed.I read the film's negative reviews, went to see it anyway, and with that, I was disappointed.So, I can't say 'Lower your expectations'.Because I did.To no avail.

title: Disgrace to the pixels on my tv
text: I truly hope Pitt will NEVER get to act in a any movie ever again - not even in the ones he directs for himself. Terrible acting, boring plot, even more boring actions - I even fell asleep.They could've just burnt all the money they wasted on this garbage. Every single pixel that appeared was a disgrace to my tv. It's shameful that someone directs such monstrosity and it's even more shameful that there is a half whit who green lights it. Honestly, I cannot imagine the extreme low level of intelligence of a person who actually liked it. The fact that there were people who have it a rating of 6 or above only shows that intelligence is truly eroding...

title: Rubbish
text: I cannot believe I paid to watch this rubbish. The review I read before watching classified the movie as an action comedy. It's certainly full of pointless killings yet is not in any sense amusing. Some of the characters are in fact so revolting that it beggars belief. Matt Damon is capable of much better. In this role he seems to be trying to adopt Johnny Depp's signature casual absurdity as in those silly pirate movies or when he played ( & in doing so deningrated) the great Hunter S Thompson in Fear & Loathing in Las Vegas. Do not waste your money on this nonsense. A tooth being extracted would be funnier.

title: Not fun, not smart
text: The movie is super weak. When I watch a movie I'm looking either for an amazing picture or great story or character development or jokes or at least something.This movie lags behind on every aspect. First, story is crazy, neither realistic nor smart, it's all build on over exaggerated revenge. Second, characters aren't realistic, they combine uncombinable traits that you'll never see in the real life. Third, the script is not funny, there are at most 2 or 3 good jokes. Fourth, the action is slow. Fifth, so much gore and blood and violence that is demonstrated as a joke, as it's totally fun and amazing to kill people left and right.So, this movie neither silly, nor funny, nor realistic, nor smart with no morale. Why did I rate 5? Well, because of couple jokes and some funny scenes.

title: What I Expected
text: Let me start by saying that I am not a fan of this type of movie. But why are some reviewers giving this mess a 10? Have they not seen The Godfather, Casablanca, or even the Bourne movies or the first Die Hard? I only went to see it because of Brad Pitt. And he is wasted in this thing. When I sit down in the theatre I have an open mind to be entertained and am willing to overlook certain weaknesses in plot, character development, etc. But why are most of the cars empty, with all of this mayhem why are no innocents injured? I could go on but won't. If you are a big fan of violence for its own sake go to this movie. Otherwise rent Reservoir Dogs and see how a true master combines violence and humor with great acting.

title: Awful and bloody
text:
Awful. It was too loud, too bloody and I had to
Leave before it was over. The plot line was hard to follow and then swallow. It bounced back and forth so often I lost the theme.

title: I don't get get it! Lots of bla bla bla and suitcase fighting
text: Why is this movie funny ,ok well I did laugh 2 maybe 3 times ,but this movie is more stupid than funny .I don't get the high rating ,cause this is by all means ,NOT a great movie .5 stars is being generous,but it's because I was actually entertained and there was a few funny stupid meaningless scenes .There's a lot of bla bla bla in this movie ,like an acting scene,staged way over the top .Brad Pitt is not carrying anything in this movie ,other than a stupid suitcase !! I do like him as an actor ,no doubt about that ,but I do question he's acting ,not just in this movie . He is though participating in very funny scenes and doing great being this ignorant hired contract killer .

title: Is it fair to review a movie after ten minutes?
text: I just couldn't watch it beyond about ten minutes. It was all forced and cliched and derivative and I just couldn't see any reason why the characters and dialogue would get any better. I had looked forward to it because it's set in Japan for one thing. But the actors (in the first ten minutes) were almost all Westerners. Not sure why it was even set in Japan. Maybe I should have watched 1hour 50 min more of the film. I rarely switch a film off or walk out of the showing in the cinema but I am not even curious to know the plot. Instead I watched a different film and thoroughly enjoyed it. So there.

title: All that CGI is just so stupid and fake.
text: Not a bad movie, with some humorous moments (not as many as the moviemakers think there are), a lot of action and tons of blood. There are some decent performances but most of them are as over-the-top as the ridiculous premise. And there are tons of the usual moronic cliches you just know to expect. There is some silly supreme bad guy called The White Death (how scary) with his limitless wealth and an "army of assassins". There's a network of killers for hire who answer to handlers, of course. There is the usual "magic earpiece" that exceeds current technological capabilities and allows a character to magically (hence the name) communicate with an unseen character while doing all manner of other things And there's no shortage of glib, witless banter in the midst of violence and mayhem. So tiresome.But I keep coming back to all the ludicrous CGI crap that ruins so many movies. There's a really cheesy snake, there's a dumb big crash, there are people who can fly, and all sorts of other idiotic stupidity. Hollywood really needs to get rid of CGI and avoid cliches.

title: Violence galore
text: This movie has got two excellent elements: It is technically very good in terms of filming, editing and images and the background music is also very good. But in terms of plot and story it is very weak. It is rather dificult to understand what it is about and in most scenes there is violence galore since people keeps punching, knifing and shooting each other with no clear motive or reason. It is full of action indeed but that is all.

title: Its fun
text: The acting is great. There isn't a whole lot happening so the story isn't complex but it's still enjoyable. What I didn't like was the constant visual flashbacks to short stories. This was so distracting and took away from the main story, I'm nor sure why the writers didn't just write it into the dialogue or have a prequal at the very beginning of the film.Last bits to use up required characters for IMDBs 600 limit!Last bits to use up required characters for IMDBs 600 limit!Last bits to use up required characters for IMDBs 600 limit!Last bits to use up required characters for IMDBs 600 limit!

title: Too much talk down rating
text: All characters except for Sanada and Micheal Shannon talk too much makes it feel sick and tired. So cliche but not bad. If you are a big fan of Sananda or Shannon, you can feel more than you've expected but other scripts are not fresh and action scenes cover up. If a plan for the sequel, they need to reduce useless scripts to fill up more creative action ideas, especially, Sanada's iconic Samurai action scenes overwhelm all boring talking scenes. And Shannon' scenes abosulutely awesome. Don't want to say more. If you can stand their silly talking scenes, this movie would be worth spending your time. Good luck.

title: Doesn't worth
text: Starts very confusing and pretty difficult keeps you until the end. Wanted to quit several times but still watched till the end hoping gets interesting.Full of aesthetic with its neon-soaked Japan setting, its edits and textual fonts. It has hilarious comedic beats, wild twists and turns in the script.Don't understand what's the point of importing a Japanese manga comic only to do away with most of the Asian characters and replace them with white and black characters.The thing that really concerns me is, judging by the number of reviews that were actually favourable, can standards fall any lower, and is there any hope for the future of cinematography - and the human race?Very very poor for a 2022 movie. I don't recommend it.

title: A violent video game without a story underneath!
text: I'm wondering if Brad Pitt factor is the reason that this movie is rated above 7 by IMDB users at the time of this review. I totally wasted two good hours watching this movie and it was a huge disappointment. The action scenes are lame, repetitive and lack creativity. The movie has no respect for the laws of physics throughout e.g., several guys walking on top of a bullet train traveling at 200-300km/hour (per odometer of train shown in numerous occasions), not factoring the relative wind of the train speed would blow them away like popcorn pieces! The screenplay is lame, and the movie has abundant scenes of crude violence in complete absence of a good story beneath. The movie is more like a violent video game where the characters want to kill as many people as possible without telling a good story. My rating for this movie is in the range of 2-3, with 3 being in towards the generous end!

title: Wasted potential.
text: They should've concentrated more on the action and less failing to be funny. The action itself is pretty boring and brief, the dialogue tries to be clever but has nothing to say and the attempt at comedy made me groan multiple times. At least it's stylistic enough, although flinging the camera from one place to another gets pretty distracting at time.Looking at the parts there's technically nothing wrong with the movie, but as a whole there's not enough action to be an action movie, too silly to be a drama and too cringy to be a comedy. Really a waste of a good cast. It's not a bad watch, but it's not something I'd ever watch again or recommend to anyone.

title: Some good gags, but the rest...
text: Action comedy on the Japanese Shinkansen train. Countless fight scenes of professional killers battling each other. Unfortunately very little authentic Japan, but a lot of cheap looking CGI. Pretty bad.

title: BORE AND GORE
text: Ask yourself, if you like games packed with action? If not, then save yourself some time and don't bother to watch.Two stars goes to good actors but thta's it. Unfortunately even otherwise good actors didn't deliver, not even close to their best roles.As there is a 600 charatcter minimum for the submitting of the review, then I will write some more. All the cliches are there: Slo-mo and then fast zoom, western-style confrontations, scenes in desert, and endless ketshup, you know what I mean. Like one music video after another.It is probably watcable as a parody or watch-one-movie-have-seen-tem-all for action genre. I din't last as long unfortunately.

title: Overrated train
