text: In my opinion, the humor in this film was too weakThe idea of the film is unusual and interestingI think this movie is overrated, it's a typical American action movie for theaters. The film has many characters and this has a positive effect on the telling of the story in the detective styleThe visuals of the movie are really fantastic. Brad Pitt, as always, played his role wellI think this is a movie for night watch with cup of beer. This is my first David Leitch's work and it was interested in further viewing of his films. I don't regret watching this movie. It was good, but not for 5.

title: popcorn movie
text: This is a popcorn movie, just to entertain in the time we have nothing more important to do. A long movie, wasting time and money. Is the movie you can see later.

title: Waste of a talented cast
text: It's pretty impressive effort to take an impressive cast and idea and make a total hash of it. Tonally all over the place, a lot of jokey banter falls flat, and yeah it did elicit the odd laugh but for the most part, it was a bit contrived. Another impressive misstep is that they've managed to make a film about killing people minus any real peril, it felt more like a multiverse marvel film which is now in it's bland phase. And don't get me started on Henry's terrible cockney accent. It's not all bad, Joey King does a brilliant home counties accent that forced me to check where she was from, there are some good set pieces and the overall idea for me is a pretty interesting one, it's just the plot, script and obligatory CGI that totally ruined it for me.

title: Tarantino wannabe
text: Two Killers (they call themself Twins) have an absurd conversation. Hey, this is not enough to be as cool like Samuel L. Jackson and John Travolta. And the movie is not smart as Pulp Fiction. You feel every second, that this movie would like as cool as Pulp Fiction. But at least, this movie is not even as cool as an average guy Ritchie movie. The dialogues and the story only silly. Boring.. Everything seems constructed. Brad Pitt cant save this bad story, i think he did the best. The longest 2 hours in my life. Nothing more to say about this movie, even if this app forces me to write a very very long story about this movie.

title: Maybe not the genre for me
text: Started interesting but the plot weakened as it went on. Felt too long and drawn out, acting was mediocre. A very forgettable movie that didn't capture me.CGI was pretty good and good to see Logan Lerman back on the big screen (underused).Wouldn't claim it's a comedy in any way, I didn't even chuckle once.CJR.

title: Did I see another Movie?
text: I don't know why Bullet Train has a high rating of actually 7.3. Did I watch perhaps another film?After thirty minutes I wanted to stop it then I gave a second chance and watched for other ten minutes. Then I stopped Bullet Train because really it made no sense and the story came too poor there. No suspense just bullets and blood for no reason. I mean nothing has been explained in details in this lame duck. It was really a torture and boring. Even Brad Pitt couldn't save this disaster and I am wondering how could he accept this role.Sorry but this train should have been derailed before. For these reasons not more than 4/10.

title: Go hard, go fast
text: I sort of liked this movie in the way of action, but I think it would be a better movie if it didn't have subtitles, but apart from that it still was a good movie.

title: Bullet Train Wreck
text: This movie tries way too hard to be a Quentin Tarantino movie, but fails miserably.The overall look is comic-booky (I guess), though if you ever played any of the Borderlands video games it reminded me of those a lot, especially the way characters are introduced.The writing was a pure snorefest - long, winded diatribes that go nowhere in a hurry and get there even slower. I was bored in the first few minutes once the "brothers" started their stupid dialogue. None of the "comedy" was funny, the story was horribly dragged out, the mish mash of the characters' storylines was boring. The "honor" subplot with the Asian men was so cliched that I just rolled my eyes at it. The Thomas the Tank references go on far too much and it's clear that this was written for people who grew up on that show (spoiler alert - I didn't).The actions scenes were beyond ridiculous and done in a "style over substance" fashion. They were so completely over the top that they practically reached a Sharknado level of preposterousness. Kicks to the crotch did nothing, punches went on forever, and everyone is magically a martial arts expert. Somehow a lever, button, switch, etc was always just within reach for someone to grab it and escape a choke hold. If this was an Airplane or Naked Gun style of comedy, it really would have been funny, but it's not - it's just plain stupid.The number of "surprising" cameos that appear wasn't even the least bit interesting. I didn't care who showed up (one of them was literally just a quick reveal), and they added nothing to the plot. By the end of the movie, I was hoping every character would die because they were all worthless and I didn't like any of them.Don't waste your time, and if you do waste your time, don't pay for this movie. There's literally 1000 movies you could watch that are so much better.

title: Pretty Bad Movie
text:
Rating: 5.0
Overall, a movie that is entertaining for the action elements and some comedic moments, but is not a good movie in terms of writing, story structure, and overall feel.Decent Direction (The choreography of the action scenes was well done but the overall moving of the story forward with the very sharp cuts to try to create humor were not that well executed (with the actors also not really given that much to work with)), Decent to Pretty Good Acting (Good from Brad Pitt (Really has to pull from his experience in the role as he isn't given that much from the director or script to work with, but he still does do a fine job (mainly because he is playing someone who is close to his real life persona)), Pretty Bad from Joey King (It is understandable that her character was portrayed to be annoying, but she really was not that good in the role), Good to Very Good from Aaron Taylor-Johnson (A joint performance with Brian Tyree Henry as they both really do a good job at playing off each other to build comedy and action), Good to Very Good from Brian Tyree Henry (See Aaron Taylor-Johnson), Decent to Pretty Good from the rest of the cast (but there was a real issue of screen-time with a huge cast like this)), Pretty Bad Story (The actual concept and idea was decent but the overall story was very poorly laid out to the point that the ending becomes very tiring), Pretty Bad Screenplay (The dialogue was filled with way too much meta humor in that it tries so hard to be like Deadpool but just ends up being very annoying (though some jokes and moments were funny (like the cameos))), Decent Score, Good Cinematography (Especially during the fight scenes), Good Sound, Good Editing, Good Visual Effects, Plot Structure was very poorly laid out as it has a big issue in building things up as if they are important then bringing them down in minutes (with this happening so many times that it just gets boring towards the end), Pacing was very fast but could have still cut out some time (like 20 mins) because of how dense in content it is, Build to climax was there but not that exciting cause it was the standard preparing for a battle trope; climax was well done and a good fighting scene, Tone was way too much like Deadpool to the point where it is very annoying, The 75% of the movie's action scenes and best moments were shown in the trailer to the point where everything else that is shown is just boring or redundant.

title: Idiotic.
text: A movie that tries to be comedy and action in one package, but comes out as plain idiotic. Some of the situations had me rolling my eyes, specially some of the dialog. David Leitch has done better than this.Simply put, Bullet Train is a subpar Tarantino movie wannabe.

title: Stylish, but lacking in substance.
text: I liked the movie overall, but the editing could have been better. There were multiple scenes where it would cut to something that had already been shown, even though the audience would have been able to put the pieces together themselves.Most of the humor worked for me, but I noticed a couple routines that went on too long. There were even whole sections that could have been cut (what was with that water bottle??). The music choices also felt out of place. I get that this movie is trying to be over-the-top and super stylish, but I just found it obnoxious. It's like the director didn't have confidence that the film was being cool on its own.TL;DR: Not bad by any means, I just thought it overstayed its welcome.

title: Bro what
text: This movie is cheeks, waste of 200 pesos boring ahh movie. I've never seen such an unfunny boring movie, unfunny twins they're boring and not witty. I hate Brad Pitt too in here, like how does bro make such fire movies like se7en, fight club, Troy, Once upon a time in Hollywood, and then go and do this trash ahh movie.Not interesting, not thrilling, not fun, didn't have me invested at all in it's plot, random things were just thrown in, and I left early the theatre and I left mad. Spent 50% of the time on Instagram to distract me from the boring movie on the screen this movie is TRASH.

title: Movie that thinks it's too clever by half
text: Movie that thinks it's too clever by half with a Kill Bill smear. There are fashionable visuals and trendy dress, fanciful hairdos and a bunch of swagger, but it ain't as funny as it thinks it is and the storyline is messy. I mean, these two goons have this valuable briefcase to guard and they check it out of their sight? In another room? Sheesh. The conceit of the assassins minding the quiet rules while still fighting wore thin fast. The best thing in this flick is Michael Shannon, by far. A goofy spiritual assassin, Brad Pitt, has to fight this, that, and the other to get to his targets and stay alive, all while zooming down Japan way.

title: Fun Energy, but Odd Film Making Choices!
text: While definitely being fun, this action-comedy has a few odd choices in its execution. It definitely has quite a lot of enjoyable moments that make it perfect for a light watch with family or friends!Aaron Taylor-Johnson was a definite standout for me! He gave his character a lot of energy and had a great connection with Brian Tyree Henry's character. Hiroyuki Sanada was also quite good despite his small amount of screen presence. There is not much remarkable filmmaking, but the film definitely looks nice due to its big budget.There definitely is a element of cultural appropriation and possible stereotyping, but I don't think there was any downright offensive parts. Some of the dialogue was a bit corny, but it sort of fits with the over-the-top style. Overall, it is fun and light watch!

title: This movie is sex without orgasm
text: This movie is frustrating because it's trying so hard to be good and yet it's execution ended up being mediocre. I'll start with the main problem I have with this film is casting Brad Pitt. I mean who doesn't love Brad Pitt but not for this role. This character was begging for Ryan Reynolds. It's a very Ryan Reynolds role that we're used to seeing. A kind of nerdy, kind of awkward (yet attractive) guy with kind of nerdy kind of awkward one liners that turn out to be funny and yet when Brad Pitt delivered them it just often fell flat. Ironically enough Ryan Reynolds does have a cameo. They really should have switched their parts. That aside another thing that annoyed me was Tangerine and Lemon were probably the most interesting characters and the only ones that didn't get an actual backstory. We know they grew up together that's it. Even a freaking water bottle got a backstory but not them. The pacing was off. Some scenes were mildly exciting followed by boring ones. It finally reveals why they're all on the same train and yet the reveal is... unsatisfying like having sex without orgasm. Sure the film was good but I didn't quite finish so to speak and I left feeling it wasn't as pleasurable as it could have been.

title: Fell flat
text: This film wanted to be a Guy Ritchie or Quentin Tarantino flick so bad but it just fell short. It wasn't witty enough, or edgy enough and it didn't twist enough. The cast was great but Pitt didn't sell it like he did for Ritchie or Tarantino. I was actually very disappointed because I love this style of film. This is the perfect representation of just how much a director and a writer can influence a film no matter who the cast is. Give this film with this cast to Ritchie or Tarantino and tell them to make a movie exactly as long as this one and I'm confident the movie would've been everything this movie wanted to be.

title: A terrible film
text: Absolutely mystified by the high rating on here, because, make no mistake, Bullet Train is a truly terrible film. Certainly one of the worst I've seen in a long time. The writing is really bad - like someone trying to do something akin to Tarantino without ever having actually seen a Tarantino film. The acting is awful, and the directing is cluttered and confusing. The pacing is way off, too; it's far far far too long, and goes on for another exhausting 45 minutes just when you think it's coming to an end. It's kind of depressing that so many people seem to rate it so highly. Watch Pulp Fiction to see how this type of storytelling can be done well.

title: De-Railed
text: Sucks. Predictable, goofy, not funny, boring show with a lot of worthless unbelievable action to include a body count of about 200. Again this movie sucks.

title: action, fast, furious and convoluted.
text: At the end it declared that this was fiction...really?Fast, and furious, so far over-the-top violence Tarantino would approve.For those who could get all the dialogue and follow all the erratic plot, I applaud.The writer, director, editor and special effects should be recognized for an incredible job and the plaintiff acting of Brad Pitt as well. Some of the music was well chosen and fit in nicely at times.Well that's all I have to say, All in all, though not my kind of movie.

title: Failure
text: At this time, we can finally draw a conclusion, David Leitch is still a lot worse than Chad Stahelski. The high-speed train, a confined space that can be used for all kinds of fuss, was so boring and boring, and the rhythm control of the whole film was even more tender. As a much-anticipated action movie, it was finally propped up by the charm of a group of stars to make it barely unsightly, and it was a failure.

title: So fing boring do not wast your time or money
text: This move does not worth your money specially in this time with the inflation save up for gas, the only good thing is brad acting, the seance are boring they did not wast any time with the story any 12 yo can do better.

title: Full of clich√©s
text: Nice photography and production design, but not very good cgi.The film lost the opportunity to show more Tokyo and their culture and at the end it is just an assembly of cliches from old films and even some Tarantino films.Generally Brad Pitt choose his projects wisely, but he definitely participated on this one just to help his old friend David Leitch. His character and the movie itself are a total nonsense.Even, it makes the same transitions of the 70s TV show "supertrain" where every time they moved to a new scene they showed the train running on the rails.I used to agree the IMDB rating. Not this time.

title: So confusing and full of unneeded cameos.
text: Very confusing story... saw it in IMAX, and the action sequences and sets were great, but the story goes on and on with no real character development. Clock-watched a few times. And a convoluted ending. I wanted it to be so much better.

title: Utterly Mindless
text: Bullet Train is a mindless action slasher comedy by Brad Pitt and host of other actors portraying some of the heavily stylised but hollow characters.This film has "style over substance" written all over it right from the first scene. The heavily stylised action pieces and premise seems intriguing for a brief while but as the film progressed the mindlessly whimsical plot starts to become tiresome.This kind of story works when it is edited sharply and is fast paced. When the dialogues are not only funny but are measured against the time. And they are getting delivered crisply. Unfortunately none of that happens in Bullet Train. In its middle portion the film looses grip on the pacing and starts meandering in the realm of total nonchalance. That doesn't help.Some characters are funny and some are not. Some set pieces are worth gushing over but some are just plain old cliched stuff that we have seen before. The action is funky but not breathtaking. The acting is "okayish" and not something to be proud of. The music pallete ranging from over-dramatic howls to funky dance numbers is at best ordinary.But the worst of all is writing. No matter how silly and unconventional film you are making, the characters needs to be backed by good writing. Editing needs to be crisp and intelligent. And that was clearly missing. Repetitive plot points and lack of genuinely funny characters didn't help this film any more.Overall it may be a fun watch for the fans of all the actors involved (and there are quite many of them) but apart from the handful "cool" action sequences and occasionally funny one liners there is nothing more to get entertained.

title: Sorta interesting to bide the time
text: If you don't mind the old 'attempt to shock the audience with violence acts by nonchalant personas' script, it's ok.Cinematography is good but you see everything coming easily.If you need to pass some time ... here you are.

title: An orgasm of hues. Watch it on mute.
text: This is a movie that is very hard to rate with a specific number of stars.On the one hand, this was the prettiest most colorful movie-length commercial I have ever seen. From the colorful neon-filled night scenes to fiery inferno's to gorgeous sunny scenes with the use of gold and white, it was as gorgeous as the trailer promised. I wished I saw this in a movie theater rather than at home. And by the end of the movie, there was the Fiji water, the new Audi and, of course the bullet train itself, so I wasn't even sure which awesome product I was supposed to concentrate on.On the other hand, this was the dumbest high-budget film I have ever seen. The plot would forget what it promised a mere couples of minutes ago. It's like the screenplay was written by a 13 year old, who's off his ADHD medication. By the end of the film, I couldn't stop laughing at what I was seeing.Of course, Brad Pit is Brad Pit, so it is hard not to recommend his scenes, but when it comes to all other scenes, my recommendation is to put on some rock music in the background, take an edible and just watch all the pretty colors.

title: What a silly movie
text: Unrealistic movie reminded me of the Indian movies of the 80s $ 90s...if you just wanna kill time and have money to waste then go and watch it, otherwise respect yourself and pass.

title: Neither smart nor funny
text: It took me about four tries to get through Bullet Train, and I kept asking myself why I was even watching it, but I wanted to give it a chance, so I did. At first I thought that it was another Tarantino meets Guy Ritchie meets Cohen brothers riff, but to be honest it's just not very funny nor witty at all. In fact, it is not even entertaining, which is why it took multiple viewings and pauses to get through it. Just kind of gross. Why I am required to say so much about a movie which amounts to the cinematic equivalent of junk food is beyond me, but let's just say that I was not impressed and will not be seeking out future works by Director Leitch. There is nothing original here at all, and the scenes defying physics are ludicrous (not funny), so what's the point? Blood and guts and a lot of sociopathic personalities who all think that they are very clever (including the actors and their characters). I consider this to be a flop. Bro. Dude.

title: "You're a Diesel!"
text: 'Bullet Train' is a fast-moving, messy, and stupid movie that does not fail to entertain. I found it funny how every character has a little backstory, even a water bottle. The film has colourful visuals, style, thoughtful action set pieces, and absurdly violent humour.However, one of the things that stood out about this movie-going experience was that I got to see it on Screen X, an expanded, dual-sided, 270-degree screen projected on the walls. And I got to say Screen X is not for me. On the sides of the walls, it was moving at ten frames per second, while the middle screen was moving just fine, which was very distracting. It does not help that it projects to the walls next to a fire exit, which was visible throughout. So yeah, I don't recommend it.Aaron Taylor-Johnson (as Tangerine) and Brian Tyree Henry (as Lemon) were the best part of the film. They are two hitmen who are good at killing but terrible at protecting people. Their interaction was the most entertaining, especially how they rope in the kid program of Thomas the Tank Engine when it comes to reading people. Also, Brian Tyree Henry and Joey King are two American actors who manage to do solid British accents.The movie is not great or anything, as there are problems, but other than that, I enjoyed it for what it is. It served its promise, and it served it well.

title: Racist Tarantino and Ritchie Imitation
text: Painful to watch a Japanese book being put into a dreadful film that's full of western people killing scores of Japanese in the first 30 minutes, and there is no effort to develop any Japanese character along the way. Super shallow and trying to imitate what is already so pass√©.

title: Proof that Netflix's mass assembly line stinks
text: The Netflix description reads..."Lovers of Deadpool and Knives Out will..." OK, you can stop right there. This movie is an insult to both those masterpieces.First off, the movie is way too violent and gory, to the point that it cancels out any of the supposed "comedy" it possesses (more on that later). I like crime shows. And heists, and capers, and spy movies. And war movies. And action movies of all kinds. But it was like Netflix hired a bunch of brand new special effects artists off the street. And those noobs wanted to make sure the audience saw their work in every freaking scene. Truly god-awful over-the-top gore that is completely unnecessary.Next, again, the supposed professional EXPERT hitmen who are taken in by the female lead. This overused trope is really getting tiresome. It's like the writers decided, we need to have a female lead, but she can't be all smarts, and witty and sneaky, because we're lazy Netflix writers. So, we'll make her act like a helpless female, and she has to rely on tears and the "poor little girl" routine to win the day. And these buffoons fall for it...every freaking time! It is so bad that I found myself either rolling my eyes and groaning loudly or fast-forwarding through her scenes.Lastly, it isn't funny. Not in the least. The verbal jokes fall flat, or go on far too long, or follow (or are immediately followed by) scenes of excessive violence that make you not want to laugh, even if you originally did (which I doubt you will).Finally, pack in stupid unrealistic train physics and you get yet another big-budget star-fest Netflix movie that is a complete mess. Don't waste your time. I'm sorry I did.

title: B******** Train Wreck
text: If you decide to watch this film, 10 minutes is all you need to realise everything you need to know about it's if you don't like what you see, switch off / over and find something else to do with the two hours you've just saved.There's plenty of big names in there who feel as out of place in their roles as their woeful character accents. These are all crammed into a clich√©d nonsensical storyline which copies much, much better movies and runs out of track with a predictable final act.If you decide to keep going then good luck and strap yourself in for an overstuffed, pretentious, overworked, repetitive try-hard slog of a movie.

title: 3 stars out 10
text:
Broke down into:
1 for the Japanese landscape and music
1 for the like real blood
1 for Sandra Bullock
Nothing else to add to this and it's well rated
Good.

title: New movie formula: a bunch of famous actors + international inclusion + crap story
text: Let me start with a question: Can Brad Pitt act? The answer is no.There are a collection of actors whom I like to call McDonalds Actors because whenever you see a movie with them, it's like going into a McDonalds restaurant, you know exactly what you'll get. Actors like Pitt, Matt Damon, Ben Affleck, Bruce Willis, etc.And Brad Pitt never disappoints. And it's great if you have not become completely bored with the guy. Which I have. So this movie already sucked on that level.The story was dumb and derivative, let's be honest. And to wallpaper over that fact, the producers tried to throw a bunch of big name actors at us, to impress us. Oh hey, Brad Pitt! Oh hey cameo of Ryan Reynolds! Oh hey Sandra Bullock! Oh hey Channing Tatum!And then let's not miss the total marketing ploy of covering all audiences. Let's see, we have Latin America covered! Check! Japan? Check! Russians? Check! We have text in both English and Chinese, Check! Check! Should make lots of money on the international market! Check!!I'm just happy I could watch this at home and FF>> thru a lot of it. It was like an idiot Tarantino film on a bullet train. Just juvenile stupidity.

title: Only watch if your physical or mental age is under 16 or like Guy Ritchie.
text: This was a convoluted mess. A big budget, big action, big stars but still a mess.1. You do not knoe what is going on and why. Characters are on the screen for such a short period of time that it is hard tro guage their purpose or reason for being in the story.2. The action is slapstick on a Three Stooges level(not exaggerating) so it is hard to take the action serious. It wants to be an action-comedy, but nothing is really funny. I chuckled once the whole movie and the rest of the time I was waiting for it to end.3. The hyper kinetic, shaky-cam, multi screen jumps does not work here. It distracts from the action on the screen. And while this is an 'action-comedy', there are some levels of logic you need to be believable. Example, we see cars full of people in one scene and then we see no people anywhere else.

title: One of the worst
text: After 5 minutes of watching you'll know this is going to be one of the stupidest movies ever. I finished watching it to the very end only because of Brad Pitt who always delivers. Other than that do not waste your time in this very awful film. A bad dream altogether where the situations on the screen would never take place in real life. A mockery. It is like getting an idea after Kill Bill and trying to emulate some of the absurd situations but without the poetry of Tarantino. On the other hand if you are bored and tired Bullet Train will keep your eyes open and maybe your curiosity will lead you to the end titles just to know how it ends.

title: Blood and Violence GALORE - with a couple of cameos
text: One couple walked out early and the rest of us watched the gore galore - and talking afterwards among audience members proved most did NOT like the display.Don't take your children.

title: Fake Tarantino
text: If I could squeeze the juice from my eyeballs to express how painful this excuses for a film was, I would.Even the desperate deployment of Brad Pitt could do little to salvage it.

title: terrible movie, and LONG
text: It's stupid slapstick, with no funny lines.However, Brad Pitt's occasional comments related to self improvement are somewhat amusing. Not funny, but somewhat amusing. That's it.There are some foolish and ridiculous special effects that are fitting for a ridiculous movie. However, from a technical point of view, they probably look realistic, although they are typically ruined by some slapstick nonsense.When you find yourself 30 minutes into the movie and think, "is this going to get better?", it isn't.Stop and go see another movie with the 90 minutes you save by skipping the end of this one.Surprised that actors like Brad Pitt and Sandra Bullock got involved.

title: Some good actors and interesting characters trapped in a stupid and absurd action movie
text: I didn't take long for me to not care about the overall story narrative because the story became so quickly and completely divorced from reality. For about 10 minutes early in the movie they seemed concerned about it seemly like this was an actual train in the real world. Then after that the violence and fighting which would have brought the train to a stop and authorities to the scene never happenedNothing felt ordinary or regular, and that made all of the interesting characters and situations uninteresting because they didn't exist in contrast to anything very ordinary or relatable at all.Another odd thing was how many English speakers there were in Japan speaking English with expectations of all of the local Japanese characters understanding their English. In some scenes they would speak only Japanese but seem to perfectly understand everything that the character spoke in English.The best thing the film had going for it was that it had some nice visual effects, shocking action moments, acting moments and crazy visuals that made it fun to follow as complete absurd escapism. And for a lot of people that's enough to make them to be happy at the movies.But I feel like if a story is going to be crazy like this one, why not make it an animated film and/or science fiction world for the characters to inhabit so the occurrences can seem less ridiculous? Or else make it a complete comedy where people cannot believe how long and absurd everything is able to get all along the ride. Instead in this film everything is portrayed as if it could really happen until maybe the end. And by then it's too late.

title: EXTREMELY VIOLENT! BAD LANGUAGE! Not suitable for children at all.
text: Gratuitous violence and extremely bloody. Listed as a "comedy" but a very DARK "comedy" that was at least 30 minutes longer than it needed to be. I am not a prude, but come-on Pitt.....you are better than this.

title: Too Frenetic
text: From the beginning, this movie moved quickly through one clich√© after another. In fact, it transitioned from scene to scene so quickly at the beginning, I wondered from early on if I could sit through it. The film seemed in a panic to prove how funny it could be. By the middle of the movie, I'd lost all interest in it. With all the hype and some great previews, I thought it would be a good piece to watch but was sorely disappointed. I stuck with it as long as possible, but finally moved on to other fare. I lacked the fun of slapstick presentations like the Pink Panther and missed the subtle humor of other offerings. In the end, I found it a bust.

title: Chaos, mayhem on a super fast train
text: This movie is one helluva train wreck and pun is intended. With all the chaos, mayhem, killings, bloodshed and gore on board this high speed train neither the director's attempts at comedy nor the prescence of star Brad Pitt is any relief. Yes there is plenty of fast paced and high voltage action embellished with special effects for those who love such stuff. So you need to settle down with popcorn and ask no questions. Surprisingly there are hardly any other passengers and the fights take place in almost empty coaches. Lots of rocking music in the background and the movie starts off on a promising note with " Staying alive" as Brad makes his way to the Tokyo railway station. The plot is complex to put it mildly. The characters are caricatures and the one liners do not raise laughs. It's also strange to hear desperados talk of fate, karma, zen and other aspects of philosophy. It appears that an interesting plot has been made complicated. Some reviewers have noted that the director David Leitch is influenced by Tarantino's work but that doesn't appear to be so. Tarantino's class and flourish is missing. The climax is outrageously unrealistic in design and execution. ( Compare with the thrilling climax of "Speed"). There is an overdose of attempted wit and humour which does not work. The sentimental stuff too does not sound true.

title: Lighting miles away from the bottle
text: The script doesn't work, the characters are silly, the cockney brothers are garbage.It's a movie stuck in 2003 and it's a cringefest from the beginning. If Brad Pitt wasn't attached to this movie it wouldn't be made.I wish Brad Pitt wasn't attached to this thing.So I need 600 Characters. SureAaron Taylor Johnson is a non-entity. You can't place an actor like him in a role requiring charisma. The charisma required for this role evaporated when Jason Statham entered 2005The cinematography direction artstyle, dialogue, plot, character development and mood are all deeply deeply lacking. In all serious I don't need to explain it. Compare it to a movie like Layer Cake or even Rock n' Rolla you'll see what's wrong with this painful jaunt.

title: Too Slow of a beginning
text:
Seasoned talents with unseasoned plot,typical showy slash and dashactors too big that their spices failed to marinate the movies given the short period of time they appear, seems to me like they are just there as glorified featurings to sell ticketsonly in the 3rd act, we'll start seeing something different happenthe forshadowing and connections is a bit cliche but alas the only redeemable noteworthy objects to exist in this piece.Underuse of Brad Pitg,
Underuse of Sanada Yukimura,
Underuse of Michael Shannonwow, quicksilver got a little buff aint imthat pink girl, she acts alright.Maybe its because of the premise and titles,
the character background and plots couldnt simmer properly from too fast of a pacing provided.

title: Tarantino with training wheels
text: Obviously the aim was Tarantino-esque, but the story should've been displayed better. Told better. It felt like they checked off a list of what would be in a Tarantino film, and presented it like any other average, star studded action comedy would have been. It's definitely watchable, but leaves a lot left to be desired in my opinion. I get the high reviews who have even gone as far not only to call this film a masterpiece and but claim Tarantino is overrated. It seems the overall bland presentation is fitting for an average action comedy lover. Maybe it could open them up to Tarantinos more complex story telling, since it takes care of every other characteristic of his movies.

title: Too much - simpler would have been better
text: This over the top violent comic thriller has lots of killers fighting killers. Lots of assassins on a bullet train in Japan. Though it doesn't feel like Japan - it's devoid of crowds and has this exaggeratedly colourful cinematography.Some wisecracks by Brad Pitt make it through but some are wasted and unnecessary because they are out of place in the action.The main problem there are all these different characters. So without enough background for each one there is no connection or sympathy for any of them. Can't root for any one in particular. Or be anxious if they are in danger. Lack of focus and emotional connnection.The all star cast keeps one watching. But in the end it's like a low end buffet.Joey King with her funny British accent is quite diverting. Most interesting of the characters. Keep watching after credits roll.Sometimes less is more.

title: It's a video game
text: Early on two gangsters argue over whether they recently killed 16, or was it 17 people. So we are treated to a flashback so we can count the true number of victims.. If you enjoy watching multiple people murdered in rapid succession by every means possible, this film is for you. I'm sure Pitt was paid a ton of money for this. But it is so disappointing watching him perform cartoon roles. Some will excuse this nonsense by calling it "light entertainment ". It's as shallow as it can get. I'm sure there is a generational gap with the audience here. If you're to old for video games I would pass on this one. What a waste of time.

title: Pointless
text: This was by far the most ridiculous pointless movie we have ever sat through. Brad Pitt has come down in my estimation. Why would he and Sandra Bullock be willing to act in this?

title: Stopped watching within a minute
text: I stopped watching within a minute when there was no English caption for the Japanese dialogues. Maybe what they were saying were irrelevant to the story, but it was annoying to feel you were missing out on something going on on the screen, a movie that you paid for. There were other movies to watch in the multiplex so I left for the opposite theatre. I did not regret walking out in this one. Maybe someday when a BlueRay copy with foreign language caption comes out. Not something I will hold my breath for. Judging from the trailer, although this is a movie that looks worth my time, it did not strike me to be a remarkable one like Fight Club or any other half-decent movie.

title: Russophobia is real
text: Just another movie, in which a Russian is the enemy. Come on...is that Americas mission in Hollywood to spread hate against Russians? We've clearly had enough of it and you do not even mean to hide the Russophobia!!! You could have chosen an American to be the war maker - which would be more accurate in this world. If you keep entertaining with such political movies, remember it has not only been made for Americans to watch it but we all see your hate and it we will not accept it anymore. Cancel culture comes from the USA, i wish some Americans wouldn't be so dumb otherwise they would understand what is wrong about such movies. In all Comedy there is a matter of truth. Such a pity that the idea and the effects, the fight scenes and humor were cool all in all but that still does not compensate for a hateful message.

title: Bullet Train (BUL) review by Most Fair
text: BUT is an action movie comedy about a group of assassins on common assignments. Their paths cross onboard a bullet train and this short review won't reveal any further details of the plot.BUT movie cast includes several renowned actors, and their all perform good, though the movie itself doesn't require top performances due to the nature of the film.BUT is first and foremost stupid and rather dumb, which makes it rather entertaining. The scenery is static and action sequences low tech, but it works!BUT is no essential movie experience but your time will not be a total waste. Watch if you have the time for it but don't prioritize. Above mediocre movie, certainly not bad.

title: Toxic masculinity and sociopathy all around
text: There are some wisecracking assassins having fun while butchering other people. They are so cool, that life and death means nothing to them.Another movie like that? Yikes.Don't get me wrong, the action is quite good (although repeating a bit), good cinematography (bordering on the cliche), and interesting plot. But the protagonists are SO unlikeable. The only humane one is being belittled by his psycho dad for not being macho man enough to take an axe and butcher some guys. Yeah, that's the message - be merciless, by apathetic to suffering, and did I forget mentioning they kiil thousands of people (off screen, in other trains/buildings) just to have a closure on their own stories, while being funny?Loved this kind of stuff when I was a kid, but not it's just... wrong.

title: Garbage In, Garbage Out
text: Put together a ramshackle script, some sub par acting talent and a director with nothing of any note in his resume and this is what you get; a sub pat Tarentinoesque mess of a film. There is no plot really, a motley collection of assassins are lured onto a bullet train by a master criminal for reasons that make no sense and we are subjected to two hours of relentless bloody violence as they try to incompetently murder each other in ever increasingly inventive ways until we get to the denouement, which is stupid beyond belief. Most of the performances are downright bad, Joey King, Aaron Taylor Johnson and Zazie Beetz excelling here but some, Pitt and Brian Tyree Henry do manage to alleviate the two hour slog. I paid to rent this, don't make my mistake, avoid and save two hours of your life.

title: Cute but Guy Ritchie does it better
text: "Cute" is really the nicest thing I can say about this.Editing is simply awful (I mean really really bad) and some of the casting choices were really terrible. Brian Tyree Henry and Aaron Taylor-Johnson try valiantly to bring some depth to their duo with some success. Bad Bunny is great, actually, but Brad Pitt is simply inane as he trods through the same stupid character he's been revisiting periodically since True Romance.I usually love Michael Shannon, but he is horribly miscast here, and Andrew Koji is just horrible- but maybe it's the wig?Everyone would have done better with a script that had been sent through several solid rounds of edits, however. Its hard to make something out of nothing, to be fair.This said, the production and art direction were very good. Every single visual style choice polished to within an inch of its life, making it more of an advertisement than a film. The concept is strong and visually appealing, but every encounter lacks depth. The absolutely shameless and unceasing product placement only underlines this.On top of all this, action was just ok.Frankly, Guy Ritchie does it better.

title: Tentomushi is a Cute Bug...
text: But this movie is not cute, cuddle or watchable.I was checking my watch for the last hour which tells you something important. So many words said amidst the noise was like being at a loud Jr High dance. Pointless chatter that meant something only to the ones talking. I left the theater with a headache.Save your time, money and ears and find some cute Ladybugs to play with.

title: Ehh Train
text: It's an ok movie. Nothing great or original. The cast is decent enough and the writing is ok. The plot is real transparent and has been done numerous times. I think Brad already did this basic plot about 15 years ago.

title: Sigh AND yawn!
text: Evvvverything seems to need to be 'irreverent' Deadpool-esque and include Brian Henry as the loveable black man - it's as if the pulp fiction era evolved into this attempt to capture the meta lightning bug in jar - yes not even mere lightning alone but a slow moving plump lightning bug - oh well.. Snoozer.

title: ALL MESSED UP
text: AVERAGE MOVIE ....NOTHING GREAT ABOUT IT ....EVEN THE STORY COULD BE BETTER IF WRITTEN WITH CARE.... COMEDY WAS FINE .. FIGHT SEQUENCE MEANINGLESS........................................................................................................................................

title: My Kid Loved This...Apparently She Has Bad Taste...Who Knew?
text: I you want to make a Guy Ritchie, Quentin Tarantino movie you should perhaps be Guy Ritchie or Quentin Tarantino .This movie smacks or trying way to hard to be cool and stylish. It feels so forced.The visuals, for the most part are dynamic and the pace of the movie feels good, its never dull.Yet the characters mostly suck, particularly the wolf and the princess, they are so one dimensional.The film suffers big time due to a bunch of cliched characters.Brad Pitt is always watchable but even he appears to be trying too hard to be this cartoonish larger than life character.The premise is a good one, the execution unfortunately struggles, resulting in a dud.

title: The train of plot holes.
text: The Asian assassin ordered to kill a person who sit in B04 but why he didn't kill her when the person was just some almost middle-aged Russian woman in high school uniform-like clothes? Why he doesn't use a knife or silenced pistol anyway?The guy in a white suit The Wolf directly attacks Brad Pitt when the murderer of everyone in his wedding is a woman whom he has given her picture for she is the assassin which he personally came to Japan to kill her. She doesn't look like Brad Pitt so why he attacked Brad Pitt? Also in flashback the guy in the white suit is shown as he directly came to the bullet train just after the wedding assassination and then we learn Brad Pitt was also in the wedding but he mention he was retired for some time. Did the guy didn't take his clothes off for a while or what? What kind of cinematography and storytelling it's?The Russian woman is revealed to have an evil plan for the Asian guy who is tasked to assassinate her. For fail-safe she states she sent a man to the his kid in hospital so if she doesn't report back in a certain period of time the guy will kill the kid. But then we learn the kid's grandfather sent a woman to protect the kid. When the guy is clearly up to no good being next to the kid this woman waited for the last minute to take the guy down so the plot can continue in the way it was badly written.So The Elder's wife was revealed to be especially murdered by White Death or his men but why The Elder wasn't killed when White Death was literally in front of him?The people kill others in bullet train but there is no security, no staff, et cetera around to ensure public peace, protecting possession of the customers and whatnot. Literally there is just a conductor and a servant.Brad Pitt takes down The Wolf but doesn't look at the envelope he has on him but he ponders "why he attacked me" for minutes.Brad Pitt was revealed to be shot twice by a man called Lemon. Why he shot him and why he just his shoulder instead of so many deadly points on his body doesn't make sense.It turns out so many foreign people brought firearms with them. Japan is not like America, it's very hard for a civilian to get a gun and Lemon bought his favourite gun with him, not even some "the random gun we were able to smuggle into Japan" gun.People constantly speak English to Japanese people and Japanese people speak Japanese back but somehow people understand each other. The hell?The Asian assassin was shot in the stomach but he survived just fine for hours.The Russian girl shot Lemon in the torso instead of the head to kill him. Lemon couldn't die because of it thanks to his bulletproof vest which his brother knew he had vest on but forgot it and believed he was dead without even checking his pulse.The White Death was revealed to be Russian. So how he could be respected by a Japanese yakuza boss who values tradition? Traditional Japanese people dislike non-Japanese people a lot. So it's very unrealistic for such a Yakuza boss to even care about the life of a non-Japanese person.The White Death thought Brad Pitt was Carter who killed his wife. It's unrealistic for this guy to not even check what Carter looks like.Lemon was angry because his brother died because of Brad Pitt but after a while they became brothers. The hell? Is an AI wrote this story?The White Death didn't just use a gun to kill The Elder, he just used a katana. Just why?I haven't watch anything that has so much plot holes since Stranger Things' first episode.The idea is good but bad execution. Brad Pitt's face got boring years ago. None of the other people are actually famous so their acting capability are barely decent. The whole movie clearly targets new generation kids who play Minecraft and Fortnite all day and when they don't they record their own videos to upload it on Tiktok.

title: When the Deadpool 2 director has a bad day - 100% cringe
text: David Leitch must have loved Domino's superpower the most in Deadpool 2.He loved it so much he gave it to Brad Pitt and created a cringy, bad movie around it.And she's in the movie! Which I loved. Love you Zazie Beats. That's why I gave the extra star.Don't get me wrong. I loved the actors. All of them. But not in this movie. Some scenes were okay ish. But the rest. Unwatchable.A Guy Ritchie wannabe movie. But the end is just so predictable. Also. Not even close. The characters and their traits. Embarrassing.The British accent which was full of lame profanity... Wow! Shocking. Why? I loved the moustache tho.David. This movie is poor. Very poor.

title: A visual feast for a nauseous plot
text: Think about a five-course meal made of dessert only and this is what you get watching this overblown, chaotic, hyper-violent (but in a "funny" way) movie, which follows the usual McGuffin for a ride that makes little sense.Pitt is an unlucky assassin named "Ladybug" (ah! The irony! Aren't you laughing?) who must retrieve a briefcase from a train populated by the usual ethnically correct mix of antagonists, two of them particularly annoying with their story about a train and a cartoon which I forgot because it belongs to "their" culture and I really don't care.I was so NOT impressed that I watched this movie once on streaming, then after a year or so I started watching it again because it made zero impression and only when the two aforementioned annoying characters appeared on the scene I remembered how annoyed I was by the whole movie and switched it off.

title: Good enough to watch on a plane, or just passing the time.
text: To be fair, I watched this movie on my flight to Las Vegas a few days ago. I found it could have been more enjoyable. I can give it a 5 out of 10 for the visuals.This action movie should have tried to take itself more seriously. It's a light comedy-action popcorn flick that tries to add John Wick flare to a Fast and Furious-style movie, and it fails miserably at both.The casting was alright. Brad Pitt was the most forgettable protagonist in an action movie ever. The character tries very hard and succeeds in downplaying himself all the time. This joke gets old very fast.The Tangerine-Lemon brothers were fun at first, but the joke gets old fast.And I hate that this movie was entirely shot within an empty Japanese bullet train in Japan, and they didn't take any advantage of that. They add very stereotypical Japanese characters and randomly slap them in this nonsense.If you hated GI Joe for that, you will hate this one too.The action is very generic and forgettable. The enemies are dumb and Coyote-like levels of stupid and forgettable. The plot is pure nonsense. I don't know the point of this movie even existing.You will be annoyed and forget about this mess very quickly.

title: Next Stop....
text: Last night I finally got around to watch bullet train staring Brad Pitt and Joey King and other actors I have never heard of.This movie was a cross Hollywood and Japanese production and was kinda quirky in my eyes I was trying to make references to other movies I have seen and honestly it's a cross between kill Bill, snakes on a plane but there was one snake on a bullet train and it felt like a comic feel to it aswell.There were a few guest staring roles like Sandra bullock Ryan renolds and Channing Tatum.In the whole movie I felt there was a unbelievable scene when one of the brothers managed to jump back on a moving at full speed bullet train. That would never work.This is a one time watch for me honestly does not have any rematch value.Definitely not something kids should not watch.I wonder if tarantino would make a version would that be better.One missing component would be a killer soundtrack.3 out of 10.

title: A Hard Watch for Me
text: This is a bit of a Marmite movie - you either love or hate it. For me it didn't work as a comedy nor as an action movie, just a bit of a mess. Bad English accents and terrible wisecracks. I thought how some of the story was woven together was good and the best for me was the water bottle. Just found it taken as a whole, a bit silly and a bit too long. Of course you had to have the strong female character in there as ever - this always grates on me as it is all the time nowadays. I half expect the old lady at my newsagents to be wearing sunglasses and chewing a matchstick when I go in - " Take yer bloody change" as she headbutts me out of the door!

A truly unusual picture. I don't think many people will like this composition. The plot is limited to one location where all the events take place. The humor also leaves much to be desired, just like from the action movies of the 90s. If we talk about the storyline, it is very predictable. But I think the absurdity is what distinguishes this film from others.Obviously, most of the positive reviews were due to the excellent cast. To be honest, it was he who interested me. And here it was not a mistake, despite the whole plot, the acting was at an excellent level.In conclusion, the film is extraordinary, its plot and monotony are frightening. The first impression is formed in the first 10-20 minutes. It was because of this that some turned off after reaching this time. Of course, the climax and denouement are much more interesting, but it does not change the fact that the film, in my opinion, is worse than average.

title: By the way, The New York Times would edit Jesus.
text: Indeed, I saw this film. I would simply like to point out that The New York Times would edit Jesus.I wouldn't.I seriously doubt Sandra Bullock would, if I may be so bold.I don't really care what The New York Times says, writes, or communicates about the film. Again, if I may be so bold, you should really consider this scene.Pitt punches plastic right in the mouth. Think fun. Think funny!Yes, there is a samurai. That's not so funny. I do not need a samurai sword going through me.What I truly liked about the film is that I was not punched, stabbed, shot, killed, beaten, dragged-to-death, cut with a ginsu, bludgeoned, hammered, runover, drowned, sliced, hung, strangled, or otherwise decapitated, eaten by a tiger, thrown out a window, poisoned, or otherwise assaulted, forced to pull a dart out of my neck because some nut brought a blow gun (the poisonous variety, not the cheap ones they make in China) with him, confronted by a guy with a rocket launcher, sucker punched, handcuffed and beaten, fed to a shark (think about it...that really could happen... I've seen it at the movies), blown up, or forced to put my head into the popcorn machine while some guy slammed it on me.Why don't you ask The New York Times about that?

title: Actually Awesome!
text: Bullet Train is a nonstop thrill-ride that keeps you hooked from start to finish. The star-studded cast absolutely kills it in this flick, every role is perfectly cast (even the five second screen-time ones). If your looking for a fast-paced, action-packed comedy, I highly suggest Bullet Train. Don't listen to the people saying that it's "way to fast" or "hard to follow along", if you watch the whole film, everything comes together in the end.

title: Very good plot- well explained
text: Also very funny and the story is great. Best action/ movie I've watched in a long time, unexpected big actors also are a good part to the movie also! Another good film from David leitch.

title: Enjoyable and fun to the max
text: The most enjoyable and fun movie of the last few years. Actually I don't remember since when I had so much fun with a movie.If you didn't liked it, then you went to watch a different movie.This movie delivers 100% what it promisses.Fast paced, eye kandy, colorful, music spot on, tons of action, funny, happy, surprising, plot that fits the direction and vise versa... fantastic.David Leitch did a brilliant job, he is upping his game in every movie and I can't wait to see more from him.All of the cast did amazing job but Brad Pitt and Aaron Johnson are both perfect in their roles, both screen magnets.On top of all that, there are more than enough surprising appearances on every turn.Loved it!

title: Delightfully Witted & Surprisingly Entertaining
text: From the director of Atomic Blonde & Deadpool 2 comes another stylishly crafted & surprisingly amusing action romp this time concerning multiple assassins aboard a fast-moving train whose individual mission puts them all on a collision course with each other in this twisted tale of fate & retribution. Bullet Train is fast, fun & frenetic but it does suffer from not knowing when to push the brakes.Directed by David Leitch (Hobbs & Shaw), the premise is simple and the endless twists n turns do make the ride somewhat enjoyable if also overstuffed & messy. The story goes back n forth every now n then to connect the dots but it also ends up overdoing the elements in ways that's detrimental to the whole journey. What works in its favour however is the kinetic action, wicked wit, chaotic energy & colourful ensemble.The story treads all the genre clich√©s with an unabashed spirit, plus character interplay is also cringe for the most part but it manages to get ample mileage on the strength of its cast & their commitment to their respective roles. Brad Pitt plays his part with such effortless nonchalance that he manages to stand out with ease. Aaron Taylor-Johnson also contributes with a brilliant showcase. And the rest also render their roles responsibly.Overall, Bullet Train offers a lighthearted & action-packed extravaganza that may be lacking in many storytelling aspects but it delivers on the entertainment front with a sufficiently satisfying execution. The film does run out of tracks as it nears its final stop, thus leading to an overblown finale that's as lazy as it is tiresome, but this high-speed action-comedy isn't without merit and does enough to keep the interest alive in the proceedings. Definitely worth a shot.

title: Bloody, Bloody - Not for the Squeamish
text: Someone tried to make Kill Bill (1&2) on a Train, but blood comes from everyone's eyes instead of their severed limbs- the ads before the show are for horror movies so that's a clue as to how much yuk is in this film- it's over the top. You start out trying to keep up with the characters being introduced and quickly give up and just go along for the ride like everyone else. About an hour in, there's a funny bone, which holds you through to hiroyuki sanada's big finish. Brad pitt in my mind was like the guy in the pool of blood sipping whiskey sours from a duck floatie. The whole thing could have been done without the gore imo, maybe with a smoother ride, because there were plenty of good actors and a moving train always has my attention.
